1.content: As the title says, who are you?
1.title: Who are you?

choices: They meet another Tactician on the road
They encounter a village, Risen are attacking!
They encounter a village, peaceful and unassailed
11.content:
Tactician Profile:

Name: Tyre
Age: 17
Appearance: Approximately 6 feet tall and of average build but quite strong. Has white hair and purple eyes.
Personality: A kind hearted soul with a philosophical, inquisitive view of life. He feels tremendously guilty for what happened to his home and thus will be the first to spring up to defend the downtrodden, often disregarding his own life's safety in the process.
Origin: A distant Outrealm, now destroyed.
Bio: His home world was destroyed by a horde of dark dragons when he was in his younger teens. His hair and eyes were once both brown but were mysteriously changed when he barely escaped a dark dragon's breath. He found an Outrealm gate and ran through it, never looking back at his destroyed home. He's been wandering the seemingly infinite Outrealms and the various worlds that are attached to them ever since.
Race: Human
Class: Tactician (Level 18)
Uses: Swords (Level C) and Tomes (Level D)
Asset and Weakness: HP and Resistance, respectively
Equipment: Killing Edge, Elfire, and a Concoction or two
Skills: Ignis

Tactician's Companions:

Name: Roy
Age: Unknown; looks to be about 17 years old
Appearance: Approximately 5 foot 10, on the thin side but rather muscular nonetheless. Has bright red hair and azure blue eyes.
Personality: A thoughtful, just, and cunning fellow. He often has to be the one that holds Tyre back from running headlong into danger like a crazed maniac.
Origin: Lycia on the continent of Elibe
Bio: He was once a great hero and king of his homeland who saved his world from a tyrant and a demonic dragon. Tyre knew very little about Einherjar cards when he chanced upon one of Roy's cards, accidentally summoning Roy's soul from across great chasms of space and time. Though Tyre had been told that Einherjar were merely husks of the people they represent, Roy seems to be as rational and engaging as most people. His body is flesh and blood and indistinguishable from any other aside from the odd bluish glow. Tyre considers him a real person and Roy considers this the opportunity to start a new, adventurous life. The two have been traveling together for about 2 years.
Race: Einherjar
Class: Mercenary (Level 16)
Uses: Swords (Level C)
Equipment: Roy's Blade, Steel Sword, and a Concoction
Skills: Sol, Aegis

Name: Anna
Age: Unknown; looks to be in her twenties or so
Appearance: Approximately 5 foot 11, athletic and curvy. Has brick red hair and red eyes.
Personality: She has two sides; one side is mysterious to a fault, the other side has a greater lust for gold than a leprechaun. She's quite clever and has a knack for coming up with massively punny catchphrases. Buried beneath her greedy, cocky, cute exterior is the sense of justice of a saint, though she will never admit it.
Origin: Unknown
Bio: She is one of the many, many Anna's running around the various Outrealms. The reason for the massive number of Anna's is, as she says, "a Secret". She took a liking to Tyre and Roy when they saved a number of villages she was doing business in on multiple occasions. She joined the two in their travels because "There's profit in following you boys." Both Roy and Tyre agree that it is incredibly handy having an Anna around and Tyre secretly has a massive crush on her.
Race: Human (supposedly)
Class: Trickster (Level 1)
Uses: Swords (Level C) and Staves (Level D)
Equipment: Steel Sword, Mend, and an Elixir
Skills: Open locks, extra movement

--------------------------------------------------------------------

"Hmm, where are we this time?" asked Tyre to his friends after stepping through the blue portal and thereby completing his transit from another Outrealm. He surveyed the land around them. There were mountains in the distance and trees in groves separated by long, large fields of grass. They were not too far from a well worn stone road. In short, there was very little to tell this realm from the countless others the three of them had visited.

"Perhaps a place that isn't overrun by Risen for once?" asked Roy hopefully, "or Entombed, or evil dragons, or bandits, or tyrannical empires that we just have to save the world from."

"Hey, we helped those people," protested Tyre, "what would you rather do, leave them condemned to follow a guy who liked to wear pink?"

"No, of course not," replied Roy. His azure eyes studied the world around them, "It's just, for once can we please not get involved in the affairs of this Outrealm and just enjoy it?"

Tyre laughed a little, "Sure, Roy, I'll try."

Anna put each her arms around the two guys. Her left arm wrapped around Roy and the attached index finger still managed to glue itself to her chin. "If you boys are done arguing, why don't I suggest we try this road up here? It looks charming enough, all open and oozing the potential of leading to massive profits!"

Tyre barely suppressed a groan at the mention of the word "profits" but still realized Anna had a point. Roy seemed to agree, "Sure, seems the easiest direction if we're to find out the lay of this land."

The three of them then started walking down the road...
11.title: Tyre

111.title: They meet another Tactician on the road

1111.content:
Name: Jacob
Class: Dread Fighter
Gender: Male
Skills: Lethality, Astra, Pass, Pavise, Limit Breaker
Weapons: Killing Edge (Muramasa), Brave Sword, Micaiah's pyre, Tomahawk.
Personality: Deals out his own kind of justice on those he believes deserves. May come and go at times. Mysterious, enigmatic, deadly.

-----------------------

Jacob moved slowly down the road as he thought of many things, until he heard something. He looked and saw a man in some kind of uniform, a boy with red/orange hair, and a girl with red hair and a colorful outfit. Jacob stopped and watched them for a moment, as if studying them. They had not noticed him yet, so he walked closer to them until they saw him.

What happens next?
1111.title: Tactician #1

11111.content:
The threesome had walked along the road for only about an hour. They'd not seen much on the road yet aside from a picturesque natural landscape and found little reason to stop their travel thus far. "Hey look! There's someone on the road ahead," pointed out Anna in her usual peppy tone. Roy and Tyre followed Anna's well manicured index finger (her other index finger, as her left was still on her chin) and saw the figure, still a good quarter mile distant.

"Well, at least we know this place is populated still," said Tyre, "that's a good thing, right?"

"That depends," said Roy, "on whether this figure is friend or foe."

"Oh, c'mon, Roy," said Tyre, "bad guys hardly ever travel alone."

"What makes you think he's alone?" asked Roy.

"Roy, you worry to much," said Anna cheerfully, "must be that old age of yours!" Roy cocked an eyebrow at this but Anna continued, "Whoever this guy is, I'm sure I'll make him a happy customer one way or another, hehehe."

"That only makes me worry even more, Anna," replied Roy to this.

As they drew closer to the mysterious person, Tyre got a glimpse of his weapons. He had a killing edge, modified quite a bit, a brave sword, a tomahawk, and Tyre could feel this man's aura, strong in the forces of magic. Tyre perceived him to be very powerful, more than enough to pulverize both Tyre and his friends easily. Tyre decided to be friendly for now, hoping that this man wanted no trouble...

"Hail, traveller!" greeted Tyre warmly.

The mysterious man looked at the threesome, "Well met," he said.

Before anyone else could say anything, Anna blurted out, "Ooh, nice weapons!" Her friends gave very dirty looks to her, making her blush a bit when she saw their faces.

The man laughed at this, "Yes, I suppose they are," he said at that.
11111.title: Talk to Jacob

choices: Why Tyre and them are there
111111.content:
Jacob looked back at the group, "Your not from here are you?"

Tyre stepped forward, "No, we're not. Oh, my name's Tyre. This is my friend, Roy. And she's Anna, a merchant."

Jacob looked back at the woman still looking at his weapons, "...She seems familiar from somewhere..." He then turned back to Tyre and Roy and shook their hands. Jacob could already feel Roy's tense muscles, not very trusting of him. "But I'm curious now...You probably came through the Outrealms right? So what are you doing here?" Jacob then felt something on his belt move as he turned to see Anna poking the Brave Sword he had there. He pulled it out, causing each of them to tense up as Roy almost attacked him, when Jacob then turned the handle of the sword to Anna. "Here, it's yours." Anna took it and started looking at it's quality. "So, what are you doing here?"

What happens next?
111111.title: Jacob introduces himself

choices: Jacob explains what world they are in
Jacob nabs back the Brave Sword from Anna
1111111.content:
"Exploring, I guess," said Tyre with a shrug. Both he and Roy still had their eyes on Anna, who was enamered with the very rare, very powerful weapon in her hands. She, no doubt, was calculating how much she could sell it for at the next market.

Tyre turned to Jacob, "We've been to countless lands via the Outrealms... you know, helping out people wherever we can before moving on... What can you tell us about this world?"

"Tyre," warned Roy, still not libel to trust the stranger.

"Roy," responded Tyre, "Jacob here just gave away to one of the greediest people in all the Outrealms one of the rarest sword types, worth a good 3000 gold."

"Oh, Tyre," said Anna, "you sly me! Besides, you know I'm going to charge 6000 gold for this... or 7! Hehehehehe!!!" She giggled with glee at the potential profits.

Both Roy and Tyre groaned slightly before Tyre continued, "You think somebody with bad intentions would give away so priceless a weapon like candy?"

Roy shrugged, "No, I suppose not."

"Forgive my friend," said Tyre, "he's had to keep me from running headlong into danger so many countless times-"

"You're welcome, by the way," interrupted Roy.

"So," continued Tyre to Jacob, "What can you tell us about this place?
1111111.title: Why Tyre and them are there

11111111.content:
Jacob laid an arm on the Killing Edge blade he knew as "Muramasa", sheathed on his belt. "Nice realm, to be honest. Pretty quiet, nice towns," glances to Anna, "a lot of merchants who...now that I think about it look a lot like you."

Tyre, not wanting to explain Anna's family to him just yet stated, "So, there's nothing wrong?"

What happens next?
11111111.title: Jacob explains what world they are in

111111112.content:
"Then I guess we should look for another Outrealm that needs us," Roy said.

Jacob took a step, "One moment," Roy turned and looked at him with Tyre and Anna, "what if I could come?"

Anna was somewhat surprised, "Really? Why? This place seems great!"

"Well...for starters look at me. Armored from head-to-toe with powerful weapons, but nothing to fight. I want to change something, like you guys are. Whaddya say? Could I tag along?" Jacob said, hoping to leave.

What do they decide?
111111112.title: No, they leave. But...

choices: They encounter something nasty on the way to the Gate (Risen, Bandits, etc...)
They arrive at the Outrealm Gate without trouble 3 days later.
1111111121.content:
Tyre tilted his head, "Sure, you can come," he said, "You're sure you want to travel with allies that are less powerful, though?"

Jacob tilted his head thoughtfully, "What makes you think I'm so much more powerful?"

"Tomes, Swords, and Axes," pointed out Tyre, "and the redish haze is a dead giveaway; you're a Dread Fighter, correct? You rank yourself amongst the most powerful, seldom seen, and often legendary warriors in all the many lands."

Jacob had to chuckle, "Well, you're right. I am pretty powerful." He shrugged, "I don't personally mind traveling with you guys even if you are less powerful... that is, if you don't mind?"

Tyre glanced at his friends, who both didn't seem to object. "Sure, I don't mind. You can be our group's Jaigen!"

"Excuse me?" asked Jacob.

Tyre laughed, "Sorry, it's a theory and a bit of a joke among us tacticians. Jaigen was an adviser and companion of an ancient King named Marth. He was exceedingly experienced and powerful compared to his army-mates but toward the end of the wars they fought he ended up being outclassed by all of them!"

"Now wait just a minute," said Jacob.

"Oh don't worry too much about the outclassed bit," quickly added Tyre, "I'm sure you're more of an Oifey." This only left Jacob more puzzled.

♪do-de-doodle-do-dum!!♪
<Jacob joins the party>

"So, are we ready to go?" asked Tyre. He looked into the group's meager substitute for a Convoy; really just a knapsack they all could use as communal storage. He rummaged quite a bit, shifting around Vulunaries, Concoctions, and the Miniature Lance Tyre found randomly one day a few weeks back. "Oh damnit, I'm out of Rift Doors!" he said. He turned to Jacob, "Is there an Outrealm Gate in this world?"

"Of course," said Jacob. He looked around to get his barrings momentarily, "just three day's walk southwest of here, nearby the coast. There's a few villages on the way so we could restock provisions or rest at an Inn or two if necessary."

"Wheee!! Business opportunities!!" cried Anna with glee.

"Excellent," said Tyre, side glancing Anna for a moment, "provided Anna doesn't anger the village chief by making him pay way too much for a 'variety pack' of Vulunaries and Sweet Tinctures..."

"Hey, his loss, my gain," pointed out Anna with a particularly devious grin.

"Yeah, and we had to hop three Outrealms to loose him," said Roy.

Jacob laughed at this, "Seriously?"

Roy nodded, "It may be funny now, but it wasn't then." Jacob laughed even harder...
1111111121.title: Jacob joins the party!

choices: Risen, summoned by a Risen Priest.
11111111211.title: They encounter something nasty on the way to th...

11111111212.content:
The stone door of the Outrealm gate stood in front of the party as they approached it. Jacob had led them through the towns, Roy checked over everything cautiously, Tyre did a variety of things like reading and study the landscape on the trip, while Anna lugged her goods around.

"Huh? Why the long face there?" Jacob asked Anna, puzzled.

"Well y'know that Brave Sword you gave me. It still hasn't sold yet! Who wouldn't want this?" Anna said somewhat frustrated.

Jacob was still confused, "Well that's a pretty common sword here. For that price and quantity it's not surprising."

Anna stared at Jacob along with Tyre, "Wait, THESE are common here?!"

"Well, yeah. Why, don't tell me you had problem finding these?"

Anna turned away, somewhat embarrassed, then she felt something heavy in one hand and felt something leave her other hand. She looked and saw Jacob had given Anna a large bouillon of gold and held the Brave Sword. He looked back at Anna and smirked, "Pleasure doing business."

Anna squealed with joy and hugged Jacob, who almost lost balance from it.

"Can we hurry up," Roy asked.

"Well, you guys have been traveling for awhile. You wanna choose the next realm?" Jacob asked.

What happens next?
11111111212.title: They arrive at the Outrealm Gate without troubl...

choices: They arrive in the middle of a battle with Risen
111111112121.content:
"Hmm," pondered Tyre as he stared at the great gate before him. He'd been traveling through gates like these for 4 years or so and he still didn't have quite a full grasp of how they worked or how to control them. Sure, there was an entire guild of Outrealm Gate guides, but a lot of them were either Anna's or extremely old. Tyre only knew the basics of the operation of the Gate. Pondering, he tried to choose something in particular the way Old Hubba had once showed him and he crossed the blue threshold, soon followed by Roy. A small way afterwards Anna and Jacob entered as well.

"Did you see that?" asked Tyre discreetly to Roy as the two floated through the streaming blue vortex that traversed the various Outrealms.

"What?" asked Roy, "Anna hugging Jacob?" Tyre nodded, "Oh, right, you have a crush on her."

"Do you think she and him..." he raised his eyebrows.

"Well, she's a human being, isn't she?" asked Roy, "I mean, supposedly..."

"But I... I've had a crush on her for the longest time," Tyre lamented.

"You weren't fast enough," said Roy, "it doesn't help that you've never bought anything at her shop either... Don't worry, there's other Anna's in the sea."

Tyre laughed, "Thanks, Roy," he said.

The other side of the vortex to another Outrealm approached. They crossed the threshold into another, new Outrealm...
111111112121.title: On to the next realm

1111111121211.content:
Jacob was amazed by the works of the Outrealm portal. He looked over to Anna who was looking over her multiple pouches and packs when they finally exited the same way Roy and Tyre did. As soon as Jacob landed, he was caught by a breeze of a Risen swinging a sword near his face. Jacob stumbled back for a moment before launching himself into the air, unsheathing Muramasa, and bringing it down on him, destroying him as he dissipates into a purple-dark smoke. Anna landed behind him as she came through the portal and he turned to see he landed between the Risen and Roy. "I must say this is already some fun," Jacob said humorously. He looked over to Tyre who pulled his blade out of a Risen's back, "Say Tyre, any idea on where we are?"

Where are they?
1111111121211.title: They arrive in the middle of a battle with Risen

choices: A group of injured mercenaries treating their wounds
A young girl holding an opened Reeking Box
11111111212111.content:
"I'm not sure," said Tyre, "but I haven't had much time to find out, you know." His Killing Edge left a trail of faint purple light as he rounded onto the next Risen. "You're finished!" he cried, flying into the air about ten feet and bringing the blade down onto the Risen's chest.

"Gughuuuuuuaaahh!!" cried the Risen tiredly as it faded into purple smoke.

"Right," said Jacob, "how silly of me." He chuckled, pulling out his Tomahawk and tossing it at a Risen from afar. He picked up the ranged axe off the ground soon thereafter at the spot where the fallen Risen had previously dissipated.

Tyre pulled out his Elfire tome and watched as two more Risen were annihilated by fire elevating seemingly from the ground below them. He looked to his side and found Roy had paired himself up with him. "Not bad, Tyre," he praised.

"Shouldn't you be protecting the others?" asked Tyre.

"Anna's paired herself up with Jacob," stated Roy idly. He then dealt death to a Risen with his signature blade.

"What!?" asked Tyre.

He looked over to where Anna and Jacob where. "We're on commission," stated Anna proudly to Jacob before he lit a Risen ablaze with what seemed to be a bolt of fire from the sky. Anna then attacked another Risen but fumbled and missed. The Risen then lunged at her. Jacob at that point pushed her out of the way and saved her from getting hit. "You get a discount!" she cried happily at Jacob.

"Uuuuuugh," Tyre groaned, "she's supporting him. This really sucks!"

"Tyre, do I have to repeat myself?" asked Roy, slicing another Risen that tried to lunge at him.

"I know, I know," replied Tyre, "'There's other Anna's in the sea' or whatever... But do any of those Anna's swing a sword all sexy like that?" He torched another Risen, this one an archer.

Roy laughed, "How much you want to bet? Just how many Anna's have we encountered, Tyre?"

"I lost count at 53, I think," answered Tyre honestly. "Yes, Roy, I get what you're saying. That doesn't change the fact that it makes me sick in the worst way to see the girl of my dreams hitting on another guy."

"Boy, you've got it bad, Tyre," admitted Roy. The two friends came upon an Entombed. Its dour look upon its almost fake looking face and yellow body seemingly made of canvas or something similar confirmed its identity. "Man, I hate these things," said Roy.

"I love them," said Tyre, "lots of experience fighting them..."

"So you say," said Roy. Both held their swords tight at the sides of their face before lunging identically towards their adversary. It dodged the attack but it's own pathetic attempt at slicing the two of them failed when they themselves dodged.

Tyre felt an increase of power as again his Killing Edge trailed purple light. He came around behind the creature and called to Roy, "Here's how it's done!" before he struck the creature square in the back before it could turn to face him. Dissolving into purple, the creature was ended. "Right," said Tyre. He felt a surge of strength, skill, speed, and luck wash over him once more but he felt as if he'd reached the pinnacle of his talents at that point.

"You think you've maxed your abilities out?" asked Roy.

Tyre looked over, "Why do you ask?"

"Because I have too, I think," said Roy.

"Then it looks like it's time for those seals," said Tyre with a smile. He went into the 'convoy' bag and pulled out two Master Seals. They looked like golden gyroscopes and were about the size of a grapefruit. Tyre handed one to Roy and another to himself. They both held the seals in both hands and concentrated hard; Roy on being a heroic warrior and Tyre on being a grandmaster tactician. The seals lit up and flew out of the two's hands. Light engulfed Roy and Tyre and when it died down, Tyre was dressed in a more regal looking version of his hooded trench coat and he sported some armor pieces. Roy now had an extension to his arm mounted shield, looking stronger and larger, and he sported a chest plate and shoulder plates over his tunic.

"Haha! It's been far too long since I've felt this sensation!" cried Roy.

"This is so awesome!" cried Tyre. He was giddy with excitement. When he finally calmed down, he noticed how quiet it was now and found after quick investigation that the entire army of Risen had been vanquished. "Wow, that was quick," he remarked.

"There were dozens of them," said Roy, "it shouldn't have been that quick."

"We took care of the rest," called Jacob as he and Anna went to meet Tyre and Roy.

"All of them?" asked Tyre. Jacob nodded. "That's intense!"

"I guess I don't know my own strength?" asked Jacob sheepishly. Anna giggled at this. "Ah, you've promoted," added Jacob, "congratulations."

"Thanks," said Roy and Tyre in turn.

"Well in any case, thank you for finishing the battle so quickly, Jacob," said Roy, "now we can find out where we are, if possible."

"Yeah," nodded Tyre, "let's spread out and see what we can find in these ruins. If anybody finds something... or ends up unlocking a whole army of bad guys, please call for back up. Nobody needs to be the hero here..."

"Except me," stated Roy with a grin.

"Well, that's a little different," retorted Tyre. Roy laughed. The four of them split up and soon discovered...
11111111212111.title: The Unknown Ruins

111111112121112.title: A young girl holding an opened Reeking Box

11111111212111211.content:
Jacob continued down a dark hallway of the ruins. The four of them had split up awhile ago, so he had assumed they're somewhat far away. He soon found a large doorway midway through the hall. Jacob approached it with Muramasa unsheathed and looked around the corner. He saw a small girl, 7 or 8 years old, pick up a small wooden-looking box. Jacob knew already had this story ends.

He charged in to try and stop her, but she already opened it, and was immediately attacked by a Risen with an axe. Jacob jumped inbetween the two and blocked the attack. "Checkmate!" He yelled as he drove his sword through it's chest. He looked over at the terrified little girl and looked at the corners of the dark room to see the eyes of more Risen. "You remember the way you came through kid?" She nodded and didn't need to be told what to do as she ran away. Jacob quickly dispersed the few Risen archers and Barbarians in the room. "Hm. I thought a reeking box would've summoned more." Jacob said questionably. Then one more Risen appeared.

He towered over Jacob, he had a blindfold in his face, armor strapped across his body, painful shards of misc things sticking out of him as this Risen carried a Brave Lance. "Could use some help here!" Jacob yelled through the hallway.

No response.

"Maybe they didn't hear me...But I can probably kill you still." Jacob said, acting somewhat cocky. He jumped above the Risen Chief and brought the blade down on it's chest in a slice that left a large wound in his body. Suddenly, Jacob's body lit up in pain. He almost fell as pain shot across his entire body. He looked at his chest and saw a wound identical to the one he just inflicted on this Risen. Jacob then realized this Risen Chief had Counter. The Chief lunged his Brave Lance at Jacob, who dodged the first one but his hit near the hip on the second try.

Jacob fell back as the Chief got closer readying his lance, he raised his lance for the finishing blow. But Jacob already raised his hand and the tome as a fireball struck the Risen Chief as he burst into flames and disappeared in a misty fog. Jacob barely made it to his feet as he left, holding the wound on his chest with his entire arm. Jacob had no vulneries, concoctions no elixirs to heal himself with. "Should've stayed a trickster..." Jacob thought to himself as he passed through the halls holding onto the walls for support as he looked for his party.

Jacob wandered and stumbled around until...
11111111212111211.title: Jacob

1111111121212.content: Do they appear in Ylisstol?
1111111121212.title: Another choice

12.content:
Name: Jacob
Species: Human
Class: Trickster
Weapons: Levin Sword, Killing Edge, Silver sword, Mend.
Skills: Pass, Acrobat, Limit Breaker, Armsthrift, Sol.
Gender: Male
Personality: Questioning, nice, somewhat easy-going.
Level: 20
Skill stat #: 337

What happens next?
12.title: Tactician #2

13.content:
Name: Greg
Age: 18
Appearance: 5'9 feet tall, and 140 lbs. Short red hair and blue eyes. Rather average build. Wears traditional Hero look with dark blue and silver colors.
Personality: Shy, but friendly and helpful.
Origin: In a village named Kirada in the Outrealms.
Bio: Lived an ordinary life in Kirada until his little sister disappeared. Combined with a dark presence, Greg decides to search for her, while also trying to discover what is going on and protect his home.
Race: Human
Class: Hero (Level 5, promoted recently)
Uses: Swords (Level C) and Axes (Level D)
Asset and Weakness: Speed and Luck
Equipment: Steel Sword, Iron Axe, and some Vulneraries.
Skills: Armsthrift, Sol, Pavise
13.title: Tactician #3

131.content: Greg pushed his way back through the next Outrealm Gate. He's been searching back and forth for his sister, but hasn't found anything else. He walked through as he walked through the next Outrealm Gate. He entered a village, but it was destroyed horrifically. Houses torn down, ground cracked, it looked as if Grima himself tore through the town. Greg walked through, hoping to find someone that would know or may have seen his sister. He suddenly heard something come from a wreckage pile. He turned and pulled a sword out, "Who's there," he yelled. He approached the wreckage of a small shack and through the collapsed beams he saw...
131.title: Walking through the Outrealms

1311.content:
Name: Jacob
Class: Grandmaster, Level 20
Skills: Acrobat, Pass, Ignis, Limitbreaker, Zeal.
Weapon stats: A = Swords, B = Tomes
Personality: Blithe, easy-going, curious, mysterious, somewhat shy.
Weapons: Killing Edge, Thoron, Silver Sword, Bolganone.
Gender: Male
Looks: Short Brown/Black Hair, medium build, light-barely-tan skin.

-----------------------

Jacob's consciousness slowly returned as pain coursed through his body. He felt a few limbs of his being pinned down by wooden beams as they stung his body. Jacob, although he had blurry vision, tried to find a way out. Then he heard a voice call out, "Who's there?" Jacob wasn't sure what to do as a man in Hero Armor stood above him. Jacob's throat was raspy and in pain, so all he could utter to the stranger was, "H-help..."

What happens next?
1311.title: ...(Another Character)

13111.content:
Greg walked slowly through the village, taking in everything he saw.

"Dang, I wonder who could have done this." he said to himself. However, before he could think more, he heard a weak voice from a nearby pile of rubble. Immediately, Greg ran over, and nearly gasped as he saw a person almost nearly buried. The person was male, and from what Greg could tell, he was a Grandmaster. Just by looking at him, Greg could tell that his guy had far more experience than he did.

Hey, you alright?" called Greg, reaching a hand inside. The man looked at him weakly and nodded, grabbing Greg's hand as he pulled him up.

"Here, take this, Might not heal it all, but it'll at least get you up and going again." said Greg as he handed the man a vulnerary, who the man took instantly.

"Ugh, thanks. Feels a little better now. Who are you stranger?" the man asked.

"I though it was proper manners to introduce yourself first, but if you insist. I'm Greg, and in case you're going to ask, I'm not from here." said Greg.

"I'm Jacob. It's a pleasure." said Jacob, slowly getting back to his feet. "So where are you from then?"

"My village is called Kirada, in another part of the Outrealms. I assume you know about that." said Greg.

"Yep, of course." said Jacob, still catching his breath a bit.

"So, what happened here? Can you explain?" asked Greg.
13111.title: Greg helps him

131111.content:
Jacob looked over to Greg, "To be honest, I'm not a hundred percent sure. I just remember hearing something late at night and then...woke up here."

Greg couldn't tell if he was lying or just incredibly lucky to not have died. But since it didn't make much sense as to why the attacker/attackers would leave him behind if he were one, he concluded he was telling the truth. "That's odd." Greg replied.

"Hey, if you came from the Outrealms, what are you doing here exactly?"

What happens next?
131111.title: Jacob explains

choices: Heading to the next Outrealm over
1311111.content:
"Well, long story short, I'm from Kiradia, but you already knew that. Thankfully, the village isn't in too much danger, at least when I left it anyway." said Greg.

"So, what are you doing here then?" asked Jacob.

"My little sister dissappeared suddenly, so I've been trying to find her. Also, despite not being much danger as I said before, there have been mysterious happenings as of late, and I want to figure out what's been going on." said Greg.

"Heh, sounds good enough. What's your sister like?" asked Jacob.

"Her name is Karen. She's 2 years younger than me. She may not look it, but she's pretty good in a fight. We kind of trained together for some time." said Greg.

"Aw, how touching. What kind of fighter is she?" asked Jacob.

"War Cleric, and she's a good one at that." said Greg.

"I see. Well, can't say I've met anyone by that name." said Jacob.

"Oh...I see." said Greg, a little dissappointed at that. However, Jacob suddenly grinned at him.

"However, who's to say she won't turn up eventually. How about we go and figure this out together? I need answers as much as you do after all." said Jacob. Greg gave him a small smile, glad to see this development.

"All right, it's a deal." said Greg as he and Jacob shook hands.

"So, now what?" asked Greg.
1311111.title: Greg's Story

13111112.content:
"I don't know of this is related to you in anyway, but maybe we could try and find the people who did this." Jacob asked Greg.

"Why? I know this is your town but," Greg began, only to be stopped.

Jacob tried to stand but fell to his left knee, "Yeah. But no one's destroyed a town like this...Maybe they might be the guys you're after. So wanna go after them?"

Does Greg agree with the plan?
13111112.title: Jacob suggests something else

131111121.content:
"I suppose it's possible that they're related." said Greg, getting back on his feet. Jacob was recovered at least enough to get moving.

"All right, so I guess we need to get going. Who knows if this place could get attacked again, and I'd say we're not in proper fighting shape for something right now." said Jacob.

"Agreed." said Greg. After that, the two of them started walking off. Jacob couldn't get over a slight limp, but it wasn't too serious. Greg on some occassions had to keep him upright. After they got a good ways from the village, they were about to go over a hill. However, Jacob suddenly stopped and pulled Greg down.

"Ouch! What the?" started Greg before Jacob shushed him.

"Quiet. Look over there." said Jacob, pointing forward a bit. Greg looked in that direction and nearly gasped. It was a group of what appeared to be Risen, except these were of a darker color. There weren't many of them, but you could tell they were strong from the aura around them. Next to them was an Outrealm Gate.

"Holy cow. What are they?" asked Greg.

"I don't know, but I think they got to be related somehow. That's the only logical explanation I can see." said Jacob. Suddenly, Jacob pulled them both down, as he appeared to see one of the Risen briefly look in their direction. After a second, Greg heard the sound of the Risen entering the gate. Gently looking over the hill, he saw exactly that as every one of the beings jumped into the gate, leaving a bunch of destruction behind them. After they were gone, Jacob pulled them both up, walking slowly towards the site.

"Well, at least there wasn't another village here." said Jacob. Greg nodded in the affirmative.

"Yeah, but I wonder where they went. Outrealm Gates are random at best. Who knows which one they are at now." said Greg.

"True, but there is no other choice." said Jacob.

After looking at Jacob, Greg looked around the site, seeing bits of pieces of rocks and wood everywhere, like those Risen liked destorying anything even remotely alive. However, as he walked through, he felt his boot step on something different. He looked down to see what appeared to be a card.

"Hey, what's this?" he said as he took his boot off the card and picked it up gently, brushing it off lightly. Right as he did, he knew what it was, as he heard legends and rumors of them.

"An Einherjar card." said Greg in fascination.

Who is the card?
131111121.title: A Bad Omen

1311111211.content:
"You mean Micaiah? The same?" Jacob said surprised.

"Apparently," Greg nodded, "should I summon her?"

"Of course. We need all the help we can get."

The card began to glow as standing before them in her red uniform was Micaiah. "Ugh...Huh? What? Who are you?" Micaiah asked, somewhat worried and frightened.

"Relax," Greg said, "I'm Greg and this is Jacob. We summoned you hoping you could help us with a problem."

Micaiah being an Einherjar, she agreed and joined them.

"Hmmmmm..." Jacob thought.

"Huh? What is it Jacob?" Micaiah asked.

"I'm gonna head off to find one of my friends. Hold on, I won't being long." Jacob limped away slightly and disappeared.

What happens next?
1311111211.title: Micaiah

choices: They pass through the Outrealm Gate
13111112111.content:
Name: Shonku
Class: Bride, Level 27
Gender: Female
Weapons: Silver Lance, Spear, Killer Bow, Brave bow, Mend.
Weapon skills: A=Lances, A=Bows, B=Staffs.
Personality: Shy, easily embarrassed, helpful, cute, sweet. Long Silver hair tied in a pony tail.
Skills: Pass, Acrobat, Galeforce, Aegis, Limit Breaker

-------------

After awhile, following behind Jacob returning was a woman in a white gown as she approached and stood in front of them. "Greg, Micaiah, this is my friend Shonku."

"Hey there," Shonku said.

Micaiah then said almost instantly, "That's a really nice dress!"

"Thanks..." Shonku said, already a little shy.

Jacob then came forward, "She said she'd help us."

"Great," Greg added, "Let's get going."

What happens next?
13111112111.title: Jacob returns with his friend

131111121111.content:
*****Character Bio*****

Name: Micaiah
Age: Unknown; appears around 17 or so
Appearance: Same as Spotpass artwork
Personality: A soft-spoken but valiant mage who can recieve visions of the future to help her allies
Origin: Tellius
Bio: Micaiah's soul is summoned when Greg ends up using her Einherjar card.
Race: Einherjar
Class: Sage (Level 10)
Uses: Tomes (Level B), Staves (C)
Equipment: Micaiah's Pyre, Elfire, Mend, and a Concoction
Skills: Shadowgift, Focus, Rally Luck, Tomefaire

*****End Bio*****

The little group began walking towards the Outrealm Gate. As they did, Greg couldn't help but look at Micaiah. He heard legends about her, being the Priestess of Dawn, but she was even more beautiful in person. However, Micaiah seemed to see something and look at him, causing him to look away.

"Are you okay?" she asked nicely.

"Y-Yeah of course. I'm sorry." he said. Micaiah gave him a soft smile.

"It's quite alright." she said as the group began walking into the gate.

"From here on, we'll need to be careful. Who knows where we'll end up." said Jacob.

"So we just keep walking?" asked Micaiah.

"Pretty much." said Jacob.

No one in the group looked excited about that.
131111121111.title: They pass through the Outrealm Gate

choices: Learning more about Jacob and Shonku
1311111211111.content:
After a while, Jacob and Shonku had walked behind Greg and Micaiah, seemingly talking among themselves. Greg looked back at them and smiled.

"Guess they're really good friends." he said, causing Micaiah to look back.

"Yes they do. Reminds me of my own friends." she said.

"Friends?" inquired Greg. He knew that, according to the legends, Einherjar were manifestations of past heroes and heroines. However, the books described them as imitations of those people, so they weren't really real. They thought of themselves as the real hero, but they were just copies, losing any experiences they gained when they return to being a card. Greg felt incredibly sorry at that. The Micaiah standing before him looked like a nice person, and he didn't want her to go away. He thought back to a while ago when she was summoned.

*****Flashback******

Greg held the Einherjar card up high, trying to fill it up with power. Suddenly, the card began glowing and it flew out of his hand, hovering above ground. Greg and Jacob watched as the light from the card formed and took on a human shape, as a distinctive woman appeared. There was Micaiah, wearing her traditional red dress, a light blue aura eminating from her.

Almost instantly, Greg was captivated. Both by the power of the Einherjar, and by the person in front of him.

"Hello, my name's Micaiah." she introduced herself sweety.

*****End flashback*****

Greg came back from his flashback, coming back to reality.

"So Micaiah," he started, getting her attention. "Where do you think you came from?"

Micaiah looked a bit confused as she answered.

"I'm from Daein in the land of Tellius. Did you not know?" she asked.

"Oh, well, I had heard, but I wasn't sure." he said. He knew now that she beieved that she really was Micaiah, although he wasn't sure what to do about it.
1311111211111.title: Greg and Micaiah talk together

13111112111111.content:
Jacob and Shonku walked behind the two as they walked through the Outrealm. "Actually now I'm interested. Where'd you get the dress?" Jacob asked.

"Oh. Actually it was an Einherjar named Eirika who gave it to me. She had one too, but there's something weird about it."

"Oh?" Jacob said curiously.

"I act more...romantic, around people." Shonku said somewhat nervously.

Jacob smiled, "Well I'm glad your here."

Shonku grew a smile, "Thanks. I promise not to leave your side...no matter what...," then, realizing what she just said, "No! I didn't mean it as a proposal!" She turned away blushing and embarrassed.

Jacob leaned over and gave her a quick one armed hug and laughed.

What happens next?
13111112111111.title: Learning more about Jacob and Shonku

131111121111111.content:
As the group walked forward, a bright light emerged in front of them.

"Ah, there we go." said Jacob, signalling to everyone else that this was their stop, or at least one that was as good as any. As they walked through, they immediately noticed the lack of light. Using a small Fire spell, Jacob illuminated parts of the room.

"Looks like ruins. If I had to guess, it's the Ruins of Nadon. Not a nice place if the rumors are true." said Jacob. Shunko stepped away a bit.

"Not a nice place you say? Maybe we should look elsewhere." she suggested.

"I don't think so. We have to see if those dark Risen came here. They might be linked so whatever's happening. I need to find out." said Greg resolutely. Shunko sighed.

"I guess so." she relented. Greg smirked.

"Hope you don't get the dress too dirty. How did you get it?" asked Greg.

"An Einherjar gave me a wedding bouquet, and this dress appeared." said Shunko, a bit embarassed.

"Ah, so there are other ways to class change other than master seals. Well, what were you before?" asked Greg.

"I was a--" started Shunko before they heard the ruins rumble around them.

"Well, something is in here. Let's move." said Jacob.

"Right. Ready to go?" asked Greg.

"Of course." said Micaish, while Shunko sighed.

With that, the group continued onward, into the Ruins of Nadon.
131111121111111.title: They enter the next realm

1311111211111111.content:
The ruins didn't seem to be deserved to called ruins. They seemed to be in an almost pristine condition, it was just really desolated. A large, wide staircase led up to the large altar-like area of the ruins. Jacob aided Shonku as she struggled a little bit with getting up them with her dress. Greg and Micaiah led the way through as something large stood in the altar.

What is it?
1311111211111111.title: Walking forward

13111112111111111.content:
"Hey Jacob, you said these were ruins?" asked Greg.

"Yeah." came the reply.

"Well, whoever came up with that needs to get their eyes checked. What kind of ruins is in near prime condition?" asked Greg, looking over the area. As Greg pointed out, the "ruins" didn't seem to be in that bad shape. There were some bad areas for sure, but nothing else of real interest.

"Well, I'm going to guess that our targets aren't here at all." said Greg. Micaiah nodded at him, but when a tremor hit, she stumbled a bit. Greg came over quickly to keep her upright. Despite the good conditions, they had come across some random tremors.

"You all right?" asked Greg.

"Yes, thank you." smiled Micaiah, which made Greg blush a bit.

"No problem." he said meekly, which made Jacob chuckle.

Anyway, they had just finished walking up a long staircase that lead up to a large alter-like area. With Shonku's dress, she needed a little bit of help coming up, something that Jacob had no problem helping her with.

"I can only wonder how you'll fight in that." said Greg.

"Oh, she can fight. Rest assured." said Jacob, making Shonku blush. Micaiah giggled a bit at the sight. Anyway, they finally reached the stop, where they saw an odd sight. There were no Risen or anything, but they saw what appeared to be another Outrealm Gate. However, unlike the usual blue hue of the gate, this one was kind of a light red instead.

"Got any idea that does?" asked Greg.

"No clue. I've never seen a gate like that before." said Jacob.

"Should we go through? It could be dangerous." said Micaiah. Greg turned in her direction.

"Possibly, but I don't think we have much choice. The Risen could be anywhere, so we should explore every chance we get. Besides, I have no problem with exploring new things." smirked Greg, which made Micaiah smile.

"Hehe, you really can be reckless when you want to, but it sounds like a good idea as any." said Micaiah.

"Good. I trust there aren't any other objections?" offered Greg. Jacob smiled, while Shonku just nodded, a little bit of fear evident on her face.

"All right, onward then." said Greg, as the four friends entered the red Outrealm Gate.
13111112111111111.title: An odd Outrealm Gate

131111121111111111.content:
Jacob walked alongside Greg as the two stood in front of the light red hued gate. "So...should I go in first or should we enter at once?"

What does Greg decide?
131111121111111111.title: The Odd Gate

choices: Greg, Shonku and Micaiah find Jacob.
1311111211111111111.content:
"Alright, I'll head on through. Follow in behind me in a few moments," Jacob said to Greg. He turned and looked over to Micaiah and Shonku who were talking with one another, "I'll see you two on the other side." Shonku waved meekly and Micaiah smiled and waved to him. Jacob then walked through the red hued gate.

It seemed incredibly small, but as he walked to the next gate, his body stopped. It started feeling as if it were moving around his insides. He looked down to see his clothes and body changing, before he could see the rest, he fainted and fell through the next gate.

-----------------

Laying on the ground now on the other side was a new Jacob.

Bio:
Name: Jacob
Gender: Female (for now)
Class: War Cleric
Hair: Hair similar to Say'ri's colored black with a gold band similar to Tharja's.
Weapons: Steel Axe, Killer Axe, Mend.
Weapon Stats: Axes C, Staffs D.
Body: A mix of Lissa's and Libra's build.
Clothing: Green and White Cleric clothes

What happens next?
1311111211111111111.title: Jacob goes ahead

13111112111111111111.content: Is Greg affected the same way Jacob was?
13111112111111111111.title: Greg, Shonku and Micaiah find Jacob.

choices: Greg and Jacob try to work through it
131111121111111111111.content:
****Greg's Bio (for now)*****

Name: Greg
Gender: Female (for now)
Class: Assassin
Hair: Still red, pulled into a ponytail like Anna
Weapons: Steel Sword, Bronze Bow,
Weapon Stats: Swords B, Bows D.
Body: Similar to Anna's build.
Clothing: Mainly dark blue, silver, with some black.

*****End bio******

"Ugh...agh!" groaned Greg as the three of them had rushed through the portal to catch up with Jacob. They had no idea what had happened to him after he went into the Red Gate first. They were running on adrenaline right now and passed right through the gate to a new realm, although Greg passed down to the ground soon afterwards.

"Phew...that was a bit nasty." Greg said before gasping and covering his mouth. Looking down, he saw how much smaller his hands looked. He looked further down, seeing a dark blue and silver assassin's outfit, showing off parts of new assets on his chest. He could feel longer hair, still red, tied at the back of his head. Looking around from "her" sitting position, Greg saw that Micaiah had a surprised look and was coming over to help. Shonku on the other hand....

"Hahahahahaha!" she started laughing, holding her sides in laughter. Greg almost immediately got angry at her, until she saw what she was also laughing at. She saw what she assumed to be Jacob, clad in purple and black clothing, looking every bit a girl like her.

"W-What in the world just happened?!" Greg nearly yelled, hearing her higher voice for the first time.

"I don't know. Did that red gate do something?" suggested Micaiah. As Greg shrugged, Jacob was coming to. Long story short, Jacob had the same reaction.

"I wish I could destroy that gate for doing this." seethed Jacob, not hiding her anger.

"That could be a bad idea. For all we know, it could be your only way back." said Micaiah. Then, Greg turned to her.

"By the way, why are you two still the same?" she asked.

"Maybe it only works on guys, or the really reason you experienced." said Shonku, having calmed down and helping out a bit.

As if things couldn't get any wierder.
131111121111111111111.title: Yes, he's female now.

1311111211111111111111.content:
"Here," Shonku said as she stood above Jacob and reached her hand out to help get him up. She reached forward with her new, slender fingers and grabbed Shonku's hand as she pulled herself up. At that moment, she realized that her chest's assets were exposed just as much as Greg's, even though she now wore Sorcerer clothes. She used one of her thin arms to cover them and pulled a leg across the other, crossed.

"Hee hee, relax. You should get used to it," Shonku said helping Jacob stay balanced.

Jacob, not enjoying this, decided he should try to if he's gonna be stuck like this for awhile. "Fine," Jacob finally said in her new high, somewhat low-toned voice, "thanks Shonku." Jacob looked over as Micaiah was helping Greg with her new body. Jacob looked over the weapons he brought and saw they were replaced. Jacob sighed at losing his weapons and his old armor...not to mention his gender.

"And who knows," Shonku stated, "maybe you can try my dress on later. Hahahahahaha!"

Jacob looked over at Shonku somewhat annoyed and chuckled, "Har Har. Be careful, I might just learn how to use these and need help training..." Jacob said with a mischivious look. Shonku gulped, looking nervous again. "Haha! Got ya!"

Shonku smirked nervously and continued helping him.

What happens next?
1311111211111111111111.title: Greg and Jacob try to work through it

13111112111111111111111.content:
As Shonku helped Jacob to at least most around with the new center of gravity, Micaiah walked over to Greg, offering her a hand.

"Well, you want to get up?" Micaiah smiled at her. Greg was a bit surprised at Micaiah's generosity and not even taking a chance to make fun of her first like Shonku. Never the less, Greg accepted the hand and got to her feet, stumbling a bit as she did. Micaiah quickly came over and helped her stay up.

"Watch yourself. Got to balance a bit differently here." said Micaiah with a smile.

"Heh, thanks." Greg said with some embarassment. She looked back and saw a sword strapped to her back. At least, unlike Jacob, she wouldn't have to get used to a lot of new weapons, despite now having a bow instead of axe.

"You going to be okay?" asked Micaiah, her face showing concern.

"Y-Yeah, I think I can get used to it, although I'm not sure about the chest." blushed Greg. Not only was the front of the outfit a bit revealing, but the assets inside weren't exactly small. Micaiah giggled a bit at Greg's reaction.

"Well, you can look on the bright side, most girls would be envious of you now." she said, still giggling. Her sincerity allowed Greg to relax a bit, even laughing a bit herself.

"Not quite what I was hoping to be envied for, but I guess it's a start." said Greg, which got both of them laughing. Once they calmed down a bit, Greg spoke again. "Thanks for the help Micaiah."

"No problem. I'm always happy to help." smiled Micaiah. Greg was happy to know that she cared this much, even in the oddest of situations.

"Well, at least I still look kind of cool in this get-up. But hopefully Karen won't see me like this. That could be bad." said Greg.

Micaiah laughed some more at Greg's statement. "She'll probably be jealous." she said, almost laughing even harder now. Greg laughed a little bit, at least glad that Micaiah could find humor even in this situation.
13111112111111111111111.title: Greg and Micaiah

choices: Set up camp on the beach
131111121111111111111112.content:
Shonku walked close behind Jacob who stumbled over in her Sorcerer clothes. "Hey Greg, um...." Jacob said, still trying to grasp the situation. Jacob then almost fell as she was still getting use to her new clothes and body assets.

Shonku caught her, "You okay?" She asked, somewhat worried even after this.

"Y-yeah," Jacob said, "hey, what do you guys think about finding a place to rest? I've had enough excitement for today." She said.

"I guess that be good," Greg added to her friend's comment, "but where?"

Micaiah then entered with, "There might be a town nearby, but if I hear that correctly," she stopped as the sound of water crashing made the noise on the beach, "there's a beach nearby. Maybe we could set up camp."

"I honestly don't care,"Jacob said obviously worn out, "what do you think Greg?"

What does he decide?
131111121111111111111112.title: After getting used to it

1311111211111111111111122.content:
"To be honest, I'm not feeling too confident about going into town." said Greg, blushing slightly. Shonku started giggling at her face.

"Not looking forward to other men seeing your breasts?" she smiled at him.

"Quiet you! Augh, I never would have thought that I would exactly be glad that Karen isn't here." mumbled Greg.

"Well, that aside, I don't care either way. So, if Greg doesn't like town, then perhaps the beach?" said Jacob. Micaiah smiled at the idea.

"I like that idea. I never got to see the ocean back in Daein." said Micaiah. Taking a second to remember what she was talking about, the others decided on where to go.

"Fine, beach it is." said Greg.

"Thank goodness that this dress is made of light material." said Shonku, fanning herself a bit in the heat. It wasn't too bad, but it was pretty warm where they were right now. With this in mind, the group of females began walking in the direction of where they heard the water. The path took them through some trees to get there.

"So, any idea where we are?" asked Shonku.

"Not sure. Don't think I've heard of this place. Perhaps we'll find out later." said Jacob.

Walking through the brief forest, they soon came to a clearing, as the ground became sandier. Looking forward, to some delight, it was indeed a beach. Looking to the right, they could even see the town not too far away.

"Oh, that's good. If we need to go to town, we won't have to go far." said Micaiah.

"Indeed. I haven't been in a real town since leaving Kiradia." said Greg.

"Me too." said Jacob.

Anyway, the group got themselves situated into the area, putting whatever supplies they had down and making a suitable camp.
1311111211111111111111122.title: Set up camp on the beach

13111112111111111111111222.content:
Jacob walked back out of the forest carrying a bundle of firewood she just cut down with an axe. She walked over to Greg who was digging a fire out as she dropped the wood beside her, dropped her axe and fell on her back, breathing exasperated. "You okay, Jacob?" Greg asked the tired Sorcerer.

"I'm fine, thanks," Jacob said, "if only I was used to this body I could've brought back twice as much wood." Jacob was still somewhat frustrated at this as Shonku walked over and sat her right side up, giving her a hug. "Thanks Shonku," Jacob said somewhat cutely.

Micaiah soon came from around a rock and walked towards the three, "Oh hey Micaiah," Greg said, but noticed something different about her, "What is it Micaiah?"

What is it?
13111112111111111111111222.title: After that

131111121111111111111112221.content:
What surprised Greg the most was that Micaiah was not wearing her usual red dress. Instead, she was wearing a similarly colored red bikini. Needless to say, it looked pretty good on her, as evidenced the reddish look on Greg's face.

"I really hope this ends soon." grumbled Greg, as she wasn't fond of doing this while still female. However, that soon turned to confusion as she looked again.

"Where did you get that?" she asked Micaiah.

"I got it a little ways over there. Turns out this is kind of a resort." smiled Micaiah. Having noticed, Jacob turned in their direction.

"Really? I think I've heard of those before, but don't see them often." she said.

"Yeah, me too." said Shonku.

"Oh, and I got some for all of you too." smiled Micaiah, revealing 3 other sets in her arms.

"W-Wait, you expect us to..." Greg trailed off, not wanting to really get anymore into being female than he already was. Shonku smirked at her.

"Oh come on, it'll be a good experience for you." she then smiled.

"I don't know if wearing a bikini was really what I had in mind." sighed Greg.

None the less, Micaiah had gone through the trouble of getting the swimsuits, so the group decided to try them on and enjoy themselves for what it was worth.
131111121111111111111112221.title: She wants to swim (Bond Chapter)

1311111211111111111111122211.content:
Micaiah passed two over to Shonku and Jacob, one a green pair, the other a black pair. Shonku walked with Jacob behind some brush nearby. "I'm not so sure about this..." Jacob said, already feeling odd about this.

"Oh Jacob. Relax and have some fun with it," Shonku said perkily, "Now, how do you get that thing off?"

Jacob looked down at the green and white dress that was stuck tightly to her body, "Um...I don't know." Jacob then realized that Shonku was behind her.

"Oh! It's tied up back here. Let me just untie it aaaannnnndddd..." As soon as she finished the green part and skirt of the dress fell revealing the clothing underneath. It was a white linen, one piece undergarment that wrapped around her upper thighs and barely reached her chest, exposing quite a bit of her breasts. Jacob let out a small squeal, which he couldn't believe he did, and tried to cover them while Shonku...

"Hahahahahaha! Oh Jacob! You're so adorable," she said as she hugged her friend from the side.

Jacob was angry for a moment, but finally smiled lightly, "Thanks Shonku. Can you help me with the rest though?" Jacob said nervously, somewhat embarrassed.

"Of course," Shonku smiled. After getting that off and changing out of her bride suit into the green swimsuit, she handed Jacob the black one.

"Oh Jacob, you look great!"

Jacob's face reddened as she looked towards the ground, "Thanks...You too." Shonku hugged her again, this time Jacob hugged in return and walked back out.

What happens next?
1311111211111111111111122211.title: Trying them on

13111112111111111111111222111.content:
"Got one for you too." smiled Micaiah as she came over to Greg. She had pulled her over to the side, giving them some privacy too. In her hands was a sky blue bikini, pretty nice looking, which made Greg blush.

"I don't know about this. I am supposed to be a guy after all." said Greg. Micaiah smiled again.

"It's okay. None of us think wierdly of you. Besides, it's a chance for some good fun. Even back in Daein, I never got to enjoy myself like this." said Micaiah.

"Honestly, you..." said Greg before closing her mouth.She couldn't bear to tell her yet that she was just an Einherjar. She didn't want to depress her.

"Well, if you insist." said Greg slowly.

"Great. I'll help you out of that." said Micaiah. She helped Greg take off the assassin outfit. Similar to Jacob, Greg was also wearing a one-piece linen undergarment, although hers was light blue. Blushing heavily, Micaiah helped her with that too.

"Now, you put it on like this and put the cups..." Micaiah kept explaining as Greg tried to put on the sky blue bikini top. After some help, she finally got it on, holding her breasts up and making her blush again. The bottom came on soon after.

"A perfect fit!" said Micaiah with a smile. Greg felt heavily exposed like this, but she was glad that Micaiah was happy about it.

"Well, as long as you're happy about it." smiled Greg.

With that, the two of them walked out and awaited the others for their little fun.
13111112111111111111111222111.title: Greg and Micaiah

choices: Greg and Micaiah - Summer of Bonds 2/3
131111121111111111111112221111.content:
Jacob saw Micaiah and Greg appear in their swimsuits as they were all ready. Before she could even act, Shonku grabbed Jacob's hand and ran with it towards the water. "Shonku! What are you- Whoa!"

Shonku jumped into the Ocean as she pulled Jacob in tow, who followed suit. Jacob emerged a second or two later with her wet, dripping hair in her face as Shonku resurfaced and began giggling. The water was fairly cold, but felt refreshing to Jacob. As she pushed the hair away, he received a splash of water in her face, delivered by Shonku.

Jacob smirked, "Oh that's how you wanna play huh?" Jacob pulled her arm behind her as she through a large splash as Shonku who laughed and tried swimming away. Jacob smiled and laughed as she chased after Shonku. He might not enjoy being a girl very much, but had to admit she was having fun as she chased Shonku. She finally reached her as the two had another splashing skirmish. The two continued for awhile as they started swimming with each other. "I'm surprised Jacob," Shonku said floating on her back, "you're usually pretty serious."

"Well...I guess this did something to me." Jacob said. "Plus," he swam closer to Shonku, "I'm having fun with you."

Shonku giggled as she swam around a bit more.

What happens next?
131111121111111111111112221111.title: Summer of Bonds

1311111211111111111111122211111.content:
While Jacob and Shonku had their fun, Greg and Micaiah were playing around in the shallower parts.

"I never swam that much, if really at all before." said Micaiah.

"Oh, it's not too bad, although I'm a bit afraid myself. If nothing else because I'm afraid of the top coming off." said Greg, which made Micaiah giggle.

"You seem to be getting the hang of it. I wonder if there are other worlds that will be like this." she said.

"You mean, that red gate? Well who knows, all I know is that I'd rather not be like this when I find Karen." said Greg.

"I imagine she would have lots of fun with you on that." smiled Micaiah.

"Most likely. Anyway, let's go in a bit more." said Greg.

The two of them went a little deeper in, Greg feeling the cool water on her mostly exposed body. It was an odd sensation, but not that bad, Greg could admit that much.

"Is there a beach like this in your world?" asked Micaiah.

"Kind of. Not nearly like this though, but there is an ocean for swimming and whatnot." said Greg.

"Sounds nice." said Micaiah.

Greg liked seeing Micaiah happy, although she still dreaded the thought of her just being an Einherjar. Greg honestly didn't want her to forget. Honestly, she had grown a bit attached to Micaiah (as a guy to clarify). But one little splash from Micaiah woke her from her deep thoughts, and the two started playing around.
1311111211111111111111122211111.title: Greg and Micaiah - Summer of Bonds 2/3

13111112111111111111111222111111.content:
Jacob dragged herself out of the water and next to the fire pit Greg had dug and fell, wet and tired. Shonku walked over and giggled as she poked Jacib with her foot. Jacob rolled onto his back and smiled back at Shonku, "Thanks Shonku."

Shonku giggled as she left to get her bed situated, it was getting darker out. Jacob looked and saw Micaiah and Greg walking towards the camp too. Micaiah walked past as she went to change into her regular clothes as Greg sat by the fire, somewhat tired. "Hey," Greg said plainly.

"Hey," Jacob replied as she looked at the sky. "What an....odd day, huh Greg?" Jacob said. Greg nodded.

"You alright?" Jacob said. She knew both of them were worried about their current bodies, but she wondered if something else troubled her.

What happens next?
13111112111111111111111222111111.title: Summer of Bonds 3/3

131111121111111111111112221111112.content:
Long story short, the rest of the day and night was spent in the little campsite the group made. The whole time, Jacob couldn't really figure out what was troubling Greg. She knew that Greg was doing her best with the changed bodies, but Jacob figured that something else was on her mind.

Soon enough, the next day had come. Everyone was already back in their usual clothes.

"Are you sure you're okay?" asked Jacob again.

"Yes I am. Why do you keep asking?" said Greg, getting a bit annoyed.

"Well, something seems really off about you lately, and I know it's not the changed bodies thing. What are you thinking about?" Jacob asked. Greg sighed, knowing that Jacob wouldn't let anything go.

"Alright, I'll tell you later, but can we travel a bit first?" suggested Greg.

"That's fine." said Jacon.

With that settled, the group was off once again. Essentially, they were looking for anything. Either they come to the town or the next Outrealm Gate. One or the other anyway. Greg was unsure if she wanted to get roped into any more female roles.

Then again, since when did anything go according to plan.
131111121111111111111112221111112.title: The Next Day

1311111211111111111111122211111121.content:
Jacob and the others walked into the town. It was larger than his once standing town, but smaller than bigger cities. They walked through, Jacob felt uncomfortable along with Greg as a few people stared at them, "Look," Jacob said whispering to Greg, "We'll split up and ask around about any odd activity or your sister."

"Alright. Let's meet back here." Greg said as Micaiah followed her and Shonku followed Jacob.

Jacob entered a small tavern like area and approached the counter, "Excuse me sir?"

The bartender turned and looked over at Jacob. "What can I do for ya miss?"

It took a second or two for Jacob to recover from that comment, "Has anything been happening that's odd? Like people from out of town, news of some kind?"

"Well," the bartender said, rubbing a hand on his beard, "There has been noises around town at night. That and some people have noticed silhouettes by the Outrealm gate."

Jacob placed a buillion on the counter, thanked the bartender and left looking for more info.

What happens next?
1311111211111111111111122211111121.title: The Town

choices: Jacob and Shonku reunite with them
13111112111111111111111222111111211.content:
"So what are we looking for, Greg?" asked Micaiah.

"Well, I suppose anywhere where you might find good information. Anything about the Outrealms, Karen, or the Risen for that matter." said Greg, fidgiting a bit as she walked through the streets with Micaiah.

"Are you okay?" she asked.

"I'm fine. It's just that this outfit is so wierd. I'm not sure if an assassin suits me." said Greg. Micaiah smiled at him.

"I suppose. You're not the dark and shadowy type like Sothe was." said Micaiah. It took Greg a split second to remember who Sothe was: another one of Micaiah's companions back in Tellius. Anyway, the duo continued looking through the streets, until Micaiah noticed a sign.

"Bagon's, the finest spot in Ariella." she quoted.

"Well, I guess now we know what realm we're in. Ariella, apparently. I guess this particular spot isn't known for modestly." Greg smirked. Micaiah lookes interesting in going in.

"Maybe we can find someone who can give us some information." she said.

"Hmm, I guess it's as good a spot as any." said Greg.

With that in mind, the two of them entered normally. The place looked like a cross between a restaurant and a tavern, sort of. One thing was for sure, the place as busy as heck.

"Oh man, how am I going to find anything here?" Greg sighed to himself.

At that point, what happened?
13111112111111111111111222111111211.title: Greg's investigation

131111121111111111111112221111112112.content:
As Greg and Micaiah looked around, Jacob and Shonku followed through the door and met with Greg and Micaiah. "Hey, figure anything out yet?" Jacob asked.

"Nothing," Greg replied. "And you?"

"A few tips," Shonku added, "but no concrete stuff."

"I have a feeling this might take awhile before something comes up."

Just then a man approached Jacob and Greg. "Excuse me, are you two gals willing to help with something?"

Greg, confused said, "What do you mean?"

Apparently the man heard differently as he replied, "Perfect," and grabbed their hands and walked through a nearby door. "What's your name?"

Jacob searched his mind for a name he could use when he thought up, "Claire."

Greg, also quick to think said, "Sarah."

Suddenly the man passed Jacob a seal with a star inside and a Seal with a mug inside to Greg.

"What are these," Jacob asked.

"Special Seals," the man replied, "We need another hand working the tables and a dancer. You two willing to make more gold?"

Jacob wasn't very fond of the idea, but he knew they needed coin to continue their search.

What do they decide?
131111121111111111111112221111112112.title: Jacob and Shonku reunite with them

1311111211111111111111122211111121121.content:
"Why do you need help now?" asked Greg.

"Oh, some of the staff went on to other jobs. Been a bit understaffed for some time now. That's why I've been saving those for a while." said the man. Both of them looked at the seals. Both of them had a golden frame, signifying that they were not ordinary classes. Jacob's had a shining star on the inside, while Greg's had a mug inside, and they both looked quite perplexed.

"If you need some privacy, I'll leave for a bit." said the man, who walked past them and out the door, although he was probably waiting just outside. Jacob turned to Greg.

"What are these? I've never seen these before." said Jacob.

"Me neither. I always knew of special seals that include dread fighter and bride, but these don't seem to go with any of those. I imagine it has something to do with what he said about working around." said Greg.

"Well, we are a bit short on coin, although I do have worries." said Jacob.

"Like what?" asked Greg.

"These female forms are almost becoming too comfortable. What if these seals do something really good?" asked Jacob. Greg gave her a look of understanding. She often had the same fears lately.

"Well, maybe something good will come of it. You first." said Greg. Jacob sighed, but nodded anyway. She firmly grabbed the star seal and it suddenly began flashing. The light engulfed Jacob, although it wasn't enough to blind Greg. Greg could see shifting around Jacob, and when the light died down, she almost gasped. Gone were the war cleric clothes and now Jacob was wearing a traditional dancer's garb, showing off most of her assets. Each of her clothes were white, and the cloth she now had was white too. A white hairband was on her head as well. She even had two big rings now around her wrists.

"Wow." gasped Greg. Jacob came back to her senses, and almost immediately tried to cover up, as you could say that the wardrobe was barely more than a bikini in some areas. In addition, Jacob now noticed that she had some better swords: namely a Silver Sword, Killing Edge, and a Brave Sword. Not a bad trade off.

"O-Okay, now your turn." said Jacob, a little reeling from the change. Nodding tentatively, Greg did the same to her Serve Seal. A light engulfed her too, shifting around her. When the light died, Jacob gasped as well. Greg was now wearing a blue tavern-like dress (that was only knee-length like a Cleric's), some brown boots, a white undertop that covered her breasts where the dress didn't, and some white gloves that went up her forearm with a gold clasp, similar to the Dancer garb. In addition,Greg noticed some lances in his inventory: a Spear, Silver Lance, and a Beast Killer. Another good trade-off.

"Wow." breathed both of them. They just stared at each other for a minute.

"Well....at least you look good." said Greg.

"Not bad yourself." said Jacob. Both of them felt awkward at this.

"Well, might as well head out and do this. That guy is probably tired of waiting by now." said Greg.

After Jacob agreed, they both began to walk out.
1311111211111111111111122211111121121.title: The two get to work

13111112111111111111111222111111211211.content:
Greg walked out as the man outside the door handed her a platter with two drinks on it. "These are for table over there," he said as he soon turned to Jacob and walked through another door nearby. Greg decided to deliver the two drinks. As he approached the table that ordered, he saw the two to be Shonku and Micaiah, both giggling.

"Listen, Jacob and me thought it'd be good to try and get some gold and the guy just offered us a quick job since they appear to be understaffed." Greg said, a little embarrassed.

Micaiah smiled, "I didn't say anything bad. You look great."

Greg felt a little more comfortable and smiled after setting the drinks down, "Thanks."

Shonku stopped Greg before she left, "Wait. Jacob too? Where'd he go?"

Just then applause rang out in the tavern as on a stage stood Jacob, blushing until she was as red as the Conqueror's Armor. Shonku began laughing and Micaiah giggled along as Greg stopped for a moment to watch.

Jacob wasn't sure how to start, but he suddenly felt impulsed into dancing. She began twirling and jumping as the people cheered more. Jacob concluded as she danced that the seal allowed her to do this. She was incredibly nervous yet able to preform such tricks. After a few minutes she finally ended as the tavern roared cheering. Jacob smiled nervously to the crowd then disappeared.

That's how it was the rest of the day. Greg served food out to people and Jacob danced for them periodically. Finally Jacob caught a break and was able to get a drink with Greg.

"Nice work," Greg commented as Jacob smiled and thanked her.

Then the man who hired them walked forward with large bags of gold, containing a few gold bricks and coins. "They're yours," he said, "you deserve each bit of it. I've never seen so many people pack in her cause of you two. Maybe I'll see you again?"

"Maybe." Jacob said and left it at that, ready to leave with her sore body.

What happens next?
13111112111111111111111222111111211211.title: The Dancer and the Waitress

131111121111111111111112221111112112111.content:
"Man, that was rough." said Jacob as she carried her sore body through the slight woods.

The group was returning to their campsite, having received a good pay from the tavern. They were still in their new classes from the tavern: Jacob being a Dancer and Greg being a Waitress. As they went back, they endured some questions from Shonku.

"It's funny. I've heard of many classes, but I don't think I've ever heard of a Waitress class. Don't think I've seen them often." she said.

"Neither did I. Maybe the Outrealms have more mysteries than we thought." said Greg.

"At least you're well dressed though. How anyone can go around in this outfit is beyond me." said Jacob.

"Aw, but you look cute in it." said Shonku, poking Jacob childishly, making her turn red.

Soon enough, they reached their campsite, and began getting ready for the night after some food. Greg wondered how they were going to change back, although she had to admit that she found the dress flattering. At least, lots of guys told her that.

"You alright?" asked Micaiah.

"Oh yeah, sure. Just thinking." smiled Greg, which made her smile too.

Soon enough, the night came and they went to sleep, thinking about just what would happen next.
131111121111111111111112221111112112111.title: They return to camp

1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.content: Jacob woke up and looked around to see the others asleep. Even though she was still tired, Jacob got up and walked out by where the beach meets the ocean. Jacob sat down by it and let the water almost reach her before being called back into the sea. Jacob looked her body over, still trying to comprehend her changes. She laid on the beach a little while longer when...
1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.title: During the night

1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.content:
Jacob was watching the water when he heard someone behind her. She turned and saw Greg walking over to her, "Hey Greg." Jacob said as she turned to the water again.

"What are you doing up," Greg asked curiously. Greg took a seat next to Jacob.

"Couldn't sleep...These bodies..." Jacob said surveying her body. Greg took a moment and looked at her waitress uniform.

Greg knew where Jacob was going with this, "Yeah. It's too comfortable now."

"Is that honestly a bad thing though? I'm willing to bet that there's a crap-ton more realms where we're like this. Might as well get used to it." Jacob commented. "So Greg...I'm fine if you don't want to talk about it, but what's Karen like?"

What happens next?
1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.title: ...Greg woke up.

1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.content:
"She's a nice girl, couldn't find anyone nicer in the whole realm." smiled Greg.

"Sounds like you enjoy her company." smiled Jacob.

"I'm an only child, so she was my playmate when we were kids pretty much. She's pretty hyper, but not so much that it's annoying. We have very similar interests." said Greg.

"Oh boy, a girl that acts like you?" smirked Jacob.

"Watch it." warned Greg, but both of them ended up laughing in the end.

Before too long, after their brief talk, both of them went back to sleep, or at least tried to. However, Jacob's dancer clothing made sleeping feel a little wierd, even though the female body was becoming more and more comfortable.

Meanwhile, Greg couldn't help but think that his waitress wardrobe was pretty flattering as well.
1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.title: Greg talks about Karen

1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.content:
Jacob woke up from her sleep and sat up. She stretched her arms and legs and yawned, her limbs still somewhat sore. She stood up and walked over to Greg and shook her shoulder. Greg awoke a little startled, but still somewhat tired. "Huh? Oh, hey Jacob. I'll go wake up Micaiah."

Jacob nodded and shook Shonku's shoulder. She rolled over in her frilly dress and smiled up at her, "Hey Jacob."

Jacob stood up and stretched as Greg approached her a few seconds later after she woke Micaiah. "So, any idea what we're gonna do next?"

What happens next?
1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.title: The next day

1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.content:
"Well, do we have much else to do in this realm?" asked Greg.

"I'm not sure. I got lots of information when I was.....dancing." Jacob said with a heavy blush, which made Shonku giggle. "Some of the guys were claiming that they heard odd noises heading in the direction of the Outrealm Gate. It's possible that, if our targets came here, they might have already left."

"Crud." said Greg, banging one hand on a tree as she walked by it. No doubt she was frustrated. This had nothing to do with their bodies. Greg didn't care much about it right now. She just wanted to find Karen and bring her home.

Jacob could feel what Greg was feeling.

"Don't worry. She's in one of these realms. We'll find her even if we have to turn every realm upside down. And if we have to do it like this, so be it." said Jacob. Shonku giggled at the serious look on her face.

"Nice speech." she said. Micaiah laughed a bit too.

Anyway, as the group enjoyed some light-heartedness, they bypassed the town, heading towards where Greg heard the next gate was. Before too long, they found it a couple miles past t he town or so.
1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.title: Leave this realm

1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.content:
The four approached the Outrealm gate ready to go in. "I'll head in again first. Follow me through a in a minute." They nodded and Jacob walked through. She stood in the Outrealm portal as her foot hit something. She looked down to see a seal with white floating in it. "Huh? What is that? A seal with...steam?" She picked it up and shrugged, deciding to activate it. She clicked and she felt her body begin changing again. She saw her clothing change as she fell through the gate to the next realm.

She regained consciousness and awoke, her body incredibly hot for some reason. She could see the gate and watched it for Greg and the others. Jacob then realized it she was still a she. "Great...Another female realm...". She looked a her clothing to be an open, blue-purple robe with strips of cloth barely covering her, much like the dancer.

What happens next?
1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.title: Heading right in

1311111211111111111111122211111121121112.content:
"Hmm, didn't hear anything back." said Micaiah.

"I wonder if it's another female realm." said Shonku.
