choices: They all introduce themselfs properly and exchange their storys.
A group of Risen/Bandits attacked the camp just after they started eating./other
1513111.content:
Lungulus wasted no second after hearing Jacob call for help and grabbed Anna's elixer. After pouring some in Jacob's mouth his - for some reason still existing - wounds healed quick, but he was still too weak to get up on his own. With a little help from Leonardo he moved Jacob up to the fire and laid him against a cliff side they used as cover for the camp. Leonardo handed Jacob a flask with water, while Lungulus tried prepared something that Jacob would be able to eat with what little they had. Anna while smileing counted the gold she made from some deals in town and handed Lungulus some ingredients, when he asked for them. Jacob wanted to help them in someway, but as he tried to stand up he felt Lungulus pushing him against the cliff again.

"Take it easy. Once you had a little rest you can think of a way repay us, 'kay?" said Lunglus while giving him a warm smile.

"Oh, on the note of pay..." Anna joined the little conversation with a devious smile. "You owe an elixer now, Lungu."

"The most you'll get from me is Concoction. Your elixer still has two uses left you know."

"Awww, but you got your first Einherjar cards! I even let you guys have them for free..." she said in a sad tone and putting on a heartbroken face.

With a long sigh, disappointed for falling to his own little weakness for Anna he responded: "Okay, okay, when you our friend over there you get the elixer AND the next bullion i get off an enemy..."

With a complete change in expression and voice Anna gave Lungulus a quick hug and went on too Jacob askin if he needed anything, handing him a blanket and doing whatnot. From the other side of the camp the was a little chuckle heared from Leonardo, who was standing guard scanning the area.

Jacob was amused at the scene, but also startled as he heard about the part with the Einherjar Cards. Not that he could pay it much mind, while Anna was constantly askin how he felt or what he needed. It was a little irritating at the beginning but he got used to it fast. But he couldn't shake off the uneasy feeling he when the cards were mentioned, since he remembered the Einherjars attacking him.

It didn't took long till the soup Lungulus ended up cooking was finished and they sat down to all eat their share of it. Since Jacob had regained some of his strength he took his part, before sitting down leaning against the cliff again, but didn't eat anything for now.
1513111.title: Unusual helpers

15131112.title: A group of Risen/Bandits attacked the camp just...

151311121.content:
Jacob just sat there, his body just felt...weird. As if someone tore out his bones and put sticks in their place. He looked at his body to see his armor and clothes with tears across it. He sat there, not having enough feeling or motivation to eat when Leonardo turned his head toward a forested area. This caught Lungulus's attention. "What is it Leonardo?"

Leonardo stood and grabbed a bow he had out. "I'm going to recon out here again..."

"Hang on," Lungulus said,"I'll head out with you. Anna, can you keep him company?" Lungulus added motioning over to Jacob. Anna nodded smiling and continued eating. Jacob was already tired again, and closed his eyes for a moment.

Then he heard a scream.

His eyes flew open to see a bandit in tattered clothes had Anna down and was frisking her for any goods. As that happened, Jacob saw a larger man with a pelt on his back and a skull of some animal on his head. The man got closer and pulled an iron axe out. Jacob managed to stand with his back propped against the cliff wall. Jacob was ready to just take the blow when he realized there was a weapon on his back, hidden under his coat. Jacob knew what to do that very moment.

He waited until the man lunged forward and lifted the axe. Jacob then reached from behind, pulled the sword out, threw himself into the bandit chief, stabbing him through the gut. The man fell with a disturbing gurgle of blood as Jacob yanked the sword out of him. Jacob's vision was hazy as he looked at the next man, who let go of Anna and charged at him with a sword. Jacob waited then dropped below his swing and brought the sword through his chest. The man fell next to the chief dead.

Anna got up, a scared look crossing her face, "Wait, if bandits are here then-...Lungulus! Leo!"

Jacob didn't know where this strength was coming from, but he ran off into the forest as Anna called after him.

Jacob saw a small opening where Leonardo laid against a tree severely wounded as a man with a bow held an arrow to his neck. Lungulus was down, unconscious. The bandit just finished looting him and was moving towards Leo when Jacob brought the sword down on the archer's neck, lopping his head off. The other man though had been quicker and dug his axe into Jacob's shoulder. Blood squirted out in a stream as Jacob still through his sword at the man, impaling him. The man fell over dead.

Jacob approached the body and yanked the sword out. He then saw the man holding something in his hand. Jacob took it and recognized it to be a Dragonstone. He slid it into his pouch, thinking it could be important. Anna quickly ran from behind as her and Leonardo stared at Jacob. "H-help...them," he said pointing to Lungulus and Leonardo, "h-help them f-first....I-I'll..." That's all he finished with before he collapsed.

Jacob awoke to be covered in bandages as he laid...
151311121.title: Bandit attack

choices: Jacob inside the card or somewhere else.
1513111212.content:
How about Jacob wakes up INSIDE the Einherjar card he was force into?

Or we could look at what the rest of the groups doing while he get back up...
1513111212.title: Gotta love these chioce chapters...

choices: ...he's back at the camp. (They summon him again)
15131112121.content:
Jacob looked at the world around him to see blue streaks of light or whatever they were cross across his vision. He remembered this place from after he was beat by those Einherjar, and still did not know where he was. His body was cold and numb. He could not push himself to move or anything. He laid across this plane of wherever he was and laid. He could remember what happened moments ago. Three people "found" him and took care of his wounds, then they were attacked. Jacob saved two of them and then blacked out.

Jacob remembered their names. The girl, who he concluded was a merchant, he believed her name was Anna. Jacob wasn't sure about the other two, though he knew their names were Lungulus and Leonardo. He decided that the archer is Leonardo and the Tactician is Lungulus. Jacob's body convulsed as he let out a coughing fit. He felt the taste on his lips when he finished. Blood. He then remembered the blow he took to the shoulder before blacking out. He turned his head toward the side where the axe dug into his shoulder to see a wide open wound. Oddly, however it was not bleeding.

Jacob laid there for what felt like hours until...
15131112121.title: What the cards hold...

choices: Lungulus wakes up in the camp, after being out for two whole days.
What going on in the camp after they get back. (Other choices welcome)
151311121212.content:
As Jacob started to fall, Leonardo wanted to help him stand, but before he could get to him a wave of pain from his own wounds brought him to his knees, too. The thing that stopped Anna from catching him was that before Jacbo even got near the ground it looked like some blue streaks wrapped around him like chains and his body dissolved into air. Leonardo and Anna were frozen in place by the sudden disappearance of the Einherjar or more the WAY he disapeared.

A painful sounding moan got the two back to their senses.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------

Lungulus was moving a little. He barely felt anything, his whole body numb as if it wasn't his own. He opened his eyes a little only to see everything in a blurry vision. He heard voices sounding like they were miles a way. They were hollow and muffled. But slowly he stated to understand them. Sounding lively and familiar.

"Ann...a? Le...onardo...?" Lungulus asked in a voice that seemed so unfamiliar. It was dead and still. So different yet, exactly like he felt. Empty. Like his life before the start of his journey.

"He's... Lungu... Get up, please..."

These word stuck in his head Lungulus felt something. Somebody was worried. Someone cared...

Slowly he picked himself up from the ground or at least tried. His arms and leags gave away and he fell back un a small puddle, but felt like he had to get back up or he would lose something that grew dear to him.

"Come on... stronger than... you know it!"

This time he got up a bit further and before he fell to the ground again was caught by something. He looked over his shoulder and saw two blurry images come clear. Two people. His... friends. Leornardo had a serious face on and a look of concern in his face, despite himself being in a bad condition too. Anna looked worried and had watery eyes like she was about to break down crying. Lungulus couldn't stand the fact that they felt bad just cause of him. Inside he was screaming in hatred for himself for never even telling them the reason, why he kept the Dragonstone all this, no matter how often they asked.

Looking at Anna again Lungulus said: "Stop giving me that look will you? I always take care of my part of a deal... You get bullion back at camp 'kay." with a sly warm smile, hoping to keep her from crying just cause of him. And he could be happy, if he would be in better shape she would have hit him for that smile.

"Back with living as it seems. How do you feel? Can you stand?" Leonardo asked after a reliefed sigh.

"I' feel just fine..." was the awnser before he almost fell down back on the ground again.

"Here. Let us... help ...you..." the instand Leonardo saw Lungulus's front he his expression turn from serious and concerned to the one of terror while Anna could do nothing, but let out a scream in a moment of shock.

As Lungulus looked down on himself, he saw what startled Leonardo so much. An extremly deep cut of in his stomach region and his entiry front was full of blood. He was starting to get some feelings, but he wished he didn't. Cause he felt noting, but a throbbing pain.

"DAMNIT! I knew you shouldn't have taken that blow for me! We've got to get you back to the camp NOW!" Leonardo shouted as he and Anna got to Lungulus's side and tried to get going, but were stopped when Lungulus started coughing heavily and fell to his knees, resting one hand on the ground holding the other in front of his mouth. After a few seconds Lungulus vision started to get blurry again, before he threw up a mix of blood and his last meal. He felt something under his hand and slide it into a pocket of his coat while the others got him back up and started moving back to the camp. He was already unconscious again, before they started moving him towards the camp.

Lungulus wasn't aware that what he picked up was Jacob's Einherjar Card, neither that he had lost the Dragonstone. And broken the only promise he ever made with it. At least for now...
151311121212.title: Something lost, Something found

1513111212122.content: Perhaps Anna and Leonardo notice the card and try to summon Jacob again to help?
1513111212122.title: What going on in the camp after they get back. ...

choices: Lungulus and Jacob wake up a few days later.
15131112121221.content:
It felt like hours until they finally brought Lungulus back to the camp. His condition was critical, and only getting worst as more blood poured from the gash on his chest. Leonardo and Anna then propped Lungulus agonist the cliff the same way they did with Jacob. Lungulus, still unconscious, as his head lolled from side to side. Anna was scared on the verge of tears and Leonardo held a face of serious concern. "Wh-what are we gonna do Leo?!" Anna said, her voice wavering.

Leonardo didn't answer until he spotted something. There was something in Lungulus's hand. He walked over an bent next to him and slid it out between his fingers. He looked and realized that is was the Einherjar's card. Blood from Lungulus's hand had smeared on the card as he wiped a bit away with his thumb. He looked it over and looked back at Anna, "Maybe he can help," he said, trying to give her hope. Quickly, the card flashed.

------------------

Jacob laid on his back, the situation replaying over and over again in his head. Who were those people? Where was he? Were the other two okay? Jacob thought about that until something happened.

He felt sharp pain in his shoulder and heat rushed through his body. Jacob's vision flashed and went white. He regained vision as he was coughing up blood that landed on his chest. He looked over to see he was next to a fire and realized it was the camp from before. He then looked up and saw the archer, Leonardo, standing above him. He quickly bent down next to him and helped Jacob sit up. "Can you help us," Leonardo said urgently, not hiding the worry in his voice.

"Wha-? What do you-?" Jacob's voice trailed off for two reasons:

1. His body was still primarily weak from the recent battle. And...

2. He then saw Lungulus' body. Blood was puddling up on the ground as it was now slowly pouring out as bandages from Anna slowed the bleeding, but didn't stop it.

He then saw the merchant girl, Anna, right next to Lungulus. Tears rained from her eyes as she sobbed. She turned and looked over to Jacob. "Pl-Please...You have to help him! Please!!" Anna said, tears rolling down her face. Jacob didn't know what he could do, when he then remembered something. Lungulus, the man who healed him, had given him he elixir after he was healed.

Jacob reached into a pouch around his belt and pulled out the elixir, still having two more uses. Jacob held to Anna, who wasted no time snatching it out of his hands and pouring the rest of it down Lungulus' throat. His wound began to close until a large, faint scar appeared, but that didn't compensate for blood loss. Jacob rolled himself onto his knees and hands and crawled next to Lungulus and placed a hand on his head. He was sporting a fever slightly. "G-Get him water..." Jacob said plainly and weakly. Anna sprang into action and returned with water and a blanket as she covered him up and poured water down Lungulus' throat.

The two looked back at Jacob in shock of the save he made with the elixir. Jacob looked back at Anna and said, "D-Don't worry...I'll pay f-for...it..." Jacob then fell on his side unconscious again, although not disappearing. Leonardo grabbed his blanket and covered him as they bandaged the axe wound on his arm. The day passed as they tried to keep their conditions stable.

What happens next?
15131112121221.title: Sure

choices: Jacob approches them and gives the Dragonstone back.
151311121212211.content:
It's been two days since they were attacked by the bandits and Leonardo and Anna started to get worried about when Lungulus and their new friend (they did't see Jacob's name on the card) were going to wake up. The night was almost over and the sun would rise in a few hours as Lungulus slowly came to his senses. It was still dark and the fire was slowly dying down. As he looked around, he saw Jacob lying next to him against the cliff. Lungulus saw his bandaged shoulder and wondered where he got this injury from unaware of him having saved them all. Next he noticed both of them covered in blankets that had several dirty spots from some sort of food or water. After feeling something give him a nudge, Lungulus looked to his other side and to his surprise found Anna sleeping next to him. After seeing this he couldn't help but smile and stroke her head a little not to wake her.

"She must have been watching over us the whole time." Lungulus thought. Looking around to see if Leonardo had seen him wake up, Lungulus noticed he wasn't to be seen anywhere. "Must be on guard duty..." Lungulus knew the morning must be near due to the slightly brightening sky and the fire. Something made Lungulus feel uneasy, though he couldn't point his finger on it. Like he forgot something important. As if had lost a part of him.

He tried to distract himself with something he could do so he, under some pain, got up and covered Anna in the blanked he they had use to keep him warm and moved over to the fire bringing it to life again with some wood. As he looked around the camp he found some fresh meat Leonardo must have hunted while he was out. After taking some of it and a few spices and vegetables he started to prepare something for breakfast.

After the food was ready dawn was but a few minutes away as Lungulus sat back and relaxed a little. Sadly the feeling he was trying to shake off bugged him the entire time he tried to get the food to be something of great taste, this time it was somewhat okay if not barely edible.

Lungulus heard footsteps and turned his head to the side, grabbing his elthunder tome he toke back while he looked around the camp. Luckily he saw it was Leonardo who had come back and wanted to greet him, but was silenced by a gesture from Lungulus pointing to Anna and Jacob. After walking up to the fire, Leonardo put his bow away.

"How are you feeling? Anna and I thought you would never wake up." Leonardo asked happy to see his friend moving and not painfully turning in his sleep, while he took some of the meat Lungulus had prepared.

"Moving hurts still hurts but other than that I'm fine. What did you do to keep me from dying anyway?"

"We didn't do much other than feeding you two the soup and made you drink some water for the last two days. Three with this one." Pointing over to Jacob, after sitting down next to Lungulus and added "He was the one who poured some of the elixer you used to help him, down your throat."

Lungulus was feeling uncomfotable about the part off being fed by his friends, but got over it quickly since everybody in his condition would have had to be. "Remind me to thank him for that after he wake up or I might forget it."

"I guess I don't have to do that. He's coming to it." Leonardo said hearing Jacob grunt and seeing him get up on his feet.

---------

Jacob was hearing voices. They were that seemed familiar. He didn't want to move, but he could smell food and felt like he hadn't eaten anything real for weeks. Forcing his eyes open and moving his body to keep himself from falling back to sleep, which -despite the fact that it hurt his shoulder like all hell- wasn't that easy. He let out a few grunts cause of the pain and forced himself on his feet. He looked to the side as he heard a yawn and saw the merchant, Anna if his memories weren't totally screwed, waking up. Then he noticed he was still in the camp of the group that were attacked by the bandits.

"Back with the living just like myself, huh?" said a voice near the fire place. It as the tactian of the group, Lungulus was it, sitting next to the archer, Leonardo, who still looked extremly familiar. "Thanks for saving my life by the way. Guess were even now."

"I guess so. What smelling so good?" Jacob said, for once seeming quite rude to just ask for food instead of introducing himself or anything.

After letting out a little laugh the awnser was: "Breakfast. Can you get your share yourself?"

Jacob stumbled over to the fire place and found some vegetables and meat fried with help of the fire. He toke a good portion of the meat and started eating. It was not that great but he couldn't care less about it's taste right now. Out of the corner of his eye he saw the calm expression on Lungulus's face suddenly change to to a the one of a paniced animal after, he seemed to fail at finding something on the inside of his coat. Jacob could hear him curse quietly to himself over and over again. After he wispering something Leonardo, who just shock his head to say no, he turned to Anna.

"Please tell me you took the stone while I was out, Anna. Oh by the gods PLEASE tell me you did!" Lungulus almost shouted.

Anna who was still half a sleep didn't quiet get why Lungulus was so panicked and only really understood the word stone, so she replied: "What about the stone? You have it since we travel together, remember? Or did you decide to sell it now?"

After hearing this Jacob understood that they must be talking about the Dragonstone that bandit had in his hand back at the forest clearing. "But selling it? Who would even buy something like that... or could they be...?!" Jacob had heard of some groups that were hunting manakete for their Dragonstones to sell them like jewelry to nobles or keep even them as trophys! Before he could react though Lungulus had already jumped up and was ready to run towards the forest, but after a few steps already started coughting heavily and fell to his knees.

Leonardo hurried over to him. "Hey! Don't try something like that just after you recovered from such an injury!"

"Do you think I care right now?! I'll have to find it no matter what!" Lungulus shouted in Leonardo's face.

Anna who had only seen such an outburst from Lungulus and never any hostile reaction towards his friends was shocked at that. "Calm down, Lungu! What's the matter in the first place?"

"The matter?! It's GONE!" Shouted Lungulus back trying to get Leonardo off of him. Thankfully to no avail.

"Like this, you won't find it anyway. Lungulus! Calm down and when the suns up we go looking for it, okay?" Leonardo who was still keeping Lungulus from running in the forest tried to talk sense into him. After a little bit of more struggling Lungulus gave up and started to cool down.

After a long silence in the group Jacob finally asked the question that was burning inside him: "What's so special about a stone?"

Anna and Leonardo looked at him like he was a mad man after having seen Lungulus pretty much explode like that and were ready to hold Lungulus down again if needed. But he merly looked at him, with the expression of a broken man who you kicked after taking everything he had left away from him and let out a long sigh.

"I should have told you guys much earlier about this. I knew that, but something always told me to keep quiet about it, so I did. It was just so much easier..."

Anna and Leonardo were surprised by the sudden change of Lungulus a few days ago refused to awnser any of their question regarding the Dragonstone now was willing to tell them everything about it. And that even to someone who they just met, too!

"You sure you want to talk about it now? I mean you were always so edgy when that came up..." Anna asked worried about how bad it must be for him, to change from a strong person who was there for everyone and helped them with their problems, to like a child who had lost it's mother and no one to care for it while it was crying in the rain.

"I've kept this to myself for to long already." Lungulus said this with his lifeless eyes staring into what was left of the fire. "As I told you I lived in a small village in one of the Outrealms. What I didn't tell you that humans and manakete live together in my village peacefully. I wasn't having it really easy. Mother deadly sick, father working all day - mostly mercenary jobs as an escort where he was out for most likely weeks- , and the other kids were either manakete or four to five years older than me. No one wanted to have much to do with me and I kept to myself, mostly reading books or learning swordsmanship. That was my all day life until bandits kidnapped a girl of our village. For our village it would have been to dangerous to just try to free her ourself so they hoped for help of the capital and its army. Since I felt like I couldn't just wait for them to arrive I went to help her myself. Tricked the bandits and got in their group helping her. When the army arrived I finally got her out off the cell and got her her Dragonstone back and everything went well with us escaping. For some reason, that I still don't understand, she tried to become my friend after that, I mean yes I helped her, but that act of me was actully more dangerous than it helped. She visited me daily, help me with chores... Hell we even played games together! It was the first time I felt truely happy. And when ever the manakete or others were picknig on me I could cry myself out on her shoulder. She was like a big sister. The day before I met you, Leonardo, SHE GAVE ME her Dragonstone and I made her the ONLY promise I EVER made. To keep it until I can give it back to her as soon as I have the chance starting the next day. When I went to look for her, I got torn to another Outrealm through Old Hubba's little accident. And now I don't even have a CHANCE to keep that promise!"

After finally telling them everything Lungulus just started cring curled up in a ball with Anna and Leonardo trying to comfort him.
151311121212211.title: Old stories of a broken man's heart

1513111212122111.content:
Jacob stood, looking at Lungulus sobbing. He felt as if all this was his fault, but not knowing why. Jacob remembered the stone, but needed to calm him down or else Lungulus might think he took it. Jacob knelt in front of Lungulus, curled up like a kid crying into his arms. Jacob reached into the pouch on his hip and cupped the Dragonstone in his hand. Leonardo and Anna didn't see what was in his hand, however. Jacob grabbed one of Lungulus's hands and held it palm up. Jacob slowly let it roll off his hands into Lungulus's, whose eyes looked up to see the Dragonstone in his hand.

Anna let out a quiet gasp while Leonardo had a look of shock, along with Lungulus. Jacob then closed Lungulus's hand over the stone. "I found a bandit nearby who had this after he frisked you. I took it not knowing what it was." Jacob placed one hand on Lungulus's shoulder, "That promise...I'm gonna be sure you keep it." Jacob said with a warm smile.

Lungulus fell, his face in Jacob's shoulder, still sobbing. He tightly held the Dragonstone, not wanting to lose it again. Jacob help Lungulus stand as Leonardo and Anna both held Lungulus, who's tears had slowed. "Th-Thank you..."

Jacob smiled when all of a sudden, his vision turned to a blur. His world began spinning and he felt himself falling. Jacob's body yet again felt cold and weak all of a sudden. When his vision returned, he realized he didn't fall since Leonardo, who gave Lungulus to Anna as she placed him by the fire, had caught him. Leonardo carefully laid Jacob back down on the ground. As he laid there, he heard it. Anna leaned over and said to Lungulus, "For an Einherjar, he falls a lot."

What? Einherjar? But he was a human, flesh and blood. He turned his head to face Anna, "W-what did you just say?"

Anna glanced at Lungulus, who's calmed down a bit then said, "Your...your an Einherjar. We found you on a card and summoned you."

Jacob laid there as his words reached his ears. How could that be possible even? Then he remembered. The Einherjar attack. Jacob slammed his fist into the ground angrily. This got the other there's attention again.

Jacob was breathing heavily when he slowed and said, "I'm...My name is Jacob. I came from a small Outrealm village. I traveled around the Outrealm until about two years ago I traveled around other Outrealms. Then, I was attacked and beaten by Einherjar, who preformed some ritual on me and..." Jacob had progressed himself as he was sitting up on his hands and knees. "I'm stuck to a card?! And the life I had to rebuild for myself is gone again?! That I'm just a husk of a man?!" Jacob looked at Lungulus, his eyes with despair. Then it was Jacob's time for tears.

Jacob let it his head hit the ground, falling between his arms as his sobbing quickly turned to crying. He just laid there, a shell of himself. Jacob couldn't even know how much time has passed since the attack. Days? Months? Years?

He laid there, tears pouring from his eyes, when he felt a hand grab his shoulder. The person raised Jacob to his feet slowly an slung his arm over his shoulders. Jacob turned his head to see Lungulus. "You said that I'd fulfill my promise. You gave me another chance to fulfill it. Now I'm gonna make sure your life doesn't go to waste."

Jacob nodded, "Thanks...". Lungulus smiled back warmly. Two broken men working to try and fulfill their life. Lungulus sat Jacob next to the fire as Lungulus sat by Anna again, Leonardo standing over Jacob. They all sat there quietly when Jacob finally asked, "What now?"

What do they do next?
1513111212122111.title: Jacob approches them and gives the Dragonstone ...

choices: The Taguel pushes it to far with another insult and Lungulus snaps.
15131112121221111.content:
"We should get moving. We've lost to much time already and if the bandits from a few days ago had friends, they might be looking for us for what happend." Lungulus concluded. "In the state Jacob and I are in it probably wouldn't end good for us." They could all agree on that.

"But we still have time for breakfast, right?" Anna said in a joyous mood before grabbing some food.

"Yes, we do." Leonardo took the chance to enter the conversation. "At least if you enjoy the taste of old leather.", was added by him after trying some of it now.

At that comment Anna slowly passed what she took for herself to Lungulus, who, just like Jacob before, dug into it like it was the last meal he would ever get. While Lungulus was eating Anna went to prepare her goods and Leonardo started to take down their the camp. After feeling better Jacob wanted to help Leonardo with the a tent, but Lungulus grabbed a hold of his arm, forcing him to sit back down.

"Let him do it alone. If we have another little blackout we just lose more time, than we would gain from helping him." He said quickly. "Also I would like to talk to you about something."

"Sure. What is it?." Jacob replied understanding his point.

"You were attacked by Einherjar, right? Do you remember who they were or why they did it?" Lungulus seemed really serious about this.

Jacob had to think about this for a little while, but all he got from it was a headache and no awnsers. "Sorry, but I can't awnser either of those questions. Why do you ask?"

Lungulus' mood changed a bit grim after hearing that awnser. "We're helping someone named Old Hubba, the man who was keeping the Einherjar cards save, get back the cards that he lost for some reason about 2 months before I met him. He told me that if someone summoned Einherjar wrongly, they would go berserk. I thought that might be the reason why they attacked you, but also performing some ritual? Seems not like it in that case..." Lungulus grew silent for a bit eating up what he had left of his food.

Jacob was confused after hearing what Lungulus just said. Why would they perform that ritual on him if they went berserk? Wouldn't they just want to kill him and go on to someone else? But he had an idea jump in his head.

"But then why would they attack me then? Except someone was-"

"Controling them." Lungulus cut him off, having the same thought process. "And if that's the case, maybe that someone is trying to force people into card hoping to create Einherjar that follow the orders of the one who summoned them." Then suddenly a smile crossed Lungulus' face. "You know what that also means? That, even if this isn't the case, the most you could have been stuck in that card would be about 2 years by now, since they only went missing for about 2 years."

Hearing that made Jacob feel extremly relieved, since it also meant that his friends would be still alive and not everyone he knew would have died off old age before he even knew what happened to him. But that also meant he and his new friends had a great problem they had to deal with, if their theory was correct. But that fact washed away for the moment as he there was actually a chance he could return to his life. "If this binding to the card is really forced, then there probably is a way to break it. You think this Old Hubba guy could help us if it is?"

"Probably, but there still is a chance that you are a true Einherjar now. So don't get your hopes up to high. Just in case, 'kay?"

Before Jacob could think of how to respond to that, Leonardo called them over since he and Anna had finished packing everything. After Lungulus and Jacob walked over to them, they told them of the theory of how Jacob became an Einherjar. Leonardo was silent thinking seriously about the odds of them retrieving the rest of the cards, while Anna was worried what would happen to the people, and her customers, that ritual was performed on.

"Breaking our heads about this problem won't get us anywhere right now. I suggest we think of a way to deal with it, when we get the chance to. For now let's go through the Outrealm gate of this place. If I remember correct it was just a few hours on foot from here, right Leonardo?" Lungulus said determined to get moving the sooner the better.

"You're right. If we keep going along the edge of the forest we should find it." And after checking if they were okay, Leonardo added: "Can you two carry your stuff on your own?"

"I sure can. Just worried if that goes for you too, Jacob." Lungulus said grabbing his weapons, the knapsack and a blanket. Jacob just nodded and took his tome and swords, as well as grabing one of the tents so Leonardo did't had to carry both of them.

The entire way to the Outrealm gate, there was not a single spoken word. Everyone had other things on their minds.

Leonardo's on the task from Old Hubba and what other problems may occur.
Anna on which goods she could sell and what she needed to restock for the group.
Jacob on his friends and why all of this had happened to him.
And Lungulus on where their next destination would be and when he would ever retun home.

When they arrived at the Outrealm gate Lungulus was struck in awe. Even though this was the 5th time he saw an Outrealm gate, they still fascinated him.

--------------------------------------

They were giant, white gates seemingly bathing in light, no matter if day or night. They were the connections between the realms, but always would lead somewhere else. You could sent in two random people through it and they would probably never see each other again. But if you were traviling as a group and wanted to stay with someone else they would sent you to the same realm, as odd as it may sound. Once they opended and you went through them it felt like you were swimming in a river and looked like you were flying trough the clear blue sky. When you would exit the gates again, you would never know where this place was, since it put you at some completely random point in the realm they lead you.

--------------------------------------

After the group came out on the other side of the Outrealm gate, they saw they had landed in a thick forest that was flooded with light and the live of it could be hear everywhere. It had a calming atmosphere that could ease all the worries they had.

If it wasn't for a distorted feminine voice shouting something they couldn't understand followed by what appeared to be a growl. As the group turned around they saw what looked like some kind of giant rabbit like beast starring rigth at them ready to jump any second. Lungulus and Leonardo (who mistook it for a laguz at the moment) had never seen a Taguel before and backed away a bit as the ceature in front of them spoke up.

"You human scum are not welcome in this forest! This is OUR home! Leave now if you want to, ever see to your rotten families again!"

This warnig was all it said, but the last part was enough for Lungulus to get over the shock of what this being might be stepping in front of the rest of the group looking directly into its eyes. After a second or less of his stare the Taguel felt extremly uneasy and was ready for anything.

"You may call me what ever you want to, but if you say a single word against my familiy again, none of gods will be able to help you then." After saying that he turned to the rest of the group and they started to walk in the opposite direction of where the Taguel was standing.
15131112121221111.title: Einherjar and Outrealm gates

151311121212211111.content:
The group walked from the Taguel, feeling it's stare at their backs. "Go on...run back to what rotten lives you have," the Taguel began again, "IF there's anything left of it."

It took mere seconds before Lungulus pulled Elthunder from his robe and cast the lightning at the Taguel. It jumped out of the way as the lightning leveled a tree. "You dare face a Taguel?!" The voice said angrily.

Leonardo and Anna tried to hold Lungulus back, not realizing that the Taguel was charging. Before Anna or Leonardo could react to Lungulus' warning, Jacob moved in front and stopped it's claw. It held there until it jerked it's hand away. Jacob, still not in peak physical form, brought the guard down as his sword was pushed away as the Taguel dug both feet into his chest.

Jacob flew backwards until he bounced off a tree and hit the ground. Lungulus snapped. As the creature pulled away, Lungulus shot Elthunder at a tree as it fell, almost hitting the Taguel. Lungulus already readied a second strike, and when the Taguel dodged the falling tree, Lungulus shot the spell hitting her.

She let out a whimper as she flew back a little ways. Lungulus breathed heavily as Leonardo ran off to Jacob. Anna and Lungulus walked closer until they stood over it. It's side was bleeding as it's ears hung. It looked up at Lungulus, but he couldn't read them. "Help her." Lungulus finally said, breaking the silence.

"What? You wanna help it?" Anna said, surprised that Lungu wanted to heal what he just hurt.

"No. I want to heal her." He knelt beside the creature's head and pulled out a concoction, as they were low on elixirs. "Here. I didn't mean to hurt you like this. I'm sorry..." He poured it into the Taguel's mouth as the wound healed slightly.

Lungulus then heard the Taguel mumble something. "What was that?" Lungulus said.

"Ayra, human. My name's Ayra. And...thank you..." Ayra the Taguel said as Lungulus scratched her head.

---------------

Leonardo finally found Jacob's body as he laid on his chest. "Jacob! You alright?!" Leonardo asked obviously concerned.

Jacob rolled over, his chest was a little bloody but not too bad. "Yeah. Don't worry, I'm fine...Could you just help me up?" He reached it out as Leonardo took his arm and slung it over his shoulder. "Thanks."

"Don't mention it," Leonardo said, "Now let's get back to Lungulus and Anna."

What happens next?
151311121212211111.title: The Taguel pushes it to far with another insult...

choices: Before the talk goes on they hear screams from the forest.
1513111212122111111.content:
Lungulus was having feeling really bad for harming this bei-- Taguel if he heard her call herself that right. But why? All those other times he let his anger controle himself, he NEVER felt so depressed and angry with himself after he got a hold of himself. He looked over to Anna who, since she had no idea what Lungulus was up to at the moment, just shrugged. With a depressed sigh he turned back to the Ayra who was getting back up on her feet.

"You sure you're good to go?" asked Lungulus as Ayra tumbled a bit. "Still... I'm sorry for hurting you. How can I make up for that one?"

"Why?" Was all Ayra said with a little growl towards Lungulus.

"'Why' what?" Now Lungulus was confused. "What's her problem now? Probably still mad for hitting her..."

"Why didn't you finish me human? Why let me live and even help me? If you would have killed me, I would at least kept my honor by dying for the clan!" Ayra was filled with rage feeling taunted by Lungulus and his will to help.

"Is that all? Easy." Lungulus now wasn't concerned for Ayra that much anymore, if she could stand again and show that much agression, so his expression had now turned completely serious. "I let my anger control myself and reacted to someones immature taunt, that way letting myself down on the level of a child. If one can't controle their emotions, then they don't have any honor. AND by helping you I'm willing to accept the consequences of my actions." While saying this Lungulus sounded like an experienced fighter, but also making sure that it was clear he lectured both of them with his words. "But you, Ayra, also shouldn't forget. There is no honor in death. Asking for something like that is only running away from your responsibility. If you care so much about honor you have to work hard to restore it and nothing else."

After he had finished the last part, Lungulus knew there were two out comes for this situation.

Scenario #1: Ayra would take this as an insult and pick another fight wiht him.
or
Scenario #2: She would understand his intentions and calmed down.

Luckily it was scenario #2 that unfolded. Ayra was backed down and released the tension in her body, taking a few deep breaths. The three turned their heads to the side as they heard someone approach, just to see it was Leonardo helping the slightly wounded Jacob. At the sight of Jacob Ayra's eyes went wide and whimpered. One of her most force full attacks BARELY SCRATCHED a human. After the two walked up to the rest Leonardo threw a dirty look over to Lungulus for losing his cool, before he turned to the Ayra.

"I'm sorry for my friends behavior just now. He tends to lose his temper when it comes to his family." Leonardo said bowing down a bit in front of Ayra. "Please don't mind if I ask, but I must say I have never seen a Laguz like you before. Could you tell me what tribe you belong to?"

Ayra looked at him for a moment confused by what Leonardo had just called her, but in the end just said: "I don't know what these 'Laguz' are, human. But to awnser your question, I'm a Taguel."

What happens now?
1513111212122111111.title: The Taguel

choices: Somehow this rushed and cmopletely mad plan works out for the better.
As expected, from this suicide mission something goes wrong. (Just what does?)
15131112121221111111.content:
"Well, since we already know your name, Ayra, I guess we should introduce ourselfs. My name's Lungulus and this is Anna, the merchant of our group." Lungulus said pointing over to Anna, who gave Ayra a friendly smile.

"If you need another Vulnerary just let me know. You'll get one of my special discounts!" Anna proclaimed happily.

"I wouldn't trust her on that." Lungulus whispered to Ayra, while making sure Anna didn't hear him. "It's still gonna cost you more than 3-times it's worth. Anyway..." Lungulus raised his voice, for everyone to hear again. "To get back on the toppik, the blond archer's called Leonardo and the man who blocked your attack to help me is Jacob."

Ayra was about to say something in responde to the friendly instrucktion from Lungulus, but was stopped by something before a single word would leave her throat and her exprssion changed far from the clam and collected look she had so far. Her ears perked up and she looked in a few different directions, before finally setting on one. While starring that way he face showing a serious, and for a second worried expression.She was able to hide the last part quick, but not fast enough to go unnoticed by Lungulus. Whatever caused her to raise her guard like that had to be something bad. Lungulus faced the same way that way Ayra looked and prepared an Elthunder spell in case they were gonna attacked by something. Jacob also noticed the tension in both of them and prepared himself, while carefully looking in all directons.

But if it would only HAD been an attack. If it would be something simple that you learned to shake off. What hit them and to what it would lead was far worse and much harder to get over. the sight they would see at the end of this day would be disturbing to the core, beginning simple.

A scream.

But it sounded more like a call from the depths of hell. It seemed so unnatural, like it didn't even belong in this world. It was a mixture of hatred and terror. Pain and despair. Agony and suffering. And it wasn't truely alone. Many other screams followed, only a lot more distant, but not in anyway nearly as disturbing or as loud. Any sane person who heard this would run. As fast as they can, never looking back. But Lungulus couldn't. He had nowhere to run, but that wasn't the true reason why he stayed. He didn't run because he wasn't the kind of person that would go on and ignore it if something was obviously wrong.

Lungulus wasted no second thought on this matter, threw his knapsack on the ground and headed in the direction the screams came from, before the others even knew what just happend. However, they realized it in a matter of seconds put down their own pieces of the camp equipment and chased after him, weapons ready.

Ayra, who almost seemed to be frozen in time if it wasn't for her deep breaths, just looked after them with a shocked and paniked expression on her face. This state didn't last long though. Hear ears went back down towards her back and the only thing left on her face was pure hatred, while in her eyes raged the fury of a hundred storms. She started to growl like mad and bolted down the path the others had created.

As Lungulus got closer to the area the screams were coming from, he noticed black strips in the treetops. and the smell that reached him soon after made it clear it was a forest fire. Knowing this would have calmed him down a bit, if it wasn't for a certain stench in the air.

Burnt flesh.

Lungulus stopped for a moment behind a huge tree, which was large enough for five grown man to stand side by side bhind it and someone on it's other side wouldn't even see them, to catch his breath. He didn't know how far he had already gotten and started to walk around it. When he saw what was on the other side his eyes widened in disbelieve, shock and anger.

It was a village burning like hell. The people, who he assumed to be Taguel from their rabbit ears and them being covered by much more hair (or was it fur?) than humans with surprising agility even the older people had, were running from something. As he looked in the direction they were coming from he saw a battlefield that more looked like the inside of a slaughterhouse. About 50 or so Taguel were trying to fight an army of barely trained soldier, which in itself would be hard for them if it wasn't for the sheer amount of humans outnumbering them 5 against 1. Still, those who tried a breakthrough were almost taken out in a single blow by any of the Taguel fighters. But there were still a lot of humans who got through every possible gap, chasing after the fleeing poeple and mercilesly cutting them down. No matter if it were the old, the injured or the weak. And even if the Taguel were far superior to most human soilders, they didn't see the far more experienced fighters in the mix. They attacked everytime a Taguel had just struck down one of their comrades and if they failed just waited for the next to go in and then try again. The thing that was the most surprising, was the fact that there weren't any archers or mages or any kind of ranged fighters with the humans.

After Lungulus got a far to good look of the massacer on both sides he heard a rustle in a tree nearby and instinctively got down. This just saved him by but an inch or to from getting impalled by the lance of pegasus knight. As Lungulus turned around an Elthunder ready he noticed the confusion on the peg. knight's face who had stopped in mid air. What caught Lungulus' eye was the lance that had nearly torn a hole in him. It was completely red, with a shared spearhead that seemed to have some kind of fangs inbetween it. Most likely to tear appart whatever it dug into.

Before any of the two could continue, Jacob, Leonardo and Anna arrived a the scene, all with weapons in hand. As the peg. knight saw them approach, he let out an annoyed sigh.

"You guys were suppose to tell us, if you set up an ambush for the beast!" the peg. knight said, clearly angry and mistaking them for someone else. "I though you were one of those! Do you mercenarys never follow the orders of your employer?!"

Lungulus was quick to pick up on this. They would need as much information as possible. "Look man, I'm sorry 'bout that one, but we need to get info on how the fights going and you guys never tell us anything. We can't work like that, or what do you guys say?" Lungulus said, before turning to the other to tell them to play along for now.

"Oh, come on! You what more do you guys need to know, than what the commander already told you?" The knight didn't even try to hid his annoyance. "You should do your work instead of ask for unnecessary details."

"We just ran around the entire place as your 'commander' told us to." Jacob said putting on a grim face. "If you wanna cause touble, go ahead. You will know understand your mistake then. Also that paladin said one of you would tell us what going on right now."

"What paladin? The commanders a general, remember? I can belive he's letting your kind fight along side us in such a battle."

"See? I told you that was another one of these 'quick cash makers'! Those guys have no respect for our work. They don't know what fair deal is." Anna said sulking.

"As if YOU would know what a fair deal is..." Leonardo mumbled a bit. Looking at the peg. knight he added. "So your gonna tell us what going on or what now?"

The knight was clearly starting to get pissed at them now. "Fine. Those peasents we put in most of these armors will all play meatshields for you, while you take care of most the beasts. It's not like they can do anything else anyway. Hell they barely know how to hold their weapons right!" After saying this the pegasus knight started to laugh like a saddistic maniac. " And don't worry ybout them running or betraying us. They wouldn't dare. Even if they did, the commander would set their fields ablaze and kill their families. Oh and us pegasus knights make sure non of these beasts escape. Why else were we trained to fight in such wild forests and given these lovely Beast Killers." The knight said, more likely making a statement, than asking them.

Knowing this would be the best that they would get to know from this guy, Lungulus jumped back in the conversation. "Well, I guess that's all then, right guys?" He turned to the group and they all got what he meant. Jacob and Anna just nodded, while Leonardo raised an eyebrow in a questioning manner. Lungulus nodded. and turned back to the peg. knight, with a smile on his face that would perfectly fit a madman. "Then let's join this slaughter!"

The peg. knight was happy to be able to get rid off these freaks, but wouldn't go nowhere. As soon as Leonardo was out of sight he shot an arrow in the pegasi's wing which caused it to crash in a tree crushing it's rider beneath itself. After the crash Lungulus turned back to the others.

"I believe we all can agree on the thought, that they could use our help." He said plain.

Ayra, who finally caught up to the group heard the last part and saw the dead peg. knight lying beneath his pegasi. She was still burning with fury. "If you want to help get rid of these flying rats!" she growled and continued her march to the battlefield helping her poeple.

Lungulus was about to shout somthing at her came up with the an idea. "Jacob! You go after and tell her to get some good fighters to get away from the rest of the Taguel. This will most likely get the peg. knights on your tail, so lead them to an open area. Leo and Anna, you make sure our 'mercenary comrades' have some accidents, while you flow Jacob and Ayra. Make sure no one sees you. And Leo. You will have to shot down the knights too. Make every hit a kill. I'll take care of the General somehow. Objections? No? Good. Move it!" And with that he ran of onto the battlefield.

The other didn't have much of a choice now, since Lungulus was already gone so they had to do as he said, if they atleast hoped to get a chance to survive.
15131112121221111111.title: A blazing bloodbath

choices: They get back to Lungulus and the others
151311121212211111111.content:
Jacob ran in a mad sprint toward Ayra. He was only able to run so fast compared to her, but somehow ran beside her. "Slow down!" Jacob called out over the roars of the battlefield.

"What is it?! I don't have time while my people are suffering!" Ayra yelled, still enraged.

"I know! But we have a plan," Jacob yelled. This caused Ayra to look at him. "We need a few fighters to draw back from the battle and lead the Pegasi away. Can you do that?"

Ayra continued to run. Jacob at first thought that she would not answer until she turned and nodded to him. She ran toward the line of Taguel and looked for a few fighters. Jacob followed around and attacked one of the Barbarians trying to break through. He then saw Ayra returning with a few other Taguel. Jacob couldn't tell male from female now beside armor.

"Alright! Follow me and Ayra!" Jacob yelled. He then made a sprint out of the village as the Taguel ran all around them. Jacob ran but then fell. He thought he would hit the ground, but he was actually picked up and placed on Ayra's back.

"Keep up Jacob!" Ayra yelled.

Jacob realized all the other Taguel were extremely fast alongside Ayra. Jacob nodded back to he and turned around saw a few Pegasus knights flying over toward them. He pulled out Katarina's bolt and struck one down as they finally pulled a good number away from the battle and turned to fight them, Jacob dismounting Ayra.

Anna was within a mass of warriors. She snuck around the army's lines when she saw a large group of knights who seemed to be at the back waiting for a moment to charge. They all were off their mounts however and a few were unarmed. Anna smiled as she pulled away and found the row of knight's horses tied up. She smiled and cut the ropes as the horses bolted in all directions away from the battle. She hid again before the knights saw her and as a few tried to chase their mounts down. "Another satisfied customer," Anna said to herself as she went toward Jacob's position for support.

Leonardo was hiding in a large mass of trees as he waited for a moment to attack. Then he saw the other Pegasus knights that did not head off toward Jacob and Ayra were attempting to flank the Taguel line.

He knocked an arrow on his bow and raised it as he hit one of the riders in the neck as he fell from the Pegasus. He continued until a few of them were left an finally found him. But before they could reach him or alert anyone else, Leonardo already shot them down.

Lungulus had made his way around the enemy to where he was hiding behind a boulder behind the Enemies' General. The man wore large black armor with a ragged condition shown on them. Lungulus also saw that there were a few Great Knights ahead of him. The general was too close to them that if he was taken out they would be alerted of Lungulus' position. Lungulus had an idea.

He took Elthunder and launched it out into the distance letting it explode. This caught the General's attention and it drew him away from the battlefield. He looked around as Lungulus jumped from the boulder, aimed, and fired.

Dead on.

Elthunder broke through an opening on the General's helmet, killing the man inside. This caught the other men's attention, but they did not notice Lungulus but saw their employer dead. No employer, no pay. No pay, no reason to fight. Many turned and ran as others were killed off fighting or trying to retreat.

Jacob and the others survived the onslaught as they finally finished their fighting. "We did it Ayra! We-" he stopped and saw Ayra on her side, a gash in her side left by a beast killer. He ran to her side. "Ayra! I need you to turn back to normal for me! Can you do that?"

She turned back to her normal form and laid there. Jacob's face went red seeing Ayra so fragile, but snapped out of it and bandaged the wound as best he could then picked her up as he went to find the others.

What happens next?
151311121212211111111.title: Somehow this rushed and cmopletely mad plan wor...

choices: A roar of the village elders echoed through the forest stopping him.
Suddenly from right beneath him a pink tornado threw him of his feet in the air.
1513111212122111111112.content:
Jacob was lucky. Ayra's injury looked worse than it actually was and the bandages he applied were enough to stop the bleeding, though he himself didn't know that Ayra was completely aware of it. That the wound wasn't to great was most likely only due to the fact that Ayra was a taguel and used to fighting. Still, she was breathing a bit heavily, but most likely able to walk on her own, if unsteady and slowly or at least if she put her arm over Jacob's shoulder for support.

When they were only a few minutes of walking from the, still like all hell blazing, village, Arya sunddenly signaled Jacob to stop and put her down. Jacob hesitated a little, as he was for himself still unsure about her condition. It didn't help his mind ease up that Ayra's human from looked like the body of an at most 14-year old child, but he still did what Ayra wanted from him. She stumbled a little, though Jacob was already by her side to help her keep standing.

It truly hurt Ayra's pride as a taguel that she needed help to walk and even stand straight. Even worse for her was that she showed her weakness to a human, who, yet again, was the providing help. There was one fact though, that eased this pain greatly for. The fact that Jacob was an experienced fighter, which didn't take a single hit in even such a chaotic fight and his strength in battle that surpassed most humans and was among the strengh of the best warriors of her clan.

This for Ayra extremly unpleasant moment was to her relieve cut short, as about seven unclear figures emereged from the shadows of the trees around them. After they got a little closer, before they stopped it became clear that they were taguel. All except the one in front of them transformed, looking around like they had no idea what was excatly going on and what they were donig here.

The one in his human form had a muscular build tall build and seemed to be about 20. He was probably 7ft. tall, but most likely taller. His face was cover in many scars, which made it extremly hard to make out what was his mouth, what just another scar and what everything else. The only feature that truely stood out were his eyes. They almost seemed to be glowing in the same blood-red Ayra's eyes had just a shade darker.

He looked a bit confused at Ayra, but his expression changed as he noticed her bandages with Jacob, a HUMAN, giving her hold. His face went red with anger at the sight of Jacob, while his expression showed the disgust about a taguel who would throw a way his honor and accept the help of something that was in his eyes lower than dirt. As the rest of the group had kept their eyes more one, apparently, their leader they startded to back of back into the shadows.

Ayra shivered a bit from this guys apperance. Jacob could feel her shivering while he helped her stand, before she could get a hold of herself. "You know this guy?" He asked quietly so the other taguel didn't hear him.

The only response he got was Ayra spitting towards the taguel. She definetly didn't like him, considering how much she seemed to respect experienced fighters or people with greater knowledge and understanding than her, like Lungulus and most likely the elders of her clan. Jacob was getting ready to fight. He could almost SEE the tension between the two exspecting the taguel around them to attack.

It didn't went the way he had expected though. Instead the taguel in front of them let out a short low growl. This didn't help ease the situation much, but it got the rest of the taguel group bolt into the forest, tails between their legs. There was a good part and a bad part about this.

Good Part: Jacob had now only one enemy if it comes to a fight.

Bad Part: This guy was going to be one hell of an enemy, if he scared the rest of them away with only a little growl.

After the stared down between the two parties continued the taguel finally decided to speak up, rather than to go at their throat.

"Will you look at that! Little Ay's getting friends with humans when she's a little hurt. From you I would expected to have atleast enough dignity as a fighter to die instead off begging for this guys mercy." His voice was deep and sounded a bit rough.

"You're one to talk! At least I fought for the clan! you were nowhere to be seen even near the battle, brother!"

Ayra spit that last word out like she was about to throw he last meal back up. Or blood considering her wound. Jacob took a few seconds to realize exactly WHAT that last word was. "Their not really- I mean- WHAT?!" Jacob though. "HOW by god are they related? They look nothing like each other..." It was true while that guys was a GIANT, Ayra seemed just far too small in comparison, despite the age differnce. Her body build was very fragile, while his looked like a normal iron or steel sword would just shatter on it. By the heavens, even their hair had a different color. The only thing they had in commen was the eye color.

"HE'S your brother?" Jacob asked out loud, without realizing it.

"That is none of your buisness." Snapped the guy back at Jacob. "But yes. This unworthy excuse of a taguel is my sister by blood.", he said every word filled with pure disgust.

"If one of us is unworthy of our bloodline it's you..." Ayra responded with calm voice, while on the inside she was ready to fight the taguel. "You abandoned the rest of the clan and hide from anything that could, become a challenge to you! You're afraid of loosing more than I hate being related with you."

This brought Ayra's brother to the edge. "You should watch your every word from now. You don't get anywhere near my skill in combat. Only the elder surpass "Tronger, the Blood Wolf". And they aren't around and that petty human ain't gonna keep me from getting you." He pressed out between his gritting teeth. He continued in a little less threatening voice. "Also, I was with the rest of the fleeing clan, protecting them from the scum YOU let through."

Ayra was taken aback at her brothers words. Not at the threath, but more at the fact that she herself hadn't considered Tronger to be with the rest of the of the clan, as well as having to admit her failure to keep the humans away from the group. She sunk her head in shame. Tronger smile with glee, knowing there was nothing she could hold against him now.

Too bad for him Ayra wasn't alone.

"That's a the best excuse you the "Blood Wolf" got?" Jacob asked in an aggresive and downgrading tone. Ayra turned her head up to Jacob's face having no idea, what he was aiming for. Tronger on the other hand formed fists with his hands, raising an eyebrow.

"What do you think you just said there human?" The smile on his face disappeared. His voice shaking with anger, disgust and the need for blood. Yet it seemed quiet calm for his state.

"The truth." responded Jacob. "IF your really that great of a fighter, why weren't you holding the line while telling Ayra to protect the other? If you're as strong as you claim, you could have kept any human from getting through, couldn't you?"

Jacob knew it was a bad idea to piss this guy off, but Ayra was, atleast kind of, his and the others friend and he would not let this guy harm his friends. He could see Tronger shaking with rage, ready to attack any moment now. Ayra for her part couldn't believe what Jacob just said. She knew he was still exhausted from the just recently ended battle, yet he was willing to fight someone, he knew he had little chances against at the moment.

Tronger transformed into his beast-form and got ready. As he was about to go at the two...
1513111212122111111112.title: Your greatest enemy? Your closest family.

15131112121221111111122.content:
Jacob was ready to counter the Taguel charging at him when the Taguel made a motion neither Jacob, Ayra, or Tronger expected. What appeared to be a miniature tornado came up from underneath him and tossed him off his feet as he crashed to the ground again. "You alright?" A voice yelled from behind where Tronger was. Lungulus, Leonardo, and Anna emerged from the forest the other Taguel fled through and stood ready to fight.

Jacob nodded to Lungulus as a reply as he turned and saw Tronger begin to stand back up. Jacob ran towards him and lifted his blade as he swing in a downward, diagonal motion. However Tronger didn't dodge it, but traded the blow with a claw that dug into Jacob's leg and chest. The two fell again as Jacob fell to his knees holding himself up with one hand. His vision had blurred, and his world was spinning. Jacob was ready to fall when he felt someone catch him. He looked over to see Ayra holding him up as she helped him stand with his arm around her shoulders.

Tronger got back up and stared furiously at Ayra as she helped a human. "Why Ayra? Why throw away everything I've done for you for this...pathetic excuse for being?"

Ayra turned back at her brother, "Because, this "being", has done more for me than you have my whole life!" Ayra screamed back.

'Ouch.' Jacob thought in his head as he saw Tronger obviously taken back by her comment.

Tronger was about to begin another charge as he moved but felt something pierce his leg. His looked and saw an arrow sticking out of it.

"Don't even think about," Leonardo said as he nocked another arrow into place ready to fire. Leonardo was ready with his tome and Anna was with her sword.

Tronger probably would've fought them, but decided to return to the elders. He turned and let out a low growl, dripping with malice, and ran into the forest. Ayra knelt down and laid Jacob down as Lungulus came over and Anna readied a Concoction and handed it to Jacob.

Jacob tasted blood in his mouth and felt the first drop trickle down the corner, but managed a grin. "W-what took you guys so long?" Jacob asked jokingly as he began to drink the Concoction.

"I believe I just saved your hide from that charge," Lungulus said. "You're welcome."

Jacob laughed hoarsely, "Just joking around..."

"Who was that anyway?" Anna asked. Ayra explained that it was her brother, his position in the clan, and their history of hatred. No one wanted to ask anymore about the subject.

"The forest here could be a nice spot to rest up at. Let's find a spot and settle for a bit." Leonardo said. The others nodded in agreement, all of them wanting a break.

Ayra helped Jacob up to his feet and toward the forest. "T-thanks Ayra." Jacob said to her as she helped carry him.

".....Thank you. For standing up to Tronger." Ayra said somewhat somber.

"Of course, glad-" Jacob stopped as more pain came up in his leg. "....alright, "semi-glad" I helped fight him."

What happens next?
15131112121221111111122.title: Suddenly from right beneath him a pink tornado ...

choices: They have trouble finding the equipment.(Got scattered from the wildlife)
151311121212211111111221.content:
It was a very well needed rest after this brutal warlike battle. There was little news the group could talk about so an awkward silence spread over the group, while they treated Jacob's and Ayra's injurys with what little the group had on them. Which reminded them, that they still had to cover a good distance back in the direction they came from before nightfall just to get their equipment back, they dropped before running to find the taguel village under attack. But at the moment they needed this rest and they had earned it. The silence was finally broken, when Lungulus walked over to Anna and passed two things to her. She let out a happy squeal as she recognized the itemsand gave Lungulus a quick hug, which caught him off guard causing a quick smile to run over his face.

"Pleasure doing business with you." Lungulus said, copying Anna's usual devious smile.

"You now that's my line, Lungu." Anna said sounding a little sad. But in a much more cheerful tone she continued. "Good to see your deal is one to be kept though."

"It hurts me to hear, that you think any less of me Anna." He said, dropping the smile and leaving to the serious expression that almost never left his face.

"That didn't happen to be a bullion and an elixer you just gave to Anna there now, did it?" Jacob asked sarcastic raising an eyebrow.

"And if it was? You two will be doing fine without one." Lungulus awnsered giving Jacob an annoyed look, while pointing at him and Ayra. Before he continued, Lungulus raised his voice a bit to make sure all heard him, even Anna who was counting the gold in the bullion already. "Also you want to make sure you finish a deal with Anna, and her sister too in my opinion, as fast as you can. I for myself don't want to find out WHAT THEY will come up with to make you wanna pay your dept with them, as fast as you can."

Anna took no offense to his comment, since she knew that a few of her sisters were commonly tring out new items they made themselfs by letting unsuspecting, mostly new, customers test them without warning. She herself though would never do that, unless they agreed on testing something of course! But considering how serious Leonardo is all the time he wouldn't agree to anything she would call fun and Lungulus had a problem with most of the things she brought back from a town, when he didn't know what it was. But despite this she still couldn't help, but to play along to get Jacob of the toppic, so she gave him a mischievous grin with a dirty look in her eyes.

Jacob backed off seeing Anna's face like that, and sat down next to Ayra, who had just watched the scene unfold. She was unable to understand how these people could travel together and trust each other, if this was the daily basis. Though she could only laugh at how easely Jacob was scared by this one woman. Leonardo on his part could only let out a sigh.

They might have known Ayra only for a day and knew very little about her, yet, it felt like she had been a part of their group for months and the same was the case for Jacob. This thought forced another smile on Lungulus' face, but it disappeared just as fast as it came, when he stared into the forest, his toughtssettled on something completely different. The images of the destroyed village flashed back in his mind. Not while it was burning like a Bolganone spell, but after he used Celica's Gale to choke the flames.

It was gruesome, disturbing, helllish sight that was burned deep into his memory.

Destroyed houses, dismembered limbs, blood all over the place, halve burnde bodies, the stench that was clinging to everything and that taste that made one want to throw up that, yet was only in ones mind. But that wasn't the worst. This picture was only the thing that made you realize what the worst part was.

Nothing you could feel, touched you this deep.

Nothing you could smell, reached inside you so far.

Nothing you could taste, was so tasteless.

Nothing you could see, opened your eyes like this.

It was the only thing you couldn't do, that scared you and yet was the same as all the others.

Nothing. Silence. No life. Only death. The dead silence that could only be heared, after the last scream of life ended. The silent desparation of the ones who died, just after their last hope of life had been shattered. This silence was the kind that killed off all sound, before it was created, even ones own breath.

Lungulus spaced out for a little while, not even hearing the others anymore or the forests wildlife at that. For a moment he was back in this silence. He felt alone even though he knew the others were right next to him, they seemed like they were further away than ever. He felt a weird cold come over him and his body was once again numb like a few days ago.

Lungulus was torn out of his trance, when he felt a hand on his shoulder shake him. It was Ayra who looked at him concerned. The others were almost ready to move on.

"Hey, Lungulus. You okay? You haven't said anything in the last hour." She said dark, as if she could feel his depression.

Had it really been an hour? Him just sitting there, starring into the nothing and kept to himself.

"I'm just tired. Probably still from this battle and an injury from a few days." He replied with a forced smile. He was extremly good at faking his emotions and lying. It was like a natural gift he didn't want, but had.

Still Lungulus hated himself for lying to her and the others, but he didn't want to bother them with this. Jacob and Ayra hadn't been in the village since they lurred the peg. knights away and Anna with Leonardo were already on their way to them and hadn't been there since the flames went out. Also he couldn't break it to Ayra that her village was nothing, but a graveyard anymore.

"You sure about that?" Ayra asked once again. Now with a more disappointed look on her face, than sad. She probably expected him to be tough considering their size differenz, But it wasn't much of his fault, that his body lacked physical resistance. He was born with a weak body like his mother completely diffent than his father.

"You think, you would feel great after not even a half a week recovering from some thing like this?" Lungulus asked in an annoyed tone, showing her the scar that the wound that almost killed him had left. Ayra's eyes widened abit, but she had nothing more to say after seeing this and just went over to the others.Lungulus got back up from the ground and walked over to the others.

"I think we should find our stuff, before it gets dark. It will be a hard for us to find it, when it's dark." Leonardo pointed out and all agreed on that.

"I say after we find it we set up camp and continue traveling tomorrow. We won't get far in these woods at night and the rests of that army might be lurking around outside the forest so we have to wait with gathering some info on the cards and this realm in certain." Lungulus said commonly. Everyone agreed, but Ayra only gave him a confused look.

"What do you need cards for? And what do you mean with gathering information on this 'Realm'?" She asked, her ears moving up a bit.

"If you want to come with us on our jurney, I'll tell you tomorrow." Lungulus said in a complete neutral tone. The others didn't understand why he was making such a secret out of it, but just went along with it, thinking he must have got a good reason for it.

"I have no reason to return to my village and no other place to stay, so what other choice do I have? Tell me that." She hissed a bit, clearly not liking what Lungulus said.

"I'm not going to tell you anything, while you have that attitude. But you'll get your other questions awnsered tomorrow 'kay? I'm tired enough as it is and I don't want to have kid all over me that doesn't even shows any respect." Usualy he would be nicer to Ayra cause of her age, but she was different than others her age.

In the end the others felt a bit left out at the scene, but were more focused on finding their equipment.
151311121212211111111221.title: A rest revives the silent death.

1513111212122111111112212.content:
That night had been a restless one, but they still needed it. After scavenging for their equipment, they rested back up. Anna packed most of her things in a pack as Leonardo remained watchful that night. Lungulus seemed to have slept a little bit away from the group. Jacob would've asked him why, but felt that he had been through enough.

They all have.

Especially Ayra.

Jacob stayed around the Taguel girl a little while longer in silence. They sat there, when Ayra broke the surrounding silence. "Jacob, I've noticed that there's an odd...glow, around you. Why is that? Are you not feeling well?"

Jacob sighed, now realizing he would have to explain to Ayra what happened. So he kept it simple, told her about Einherjar and cards, then about what happened to him and how he was found by Anna. "Odd." Ayra replied afterword.

They sat there longer, when Jacob broke the silence this time. "You alright?"

"I'm fine. Why?"

"I think it's obvious. Your village was attacked."

Ayra turned and looked at the floor. "So?"

"You don't feel sad?" Jacob said to Ayra, not showing much sorrow.

"My village doesn't matter anymore. I've been dishonored by my brother. I'll be remembered for my failure."

"Failure? You protected your village!" Jacob said, is voice raising, but not enough to catch the others attention.

"And it was doomed from the start! You saw how many there were! If every man, woman, and child stopped to fight, that wouldn't have been enough! I-I...." Ayra looked down, obviously still tired, when her eyes began watering. She held her tears, but was obviously hurt at how weak she was when she was supposed to defend them. Ayra then felt something wrap around her.

Jacob draped a blanket around Ayra and helped her lay down. "You were the bravest one there...If what you said was true, that you have nothing in that village, then why risk so much to protect it? That's real courage. You were the strongest one there." Ayra was going to reply, but sleep took her and she fell to sleep, as did Jacob a minute later.

--The next day--

They were traveling again. There was a somber mood collectively in the group. They were silent all the way to the next Outrealm gate.
1513111212122111111112212.title: After the night.

choices: Theys return to the others and he tells them about the request.(Not about cards)
On the way to/ or at the home of the nobles.
15131112121221111111122122.content:
The group had just reached the edge of the forest with Anna and Leonardo in the lead and Jacob, Ayra and Lungulus in the back. Just before they left the cover the last trees provided them, Lungulus let out a long sigh. It wasn't very loud and Jacob barely noticed it, but it still caught his attention. When he looked to his side he realized neither Lungulus, nor Ayra were next to him anymore. He looked a few steps behind him and saw Lungulus had put his hand on Ayra's shoulder and stopped her. He was giving her a look that showed his sympathy, but also a certain disapointment.

Ayra was confused, not knowing why Lungulus had suddenly stopped her. His look was warm and friendly, yet it seemed sad about something. She could guess, what made him look at her this way, but she just couldn't understand Lungulus. She looked over to Jacob who had stopped, in hope he would know what Lungulus was thinking. Though all Jacob could do was shrug as he had also no idea what Lungulus wanted from her.

As she turned her attention back to Lungulus, she finally decided to ask: "Do you need something?"

Lungulus replied in a serious and strong tone. "It's nothing I need, but rather what you need to do Ayra." This confused her even more and even Jacob was giving him a wierd look. As Lungulus saw both their reactions, before once more he let out another sigh and continued. "I am NOT going to tell you what you have to do, but you hav to remember we won't be coming back her anytime soon, Ayra. That is, if we ever come back here at all."

Ayra lowered her head as she started understand the meaning of his words, but tried to remain her self-confidents before she spoke up again. "I told you already. I made up my mind nothing will change that. I WILL go with you guys."

"That's not what I mean and you know that as well." This sentence was hitting Ayra hard. She was tring to stay strong, but in a great struggle with her emotions.
