She felt her legs giving in and falling on her knees, she started to tear up and sobbing a bit, while she lowered her head. She couldn't ignore it anymore. What it truely meant to leave now. She felt a hand on her shoulder again, holding her with in a tight grip hearing Lungulus voice again.

"Let it out. When you're done and feeling better, we'll be moving on." With that Ayra finally gave in and started crying.

Lungulus walked over to Jacob, who was giving him a harsh look for being so hard with Ayra and was about to go cheer her up. Though before he even got close Lungulus stopped him, looking him dead in the eye.

"Let her be. She needs to get through this on her own." He said in a cold voice. Jacob had seen Lungulus in many different situations by now, but how unheeding he was with a friend, started to disgust Jacob. He could easely force Lungulus to let him through, though that would be something he could do for Ayra's sake, as she was already in tears, so instead he was willing to try, to talk sense into Lungulus. Even if he was only willing to give Lungulus one chance for that.

"Give me one good reason for that and I will think about it."

"I'll give you two. First: It is hard enough for her to let her emotions out even when she is alone. To her it's a weakness that she doesn't want to admit to anyone else or even herself. When you interrupt her know she will most likely just hold most of it back again and it will slowly eat away at her from the inside. Second: She's leaving her home behind. I heard you two last night. She has nothing that keeps her there, yet she refused to just give it up. And now she is leaving it behind."

Jacob didn't like it, but he had to admit Lungulus had a good point with what he said first, but the second part Jacob had something, he could render that argument useless.

"We ALL left our homes behind. But we don't try to deal with it ourselfs, but together as a group, Lungulus." Lungulus had to see the truth in what Jacob just said. He was sure of that. Yet Lungulus still stood in his way, before he awnsered once again coldly.

"That goes for you and most likely Anna and Leonardo too, but the reason for that is simple. YOU GUYS COULD SAY YOUR GOODBYES AND MAKE PEACE WITH YOUR HOME. You knew there was a chance you may never return, but you still left. You had the support of your home, am I right? My point is that she doesn't have this kind of support, but is still going to leave. If she can't make her peace with this place alone, it WILL slowly tear her apart on the inside. I know that, cause it's happening to me. I couldn't make my peace with it and even though I've been talking over this with Anna and Leonardo, the regrets of what I left behind ain't leaving. The wound that left in my heart is one that won't heal until I've return to it and probably not even truely heal then."

After Lungulus finished his little speech, Jacob knew neither what to say, nor what to do so he just stood there looking at his friend. But he knew how much it must have taken from Lungulus to reveal what's inside him. He was also a bit stunned a how understanding Lungulus really was and how easy it was for him to argue with someone, while he kept cold as stone. That was something about Lungulus that seemed like a blessing, but was also a thing to fear, as could almost read one like an open book.

"Mind doing me a favor?" Jacob was surprised to hear Lungulus talk again all of the sudden and just gave him a nod, so Lungulus continued. "Get after Anna and Leo. They don't seem to have noticed us fall behind. Tell them to wait for Ayra and me 'kay? If they ask why we're still here tell them Ayra's putting her regrets behind and makes peace with her home. We'll catch up with you guys when she's done." Jacob didn't bother to ask why Lungulus was staying. He knew Lungulus was going to awnser that question, so he did as he was asked off, though he still could hear Ayra crying, which hurt him, though he knew he shouldn't stop her.

As Jacob left Lungulus turned his attention back to Ayra , who was still crying a few feet from him. It took about ten minutes, before Ayra's tears started to slow down. Lungulus didn't know if stopped crying, because Ayra had let all her emotions out or she just ran out of tears to shed, but in the end it didn't matter. He started to walk over to Ayra, who to his surprise was smiling as he helped her stand back up.

"Thanks, I think...you were right...I needed that." Ayra said in between the last of her sobs.

"We can only truely see the joy in our life and future, when we were able to let go of our pain and sorrow. I'll make sure to remind you of that." Lungulus said in a soft tone.

"Well said youngster. It's good to see that our child will be in good care, when she leaves her home."

The sudden voice startled Ayra as she tried to find it's source. Lungulus for his part though immediately found it as he saw an old taguel approached them. He seemed to have grey hair and didn't look like much of a figther either.

"It's nice to see that you finally decided to reveal yourself, sir. It ain't nice to follow someone through the woods and then listen in on their private convesation. Espacially if that goes on for an entire day." Lungulus greeted the man in an for this kind situation, unnormal calm manner.

"I'm did not expect for you, out of your group, to notice me, youngster. But I hope you will be just as cautious in the future." The taguel spoke in gentle and confident way.

"I don't intend to do so, until I fulfilled a friends request. But I believe you wish to talk to Ayra, so I'll with draw from this conversation." That said Lungulus took a small step to the side so he wasn't in the way of the two taguel, but still able to intervene if anything happen.

Ayra for herself could barely understand what was going on. First she found comfort in the presents of humans. Then she cried for the first time since long ago. And to top of it all, one of the clan's elders followed her through the forest. She at a loss of words for a few moments, before she found words that were at least somewhat fitting.

"I'm deeply sorry, if I worried you, elder! Please, if there is anything you need from me, just say so!" Ayra was extremly nervous in the presence of an elder. That was nothing to blame her for though as they were the most respected members of the clan for their wisdom, strength, skill or another reason.

"There is no need to be worried child. We know you well and aren't fooled by your brothers words. The clan respects him, but we are all well aware of his hatred towards humans. You are still welcome in the village." Ayra was enlighted to hear these words, but was now unsure what to do. She didn't knew if she could leave her village behind, but she also couldn't just abandon the other. She looked over to Lungulus for help in this decision, but then saw he was reading in one of his tomes uninterested in the conversaion only giving her a quick glance that pretty much said: 'Your choice'.

"I'm sorry elder, but I've made my decision. I will go with my friends." Ayra anounced proudly.

"I wasn't expecting any different of you. You're parents will be proud of you. But we all want you to know that if you ever wish to return, you are welcome home." After he finished and Ayra once again show him her respect, the elder turned to Lungulus once more. "And youngster. I would also have a request for you." After Lungulus put his tome away, he turned his full attention to the elder and simply nodded in response. "There is a family of human nobels that lives about a month of travel from this forest that has always been on good terms with our clan and I want you to tell them what happened.."

"Elder, you don't mean..." Ayra suddenly interrupted.

"Yes, child. The family of the little boy, you used to play with..." Ayra was left in thought after that. Quietly the elder hinted to Lungulus that said nobles, possesed some of the cards.

With a smile Lungulus replied. "We'll let them know."
15131112121221111111122122.title: Leaving home behind, a new destination in mind.

151311121212211111111221222.content:
After Lungulus and Ayra regrouped with the others outside of the forest and told them of the taguel's request, which Lungulus accepted without even asking for the others opinion and that was really to everyone liking. Nonetheless he for his part, and Ayra probably too, were set on fulfilling this request even if he had to go there alone and the others were fully aware of it, which left them with no other choice but to go with them. They couldn't just let their friend run around this realm alone, especially since one of them has a temper worse than a wyvern's and the other still looked and acted like a child most of the time.

After the short discussion the group got going with Ayra taking the lead, since she vaguely remembered the way. She also wanted to take some of the equipment of the others, but Lungulus kept her from taking anything with two reasons. First was that everyone carried their own stuff (except for Jacob who had taken one of the tents for the others), she wasn't going to play the pack mule for the group and Second, if any strangers saw her carring some of the stuff for them, they would most likely jump to the conclusion that she was some kind of slave. Ayra started to get angry at how little respect Lungulus seemed to have for her and her own decisions.

Jacob kept her calm for the time being and later asked Leonardo, if he knew why Lungulus treated her this way.

"A golden cage is still cage, Jacob. He is fully aware, that's where Ayra wants to be put the least and wants her to understand that a cage isn't just to keep away her freedom, but also to protect her from the outside." Leonardo replied."Though he better has something in his hand to keep her from breaking out or he's gonna reap what he sowed."It wasn't really all clear what Leonardo meant, most of it was easely understood by Jacob.

For the next week the troop did not come across many other travelers, but those they did come across were giving them a wierd look or more likely Ayra. They probably had heard of what happened in the forest and didn't want to have anything to do with a taguel. The fact that the news about the incident had spread so fast wasn't helping them. Especially since the group was almost out off supplies and there was only one town anywhere nearby from what Ayra could tell them, so there was no way around it.

"Hey, Ayra! Come here for a sec 'kay?" Lungulus called out to Ayra who had gone a bit ahead of the others, as soon as the town got in sight.

It was rather annoying to her. 'What does he want now?!' she thought as she walked over to Lungulus. "What is it?"

Lungulus reached in his knapsack and pulled something out. "We don't want any trouble in town, so I thought it would be better if you wear this to cover up your taguel features, at least for now." What Lungulus pulled out was actually a second tactian cloak like his own. The only difference was that it was made a bit tighter so it would fit her. It would still drag on the ground a bit though due to the size difference.

"WHAT?!" replied Ayra enraged, which caugth the attention of the others. They were slowly having enough of the arguments of the two. "You really think I would hide my origin?!" her anger was clear in her voice and Leonardo and Jacob took a step in their direction knowing when that became the subject of conversation with either of them, they were almost unreasonable. Anna for her part backed off though, not exactly wanting to get dragged into this.

Lungulus let out a short sigh and hid his face behind his hand for a brief moment, thinking about how to get what he meant into Ayras head. "Okay, hear me out on this and don't interrupt me, please."

Ayra was in the mood to tear him to bleeding shreads rather than listen, but he had proven to be understanding, despite the fact that he was sometimes rather blunt in his choice of words.

"I know you are proud of your blood and I understand you don't want to hide who you are, but as I said this cloak is just to hide your Taguel feature, more clear your rabbit ears and tail. You know most humans are scared of Taguel like us the first time we saw you too, but for these guys on top of that, there was a slaughter on both side initiated by humans. If they would see a Taguel anywhere near to a town, They would most likely think your want them to pay with blood. Clear so far?"

Ayra could help, but let out a little growl. 'Does he think I'm that dense?!' she thought. "Yes..." was the only thing she had to say at the moment though. Lungulus relaxed a bit seeing that Ayra was willing to listen.

"Good. Then the rest isn't so hard anymore. Also I'm not asking you to deny that you ARE a Taguel and that if someone asks you, you can tell him the truth. If your already inside the town, they will care far less, as they would expect you to be in there for a while. Now in the end the thing is, you saw we are all most out of supplies. Especially food and tents. The two tents we have are almost breaking down and it would be far less cramped in them if we got a third one. Also I, for my part at least, need a new tome or else I'm almost useless in combat, since I can't just use a beast- or dragonstone like you and my own tomes have only 3 uses for the wind one and about 10 uses for the thunder one left. But the main problem is we need to find someone who knows the way to your old friend. You said yourself you vaguely remember the way. That alone could take a day or two and to be honest... I fear you would get in unnecessary danger if we left you alone for the time."

Everyone was taken aback at the last part. It hadn't been often that Lungulus said something nice to Ayra. But suddenly going as far as freely saying he didn't want her to get hurt or even putting her in any kind of danger as long as it wasn't necessary, even if he had to get in another argument with her.

Ayra herself was at first mistaken it for an insult, meaning she was able to defend herself, but it took no two seconds before she realized what he actually meant. Or rather how much she and the others meant to him, which caused her to blush a little and hide her face by moving her ears slighly in front of it as she started to apologize. "Sorry, I didn't thougt... I mean I wasn't aware you... no I--"

"You didn't thnk I cared about you. It's the simple truth." Lungulus cut her off, before he gave her a smile to cheer her up. "Don't think bad about yourself cause of that. Most people would think like that, judging by the way I act. So would you be willing to take my spare cloak and safe us some trouble, please?"

"Yea-- hold on, your spare cloak? Then how come it looks like it was made for some one with my build, just a bit taller? Wait, did you wear this before?" Ayra asked a bit confused as she took the cloak.

"First, yes, my spare cloak. Second, because I customized it a bit. Did all the housework at home. Third, no, I did not wear it before. Anymore questions before we go visit the town?" he asked everyone at the end.

"Not anymore." replied Ayra, while everyone else just shaked their heads still stunned by what just happend. With that Ayra put on the cloak to find it fit surprisingly well and pulled up it's hood over her face, so the group could start to walk towards the town again. There was a feeling of ease spreading over the group that, together with the silenceof the field, letting everyone think and made the soon following conversation much happier.

As they arrived at the gates of the town, they had a short run in with the guards which were a bit hesitant with letting them in the town. They wanted to for Ayra to take of her hood, but Lungulus was quick to convince them that she and him were on a pilgrimage and Ayra had vowed not to take her hood off before they had reached their destination. After that they had no trouble getting inside the walls of the town with Anna as a merchant and Jacob and Leonardo as bodyguards for their group.

Once inside Ayra was amazed at the size of the houses and overall the human town. She had been to the one human friend she once had a few times, but she remembered it to be just one mansion. She had never been to a true town or city. It ws far larger than her old village and everything was far more lively. There were far more poeple than she had ever seen in one place. She was torn from her thoughts when something touched her on the shoulder. When Ayra turned around, she had barely enough time to react to what was thrown at her. But she somehow managed to catch it and saw it was a small purse with some gold at it. When she looked up, she saw that Lungulus was the one who threw it adn Jacob was the who to tapped her shoulder.

"You do realize we are here too, right?" Lungulus said.

Ayra started to blush, yet, again, before she noticed Anna and Leonardo were missing. "Sorry. Where did the other two go?"

"Anna ran straight for the market to make herself some profit and I asked Leonardo to go after her, just in case she finds something that sparks HER interrest. And to get the food and other supplies. I'll be going and look for an armory of sorts and head for the local pub for information after that, so if you need me look in there. Would be nice if you guys could get us two rooms in one of the inns. Jacob has the gold. See you at sundown." With that Lungulus turn and started to walk of in on direction, after which he made a short stop to turn and add: "Oh, and spend the rest of the gold on what you want. Good children should get a little treat every now and then don't you agree!" After that he laugthed a little and ignored Ayra's angry shouts.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------

So who do you want to follow now?
151311121212211111111221222.title: A trip to town.

1513111212122111111112212221.content:
Jacob and Ayra walked through the streets of the town, looking for an inn they could rest at. Jacob walked along with Ayra before Ayra started a conversation. "Why do you have that...stuff, around you?" Ayra asked pointing her finger at him while spinning it.

Jacob looked back confused, wondering what she meant. "What stuff?"

"It's...kinda like a blue fog or mist..." Ayra said, trying to describe it.

For the first time since Jacob was released, he took a good look at himself. He noticed a turquoise-ish haze outlining his body. He moved his arm as the color followed. "Hm. Probably cause I'm Einherjar now..."

Ayra looked toward him, her eyes glistened curiously. "Einherjar?"

Jacob turned and looked back. "I um....I was a normal human, but then these other Einherjar trapped me into a card. Einherjar can only be summoned by card. And when they are, they have this mist around them."

Ayra still spoke up. "Still, what is an Einherjar?"

Jacob sighed. "Guess I should've started at that. An Einherjar is basically a ghost. A person who once was. Einherjar don't age, and can be used over and over."

Ayra felt the grim situation Jacob was in and turned back to the street in front of them. "Oh..."

"...Thanks."

Ayra's ears perked slightly under the hood. "Huh?"

"Felt good to say that. Kinda like I needed to. Thanks Ayra." Jacob said smiling back at her.

The slightest blush appeared on Ayra's face as she smiled just barely. "Oh...y-your welcome."

Jacob found a suitable inn and walked up with Ayra to the counter. After a bit of negotiating, they finally snagged the two rooms.

What happens next?
1513111212122111111112212221.title: Follow Jacob and Ayra.

15131112121221111111122122211.content:
As the others were most likely minding their own business, Lungulus was still looking for an armory. "Isn't there even a SINGLE shop left that sells tomes I can use?!" he thought. "Sure, most people around here wouldn't be able to use anything better than the basic spells, but every last one up to and including the Arc-spells?!" He let out a long sigh. It was obvious that the people would try to arm themselfs in fear of what might happen, but to this extend just seemed ridiculous! He was about to give up, when a sign in front of a run-down shop caught his eye.

'All seals for half the normal prize! Take three and have a forth for free! Got old, used weapons you don't need anymore? We buy them from you for their full value! Lottery for new customers included!'

Looking back at the shop Lungulus wasn't sure if this was worth a try or some stupid joke. It didn't look like the place was still suit-able for being used as a shop. Lungulus thought about it if he should give it a shot. In the end, with out much hope, he decided to go inside and take his chance.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------

Meanwhile Anna was selling her goods like fresh, warm buns, despite her ridiculous prizes. But now that she was almost already out of healing items, there was barely anyone who even looked at her little self-made market-stand. Leonardo had finished buying all the supplies and was checking the condition of his bows, while observing Anna. As Anna noticed Leonardo with his a bow in his hand, immidiatly a sly grin came across her face. As she waved Leonardo over he already knew from the look on her face, she thought of another way to make some easy gold and that he wouldn't like it.

When he got to the little shop, Anna had already prepared everything she needed for her little idea. The moment Anna turned back from her preparations, she was met with the strict look on Leonardo's face.

"Hey, mind doing me a favour Leo?", Anna asked with an innocent look on her face.

"That depends. If it means using me as some kind of advertisement of cheap mascot for your stand, then I'm sorry, but no." He replied, not really wanting to have to work for her in general.

"Of course not, silly!" Anna said giggling. "We offer the people a little game. They pay some gold, then you and them compet in hitting something I throw in the air. The one who misses first loses. It's as simple as that." She explained.

"Let me guess, If I win you keep the money. But why should they even try? I'm sure you wouldn't give them back their gold or even twice of what they paid." The doubt in Anna's idea was clear in his voice.

"You know me to well at times, Leo." Anna awnsered, like it was some kind of compliment. "But IF they win, They can choose a prize from the stuff over there." She said pointing over to the goods she just prepared.

As Leonardo looked over to what 'prizes' Anna had in mind for the winners to choose from. Quiet a lot of things were of no use for him or anyone at all. There were a few useful things like a Sweet Tincture or some high quality dishes to get the first customers attention. Still he knew Anna would be able to keep this little shop turned archery booth running even when those things were gone. Also they could use the money...

"Fine, I'll play along. How would you want to share the profit?" Leonardo said, accepting the fact that even if he tried to decline Anna's "request" or whatever you would want to call it, she wouldn't stop bugging him until he agreed to help her.

"Since we know each other for so long I'll say 70:30. For me that is." She said, her voice sounding as sweet as she could possibly make it sound. Though Leonardo wasn't going to fall for her tricks.

"Anna, you just said yourself, I know you to well at times and so do you know me. That means I'm not going to fall for you're tricks and you know what I think about this waggger."

"Fine." Anna replied a bit annoyed. "65:35 in my favour."

"50:50 and nothing else. If I don't shoot an arrow, you don't earn a single coin from this and you know it." said Leonardo as emotionless and cold as Lungulus was whenever he was dead serious.

One look at Anna's face showed, that she was completely dumbstruck, but that changed quick and it was clear she felt badly insultedby him. Her voice was also a bit shaking as she told him to wait, while she was getting someone willing to test his or her skill at her shop.

While he waited Leonardo got the feeling hw ahould keep a safe distance from Anna for some time...

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------

"So, you don't fear the Taguel at all, man?"

"What's there to be afraid of, ehh? They aren't some mindless beasts like most of the townfolk think. I'm surprised you even know their real name. First of all they won't be dumb enough to just kill a person on the street or attack the town. Second: Their home's gone. Got to rebuild that or find a new home over all and last... their elder remember."

Lungulus had made his way to the the local pub after Lady Luck has been on his side for once. Back at the store he was able to trade his Celica's Galeagainst an used Elthunder with 20 uses left, which he used to repair his old one with. On top of that the prices for the seals were compared to the other realms almost nothing so he bought two Master Seals for Anna and Leonardo as well as one and one free Change Seal for Jacob if he wanted to try another class and Ayra if she was willing to try out how the others fight. If she didn't though he could still use it himself.

But for him, the best was the fact that he actually won something in the lottery. A special forged weapon. It was a rare thunder tome called Superior Jolt. It was meant to be used in fight against other magic users, since it let you read the enemys magic flow. Usually this skill was only learned by Sorcerer or Sorceress of a high rank. Also the normal flaw of all thunder spells, the lacking accuracy, was slightly corrected in the forging process. Though 'forging' may not be the right term for the alteration or in some cases, simple translation of a spell to increase it's power. But the thing about it that was strengthened the most was it's ability to inflict critical damage to the target, when it hits. It would take a while till Lungulus would be able to use it since he just learned how to use C-rank tomes and this one was a B-rank one, he didn't wait to give it a fitting name, after all thunder magic was his favorite kind.

"Raiden's Wrath". A perfect name, cause of the power this spell contained and the meaning of the first part. Translated it would be "The Tundergod's Wrath".

Finally having arrived at the pub, he met the leader of a trading caravan. It was a man with a lot of experience in both: His job and drinking.

Lungulus himself was quiet resistent to the efects of alcohol and was, when the others weren't there of course, always a good drinking companion. Mostly he used that to get information out of the people there, since he drank with them until they didn't even knew what they were saying anymore, or just didn't care. From time to time though, it was his way to forget what happend, if only for a short time. This time he did it for both.

The man and his caravan was just like Lungulus' group, headed towards a family of nobels that lived in the same direction they had been going so far. The only questions were if it were the same nobels and if they were willing to let a Taguel like Ayra travel with them, but the man didn't seem to have a problem with her people.

"Mind telling me, WHAT they remember? This head of mine isn't the best after a good 20 beer." Lungulus said having a hard time keeping his focus. The stuff in this pub was stronger than what he was used to and he had already drunken more than the other times.

"Don't blame your head for it boy. Most people don't even tell their kids what happend. They want to forget it." The man took a sip from his mug, before he scratched his beard, which was quite glorious. "In simple, the hunt for the Taguel was cause of some of the high'n'mighty wanted to turn the fun around. Around my grandfathers time it were the Taguel hunting us, you know."

"So basicly, you they don't want the past to live up again and bite their asses." Lungulus said. "Anyway you said your group was headed towards some nobles in the area?"

"Got a good memory boy. Yeah we have had some big orders from them for food and everything. They're also on good terms with the Taguel. Heck, we've been trading with the Taguel, too." The man said, falling silent after what he just said and having finally given Lungulus enough information, to get the conversation in the direktion he wanted it.

"Sir, mind taking a few more guys with you for a while?" Lungulus said as friendly as he could sound. "My friends and I are headed the same direction and I'm not really as confident with the travel." The man looked him over for a bit, before he smiled a little as he responded.

"I see. Well as long as you have what you need for yourself, you could tag along I guess. You're an kid and I see that. Name's Leroy." Leroy said while reaching out with his hand. Lungulus was glad that things were going smoothly for a while and shook Leroys hand.

"Mine's Lungulus. My friend are probably going to come pick me up later, so tell them the detail about when we depart. I doubt I'd remember." Lungulus said, before raising his own keg. "Cheers, Old man!"

"Cheers, boy!"

Both downed their keg in one go. For these two it would be a long evening, if not a long night.
15131112121221111111122122211.title: The merchant, the einharjar, the drunk, the deal

151311121212211111111221222111.content:
After the two found a room in the inn and wandered city merchants' shops and attractions. Jacob and Ayra wandered aimlessly for awhile, looking around the town. "Feels different from your village?" Jacob asked, trying to start a conversation.

"A few. The buildings here are MUCH taller than what we had in the village. Many more merchants than the usual one or two we would get from travelers...That, and all the man-spawn..." Ayra said, she spat out the last word like it was pure evil.

Jacob chuckled lightly. "You'll get used to it...Well at least I HOPE, you do." Jacob looked back at Ayra, still in the cloak Lungulus gave her. She seemed a little on edge, but was fine besides that.

Jacob wandered until he heard the sound of a familiar merchant. Turning the corner, Jacob and Ayra saw Anna talking to a Knight, who seemed to be wondering if he should buy one of Anna's Steel Lances. Leonardo was leaning on a post next to her stand. Jacob walked over to Leo as Ayra began looking at what Anna had. "So there you guys are. We're gonna meet with Lungulus soon. You coming?"

Leo sighed. "I would, but Anna is bartering like a madman! This has been going on for about ten minutes." Anna glanced at him and just smiled.

Jacob sighed as he walked behind the Knight and tapped his shoulder. The Knight turned halfway as Jacob managed to slide a Buillion in his hands out of Anna's sight as he nodded and turned around. The Knight finally agreed to Anna's price as she handed him the Steel Lance. The Knight left as Leo pulled away from the post. "Now, Anna?"

Cupping the gold in her hand, she nodded. "Alright, alright..." She said as she packed her things up. "You bartered that guy to near-death!" Leo exclaimed as she continuing packing.

"A merchant has to be as fierce as the client...or even more so." She said smiling devilishly. The three thought that they should just refrain from speaking to Anna right now and continue to the pub Lungulus was in.

That's exactly what they did.

-------------------

As the four entered the pub, they saw Lungulus and another man sitting at a table having a conversation. Jacob walked over as Lungulus spotted him. "Oh, Jacob. And the others, this is Leroy. We'll be traveling with him since he's going where we are. Leroy, these are my friends."

The man raised a mug of some drink. "Greetings!" The man roared cheerfully. Jacob nodded to him when Lungulus handed Jacob a bag. "Here, I got some Seals you can use if you want." Jacob set the bag on another table and pulled out a Second Seal. Ideas for classes rushed through his head. After some thought, he decided to be...
151311121212211111111221222111.title: Reunion in the pub.

1513111212122111111112212221111.content:
Jacob looked the Seal over when a particular class came to mind. Jacob walked to the bartender, still holding his Seal. "Excuse me sir? Is there a room I could have some privacy?" Jacob asked. The bartender nodded his head in the direction of a door leading into what would seem to be a restroom.

Jacob nodded back to the bartender as he walked toward the door, leaving Anna, Leonardo, and Ayra with Lungulus and Leroy. Jacob entered and latched the door. Jacob then looked back at the Seal, his class in mind.

He had always heard of Assassins but had never seen one...For good reason. Shadowy thieves and warriors with the ability to strike at an enemy's weak point. He felt as though this class had a calling to him, being good with a blade and knives, and having some experience with bows. He soon focused and let the Seal float above him before the Seal released a bright light.

When it faded, Jacob wore a tight black uniform, with an odd chest plate and a dark hood. He had knives on his hips and arms. He had a quiver on his back along with a Silver Bow as he had his Killing Edge in his sheathe. He felt as though the uniform was tight, but that made sense. You needed little drag when sneaking. He then entered the main bar floor.

The five turned and looked at his class as he moved a little uncomfortable from the stares. "What?" Jacob finally asked.

"Well, it's just a interesting class choice. I've never seen one really." Anna said. Jacob sighed and looked back at Lungulus, when he realized that his face looked kinda flushed.

Jacob sighed, knowing what that could mean.

Is Lungulus drunk?
1513111212122111111112212221111.title: ...an Assassin.

15131112121221111111122122211111.content:
After another look at him, Jacob was sure Lungulus was drunk, if only slightly. What Jacob couldn't see was that Lungulus was barely even sure of his surroundings anymore and just managed to keep up the charade towards the others. He was about to ask him how much he had drunk, but Leroy took the word.

"So, you're his friends? You sure are quite young to be traveling around these times." he said, raising an eyebrow. "Ah, damn me if would try to tell you what to do and what not. That's you're families job." He emptied his mug after saying this and didn't see how Lungulus and Ayra lowered their heads a little, before looking back up at him. "I guess I should tell you lot now when we depart, eh?"

"It would be good to know." Leonardo said. "And would you mind telling us if there is anything we should know about you, sir?"

"A man who was taught manners I see. Can't say that it worked with this guy to well." Leroy said looking directly at Lungulus who only smirked and took a sip from his mug. "Departure is tomorrow moring, two hours after sunrise. You should know it's not only me, but my caravan you'll be travling with." The others were sure Ayra wouldn't be to happy about being around many humans for to long, but this was something she would have to deal with. "The others may seem a bit hesitant in trusting you and... different about their ways, but aslong as you don't start trouble, there will be no problems." Leroy just then abruptly changed from his nice and friendly attitude and was suddenly completely seriuos and his voice seemed as sharp as a swords edge. "We have 3 major rules:

1# Don't even dare thinking about touching something that doesn't belong to you.

2# Pick a fight with one of us and we're all gonna be you're enemys.

And 3# Talk bad about us or make people think badly about us in any other kind of way and we will make sure to hunt you down."

"Don't worry about something like that!" Anna said smiling innocently. "I would never let anyone steal someone elses stocks. Merchants honorable word."

"The rest goes for us to." Jacob said. "So I don't think there will be any problems."

"Just wanted to make it clear for you. Guess everythings settle now." Leroy said back in his friendly mood. It was surprising how fast his attitude could change completely. "See you tomorrow then."

"Not just yet, old man." Lungulus suddenly said, his voice seemingly a bit unstable. "You didn't forget what you said ten minutes, before the came in did you?"

Everyone was looking at him wierd, except for Leroy looked around the room a little and over to the barkeeper. Lungulus just put on a sly grin, before he emptied his mug. Jacob wanted to keep him from it, but Lungulus was done with it before he could even react. "You're paying, Leroy. I told you I could take this stuff." Lungulus said, before laughting loudly like some maniac which Leroy joined.

"You are toughter than I thought, boy. I have no idea how you did it, but a deal's a deal." Leroy turned over and yelled to the barkeeper. "I'll pay for the boy here too buddy!" The barkeeperjust looked over to them and prepared the bill for what Lungulus had drunk. "Though I think for today we had enough fun. I don't want to be waiting for you boy, so you and you're friends should get going."

"Yeah, guess we should." and with those words Lungulus stood up and walked outside while trying his best to walk straight. He had the feeling, he would throw up at any moment now and didn't want to do so inside when the others were there. Neither did he want to pay the bill after Leroy had to pay now, nor did he want the others to see how much he had drunk in the first place.

While he was outside around a corner, spitting back out whatever he had eaten and drunken the last few hours, the others were saying goodbye to Leroy after making sure the marketplace was going to be the meeting place, before they leave the town. Once they were outside Lungulus was already waiting for them.

"You feeling ok?" Jacob asked as they started walking towards the inn where Jacob and Ayra rented their rooms. "How much did you drink in the first place?"

"It wasn't much honestly. The 'normal' stuff is just a whole lot more intense than anything I had before. And that last one? Hell, I don't even know what that stuff was but... I think even if the inn gets torn down and I sleep on a pile of rocks, I don't think even a dragon burning my behind would wake me up." Lungulus said just following the silhouettes of the others.

"Whatever. As long as you get moving tomorrow morning I guess it's alright." Jacob replied. He was just happy he didn't need to carry Lungulus.

Once they were at the inn, Lungulus gave one of the Master seals to Leonardo and the other seals to Anna and Ayra, before guys and girls got in their separate rooms.
15131112121221111111122122211111.title: Drunk and no need to pay. What's better?

choices: No (On to the start of the trip)
151311121212211111111221222111111.content:
Jacob sat up as the light angled through the window and shined in his eyes. He stretched his back out, looking outside. It wasn't too bright out, so he knew he had time to get ready to go. Jacob stood and entered an empty conjoining room and began to re-equip his new armor.

It was hard to get on at first. The armor was tight to help silence his movements, but did they ever think of allowing the person to breathe? 'Maybe I can lose a few pounds from this thing,' he said, finishing equipping his armor. Jacob looked in the mirror and decided to get rid of something on his new armor. His gauntlet had curved spikes, maybe to act as a weapon, but they seemed to bulky for him. After a bit of work, he managed to remove the spikes.

Jacob finally began to equip his new weaponry. He had a quiver of arrows on his back down by his hip, his bow attached to it. On his side pouch he had a Killing Edge ready. He knew this weapon an his new class would allow him to strike fast and hard. Jacob sheathed his weapons and left the room.

Jacob walked out of the room to see Lungulus in the hall. "Hey, ready to go?" Jacob said, walking down the hall toward Lungulus.

Lungulus turned and nodded to him. "Yes. I was just going to get Anna, Ayra and Leonardo." He said as the two walked down the halls toward the rooms.

Jacob thought in his head. 'I wonder if they used the seals they got...'

Did they?
151311121212211111111221222111111.title: The next morning

choices: Leroy comes with the woman back.
Skip to outside of the city/Other options
1513111212122111111112212221111111.content:
The others had used their given seals, too. Well at leastAnna and Leonardo did, while Ayra still had to think about her possible classes and if she was acrually going to use the seal at all. The thought of learning new skills and ways to fight was something that made her curious, but that also meant giving up the only way she learned to fight and she would have to start from the humans most basic form of fighting. As a Taguel she hasn't been in many fights, but it was her way to live, the way she hunts and the way her heart felt and was beating for.

Jacob could see in Lungulus' face, that he was a bit happy about Ayra not having used the Second Seal yet. Though Jacob wasn't sure if Lungulus was happy because Ayra was thinking this through or simply because he could still use it himself, if he had a reason to. The classes Anna and Leonardo picked were pretty obvious.

Anna became a Trickster like most of her sisters that weren't purely focused on merchants business of buying low and selling high, but were OK with almost every way of making money. ALMOST every way. Her new leather armor was tight and very form emphasizing. The parts around her side were red and more elastic tp allow free movement all the time. The middle of the front was in a neither bright nor dark yellow and made of a sturdier material than the rest. Her Levin sword was in it's shaft on the right side of her hip. This was also the first time that Lungulus noticed that Anna didn't have a little charm for good luck, or whatever they were good for, for her swords like all her sisters. Well, at least all he had met so far.

Leonardo had promoted to a Sniper. It wasn't much of a suprise for Lungulus, as for from what he knew of Leonardo's first life, he had also been a Sniper and he wasn't any good at riding horses. His new armor was part leather and metal in almost equal balance and looked the most protecting out of what everyone else in the party was wearing. The shoulder armor on his left shoulder also seemed to have gained an extra plating. Leonardo now also had to keep his quiver like almost all other bow users a bit over his hips in a horizontal position, instead of straight over his back like he prefered. That was something his new armor didn't allow or he would have to give up on a lot of mobility.

After they had collected all the things they needed, the group made their way to the market place where they were suppose to met Leroy and his caravan. Along the way they were given a lot of wierd looks and while Lungulus was always able to shrug such things off and Anna and Jacob didn't even notice them, Leonardo and Ayra felt uneasy. Leonardo was always the most careful of the group and was 'cause of that from time to time a little paranoid in these situations. Ayra's problem was that the stares of the humans were different from the looks of her friends or her kind. These were looks of distrust and hate. At this point she was happy she had the cloak from Lungulus and hid her face deeper in the hood.

As they spot a caravan packing it was obvious this must be Leroy's group, since there was no one else in sight. It was bigger than Lungulus had expected, when he convinced Leroy to let them come for the trip. It were probably 75 to 100 people in this caravan. What was a bit surpising was that there were a few groups, over all Lungulus spotted about 20 people, that wore cloaks or something else that hid everything about them, just like Ayra.

None the less they would most likely have to report to Leroy and the fastest way to do so was to ask around for him. There was another person wearing a cloak walking by, though the woman wasn't wearing a hood. She had long hair that was black as the night and seemed to have a thin build.

"Excuse me, miss?" Lungulus said as he walked up to the woman, who immediatly turned around in suprise. She had dark blue eyes and a soft face.

"Yes, how can I help you sir?" the lady said with a friendly voice and a smile on her soft face. Lungulus knew she was actually happy to see him. Her eyes showed disgust and annoyance, while she was trying to hide black feathers from his sight, but in the end failed.

"I'm sorry, if I interrupt anything important, but is there a man named Leroy part of your caravan?" He asked friendly. He just hoped Leroy and his caravan didn't leave town yet and he was talking to the completely wrong person. His worry was without reason though.

"Yes, Mister Leroy is the head of our caravan. Do you have any business with him?" she asked raising an eye brow a little.

"Actually, WE do." Lungulus said pointing over to his friends. The woman looked over them once before looking back at him. "Could you please bring us to him or tell him we're waiting for him?"

"Of course. Please wait for him here." she said, before turning around and leaving in towards one end of the caravan, all while quietly cursing Leroy from what Lungulus still heard from her.

"You heard her. Guess it's time for the old waiting game." Lungulus said back to the others. As the others started to chat a bit again Lungulus looked after the woman and thought he saw movement under the back of her cloak. Though what made him really suspicious of her was the fact that after whatever moved under her cloak there were more black feathers droping out from under it. He took the few steps the lady had gone so far and picked them up for a closer look. The were like large feathers of a raven, and they were suprisingly tough to damage, so he hid them in his own cloak, while waiting with the others for Leroy.
1513111212122111111112212221111111.title: Clothes make people

15131112121221111111122122211111111.content:
Jacob and Anna had begun conversing with one another. "So, all your sisters look like you and have the same name?" Jacob asked, still shocked by the fact of Anna's family.

Anna nodded, her ponytail bobbed. "Yep! All of them. And we're all merchants and got a thing for getting coin." Anna finished off with a devious smile. Jacob was about to continue when he saw the woman Lungulus speak to and Leroy come walking back. To Jacob, something seemed off about the woman. Not dangerously, but just in a sense of format, why she looked like that on a caravan trip.

Lungulus soon initiated a conversation with Leroy. Soon after, Leroy began to yell out to others to get the caravan moving. Lungulus approached the group. "Alright, let's get moving."

Leonardo walked up front near Lungulus and Ayra. A little ways back was Jacob and Anna, who continued conversing, Ana asking the questions now. "So, what's it like? Being Einherjar?"

Jacob looked down over his body to see it glow a small, light blue. "I...can't really say. It's just a new feeling I have." Jacob said with a shrug. Anna smiled and immediately changed the topic. "Hey, are classes aren't that different, you being an assassin and all..." Jacob shrugged.

"I guess."

"Buy a Second Seal and we can both find a way to make a profit!" Anna said, trying to rope Jacob in. He just smiled sheepishly and rubbed the back of his head. "U-Uhm...No thanks."
15131112121221111111122122211111111.title: Leroy comes with the woman back.

1513111212122111111112212221112.content:
Jacob looked the Seal over when a particular class came to mind. Jacob walked to the bartender, still holding his Seal. "Excuse me sir? Is there a room I could have some privacy?" Jacob asked. The bartender nodded his head in the direction of a door leading into what would seem to be a restroom.

Jacob nodded back to the bartender as he walked toward the door, leaving Anna, Leonardo, and Ayra with Lungulus and Leroy. Jacob entered and latched the door. Jacob then looked back at the Seal, his class in mind.

He had seen many unique blades and swords that are legendary in battle. However, only one skilled in the Swordmaster's Art can use them. Jacob saw this as a chance. Activating the Seal, it hovered and spun above him before shining light down. He then wore black scaled armor, and over that was a grey Swordmaster's coat. Jacob looked in his inventory to see a Sol Katti, an Amatsu, a Killing Edge, and Mystletaiin.

He left the room and approached the others in his new class. "Swordmaster...Good choice." Leo commented. Jacob soon turned back to Lungulus, and saw his flushed face.

Is Lungulus drunk?
1513111212122111111112212221112.title: ...a Swordmaster.

choices: They reach a village to rest at
15131112121221111112.content:
Jacob quickly recovered from his wound and stood on his own again. "We should keep moving soon while it's light out." He said.

Lungulus and the others nodded as they were getting ready to go, when Ayra stopped them. "Wait," she said, then suddenly changed into what looked like a female human with fur and in red armor that didn't cover much. "Where are you going?"

Lungulus was surprised by her sudden change, "W-we're just traveling Outrealms right now exploring."

It was quiet for a moment before she said, "Let me come."

This caught them offguard for a moment, "Why would you want to come with us?" Anna said confused.

Ayra then explained, "You have proven yourselves to be mighty warriors. It would honor me greatly for me to travel with you. If you would allow it."

They all looked at one another before Lungulus finally said, "Alright, you can come." Anna and Leonardo didn't mind, but were worried that she might make the wrong comment again.

Jacob was okay with it. He was fascinated b the Taguel, even though he knew a few. He had spent most of his travels resting with different Laguz tribes. Jacob nodded as he picked up one of the tents he was carrying before, when Ayra approached him and said, "I apologize for any wounds I may have inflicted."

Jacob surprised by this replied, "No problem, it's all right."

Just then Ayra grabbed Jacob's tent and the other one and took a single rope as she tied them to her back. They all watched confused when she transformed back into her Beast form, now carrying the tents on her back with ease, "I'll relieve you of some of the burden during our travels."

Lungulus smiled, "Just don't push yourself to hard okay?"

She replied with a nod as Jacob walked beside her and petted her for a moment. The group packed up the rest and continued along.

What happens next?
15131112121221111112.title: Other option.

152.content:
Name: Denise
Age: 16
Appearance: 5'5 feet tall, and 110 lbs. Dark red hair that fails to just blow the shoulders. Held back with a white headband. Wears typical War Cleric armor with a light blue dress with white accents.
Personality: Shy, but friendly and helpful.
Origin: In a village named Melheim in the Outrealms.
Bio: Lived an ordinary life in Melheim and took to Clergy work when she was a little girl. Began to sense something wrong going on in the Outrealms and decided to take a journey.
Race: Human
Class: War Cleric (Level 20)
Uses: Axes (Level B) and Staves (Level A)
Asset and Weakness: Speed and Luck
Equipment: Advent (forged Bolt Axe), Mend, Ward, and some Vulneraries.
Skills: Armsthrift, Limit Breaker, Renewal, Galeforce, Miracle


"Phew, what a walk."

Denise sat down on the dirt road she was walking on, taking a swig of water from her pouch as she did. It had been a week since she started out on her journey, trying to figure out the source of darkness she felt over the Outrealms. Not many knew of the Outrealms, but she did. At first, she was hesitant about leaving, as she had been tending to her ill parents. However, they were feeling well by now and gave her many blessings for her trip. She smiled at the thought.

She wasn't ill prepared, as she was a War Cleric, so she had decent armor on. She was given a forged Bolt Axe, which she called Advent, which took advantage of the magical prowess she was gifted with at birth. She always had a talent with magic, although she wasn't into anima spells or anything.

Anyway, after she left her village, she had traveled to the outskirts, where she came across a towering blue gate, obviously an Outrealm Gate. She had traveled through it to this realm, pull of wide and open plains. She wasn't sure what it was called though, but she hoped she would find out soon.

"Well, time to hit the road again." she said to herself as she packed her stuff again.
152.title: Tactician #6

1521.content:
Name:Julia
Class: Dancer
Age: 15
Appearance: 5'2 and 105lbs. Wears a darker colored Dancer robe colored a purple-violet with black on the chest piece. Has reddish-brown hair with a feather in it and a soft face.
Personality: Shy, but meaning to help.
Origin: A small Outrealm town.
Bio: Shyest in town, she manages to dance in front of hundreds and thousands of people. She wants to leave, but is scared to go alone and too nervous to ask anyone. Easily embarrassed or flattered.
Race: Human
Gender: Female
Weapons: Two-Step Swipe (Unique Killing Edge).
Asset and weakness: Speed and Magic
Skills: Dance+, Movement +1, Galeforce, Acrobat, Lethality.

She was sore from her dances today. She walked down a dirt road that led to who knows where. She wanted to leave so much, but couldn't. Even with her sword, she couldn't. It wouldn't be enough. She then spotted someone down the road. She wasn't familiar to Julia and she wanted to hide, but she was too late and decided to ask who she was.

"H...H-Hi!...C-Can I help you?..." Julia stammered as the War Cleric approached.

What happens next?
1521.title: Down the road

15211.content:
"Hmm?" Denise wondered as she saw a purple-violet clad girl approaching her. Judging by the attire, the person was obviously a dancer, and a fairly fit one too. Her face looked...innocent for lack of a better word. Not really the one Denise imagined dancing in front of many people.

She could see the girl attempt to hide at first, but apparently didn't as Denise approached.

"H...H-Hi!...C-Can I help you?..." the girl stammered. Denise raised an eyebrow at the girl's apparent shyness.

"Hello. I'm Denise. It's a pleasure to meet you." she smiled as she offered a hand for a handshake. The girl seemed to hesitate before taking Denise's hand.

"I-I'm Julia." spoke Julia.

"That's a cute name." smiled Denise. "So what'cha doing all the way out here?" she asked.

"Oh....just taking a walk." Julia said softly. Denise saw the Killing Edge strapped at her waist.

"That's an impressive sword there. Is it custom-made?" she asked.

"Oh?...Um, yes it is. How did you know?" asked Julia.

"I've been around the block a few times." smiled Denise. "Do you live up ahead?"

"Yes." said Julia. "It's just a little ways behind me."

"That's great. Do you mind if I come to your hometown? I've been walking around for the last week." said Denise. Julia didn't seem too sure, but she didn't want to refuse Denise.

"Okay....that's fine." said Julia as the two girls began their brief walk.
15211.title: Denise takes Julia with her

152111.content:
Julia walked with Denise back to her home. It was a small house with a kitchen and bedroom. She offered Denise a seat and got her some water, handing that and food toward her sheepishly. "H-Here." Julia spoke.

Denise took it and nodded, "Thanks." She began to eat and drink when Julia started a conversation.

"I-I haven't seen you here before. Where are you going?" Julia asked, curiosity building in her.

"Honestly? I'm not sure. It feels like something is out there and I need to find it." Denise spoke.

Courage rose in Julia as she stood and took a deep breath. "Would I be able to come?" Immediately after that, she blushed as Denise looked back.

"Sure."

"R-really?" Julia asked back shocked.

"Yeah. Pack up and we can go." Denise spoke.

She packed up what little she had and followed Denise to the gate nearby. She always saw it but never dared traveling Outrealms. With a quick glance at one another, they entered.
152111.title: To Julia's home

1521111.content:
"So Julia, what do you do for a living?" asked Denise as the girls traveled through the Outrealm Gate.

"Oh...well I do dances quite often. There are often thousands." she blushed.

"Wow, thousands. That's great!" smiled Denise. "You must be really good."

"Oh, it's nothing special." she blushed again. "So....how long does it take to walk through these realms?"

"It's not too long. Just a minute or two. Another opening should be coming up soon. Unfortunately, the destinations are rather random, which has kind of hampered my journey." said Denise.

"I see....what are you searching for exactly?" asked Julia.

"Well, I started feeling that something was out there a few weeks ago. Some people thought that I was cursed or something. Although, being a cleric, most pretty much thought otherwise. However, I know some evil is out there and I want to find out what it is before it threatens Melheim, my village." explained Denise.

"Oh, well that's great." smiled Julia.

"Thank you." said Denise. "Oh, looks like we're here. You might want to shield your eyes."

Taking her advise, both girls covered their eyes as a bright light indicating the next realm appeared in front of them and engulfed them both.

The next thing both of them knew, they were walking out into another field, which seemed to be near a town in the distance.

"What is this place?" asked Julia.

"I guess we'll find out soon enough." said Denise as she began to walk. Perhaps that village might offer some insight.
1521111.title: The realm of Awakening

15211111.content:
The village seemed small and peaceful. Already reminding Julia of the home she left behind. As Julia and Denise walked through town, she heard something from behind a hut. "D-Denise? Y-You go ahead, I'll catch up." Julia spoke.

"Really? Okay..." Denise kept moving.

Julia poked her head around the hut to see a boy with brown hair in blue merc armor dance. She was captivated by it until he saw her, which caused them both to yell and blush.

"H-How long were you there?" The man yelled.

Julia covered her face. "S-sorry! I-I-I was j-just curious!"

The man stopped and approached Julia as he pulled her hands away to look at her face. "My...You're the most gorgeous woman I've seen..."

Julia blushed dark red. "O-Oh...Th-Thanks..."

He held out his hand. "I'm Inigo."

"Julia."

"Where are you going?" Inigo asked.

"T-To meet my friend." Julia asked.

"Oh! Well I can lead the way through here." Inigo said. Julia then followed Inigo through town.
15211111.title: The village

1521112.content:
"So Julia, what do you do for a living?" asked Denise as the girls traveled through the Outrealm Gate.

"Oh...well I do dances quite often. There are often thousands." she blushed.

"Wow, thousands. That's great!" smiled Denise. "You must be really good."

"Oh, it's nothing special." she blushed again. "So....how long does it take to walk through these realms?"

"It's not too long. Just a minute or two. Another opening should be coming up soon. Unfortunately, the destinations are rather random, which has kind of hampered my journey." said Denise.

"I see....what are you searching for exactly?" asked Julia.

"Well, I started feeling that something was out there a few weeks ago. Some people thought that I was cursed or something. Although, being a cleric, most pretty much thought otherwise. However, I know some evil is out there and I want to find out what it is before it threatens Melheim, my village." explained Denise.

"Oh, well that's great." smiled Julia.

"Thanks." smiled Denise. "You know, you seem pretty good with that Killing Edge. Seems kind of wasted on a Dancer."

"I guess so, but it's the only thing I'm good at." muttered Julia.

"Well, who knows. We'll probably find many things in other realms." said Denise. "Oh, you might want to shield your eyes."

At that comment, a bright light appeared in front of them, indicating that they had reached the end of the path. Doing as she told, they both closed their eyes as they exited the gate, appearing in a new location.

"What is this place?" asked Julia.

It was a very mountainous area, with many hills and plateaus here and there. they appeared to be on one such mountain themselves right now.

"Wow, this is quite the view!" said Denise as she looked over the peaks and valleys around.

"I think I'm going to be sick." muttered Julia.

"Oh, don't wimp out now. We just started after all. I see a town up ahead. Let's go there." said Denise, grabbing Julia's hand.

"Ok." she said.
1521112.title: Another place

15213.content:
Name: Ashley
Age: 19
Appearance: Stands at a modest 5,4. Has a natururaly thin and petite body. She as light black almost light blue hair. She wears a robe that's red with gold trimming. She wears white stockings, and two inch high heels in an attempt to boost her stature. She is also known for wearing a black dress, white stockings, and ballerina like shoes.
Personality: Tends to be a reclus around people she dose not know. She enjoys being spoiled and being taken care of. Can be rather brash towards other women.
Bio: Belonged to a wealthy powerful family. Was "kidnapped" for a period of time and taught dark magic and curses. Now she yearns for seeing the world, finding friends, and maybe something more.
Class: Lvl 11 Dark Mage.
Skills: Hex and Anathema.
Weapons strength: Tomes A.
Weapons: Multiple tomes.
Asset: Magic
Weakness: Anything requireing physical strength or stamina.

Name: Austin
Age: 20
Appearance: 6ft even. Short shaved hair. Green eyes. Wears leather greaves, gauntlets, metal chest plate, spaulders, pauldrons, thick leather boots, and rode with hood. His robe and hood are dyed an dark ice blue color.
Personality: Serious when dealing with death. Generally protective of other friends and people in need of help. Can be easy going when with friends and tends to be outgoing in familiar settings. Tends to get in fights.
Bio: Grew up in a well off family, but lived a harsh life in a large city. Stealing and fighting was a common occurrence. Later in his teens a well-known assassin taught him his skills.
Class: Lvl 18 Assassin.
Weapon proficiency: Sword A, Bow A
Asset: Skill
Weakness: Magic
Skills: Lethality, critical +25, Locktouch
Equipment: Brave sword, silver bow

The two girls spotted the newcomers walking down the road. " Um hello! Are you passing through as we'll?" Julia struggled to ask the two. Austin waved at her in response before being stopped by a annoyed stare by his employer.

" Do they look like a threat to us?" Ashley whispered to her guard. " The one on the left is a War Cleric, her axe is a bit large for her and may slow her down in a fight. The other is a dancer, by far the more dangourus. It would be difficlut to keep up with her movements. Her blade is too light though, easy to deflect and in a test of stringth would faulter. Don't worry though they don't seem like cold blooded killers.The Dancer squirming slightly under the inspection.

" In any event I would prefer not to fight women." Ashley scoffed at this " Funny,I thought I hired an assassin.... Very well I suppose we could talk to them."

Will they all join forces?
15213.title: An awkward introduction.

1522.content:
*****New Character*****

Name: Jacob
Class: Samurai
Age: 16
Appearance: A blue coat, thin and light, slightly long, with black pants and a white robe underneath, and brown hair tied into a ponytail.
Skills: Acrobat, Luck +4, Aggressor, Armsthrift, Lethality
Weapons: Swords = A, Tomes = B.
Inventory: Killing Edge, Sol, Micaiah's Pyre, Mjolnir.
Bio: From a realm of chaos, he grew up alone, trying to be nice, but also getting stabbed in the back. He managed to become a holy warrior (Samurai) and emigrate to other realms before splitting away to explore.
-----------

Jacob opened his eyes to see two of his weapons broken in front of him. A Killing Edge in pieces and a Micaiah's Pyre tome split in two.

"Great. Just great." he muttered to himself.

He could already see a pool of blood forming around him. He made a quick attempt to get up and move forward, only to stumble back to the ground. Unfortunately, that only served to open the wound even further. Unable to do anything, he laid on the desolate dirt road, when he saw a silhouette coming down from the plains.

"Who is...." he muttered before passing out on the ground, the wound getting more serious.

Denise merrily walked down from the plains, hoping that she would make some way in her little journey. However, as she neared the dirt road, she saw some items off to the side.

"Huh? Is someone there?" she asked as she gently walked forward, gasping as she saw the form of a man badly wounded. "Don't worry! I'll heal you!"

She whipped out her Mend staff, letting it work its magic over the man, who she recognized was wearing clothes in a somewhat similar fashion to her own. She had seen them before. They were the clothes of a Samurai; in other words, a member of the Samurai.

"How did he get a wound this bad?" she asked herself as she kept tending to his wounds, not stopping until she closed the wound completely. It wasn't easy, as it took much of her strength to do so. However, it was successful as she soon saw the man breathing soundly. She smiled at the sight.

"Thank goodness." she sighed in relief. It wouldn't do to leave the unconscious man there, but she couldn't lift him up. Guess she knew where she was setting up camp for the night.
1522.title: Something happens

15221.content:
When Jacob awoke, pain traveled through his body. He saw he was in a tent of sorts and on something soft while being covered by a blanket. He tried to sit up when pain forced him back down.

"Don't move yet!" A voice said, which Jacob determined to be female. Soon he saw a girl in a dress of sorts he had seen others in the clergy wear.

"W-who...what's...?" Jacob was interrupted by the girl's light smile.

"I found you in the middle of the road like this. I'm Denise." The girl said, holding her light smile.

Jacob's body relaxed, knowing he was probably safe here. "J-Jacob...Thanks for patching me up."

Denise sat by his side, "Do you know what happened?"

"No, I remember getting ready to fight a guy, then I blacked out." Jacob said. "Then I...I..." He put a hand to his head as Denise grabbed his arm gently and brought it down.

"It's okay. Give it some time, okay?" Denise responded.

Jacob nodded. "What are you doing out here?"

"Oh. I...I feel like there's something out there, and I wanna find it. So I left and began to search for it."

Jacob then sat up with Denise's help. "Well...Would you mind me tagging along?"

Denise was taken back by this. "Really? You wanna help me?"

"Yeah...You saved me...Also, you're part of the clergy. So...?"

Denise chuckled lightly and smiled at Jacob. "Once you heal up, sure."

Jacob nodded, "It's the least I can do."

What happens next?
15221.title: The night

152212.content:
As morning came, Denise awoke early and cooked food nearby, before waking Jacob and giving him some stew. After they finished the quick meal, Denise got to work with her staffs and healed Jacob up enough for travel.

Jacob nodded to her and slid his Killing Edge into the sheath at his side. "Thanks again." Jacob spoke gratefully.

"Of course. Now let's get going." Denise replied with a slight smile on her face.

They packed up their things and traveled down the road. They soon found the swirling vortex within the gate and stood at it.

Denise looked at it, then back at Jacob. "You know what these are, right?"

Jacob nodded slowly and turned to face her. "Yes. When I was a boy, I fled to one of these and was found by a clergy. They took care of me until I became a Samurai. Then I left there to travel and explore. But I've only used these once or twice."

They stood a little longer before they faced each other, nodded, and entered.

What happens next?
152212.title: The next morning...

1522121.content:
Jacob walked alongside Denise through the swirling gate's passage. Jacob and Denise walked for a few minutes when Jacob felt...tingly, for lack of a better word. "Denise? I'm not f-feeling so great..."

Denise turned, a look of confusion across her face. "Really? I feel fine. I'm sure you're just recovering a little."

Jacob nodded, assuming the War Cleric to be right. But the moment they reached the next gate, the tingling intensified until Jacob hit the gate. "Ugh...gah!" Jacob passed through before losing consciousness.

------------

Denise had also blacked out, but felt fine upon waking. She quickly stood and dusted herself off and turned to Ja-...oh boy.

------------

Jacob opened his eyes and felt weird as soon as he did. He put a hand to his head. Something seemed off, but he ignored it. He sat up and noticed two things:
1. Was that his pants seemed to be replaced by a skirt of sorts.
And 2. Was a weight in his chest.

He looked down to see two bulges under his Samurai garb on his chest. He also saw his legs seemed a bit slender and smaller. He looked up and saw Denise, with a shocked look on her face. "Ugh...What just-" Jacob's hand flew to his mouth. His voice was higher pitched now, it sounded quite feminine, like it had a small dignified tone to it.

Jacob scrambled for his sword and looked into the reflection to see a girl's face looking back. Her face seemed to keep it's composure, but had a more feminine bone structure now. Her hair was a dark brown, short down the sides as the back reached to the base of her neck. Jacob looked back up at her friend. "Wh-what just happened?"

Denise replied quickly. "I don't know. Maybe it's the realm or something."

Jacob sighed as Denise held her hand out to pick her new friend up. Jacob stood and wobbled with the new leg shape and weight on his chest, Denise catching her. "It could take getting used to."

Jacob finally got it down, and now stood, blushing with her legs crossed slightly and a hand over her new assets. "Th-thanks..." Jacob replied with her new voice.

This was gonna be interesting.

What happens next?
1522121.title: Realm #1

15221211.content:
They didn't last long in the place where they appeared. Denise immediately saw a town in the distance, and immediately said that they should go there.

"Perhaps we can stay there for one night if we need to." said Denise.

"I guess so. Hopefully there's another Outrealm Gate somewhere around there." said Jacob, still struggling to keep balance.

"Don't worry. You'll get used to the new weight soon." smiled Denise.

"I hope so." said Jacob.

The two girls walked out of the forest, getting into the clear as the town came into sight. It appeared to be a pretty bustling town, with a decent amount of people. Denise liked the sight of it. She hadn't seen many large towns in her homeland.

"You know, we might be a bit shot on gold right now." said Denise as she happened to look through their short list of supplies.

"Well, where do you think we might get more?" asked Jacob.

"Maybe get a job or two?" asked Denise.

"I don't know. I don't think I'm in a good spot for that." said Jacob.

"Well, we'll see." said Denise.

The two of them entered the town, appearing to be about mid-day right now.
15221211.title: Visit the town

152212111.content:
The two girls walked through town looking for any kind of job to get some gold with. Some time passed when Denise pointed one out. "I'll go get started, ok?"

Jacob nodded, trying to smile. "O-okay."

Denise left as Jacob was left there.

"Hi, um...excuse me?"

Jacob let out, to her shock, a small yelp as she spun around to see one of many Annas behind her. "Sorry, didn't mean to startle you."

"O-oh...What is it?" Jacob replied, having calmed down a bit.

"Can you follow me for a moment? I'll make it worth your while." Anna added, her finger on her chin.

Jacob followed the merchant to a shack where she had a seal with flowers inside. "I want you to use this."

"Why?"

Anna smiled back. "This is a dress I made. I want you to wear it around town so people can buy my other ones."

"Y-you want me to wear a dress?" Jacob stammered.

"Yep. Your body and posture are perfect for this. And I'll even pay you."

Jacob was blushing intensely, but they needed the gold. "O-ok..."

"Great," Anna replied handing her the seal. "Go get 'em."

Anna left as Jacob held the seal. Bracing herself she activated it. When the light died down, Jacob was in a large sparkling wedding gown, with a wide skirt and an area that covered her assets from the front. Jacob blushed and left, now trying to get used to the dress. She wandered through town until she found where Denise went and entered.

What happens next?
152212111.title: After that

1522121111.content:
"Denise?" asked Jacob as she looked inside the little tavern she saw Denise go into. She was lucky that others weren't asking for her name right now. She hadn't even thought of one, since "Jacob" wouldn't work for a girl.

"Jacob?" asked a voice. Jacob looked to the side and her jaw dropped a bit.

Denise was wearing a different outfit, composed of a short tavern dress that ended above her knees and had short sleeves. There were small bits of armor on it too. She also had plates in her hands too. She had never seen this before.

"What are you doing?" asked Jacob. Denise scratched her head a bit.

"Well, when I got in here, they said that they needed a new waitress since one went home sick today. They even have a seal for it. This is the Waitress class apparently." said Denise. "And you somehow got roped into being a Bride?"

"An Anna forced it on me. It's humiliating." said Jacob.

"Well, this isn't much better. I'm getting this skirt flipped almost every 5 minutes by some of these guys." groaned Denise.

Anyway, Jacob had to go back to walking around as an advertisement while Denise kept at her serving job. It wasn't a great job, but it paid at least.
1522121111.title: The other job

15221211111.content:
Jacob walked until her legs burned. She made her way back toward the shack to see Anna counting gold. "Oh, there you are my money-making bride!" Anna said with glee.

Jacob blushed more. "Pl-please don't call me that."

"Why not? People came in an bought my dresses after they saw you in it." Anna said cheerfully.

"R-really?"

"Yeah! Oh, here's your gold." Anna said. The bag was large but light. It had gold and, something else inside. She ignored that for now and asked Anna if she could change back. When Jacob was back in her Samurai garb, she realized just how much of the legs it showed and walked forward with her gold, as she went off to see if Denise finished.

What happens next?
15221211111.title: Finishing the job

152212111111.content:
Denise worked throughout the day, washing dishes and carrying drinks to bar patrons. Not her choice job, but it paid. She wiped down one of the tables when the man who had hired her tapped her shoulder.

"Hey there, I just got someone else to work full-time, so you're free to go." The man said, handing Denise a bag of coins and a Second Seal, in case she wanted to change back.

After giving her thanks, Denise left the bar to see Jacob sitting nervously on a nearby bench with a fair-sized bag of gold. She saw Denise and stood and walked towards her. "Ready?"

"Yeah," Denise replied. "Let's go."

They walked out of town when Denise saw Jacob's bag of "money". "You got paid that much?" Denise said somewhat shocked.

"Well...it feels like there's something else there." Jacob replied.

What happens next?
152212111111.title: Denise finishes

1522121111111.content:
"What else is in there?" asked Denise.

"I don't know. I didn't look." said Jacob. They digged through the bag a bit, with Jacob gasping as they saw a pair of bikinis in there. Denise smiled at them though.

"Aw, they look cute. Guess it's no surprise that Anna would give you those. I heard that this place is called the Hotrealm, hence the heat, and that their resort here is pretty famous." she said.

"But why me?" groaned Jacob.

"Well, no one else knows that you're really a guy. So, you want to try them or not?" she asked.
1522121111111.title: Back at camp

15221211111111.content:
Jacob sighed. Denise seemed kind of excited and he didn't want to disappoint her. "F-fine..."

Denise smiled, taking a green bikini and leaving Jacob with a blue one. Jacob walked behind a line of foliage and began undressing.

After sometime, Jacob still didn't have her undergarments removed, somewhat confused as to what to do.

"Do you need some help?"

Jacob, not meaning to, shrieked and turned, blushing dark red. She saw Denise standing there, wearing her green bikini. Jacob blushed, "M-maybe...w-would you mind?"

Denise smiled and walked beside her. "Sure, let's remove the rest of what you're wearing....Okay, now place this around your shoulder..." A few moments later, and Jacob was in her blue bikini, which seemed one size too small. "Looks a little tight..." Denise said.

"F-feels tight too..." Jacob stammered. Denise smiled and took her hand as they made toward the water.

What happens next?
15221211111111.title: Getting it over with

152212111111111.content:
"I wouldn't be surprised if she did that on surprise." said Denise, referring to small bikini.

"I bet." moaned Jacob.

"Anyway, let's go in the water. We're the only ones here after all." smiled Denise as she ran into the water. After getting over some anticipation, Jacob smiled and joined Denise as well.

"Feeling better?" smiled Denise.

"Good enough, I suppose." said Jacob.

The two continued doing that for some time, alternating between playing in the water, and just laying out in the sun.

Soon enough though, afternoon was coming, and it was a good time for them to get going. Jacob wanted to get out of this after all. However, she couldn't help but feel that something else was inside the bag of gold she got from Anna.
152212111111111.title: The Hotrealm

1522121111111111.content:
After gathering their things and changing back, the two girls found the next Outrealm Gate. They stood before it. "You ready Jacob?" Denise asked.

Jacob nodded, her ponytail bobbing as she walked through it. A while a way in, Jacob spoke up. "I haven't changed back yet..." Jacob said somewhat worried.

"I'm sure you'll be fine, just-" Denise began when she began to stagger. She saw Jacob suffering the same thing as the two blacked out.

---------

Jacob sat up, his body feeling weird again. He assumed it was because he was getting use to his old body again. He then saw a red-headed girl with her hair in a ponytail sit up. She had a striped Trickster outfit colored red and yellow. Jacob grinned, having Denise have a taste of what he went through. "Well look who's-" Jacob began and stopped. She looked down to see herself in a merchant uniform, her assets hanging underneath.

Denise turned her head, "Where are we now?"

Jacob spotted a town in the distance. "Maybe we should check there." With that, the two stood and entered the town.
1522121111111111.title: Continuing on

15221211111111111.content:
"Wait a second, why do you look just like me?!" cried Jacob when she got a better look at Denise. The two girls stood there dumbfounded, absolutely shocked that they looked exactly alike physically. Their clothes were different, but they could tell that they were both Annas.

"Maybe the rumors were true?" Denise pondered to herself.

"What do you mean?" asked Jacob.
