"Well, you notice how there are always lots of Annas around. I've heard rumors that they actually have their own realm somewhere, solely dedicated to them. Never knew it was true though." said Denise.

"And what makes you think this is that world?" asked Jacob.

"I'm not sure, but it would explain why you and I both look like her now. Guess we should just check out that town up ahead." said Denise.

"Fine." groaned Jacob, having to endure being female for a while longer.

The two of them began walking along the trail towards the village that Denise spotted out. As they got closer, Denise's idea was confirmed; there were Annas everywhere; dressed in every kind of clothing as if it was a natural city. There were even some kids running around too.

"Well, nothing freaky about that." groaned Jacob.

"I got to agree with you there." said Denise. "Well, at least this class uses staves so I at least have some kind of familiar weapon." she added.

The two of them walked along, giving the occasional hello to any passer-bys. Eventually, they saw an empty shop by the side.
15221211111111111.title: The Anna Realm

152212111111111111.content:
"Hey, look at that." Jacob said, pointing toward a shop. It seemed to be in good condition, but was completely empty.

"Seems deserted," Denise replied. "What, are you planning something?"

Jacob hoisted the bag on her back. "Well, we might as well take advantage of it. I'll set up a quick shop, and maybe we'll get more gold or cool items."

Denise looked kinda surprised, "Really? You running a stand?"

Jacob turned and said "I can negotiate anything, including money."

Denise was a little surprised by Jacob's change of mood, but smiled. "Alright then." The two Anna's set up shop and unloaded multiple items on the shelves. Other Anna's came by, and for each one there was a negotiation, usually ending with Jacob making a profit.

The day ended with them receiving a Gâe Bolg spear, a Goddess Staff, and a large bag of gold, including some bullions. Jacob sighed, wiping sweat from her head. "What do you say we head to sleep, Anna?" Jacob said, trying to blend in a little.

Denise nodded as the two...
152212111111111111.title: Decide to use it

1522121111111111111.content:
"Well, I guess we should look for an inn somewhere." said Denise.

"All right, that sounds good." smiled Jacob. Denise smiled a bit at how Jacob seemed to be having more fun now, a big contrast to when he/she was moping around in the last realm. This Annarealm business seemed like quite a place.

Anyway, they closed up shop for the night, wondering if they would come back the next day or not. They weren't in a big hurry or anything. Denise quickly found an inn for them, and they got themselves a room with two beds.

"Well, needless to say, I didn't expect these kinds of realms when I left Melheim." spoke Denise as she got a nightgown on.

"Neither did I, but this seems to be getting a bit more comfortable." said Jacob.

"Glad to hear it. I wonder what this place is like during the morning, since we got here pretty late." said Denise.

"Guess we'll find out." said Jacob.

"Right. Good night." said Denise.

And with that, they both went asleep.
1522121111111111111.title: ...looked for an inn.

15221211111111111111.content:
Jacob woke up as she sat up and stretched in her nightgown. A quick look outside showed morning light and Annas already out and about. Jacob soon began placing her merchant outfit on as Denise awoke. "Morning there." Jacob said, a little cheerful.

Denise nodded back to the Anna merchant. "You seem excited. Why would that be?" Denise asked.

"I wanna check on a few of my "sisters" up in the Rescue Mines." Jacob said as she finished putting her boots on.

Denise smiled, seeing Jacob like this made her happy that she's seeming to get more comfortable here. She nodded as she began changing into her Trickster uniform.

The two Annas soon left and took an hour walk or so up a cliffside to the Mines.

What happens next?
15221211111111111111.title: Next Day

152212111111111111111.content:
"Wow, this is quite the walk." said Denise as she and Jacob made the hour-long hike up to the Mines. They had recently heard that there was a pretty bad Risen attack there, but an army from another world saved every one of them.

"Yeah, the minerals here make it worth it though." smiled Jacob, putting her finger on her chin.

"How did you know that?" asked Denise.

"Why wouldn't I know it? Every Anna knows that." said Jacob.

"I didn't." Denise said to herself so Jacob couldn't hear. That was a bit weird, but Denise decided to put it aside for now. As they got closer to the mines, the temperature definitely began to rise higher and higher. They were sweating quite a bit as they did, causing Jacob to remove her heavy merchant coat. Thankfully, underneath, she had a bra-like top that other miners were wearing.

"Wow, feels even hotter than normal today." laughed Jacob as she wiped some sweat off. Ignoring that, Denise looked around the other Annas, who were mining the minerals along with having pleasant conversation.

"How are things going?" asked Jacob to one Anna.

"Pretty good. Got a good stash so far. I've got a shipment heading to Ylisse soon." smiled the Anna.

"Good for you." smiled Jacob.

"Wow, she's getting comfy." said Denise. There wasn't anything wrong with that though, so she let it slip. This was a pretty rare place after all, so she even did a little looking around herself.
152212111111111111111.title: The Rescue Mines

1522121111111111111111.content:
Jacob and Denise soon left the mines, and returned to their inn. Upon returning, Jacob began to pack her things up into a cart she rented. This caught Denise's attention. "What are you doing, Jacob?"

Jacob looked up from packing with a sly smile. "Funny you should ask sis. My inventory has grown a bit big, so I thought I'd travel to the other town and see if I can sell any of this. Wanna tag along?"

Denise was surprised by Jacob's enthusiasm. However not interested in selling, she wanted to explore. "Of course."

"Great! Let's get going," Jacob said, pushing Denise along.

The two twins soon left the current town, coming up on Veeral, a town famous for it's weaponry.

What happens next?
1522121111111111111111.title: Sticking around

15221211111111111111111.content:
After making the hour-long trip back to town and getting their stuff, the duo then set on, thankfully, a lesser trip. The journey to Veeral was only about half an hour, making it a bit easier for travel for the two of them.

Veeral was a bit smaller than the main town, but only because it was employed highly towards a certain product rather than the more family-like atmosphere of the main town. Veeral specifically was geared towards weapons, and there were sure to be all kinds when they arrived there. Denise didn't care too much about the profits though. She was more interested in trying to find a possible exit out of the realm so she could eventually get back to the reason they were traveling in the first place. She wasn't sure if that was what Jacob was thinking about though. She seemed to be really be in the spirit of things.

Soon Jacob and Denise pulled into the town and set her cart up on the side of the road. She placed her things out, when Denise wanted to wander off. "Alright sis! I'll be here."

Jacob received many gold coins from her sisters, buying wares and weapons. Now "Anna" had only one goal:

Fill her coin purse until it's bursting at the seams.

What next?
15221211111111111111111.title: Veeral

152212111111111111111111.content:
After leaving Jacob behind, Denise decided to look around the town. It was about as lively as the main town, although with not as many people. She got the occasional "hello" and such, not really talking beyond that.

"This seems like a really lively realm, even if everyone looks the same." Denise lightly giggled. It was weird to think that such a realm worked like this, but everyone seemed happy, and that's what Denise liked more than anything: seeing everyone happy. It reminded her of Melheim.

Anyway, she kept walking around, even after grabbing a quick snack at a little shop. She couldn't find much else of interest within the town limits, seeing nothing more than houses and many weapon shops. However, as she looked outside the town for a bit, she squinted and saw something in the distance: a familiar blue swirling device, which made her smile.

"Ah ha, an Outrealm Gate. I wonder where that one leads to." she said to herself. "I guess I'll have to get Jacob first though before doing that. I hope I can find her in this crowd though."

And with that, Denise tried to return to her friend.
152212111111111111111111.title: Anna (As in Denise)

1522121111111111111111111.content:
Denise wandered through the streets, back from the way she came. She looked over each vendor, trying to see which one is Jacob. Denise had a feeling this would be hard, since Jacob seemed like she was acting the same as any other Anna.

She passed by a cart when the Anna there stopped her. "Denise!" Anna yelled as she quickly pocketed some gold. "Find anything of value?"

Denise sighed and smiled, "Yeah. I found another Outrealm Gate, and was thinking we should go."

Anna placed a finger on her chin, thinking it over. "Well that would expand the market, but I'll be kinda sad to leave my sisters behind...I'm sure they won't mind though. Alright, I'm in." Anna then packed all her things in a bag, including her gold and held it over her shoulder. "Let's go!"

Denise was quite shocked by Jacob's change in attitude, to the point where it worried her. But she assumed that when they left, he would be back to normal. The two went toward the Outrealm Gate and left the Anna realm.

What happens next?
1522121111111111111111111.title: Finding Jacob

1522121111111111111112.content:
Jacob soon left her sisters in the mines and left with Denise, suggesting that they keep moving. Jacob agreed, after saying goodbye to her sisters and gathering her things, she left with her "sister" toward the Outrealm gate as they wandered through.

To somewhere neither Jacob, Denise, or Anna was expecting.

----------

Jacob woke up in a cool, damp place. He sat up and saw her new attire. She wore a red-pink Swordmaster outfit, her hair was black and untied as it hung behind her head. She rubbed her head and saw Denise sit up as well. "Denise, are you okay?" Jacob said, rushing to her side and helping her up.

"Just a little woozy," Denise replied. Then the two heard loud noises that caught their attention. They moved toward the end of the alley they were in to see towering buildings and metal machines moving through the streets. "Tis' an interesting realm, no?" Jacob said.

Denise nodded, intrigued. "Yeah. Let's check it out."
1522121111111111111112.title: Leaving

153.content:
Name: Jacob
Class: War Monk
Age: 16
Appearance: A white cleric robe with purple decals.
Skills: Acrobat, Luck +4, Aggressor, Relief, Lethality
Weapons: Axes: C, Staves: A.
Inventory: Heal, Killer Axe, Steel Axe, Recover, Rescue.
Bio: From a realm of chaos, he grew up alone, trying to be nice, but also getting stabbed in the back. He managed to become a Cleric and emigrate to other realms before splitting away to explore.

-----------

Jacob opened his eyes to see two of his weapons broken in front of him. A steel axe in pieces and a Heal Stave split in two. Jacob could already see the blood pooling around him. He made a quick bout up and forward, only to stumble forward and gain a more open wound. Unable to do anything, he laid on a desolate dirt road, when he saw a silhouette in the distance emerge from a portal of sorts.
153.title: Tactician #7

154.content:
Name: Samuel
Race: Manakete
Age: 1000+ (Appearance: 12 to 13)
Gender: Male
Appearance: A short haired boy in Tactician robes. As a dragon, he is dark red with blue eyes, instead of his standard brown.
Items: Dragonstones+
Level: 30
Skills: Skill Breaker, Wyrmsbane, Lethality, Acrobat, Pass.
Personality: A male Nah, basically.

---------

Samuel woke up on the side of a dusty road. His head hurt. Like hit-over-head-with-warhammer-hurt. He rubbed his head, unable to remember what happened when...
154.title: Manakete #1

1541.content:
****Greg****

Name: Greg
Age: 18
Appearance: 5'9 feet tall, and 140 lbs. Short red hair and blue eyes. Rather average build. Wears traditional Hero look with dark blue and silver colors.
Personality: Shy, but friendly and helpful.
Origin: In a village named Kirada in the Outrealms.
Bio: Lived an ordinary life in Kirada for the longest time. Eventually, he decided to travel through the Outrealms, looking to see what else was beyond Kirada.
Race: Human
Class: Hero (Level 20)
Uses: Swords (Level A) and Axes (Level B)
Asset and Weakness: Speed and Luck
Equipment: Ragnell, Silver Sword, Steel Axe, and some Vulneraries
Skills: Armsthrift, Sol, Pavise, Limit Breaker, and Swordfaire.

****End Bio****

Since leaving Kirada, Greg really wished that he had brought a map. Although, he figured that there were likely no maps about how to travel through Outrealms. Perhaps Karen was right when she told him to be better prepared.

"Serves me right, I guess." he sighed to himself.

Anyway, he was walking along a dirt road so far, looking for another town. As he did though, he came across someone who was just getting off the ground. He did a double take at first, seeing the man's longer ears.

"Is that....a Manakete?" Greg asked himself. He had never seen one before, but he had seen them in books. The man matched the description for the most part.

"What'cha looking at?" asked the man, who spotted Greg, causing him to jump back a bit.

"O-Oh, I'm sorry.....I'm Greg. I apologize if I was staring." he apologized, offering a hand to help him back up.

"No problem. I'm Samuel." said the man.
1541.title: Someone finds him

15411.content:
Samuel sat up, then stood. Greg seemed bigger than him, even though they were the same age. "Say...Would you know where we are?"

Greg shrugged. "I got here just recently. Didn't think I'd see a Manakete." He said.

"Yeah well...You see and experience things you've never thought in these realms....Hm..." Samuel trailed off.

"What?" Greg asked.

"How about I join you? I don't remember what I was doing, but I think you could help. What do you say?" Samuel asked.

Does Greg say yes?
15411.title: Meeting

154111.content:
"You have no problem walking with some stranger you just met?" smirked Greg, crossing his arms in an amused way. He hadn't met someone like this in quite some time. Samuel kind of smiled at him in return.

"Hey, I'm a Manakete. If something goes wrong, I can handle it. Besides, I think I hit my head somewhere, and wandering around aimlessly wouldn't do me any good." said Sam.

"Good points." nodded Greg. "Well, you can come, at least until you think you feel better."

"Sounds good." smiled Sam as the two shook hands briefly. After that, Greg immediately urged them to get to the next town. Along the way, Sam asked him if he knew what realm this was. Greg shook his head.

"Unfortunately, I don't. I haven't met many people since I left Kirada, my hometown. There aren't a lot of maps for this kind of thing." Greg chuckled to himself.

"Kind of easy-going for someone who's lost." muttered Sam.

"Speak for yourself." Greg retorted.

"Hey, I'm not easy-going, just a little cautious right now. Like I said, I don't remember what I was doing before." said Sam.

"But at least you remember home and all that, right?" asked Greg.

"Yeah, those are good." said Sam.

Nodding, Greg left it at that. He wanted to find the next town before nightfall. Luckily for them, the town soon came over the horizon, and not a second too soon. It was an average town, nothing too out of the ordinary there. People were still bustling along the streets, getting any needed supplies for the day. Sam flinched a but at the large amount of people.

"Shy?" smirked Greg.

"Manaketes don't generally hang around in human cities. We kind of stand out." said Sam who put his cowl over his head.

"I guess you would. If the ears don't stand out, the lack of aging would." chuckled Greg. "Hey, how old are you anyway?"

"Over 1000. Why?" asked Sam.

"Oh, no reason. Just curious. Manaketes really do age slowly, just like the books said." nodded Greg to himself. This little journey was already off to an interesting start, and it would only get weirder with these two.
154111.title: Accepting the Offer

1541111.content:
Samuel knew this was gonna have an interesting outcome. If everything went truly terrible for some reason. All he needed to do was pull out a Dragonstones and away he'd go.

Samuel made sure to keep his ears under his hood, not to draw attention. The two walked through when Samuel heard a noise. He stopped walking and looked around to see a girl with pink hair. "Psst. You two."

Samuel double-checked both ways as Greg and Samuel walked closer to the girl, urging them into the alley. "Who are you?"

She wore a dark brown Dark Mage uniform and held a time under her arm. "Listen, I just need to test my new tome out."

"New tome?" Greg questioned. "What does it do?"

"That's the thing. I don't know, I was hoping you would let me try. If anything goes wrong, I could fix it...possibly." The girl said.

Samuel and Greg exchanged glances as Samuel shrugged and Greg nodded. "Alright. Go ahead."

The girl smiled and nodded, then opened her tome as she flipped through the pages and hit the two with some sort of beam. The two felt it hit, but that was all. "So...feel different?" She asked.

Samuel shook his head. "Not in the slightest."

"...Maybe I cast it wrong. Alright, sorry for wasting your time." She apologized.

The two nodded and left. Something bit at Samuel though. "I have a bad feeling..." He murmured to himself.
1541111.title: Getting pulled aside

15411111.content:
"Well, that was kind of weird." said Greg.

"I guess it was. Although, I've got a bad feeling about this." said Sam.

"What kind of feeling?" asked Greg.

"I don't know. It's hard to explain. I mean, it was kind of sudden and all." said Sam.

"Yeah. I haven't met many Dark Mages. Not many of them in Kirada after all." said Greg. "Anyway, we're not in any kind of rush, so I think we should try and turn in for the day. We shouldn't rush traveling through the realms. Who knows what could happen if we did that."

"Good thinking." said Sam. "I think I see an Inn over that ways."

"Okay." said Greg. With that settled, they walked towards the Inn that Sam spotted. As they did, Greg's mind did keep wandering back to that strange girl. She didn't seem like a bad person, but he did wonder if everything was all right. He never heard many good things about Dark Mages after all.

"Have you met many Dark Mages?" asked Greg.

"I think I've met a few here and there, although what we just witnessed was a first." said Sam. Greg nodded in understanding.

Anyway, the duo got to the inn, where they were able to get a room for themselves for the night. However, it was still the afternoon right now, so it wasn't exactly bedtime. This gave them at least a little time to relax a bit.
15411111.title: A Curse's side effects

154111111.content:
The two sat in their room for awhile, going over inventory. Samuel counted off his Dragonstones, Greg his Swords.

Samuel soon sat down in a chair as did Greg. "So, what's it like as a Manakete?" Greg asked.

"Well...you see A LOT, for starters. You learn things over the centuries that really help you out. But also, I just enjoy flying around as a Dragon. 'Course it has to be away from humans, but..." Samuel trailed off.

"Meet anyone important?" Greg asked, knowing that Manakete alive now could've been alive in King Marth's time.

"I did have a run-in with Roy before, and ended up helping him. But that seems like the only one," Samuel added.

The two continued discussing among one another when Samuel found himself readjusting himself in his seat constantly, along with Greg. He couldn't understand why he felt uncomfortable, but then decided it was because he was tired. He stood and stretched as the two went toward the respective beds and fell asleep...

...unprepared for Morning's surprise.
154111111.title: Relaxing

1541111111.content:
Greg felt the morning sunlight light up his face as it rose into the sky. He always hated this part of the day, having to wake up from a nice sleep. It was surprisingly a comfortable sleep, as he didn't know what to expect from these Inns in the Outrealms.

He got up and stretched, although for some reason, his limbs felt a little different than normal. However, he was still kind of half-asleep so he didn't really bother. He did have to remove something from his face though, which felt like his hair. That very thought was odd. Greg's hair was always short, so why would it be in his face? He still didn't think much of it, blaming the bedhead or whatever. Still, the kicker came when he tripped and fell over something soft, which turned out to be the sleeping pants offered by the Inn.

"Huh? Didn't these fit when I got them?" he asked himself. Immediately, his hands went to his mouth. That voice didn't sound familiar at all. As he struggled to get up, he saw that he even had to hold up his pants a bit to keep them up. Not only that, two mounds on his chest were obscuring his view. Gasping, and now fully awake, Greg ran to the bathroom provided by the Inn. Closing the door behind him, he looked in the mirror, his smaller hands on his chest.

He was obviously no longer a "he", but a "she" now. She was smaller than she was before, shorter by a good couple of inches. The white shirt she wore draped over one shoulder, as she now wasn't big enough for it. The mounds poking through were obviously a C-cup at minimum. Her body was lithe and petite, although not so much to be considered non-healthy, and she certainly had a decent amount of muscle. However, a bigger shock was her hair.

"My hair...it's red."

Greg's formerly blue hair was now a vibrant red, cascading down her face and back. To be truthful, the red color went nicely with her fair skin tone, much to her discomfort. Her eyes were lighter too, kind of like an orange-yellow color. It was like all the dark colors of her male self were replaced with brighter colors. Still wondering if this was a dream, Greg splashed her face a bit with the water that was there, although the same soft face remained after she did. She touched some places on her face, from her bigger eyes to her smaller nose and mouth. It felt so surreal. What had caused this?

However, Greg had to put those thoughts aside as she knew that she had to get a bath done before starting the day. She sighed as she dropped her bigger clothes; this was going to feel like a long day.

*****Afterwards*****

Greg finished her shower after a while, finding it a bit of a pain as the water felt bizarre on her skin, and her hair took forever. She officially swore off making fun of Karen whenever she took forever in the bath.

To Greg's surprise, once she dried her hair out, she quickly found a band and whipped it into a ponytail, still leaving her bangs around her forehead and face. She didn't know how she knew how to do that.

"Weirder and weirder." she sighed again as she exited the bathroom, drying herself off and finding her clothes. However, she also saw that her clothes had changed. Her blue and silver Hero clothes were gone, replaced with the garb of a female Mercenary. The tunic itself was green, with the armor white. The pants were a typical dark color.

"Great....it's like someone used a Second Seal on me." Greg sighed as she got her clothes on, stumbling a bit with the bra before getting fully dressed. Sam was still totally beneath the covers, so Greg decided to leave him alone for now and get some breakfast.
1541111111.title: In the Morning

15411111111.content:
Samuel opened his eyes slowly as he awoke. Something was up, and he knew it, but he was too tired to care at the moment.

He didn't want to wake up, so he decided to stay in bed. He went to roll over in his chest when something blocked him on his side. He groaned, not wanting to deal with something early in the morning like this. He then realized the groan that escaped his lips had a higher pitch than usual and sounded older.

Samuel decided he should get out of bed now, knowing that Greg's probably awake. He sat up and stood from the bed rubbing his eyes. Something was definitely up. He felt more limber than usual as he stretched...

...Then he looked down to try and discover what the odd, heavy weight on his chest was.

Samuel was never good with measurements like these, but about half of her B/A-Cup assets hung above her dress and stuck out. The red dress she was now wearing barely covered her rear as she wore thigh-length boots and a pink cloak. The sad thing though...

...this was only the second time it happened.

He was smaller then before, so he could deal with it, but now he had a body of...larger proportions. "She" sighed as she looked in her nightstand and saw a headdress on it. She sighed and picked it up. "...Guess I should change." Samuel said, a finger pressed against her lips in surprise, even though she knew it was coming.

----

Samuel had been married before. He knew how to do things to help women out, like braiding hair, like what he was doing to himself right now.

Her hair had hung off loosely and messy. After running it under water and straightening it out, she put her hair in a long neat braid. She soon picked up the gold headdress and put it on, along with her pouch of Dragonstones. She looked down to still see her partially exposed assets there and blushed nervously. She needed to find Greg. She soon left their room.

Samuel went down the stairs to see a fairly empty bottom floor, but in the corner was a Merc eating her breakfast. Although their faces changed to a more feminine look, she could tell it was Greg as she approached her.

What happens next?
15411111111.title: Sam wakes up

154111111111.content:
Greg was just popping a fork-full of breakfast into her mouth as she saw another woman approach her. The obvious Manakete features stood out to her.

"So you ended up like this too, huh?" Greg deadpanned, as if pretty much used to it already.

"Yeah." said Sam as she sat down, adjusting herself on the seat. She didn't have a cloak now to keep others from seeing that she was a Manakete, which worried her. Thankfully, not many people were there, and those that were weren't paying much attention.

"So....you're back to being a Mercenary?" smiled Sam.

"Yeah, apparently. I guess it's not all bad. I still have my skills and weapons. I wished that I had kept my blue hair though." Greg groaned.

"Red actually looks surprisingly good on you." said Sam, as she tried to lighten the mood somewhat.

"Thanks, I guess. You're surprisingly calm." said Greg. "Guess being around for who knows how many centuries kind of takes most surprises away, huh?"

"Well, I can safely say that I've never experienced this. You think that Dark Mage had anything to do with this?" pondered Sam.

"I'm willing to bet it does, hence why I plan on searching after breakfast. It's the only reasonable explanation." said Greg. "So get something to eat. I'd like to leave, one way or another."

After Sam got some breakfast, the two of them left their inn key at the desk. They told the person at the desk not to ask when she mentioned not recognizing them. Greg went out and found a bigger cloak for Sam, as the little pink one wasn't near big enough. To be honest, as weird as this was, Greg did find some of her sword movements to not be affected much. Her muscles weren't too different, but a little slimmer and easy to move in. Her clothes moved well with her body. She could at least be thankful for that.

However, their little search for the Dark Mage ended in failure.

"Well, that ended up as a waste of time." groaned Greg. It was bad enough running around in circles, but having a guy or two find her new look "appealing" didn't help. Sam laughed a bit as Greg rubbed her forehead.

"Maybe we should just leave. If there's one thing I heard about Dark Mage curses, they usually aren't permanent. This will most likely pass over. Meanwhile, I think we should leave to the next realm. I'd rather get far from here to be honest." said Greg.

"I agree. I don't want them to see me either." said Sam. Luckily, Greg had seen the familiar swirling energy of an Outrealm Gate in the distance, so they knew their destination now. With that in mind, they began to make their way, with Sam shedding the cloak once they were further away.

"Do all female Manaketes wear clothes that small? Because, if so, you must have quite the culture." said Greg.

"Not all of them, but some are like that." said Sam as they finally approached the gate.
154111111111.title: Reactions

1541111111111.content:
The two once-boy-girls stood in front of the gate of swirling energy leading to the Outrealms. The two looked at each other. "Wondering what will happen?" Greg asked Sam.

Samuel nodded slightly, "I just hope I can get a better change of clothes at least. Still a little nervous about this part..." Samuel said shyly, pulling up her dress to try and cover her assets on her chest.

Greg laughed a little before the two nodded at one another and entered. Upon entering, they felt their bodies begin changing and they passed out.

-----

Samuel opened his eyes to see the blue sky above him. He groaned and realized he was still a "she". She sat up slowly rubbing her head. "Great..." Samuel said as she heard a more country-accented voice. She stood up and looked herself over. She wore a grayish-blue breastplate with a small skirt of sorts. She wore a matching helm that allowed her long green hair to flow from under it. She recognized her instantly and saw she was Nephenee.

"Oh! Nephenee, huh?" Samuel said looking herself over.

Soon though, he was interrupted by a noise nearby as she saw her friend stand.
1541111111111.title: Traveling again

15411111111111.content:
"Ugh, ow. That was the roughest landing yet." groaned Greg as she struggled to get up. Something felt off again though, but Greg couldn't quite put her finger on it.

"So, you changed again too?" asked Sam. Greg gawked at Sam a bit at seeing her new appearance.

"Who are you?" asked Greg, instinctively reaching for her sword, which down seemed to be slimmer in appearance.

"Woah, calm down there! It's me Sam. This realm seems to have changed us." replied Sam, talking in that new country accent. Greg seemed to calm down a bit, taking a look down at herself. She now had on an orange tunic that also served as a short skirt, black gloves on her arms, and some black stockings to go with black boots.

"Who's this?" asked Greg.

"You kind of look like Mia, a Tellius warrior from long ago." said Sam.

"And how in the world did the realm do that?" asked Greg.

"I don't know. I've changed too obviously, but I don't get why." said Sam. However, she saw Greg laughing a tiny bit. "What's so funny?"

"You sound kind of funny with that accent, given that you were a Manakete just a while ago." Greg smiled.

"Yeah, I guess so." Sam shrugged.
15411111111111.title: Greg's new body

154111111111111.content:
Sam soon looked through her inventory to see her Dragonstones replaced by a Spear, Sigurd's lance, Brave Lance, and a Killer Lance. Not that bad a trade off. Holding it, she seemed used to the feel of the spear. She soon looked back to Greg. "Well, we shouldn't just sit out here," Sam said as she helped Greg up. "Come on, let's see if we can't find an inn or something."

Greg nodded as the two walked down a dirty, dusty road. As they walked, Sam started a conversation. "Hey, Greg?"

"Yeah?"

"We've been going into these bodies seemlessly it appears. Aren't they feeling...too familiar?" Sam shrugged.

Greg shrugged as well. "A little, but we were just girls in the other realm, so I guess it makes sense." The two walked a little longer when Greg asked, "Why do you keep that helmet on?"

Putting Sam in the spotlight, she went red. "Well it's...kinda embarrassing...I-I'd rather keep it on." Sam said.

Greg was suspicious for a moment but pushed it aside as they found a small town.

What happens next?
154111111111111.title: After that

1541111111111111.content:
Along the way, Greg looked into her own inventory, seeing a Slim Sword, Eirika's Blade, Brave Sword, and a Killing Edge. The smaller swords seemed to grasp better in her hands than before. Her muscles were still pretty good, and she felt as nimble as she did in that previous female form. She did feel a little miffed about one thing though. She was apparently a Myrmidon, while Sam was a Halberdier.

"Well, might as well see what that town has." said Greg.

"Sure." said Sam.

The two of them walked into town, a rather normal one by the looks of it. Greg sometimes wondered if she could ever keep track of all these realms with all of these similar looking towns.

"So, wanna look around for a bit?" asked Greg.

"I guess we could." said Sam.
1541111111111111.title: The town

15411111111111111.content:
Sam and Greg walked through the town. In general it was small, but it was a fair size in reality. The two females wandered through the streets, passing vendors by. Sam kept her eyes out for an inn, one that the two could stay at while they try and discover where they are.

The town itself was intriguing. It seemed bustling, even for it's size. It was nothing like her little farming town in Tellius that she grew up at....

Sam put a hand to her head. 'I...I remember that but...' Sam thought, trying to cope with new memories slowly intruding into her mind.

"You alright?" Greg asked by her side.

Sam nodded, "Yeah...Thanks Mi-...Greg." Sam turned to look for an inn again, trying to take her mind off topic.

What happens next?
15411111111111111.title: Around the town

154111111111111111.content:
After a while of walking, the two of them stumbled upon an inn together. Greg made the suggestion to check into the inn. There wasn't going to be light for much longer anyway, and they had a full day ahead of them after this, whether they got to another realm or not.

"Gods, I'm starting to wonder what to do really. I've just aimlessly wondered around." groaned Greg as she had the inn key in hand. They got a key for one room, since they were thinking of leaving town the next day.

"Well....we could figure that out....tomorrow." said Sam.

"Good idea." said Greg.

After that, the two of them settled in for some dinner at the inn, which was serviceable at best. Neither raised a complaint though as they paid for it. After a while, they returned back to their room where they got ready for bed.

"Feels weird wearing this gown though. I guess it's not too bad, but I've felt better." said Greg. Sam just nodded, getting into bed herself.

"And why are you still wearing the helmet?" asked Greg, but Sam was already beneath the covers. She just shrugged and let it go for now. Was Nephenee really this shy in the legends?

*****Next Morning*****

"Hey, wake up!" cheered Greg as she tried to get Sam out of bed.

"But....it's only dawn." spoke Sam.

"No time like the present to get going. Now get washed up and ready." said Greg, feeling a little more energetic than normal this morning. Sam groaned as she got out of bed, taking her helmet off to straighten out her hair after Greg went into the washroom. After a while, both of them were dressed and returned their room key. They nabbed some rolls for breakfast and began hitting the road.

"The next gate should be just out of town. Shall we head there?" asked Greg.
154111111111111111.title: They locate an inn

1541111111111111111.content:
The Myrmidon and Halberdier wandered down a dusty road identical to the one they had used to enter. Nephenee walked with a patterned stride alongside Mia, who did the same, but had more energy in her movements.

The two soon saw the swirling gate and approached it. "You ready?" Mia asked.

Nephenee nodded, and the two entered the swirling vortex. They walked inside of it a bit when the two blacked out, their bodies returning to normal...

...well, almost.

Sam opened her eyes and groaned before sitting up. She looked down at her black assassin armor and noticed the bra askew. Quickly readjusting it, it still showed more cleavage than needed under the bra. She then looked into her inventory, a Killing Edge, Niddhogr, a Killer Bow, and a Silver Sword. "Man..." Sam groaned with a hand to her head, "...It was interesting being Nephenee, but I'm glad I'm back to normal."

She stood up when she heard another groan and stood over Greg.
------------
Sam's new profile:
Name: Sam
Gender: Female
Class: Lv 15 Assassin
Skills: Lethality, Acrobat, Pass, Limit Breaker, Wyrmsbane.
Appearance: Black assassin suit with long dark purple hair (similar to the special colored hair in the Hotrealm DLC).
1541111111111111111.title: Heading  out

15411111111111111111.content:
Greg felt a huge headache as he slowly opened his eyes. He remembered passing through the Outrealm Gate along with Sam, and that they both looked like some heroes from some time ago. He had never felt so different in his life, not even when he was that female Mercenary when that Dark Mage cursed them. That was a wild ride for sure.

Greg's eyes suddenly widened at those thoughts and looked at his hand, clad in his familiar Hero armor, bringing a relieved smile to his face. Not that being a girl was a bad thing, but he was glad to be in his familiar body. Even his weapons were all on hand. All felt good, except for the nagging headache.

"Are you alright?" he heard a soft female voice. Greg raised an eyebrow, not recognizing that voice specifically. He turned around and practically blushed at what he saw. There was a female Assassin in front of him, the armor black in color. Her long dark hair extended down in back freely and her eyes almost bore into Greg.

"What the?" Greg sputtered. Was this Sam in another form? This seemed to be the biggest change yet.

"What are you doing?" asked the girl.

"Is that you, Sam?" asked Greg. The girl raised an eyebrow.

"Yeah, I am. What are you surprised about?" Sam asked, putting her hands on her hips.

"Um, well I figured you'd be back to normal since I am." spoke Greg.

"What are you talking about? I AM back to normal." spoke Sam, as if it was obvious. Greg felt like his headache got worse.

"This is killing me." he muttered to himself.

"Are you injured? I've got another Elixer here." spoke Sam.

"Oh no, I'm good." spoke Greg as he got to his feet. Was this how Sam remembered herself now? He saw that she still had the Wyrmsbane skills, something only Manaketes could get. So that life was still around in some way or form.

"Um, so what really do you remember?" asked Greg, getting another raised eyebrow from Sam.
15411111111111111111.title: Greg's reaction

choices: They search for a nearby town
154111111111111111111.content:
Sam tilted her head. Greg didn't look injured, but did he really forget what happened. "Well a few realms ago a Dark Mage cast a spell on the two of us. It changed you into a girl, but not me since I was one already."

Sam stood and put away the elixir she had ready. "After that we found another Outrealm. I became Nephenee and you became Mia. We stayed there for a day or so until we came across another Gate and entered. And here we are." Sam said.

Sam was still curious as to why Greg was giving her this look of confusion. 'Hmmmm....Maybe it's cause of all the Outrealm movement...' Sam thought to herself.

"I noticed you have Wyrmsbane. I thought only Manaketes know that." Greg questioned.

Sam looked back at Greg. "We've been over this. It was a trait I was born with. Besides, we wouldn't know if it was a Manakete-only skill. We'd have to meet one to know for sure...Now come on." Sam lifted Greg up as they stood in a forested area of the new realm.

What happens next?
154111111111111111111.title: New Sam

1541111111111111111111.content:
"So...." started Greg, trying to get his thoughts together. It didn't help that Sam's outfit was especially flattering in regards to her chest, exposing some of it, making him blush a bit.

"What?" asked Sam.

"How long have you been an Assassin? I don't think I ever asked." Greg asked.

"Hmm, quite a while, I guess. I tend to keep to myself more often, so I guess I kind of ended up in this class. Guess that's how it roles sometimes." explained Sam.

"Fair enough." said Greg, still getting a glance at Sam's chest. He had never traveled with a girl (at least, he hadn't as a guy), so he wasn't sure how to handle this. Not only that, this woman was a Manakete at what point, but was now a regular human, perhaps for good.

"Anything else?" asked Sam.

"I don't think so." Greg said, rubbing his head a bit. Soon after he said that, he could see a town coming up in the distance.

"Ah, a town. What say we stop there for a bit?" asked Greg.

"That sounds good to me. Traveling through those gates is a bit tiring at times." smiled Sam.

The duo made their way down to the town, another ordinary town. Greg began to wonder if there was much difference at all between this realms. All these towns looked so similar that it was hard to tell at times.

"By the way, would you stop looking at me like that?" said Sam, turning herself away from Greg again. Greg flinched, realizing that he probably glanced over again. He didn't say another word for a while.
1541111111111111111111.title: Greg asks more questions

15411111111111111111111.content:
The town they entered was well-developed. Vendors leaning out shop windows, trying to lure potential customers. Sam and Greg wandered through town. Sam caught a few people staring at her chest. "Sheesh! They have nothing better to do or something?" Sam said a little annoyed.

"Ignore them," Greg finally chimed in after his silence.

Sam smiled. "Thanks Gre-" she stopped as she saw something in a nearby shop. She bolted towards it, Greg losing sight of her.

----------------

Sam ran up to the vendor and stared at her target. A Wedding Bouqet. She had been looking everywhere for these, and she finally found it. Sam quickly identified the merchant as an Anna, and tapped her shoulder. "How much for the Bouqet?" Sam asked.

Anna looked her over. "About 5000 gold."

"What? Can you lower the price a bit, I need to learn how to use it's weapons correctly." Sam added.

The merchant put a finger to her chin, then smiled. "How about I add a two Arms Scrolls and the Bouqet?"

Sam nodded, "Deal!" She exchanged the cash and bought a Silver Lance, a Silver Bow, Luna, and Astra. She activated the seal as she now wore a sparkling Bride's dress. Sam squealed as she looked for Greg, spotted him, and made her way toward him.
15411111111111111111111.title: Later on

154111111111111111111111.content:
Greg was quickly trying to find his runaway friend as he weaved his way through the crowd. Why did she have to run so fast? Greg sighed as he thought about it. Sam wasn't like this before.

"What could really be so important to run off like that?" he asked himself. He would unfortunately get his answer soon when something white flashed in front of him, making him blush even heavily than before. Immediately, he saw Sam in front of him, wearing the sparkling outfit of a Bride.

"What do you think?" smiled Sam as she did a little twirl in it.

"What....the.....hell?" Greg sputtered out.

"What does that mean?" pouted Sam, putting her hands on her hips.

"I mean, what the hell?" Greg repeated more fiercely. "The dress looks nice, buy why in the middle of a town? We're getting odd looks already, and I get the feeling that they're not good looks. Not to mention..."

Greg trailed off a bit there. He wanted to say she looked better in her previous class. In combat, Brides were known as a great support class, which contrasted heavily with who Sam was, both as a boy and as a girl. Even Greg would have to admit that she looked better before.

"Hmm, well I guess you have a point. I couldn't help myself." said Sam.

"Wonderful. Now would you please change back?" Greg urged further, facepalming as he saw some guys giving him grins that said "Lucky guy".
154111111111111111111111.title: Greg's reaction

1541111111111111111111111.content:
Sam was a little upset that she couldn't wear the dress, but understood why. She walked back to the same Anna, who gave her a quick look. "Something wrong," the Anna asked with a worried look.

"My friend doesn't feel to comfortable with me around him like that." Sam somewhat pouted with her arms crossed.

Anna nodded. "I can see that I guess, him being a little nervous. Anna then smiled, "I may have a deal for you. Here."

Anna then laid on her cart a Seal. It was golden and had a blade sparkling inside. "W-what is that?" Sam said in complete awe.

"We were given choices as to what Seals to sell, and the Bride dress was more popular, so we sold those. We never sold this, though. I'll exchange it for you." Anna said smiling gleefully.

Sam tapped her cheek, "Will I have to learn to new weapons?"

"No. It uses Lances, Bows, and Swords. How do you feel about it?" Anna asked.

Sam smiled. "I'll take it!"

She activated the "Blade Princess" Seal. It comprised of a small, blue tunic with long sleeves that covered her torso and exposed a bit of her cleavage, along with a white cloak-like robe that acted as a skirt as well, a string tying it at the waist. She also wore some stockings that would reach the thighs and boots shorter than knee length. It also had a hair band designed similarly to the Dancer's. She thanked Anna when she turned and saw Greg looking for her. She waved and got his attention as he went over to her to get a better look.
1541111111111111111111111.title: After that

choices: He asks something else about her
15411111111111111111111111.content:
For the second time that day, Greg was shocked at what he saw, his jaw dropping. The tunic and robe complimented Sam's figure perfectly, even showing a bit of generous cleavage. The robe also served as a skirt, although it didn't extend long, perhaps barely past her rear. The stockings showed off her slim legs, and he hairband kept her hair from her face.

Greg felt as if someone had just hit him with a Thoron spell.

"Um, Greg? Is it alright?" asked Sam, snapping her fingers in front of his eyes. Greg immediately shook his head, his face reddening at his thoughts.

"Oh, r-right....umm...it looks good on you. Very flattering." said Greg as honestly as he could, getting a smile from Sam.

"Really? Thank you! In that case, it's a done deal. Thanks miss!" cheered Sam, shaking the Anna's hand, who thanked her in turn for the purchase. Right after that exchange, Sam grabbed Greg's hand and they were off. Eventually, the thought of what this clothing style was finally made it back to the front of Greg's mind.

"So Sam, what class is that? I saw a flash, so it was a class change." said Greg.

"Yep, it was. She called it a "Secret Blade" seal. You know, kind of like the Dread Scroll that the legends speak off. She said that this class is kind of like a counterpart to the Dread Fighter, since only males can be those. It's meant to enforce a lady's fierce strength and subtle grace and majesty. What do you think of that?" smirked Sam.

"Well, I see the grace part." thought Greg, shaking his head again. He felt as if his prior knowledge of Sam was gone. This was Sam now, and Greg could barely keep his blush down.

"Well anyway, perhaps its best to reserve an Inn. Perhaps tomorrow we can explore more of the realm." said Sam.

"Oh...um...sure." spoke Greg, getting Sam's attention.

"Are you okay? What's wrong?" asked Sam, a concerned look adorning her face as she stared at Greg.

"Oh, it's nothing, really. Just something on my mind." said Greg.

"Really? Like what?" asked Sam, now curious.

If only Greg could just spit it out. Was even reality changed thanks to her new form?
15411111111111111111111111.title: Greg reacts

154111111111111111111111111.content:
"I was meaning to ask you before about your family," Greg said.

Sam looked over at Greg, a look of confusion. "You already asked me that," she giggled. "If you want to hear it that much, okay. There wasn't much. I had a family of thieves, but I was only raised by Dad in that aspect in a land called Ylisse. I felt as though there was more for me out there, so I decided to leave. I remember before I did leave though, there seemed to be some war brewing between the Ylisse and Plegia. I hope Dad is alright..." She thought, wrapping hair in her finger.

She sighed and smiled at Greg, "Well, that's my story, again." She said. She seemed worried since Greg kept asking her questions since she arrived. "Let's go get an inn room and rest up."

Her new class got interesting looks, a few people staring (who she looked at, making them turn away), and some passing it off as a generic piece of clothing. They found an inn and got a two-bed room. She sat in the chair, looking in her inventory, seeing a Killing Edge, a Silver Lance, a Brave Bow, and an elixir.

"Are you okay Greg?" She asked.
154111111111111111111111111.title: He asks about her family

1541111111111111111111111111.content:
"Oh, um, yeah I am. Just thinking about some things." he said.

"Really? Like what?" she asked.

"Well, just how odd things have been since I left home. I set out to see what's out there, but I didn't imagine things being so weird." said Greg, taking a seat on his bed. Sam gave him a soft look and sat right next to him.

"Well, then it's definitely a good thing I met you. Traveling through the realms is easier with a buddy." she said with a smile.

"Heh." Greg actually smiled back. "You might be right about that. Still, I can't help but wonder if anything is out there. I mean, with all the realms out there, one is bound to be at war or something."

"Yeah, I guess there would be." said Sam, sighing. "That seemed to be starting in my world before I left. Ylisse...has seen quite the hard times as of late. I imagine your home is much more peaceful."

"Probably. It's so small that my village probably wouldn't even be noticed." smiled Greg before he gave a big yawn. He had just removed his armor, just having his casual clothes on. Still, he felt pretty tired from the days events.

"Well, tomorrow, we should set off so we can find these new places, and see if your bad premonition ever comes to pass." smiled Sam, who ended up yawning as well. Her robe was off, leaving just her tunic. She was pretty tired as well.

Greg leaned back to rest, but ended up closing his eyes and sleeping as is. Unfortunately for him, Sam ended up doing the same, neither of them moving for the remainder of the night.
1541111111111111111111111111.title: Greg responds

15411111111111111111111111111.content:
Sam opened her eyes, the sunlight peeked through the window and shined against her eyes. She sat up and stretched, as she then stepped out of bed and walked to the restroom provided. She equipped her "Secret Blade" armor and straightened her hair before placing her hairband in her hair. She put a sword on her hip as she walked back into the bedroom.

She approached the sleeping Greg and shook his shoulder as he groaned and woke. "Wake up, Greg! I wanna get going and explore!" Sam said gleefully.

Greg nodded and equipped his armor and weapons as the two grabbed breakfast and ate on the way down the road.

It wasn't long until they saw the swirling vortex that was the Outrealm Gate. Sam looked to Greg, "Ready?"

Greg nodded. The two then entered the gate, and passed out.

--------

When Sam awoke, she and Greg were in somewhere...odd.

It was a massive hall to what seemed to be a temple. 16 statues stood in the hall as there was an altar-like surface. She looked around and saw outside was large landscape of green land. She also saw two horses inside the temple. She stood up and walked by the unconscious Greg and shook him awake. "Where...Where are we?" Greg asked.

"I'm not sure, but..." She looked outside and saw a temple a distance away with a light shining into the sky from the temple. "I think we should head there." Sam said as she ran toward a horse.
15411111111111111111111111111.title: Morning

154111111111111111111111111111.content:
Sam and Greg both mounted their own horse and began riding out of one mysterious temple to another. "Where exactly are we," Sam asked Greg as they rode.

"I'm not sure. These realms are countless and could have thrown us anywhere. I say we keep our eyes open." Greg replied as the rest of the ride was quiet.

The temple was an old, stone ruin. Torches lit a large hallway as it stretched across the ruins. The two left their horses outside as they entered. Sam and Greg looked around before Sam exclaimed, "This place is huge!"

Then it happened.

A four-legged beast dropped from above and landed in front of them. The thing reminded Sam of an ox, but it had no horns and wore armor everywhere but on it's back.

And it was charging at them.

"Watch out!" Greg yelled as we swung his sword at it. He made contact, but did no damage as it slammed into Greg and knocked him back before he recovered. It charged at Greg again when Sam shot an arrow at it's exposed back. It let out a roar of pain as it turned and charged Sam.

"It's back," yelled Sam, "Hit it's back!" She ran and rolled out of the way of the beast as Greg swung struck it's back. Sam waited as it charged her again and jumped up on it's back before thrusting a sword into it's back. The beast let out a final roar and collapsed. Sam stood and looked at Greg. "Whew...Well I'm glad that's-" Before she finished, a shadowy tendril shot out of the dead beast and hit her. She felt cold as she fell to her knees, collapsed, and passed out.

-------------------

Sam opened her eyes slowly to see herself back in the temple they were in before. She was laid on the altar like bed. She tried to move at all but to no avail as Greg came at her side. "Sam, are you alright?" He asked.

She looked at Greg, and Greg saw something new in her eyes. Fear. "G-Greg..." Sam sputtered through a dry mouth. "Wh-what...happened....?"

"You fainted after killing it, so I carried you back." Greg replied.

Sam flushed lightly, but her face remained pale. "I-I feel...c-cold..." Sam stuttered, shivering.

Greg then locked her hand with his and brushed a few stray strands of hair from her face. "It's alright...You're safe now."

Sam sat up slowly and tried to stand, but fell against Greg as she flushed again. "Th-thanks..." Sam shivered as Greg sat her down and covered her with a blanket.

"Don't mention it." He said as Sam soon fell back to sleep.

When she awoke...
154111111111111111111111111111.title: The Beast

155.content:
Greg and Jacob story reboot.

Click "More" for more story options.
155.title: More Slots

1551.content:
Sometimes, there is more than one variation of a story. This is one such tale. Like having the same person draw by different painters.

*****Greg*****

Age: 18
Appearance: 5'9 feet tall, and 140 lbs. Short red hair and blue eyes. Rather average build. Wears the dread fighter outfit with dark blue armor instead of red.
Personality: Shy, but friendly and helpful.
Origin: In a village named Kirada in the Outrealms. Kirada is a quaint little town surrounded by plains and hills, with the ocean some distance away. Large mountains loom in the distance.
Bio: A wanderder who is traveling through the Outrealms. He left his family behind after deciding that he felt a disturbance. He is well traveled and strong, possessing many powerful items he has found. However, there are many Outrealms that he has yet to see for himself. He travels on his own, despite the insistance of his sister. At the beginning of this story, Greg finds himself in a major conflict.
Race: Human
Class: Dread Fighter (Level 30)
Uses: Swords (Level A), Axes (Level C), and Tomes (Level A)
Asset and Weakness: Speed and Luck
Equipment: Zenith (forged brave sword), Mjolnir, Book of Naga, and an Elixir.
Skills: Armsthrift, Sol, Limit Breaker, Ignis, and Aggressor

*****End******

And now, the story is retold.
1551.title: Story #2

15511.content:
If there was some thing that often ticked off Greg, it was being in the middle of a war zone.

"Whoa! Watch yourself! Keep your wits about you!" commanded Greg as he ran around, doding fire spells that rained down from the heavens.

This was the realm of Bryyo, a land that was enbroiled in a bloody war. Greg had no idea how the war began, as it likely started long before he came around. The scene was dark and gritty, as soldiers of all kinds clashed with heavily armored knights and other such cavalry. There were plenty of mages around, skilled ones too, as meteor spells were raining down like there was no tomorrow.

"Ugh." grunted Greg as he took cover behind a hill. "This is what I get for getting involved in other world's problems." he grumbled.

He was searching through the Outrealms because he believed that something big was coming, and he needed to search out and find it. The last thing he was looking for was to stumble into a war. He wasn't stupid, and a pretty capable tactitian, but he didn't like getting involved in such matters.

Another near miss with a spell broke Greg out of his mental state, causing him to stay on the move. He had powerful weapons on him, a result of his travels, and his Armsthrift skill allowed him to keep using them infinitely. Good thing too, because his side was clearly outnumbered. He hadn't even asked to get involved. They pretty much picked him up and dragged him along. Long story short, it was a pain in the ass.

"Die!" roared a paladin who was coming over the hill towards Greg. However, the dread fighter was hardly worried, as he clutched a yellow tome in his hands, powerful lightning crackling through his fingers.

"Mjolnir!" came Greg's reply as a thunderous bolt of lightning like no other struck the paladin dead, clearly no match.

"Gods, this will go on forever at this rate. I honestly have no obligation to this world anyway." sighed Greg. That being said, despite his complaining, he never wanted to leave people suffering, despite his rule of not wanting to get involved in dramatic affairs. Greg helped a male soldier to his feet, one that was bleeding on his side.

"Wait here for a healer. You can't fight like this." said Greg, getting the soldier to a safe spot. After dropping him there, Greg ran back out, bringing out his forged brave sword Zenith. Zenith looked like a normal brave sword, but it was a bit slimmer, and it was mostly colored red. With the blade, Greg was too swift for anyone. As he cut them down and got a brief respite, he looked out over the land. He hadn't seen much so far, other than this one battlefield. He hadn't even got to visit any of this realm's villages or cities.

"Too bad. Would have been quite a sight before it was ruined." he commented.
15511.title: A rough time of it

155111.content:
Greg was ready to attack them when he heard a bloodcurdling scream from behind him. He turned around to see a large lance, the Legendary Gae Bolg, get ripped out of the healer's flesh. Standing above him on a massive black, demonic-looking horse was a man in black and red armor. Greg remembered hearing stories of a man named Walhart the Conqueror, but after seeing this man, he already seemed tougher. Greg held Zenith, angered. "Why's you kill him?! He was unarmed!" Greg yelled at the figure.

The figure merely turned and faced him before saying, "Exactly. Therefore, he was useless. Those on the field of battle who are wounded or cannot fight are useless. They must be dispatched of." The figure said plainly, with some delight of his recent kill in his voice.

Greg rushed toward him, Zenith raised. "I'm gonna kill you, you soulless bastard!" Greg yelled as he swing Zenith. The figure held the lance up as he blocked each attack with ease as his horse jumped away.

"Fall to the wayside!" The figure screamed as it charged at Greg.

Greg planned his attack and how he was holding his lance. He knew he could counter it.

That was until the arrow pierced his back.

Greg felt the sharp pain shoot into his back as he lost his form. Just as he did, he received a sharp slash across the chest from the Gae Bolg. He flew across the field and landed a distance away. That's when he heard his back shatter. He couldn't move, his body crippled. He heard the hooves of the man's horse galloping closer. Greg readied for death when...it jumped over him. The man seemed preoccupied with the larger battle below. Greg wanted to help, but he was too busy fainting.

-----------

Greg awoke, laying in the same place as before but with more bodies piled around him. He still couldn't move with his broken spine. He laid as smoke and death filled his nostrils. He thought that this would be it. He would die from this wound. Then he noticed the sun glistening something by his hand on the ground. With what strength he had, he grabbed it and saw it was a...
155111.title: Greg continues the fight

choices: ...in a camp set up by the man.
1551111.content:
Name: Jacob
Class: Tactician, Level 18.
Appearance: Short Black/Brown hair. Medium build. Standard Tactician robes.
Weapons: Killing Edge, Mjolnir, Silver Sword, Valflame.
Weapons stat: Swords = B, Tomes = A.
Gender: Male
Origin: A small Outrealm village.
Age: 16 (almost 17)
Skills: Pass, Acrobat, Limit Breaker, Armsthrift, Zeal.
Personality: He can be curious at some moments and others be quite ruthless. He tries to adapt to situations as best as he can. He scolds himself at times for being too trustworthy. Tries to make friends when he can, but knows when someone's his enemy.
Bio: Jacob once traveled through Outrealms exploring when he was set upon by a few odd Einherjar. They fought but ended up overwhelming him. They then dragged Jacob through the Outrealms until they reached a temple ruin. Jacob was laid on an altar of sorts as the Einherjar suddenly sealed Jacob into an Einherjar Card. They then threw it back through the Outrealms, hoping it would be lost forever. Jacob had no memory of a past family, not knowing if they were alive or dead. From being left in the card, Jacob would have the same glow Einherjar usually have. Jacob has been trapped inside since...

----------

Greg read the card until he saw the card read "Jacob". It showed a Tactician teen reading a time with focus. Greg, out of options, summoned him. After a moment with bright light, Jacob laid in front of Greg before slowly picking himself up. "Wha-? Where am I? What's-?" He stopped to see Greg's bloody body and his weak stare. Jacob quickly knelt next to him, and slowly picked him up. "Stay with me!"

Greg was out a few moments later...

When he awoke, he was bandaged and laid...
1551111.title: ...(Another character)

15511111.content:
Greg had no idea how much time had passed between the end of the battle and now. All he knew was that he couldn't get up at all. Heck, even moving one limb was a challenge. He remembered something in his hand, something small. He couldn't tell what it was, but he knew that the sun glistened off of it before he passed out. Anyway, Greg's eyes slowly fluttered open as he heard the cracking of a fire nearby. Opening his eyes further, he could see that it was nighttime now, and he could vaguely see someone near the fire, emitting a blue glow.

"What the hell?" muttered Greg to himself at the strange man. The man obviously heard him though, as he almost immediately turned around and smiled. Greg could make out features of the man. He looked about the same age, with dark hair on his head.

"Oh good, you're awake. I was beginning to worry that you might never wake up." said the man as he came over with a bowl he had. Greg could tell that he was leaning against a rock or something, and he was able to raise his left hand high enough to take the bowl.

"T-Thanks." Greg stuttered out, having a little difficulty with talking.

"It's no problem. Got to admit that that I was surprised to see such a battlefield after finally getting out of that hellhole." muttered the man.

"What hellhole?" asked Greg.

"The card you had. Purely by luck, the card found its way towards you, and you put just enough power into it to activate it." said the man. Greg squinted his eyes at the man.

"Card....Wait, that card I had.....It was an Einherjar card.....I'm sure of it." Greg said between pauses. He then looked at the man again. "Are you an Einherjar?"

"Heh heh, sort of." said the man, laughing as if it was no big deal. "Got into a little too much trouble. But I'm obviously not a real Einherjar since I can actually remember being in the card. Thanks for that by the way." said the man, sitting down.

"Ugh....no problem." said Greg, feeling pain throughout his body. He was bandaged up a bit, but it did little to help the torn ligaments and his broken back. Greg then turned his attention to the man again. "So....who the hell are you anyway?" he asked.

"It's Jacob." he replied curtly.

"Greg." said Greg.

"Pleasure." replied Jacob. Gathering enough strength, Greg turned his head to the right, looking over the now desolate battlefield.

"How did the battle go?" asked Greg.

"No idea. It's been like this since you summoned me. I don't know what happened while I was in the card." said Jacob. Greg sighed, wondering if anyone was able to survive the bloodshed. He turned to Jacob again.

"So....I see you're a tactician. You apparently.....don't have any weapons." said Greg after catching his breath a bit.

"Yeah, kind of came without them." said Jacob.

"You should fix that.....and get your "condition" checked while you're at it." chuckled Greg, which only brought more pain to his wrecked torso.

"Very funny, although I can't say I disagree." said Jacob. "Anyway, I wouldn't be surprised if any enemy units come back. However, you can't really move at all in your condition. Tell you what, I'm going to take a short walk over to the nearby village and get some supplies and maybe a doctor if I can. Elixirs and vulneraries ain't going to fix you up at all."

"Sounds fine.....just hurry." said Greg, breathing had a bit.

With that, Jacob ran off, heading to the nearby town. It would probably take him about 10 minutes at least to make it while running, so Greg wasn't going anywhere for quite a while. Greg felt like hitting something. Sitting still wasn't a strongsuit for him.

"Damn it." he sighed and leaned back. "I could use a miracle right now. Things can't look any drearier."

He shouldn't have said that. As he did, he felt a raindrop. Then another. And then another. And soon enough, he was getting poured on in about a few minutes. Greg sighed again, resting his hand on the ground. He really wished for a miracle right now.

As he made that wish, a bright card-shaped light appeared underneath his right hand.
15511111.title: The "Einherjar" human

155111111.content:
*****Celica bio*****
Age: 16
Appearance: 5'0 feet tall, and 110 lbs. Long red hair and red eyes. Wears sage outfit from DLC, except her top covers more of her torso.
Personality: Caring and intelligent. Loves to help out people with her healing powers.
Origin: Princess of Zofia on the continent of Valentia.
Bio: A young maiden who once helped the heroic king Alm defeat the Dark God Duma. In time, she became the queen of the new nation of Valentia along with Alm. People often believed her to be the reincarnation of the earth goddess, Milla.
Race: Human
Class: Sage (Level 20)
Uses: Tomes (Level A), and Staves (Level B)
Equipment: Celica's Gale, Arcwind.
Skills: Rightful King, Tomefaire, Dual Support+, Limit Breaker, and Aegis.

*****End bio*****

Greg felt something beneath his right hand, and he slowly turned his head. A bright card-shaped light was appearing there, and Greg lightly tightened his hand around it. He couldn't see what was on the card at all. However, he knew that it felt warm, almost like a mini-sun. It felt good, compared to dreary conditions Greg had been fighting for the past few weeks or so. Given it's shape, he wondered if it was yet another Einherjar, except that he knew there wasn't one before. Was it answering his prayers? Greg wasn't often the type to believe in luck, but he certainly could use the help.

"Well, one way to find out." he said as he put a bit more power into the card, and the light began to burst, forming a wall of blue light. Greg watched in awe as the blue light shaped itself into a human form, looking like a young girl, according to Greg anyway. The light gave way to long shining red hair with fair skin. The being wore a red sage-like outfit, with some golden pieces of armor. The top of the outfit felt a little bit of her midriff exposed, but just a little. Greg gasped as the light died down more and the being took shape. The girl's eyes fluttered open, revealing red eyes that reminded Greg of a crystal ruby. It was gorgeous.

While the appearance was very different, Greg could still pin down who the girl was. She was Celica, known as the "Blessed Maiden" from the Valentian lore. The girl who helped form the kingdom in the first place. Of course, that wasn't the only thing on Greg's mind. The girl's beauty was....striking, even to someone like him who didn't know a thing about romance. That aside though, the girl soon noticed that it was raining.

"Rain.....where...am I?" she asked slowly, mostly out of confusion for where she was. However, Greg groaned a bit, and that caught her attention. Celica turned her eyes toward Greg and gasped upon seeing his injuries.

"Oh my gosh, are you alright?" she asked after running over to him. Ignoring Greg's red face, Celica took notice of his wounds and broken back, being an expert in this field. She nodded as she formed the conclusion in her head.

"All right, don't move. I'll patch you right up." she said, giving Greg a sweet and reassuring smile. Greg's face turned about as red as her hair. Celica closed her eyes, putting her hands on Greg's torso. A small light emitted from her palms, and Greg could feel the energy entering him, seemingly putting his bones and ligaments back into place. Of course, such a procedure wasn't painless. Greg grunted in discomfort as everything was shifting back into place.

"Don't worry. Your injuries are extensive, so I'll have to keep this up for a while before they're healed." said Celica, as cool and calm as a cucumber.

"Thank goodness she's looking at my wounds. My face must be burning red by now." said Greg, somewhat embarrassed by having such a girl near him. Back home, he barely had any girls talking to him. His little sister, Karen, was perhaps the only one who cared to talk to him.

After a minute, as she kept healing, Celica gasped a bit, yet not losing her concentration.

"Forgive me, I never introduced myself. My name is Celica, princess of Zofia. What is your name?" she said kindly.

"It's Greg." he replied softly.

"It's my pleasure, although I wished we met under different circumstances." said Celica.

"Oh, it's okay. This doesn't happen so often." mumbled Greg.

"I'm glad to hear that." Celica smiled at him. Celica's magic could quite some time, given the extent of Greg's injuries. In fact, it took so long, that Jacob was already walking back before she was done. While still out of sight, Jacob caught a view of the spectacle, seeing the maiden healing Greg.

"Well, I guess it's a good thing I couldn't find a good doctor. Would have been a waste." grinned Jacob.
155111111.title: The Blessed Maiden

1551111111.content:
Celica's hands soon faded as she finished healing him. Jacob smiled, glad of the help the Einherjar provided. While he was gone, he also restocked himself with weapons and found a tome on him, now leaving him equipped with a silver sword, killing edge, and the tome Valflame. Jacob walked over and bent on the other side of Greg across from Celica, who just noticed Jacob. "I can't thank you enough for helping my friend here. I'm Jacob."

"Celica." She replied with a smile, but still worried about Greg.

"This rain's not doing him any good. Come on," Jacob said. Jacob slid his hands under Greg's back as Greg clenched his teeth and winced a bit in pain. Although she healed him, the pain was still there for the most part. "Sorry. I'm being as careful as possible."

Jacob finally got to an area of trees near a mountainside and laid Greg under them, keeping them out of the rain. "Thanks..." Greg said back. Celica still saw he was weak and couldn't help feel bad.

"I'm sorry this was all I could do," Celica told Greg.

"You fixed me up. I'm better than before and I'm not gonna die at least, thanks Celica." Greg replied, smiling as best he could. Celica smiled back and laid by Greg. She curled next to him and laid a hand in his hair as she gently brushed it out of his face. Greg's face was red for a moment, surprised at her actions to make him feel better.

Jacob sat at the side and chuckled, when he fell. Greg watched as Celica jumped up to catch him, but he was gone as blue flames developed his body and he disappeared. They were both shocked at how he disappeared. "Where'd he go?!" Greg said at his friend's disappearance.

Celica was about to speak when she saw something on the ground. She picked it up and handed to Greg with a worried expression on her face. Greg grabbed it and saw it was Jacob's card. Greg looked it over for a moment. "Poor guy..." Greg out enough strength into the card to cause a bright flash as Jacob laid on the ground. Celica knelt over him and turned to Greg. "Let's get out of the rain."

Celica helped Jacob up and leaned him against a tree out of rain's reach as Greg, still weak an hurt, was able to move. He sat himself next to Jacob, who was coming to.

"Ughh...what...?" Jacob began before Celica silenced him.

"Shhh, shhh. I'm not sure what just happened, but I know you need rest. 'Kay?

Jacob nodded and rolled into a small patch of grass as Celica sat next to Greg. A few moments later they all fell asleep.

What happens next?
1551111111.title: Celica finishes healing

15511111112.content:
Greg soon felt the warm rays of the sun bursting through the trees that covered the campsite. Blinking a bit, he rubbed his eyes and looked around the campsite. He felt something warm to his left, so he looked to the left and saw Celica leaning against his shoulder, perfectly asleep. Greg smiled at the sight.

"Man, you wouldn't think she was a royal or something when you see her like this." said Greg, briefly ruffling her red hair. He nudged her a bit, trying to get her awake. He noticed that his arms and torso felt a lot better, if not a bit sore. However, it was more than enough for him to finally be able to walk.

"That girl really knows her healing powers huh?" Greg heard from his right. He looked over to see Jacob already awake, getting himself some breakfast. He looked like he had been awake for some time.

"You got up early." said Greg.

"Yeah, bit of a light sleeper last night. Not too much of a problem though." said Jacob. After he said that, Greg turned to Celica.

"It's pretty rare to find someone who can heal without a staff. To date, I thought that only Micaiah, the fabled Priestess of Dawn, could heal with a staff, and those required her own life force or something." explained Greg.

"Yeah, she truly is a wonder. I can see why what you're infatuated." smirked Jacob. Greg instantly went red.

"What?! What are you implying?!" Greg practically yelled, which ultimately roused Celica from her sleep. Her red eyes fluttered open as she yawned.

"Good morning Greg. Ah, your wounds seem to be all healed now." she smiled.

"Oh, uh, yeah." Greg stumbled a bit, making Jacob laugh. After Celica helped him up, Jacob got some breakfast for all of them. As they began to eat, Celica looked at Jacob.

"By the way Jacob, what happened to you yesterday? What was that card?" she asked. Jacob almost choked on his drink when she asked. Obviously, as he predicted, Celica didn't know anything about the Einherjar. She didn't even know that she was one herself.

"You could say it's a curse someone placed on me some time ago. It happens." said Jacob. Celica's face became sad at his words.

"That's awful. I'm sorry that I can't help though. My powers don't work on curses." she said solemnly. Jacob gave her a reassured look.

"Oh no, it's okay. I can deal with it." said Jacob. Celica cheered up a bit as she went back to her food.

"So what now? The battle here is long over, but I'm sure the war is still going on." said Greg.

"Do you want to keep fighting the war?" asked Jacob.

"Well, I honestly prefer not to get involved in other world's affairs like this, but I don't like leaving people behind to die." said Greg.

"That's reasonable. I haven't seen anymore fighting in this area. I wonder if they've moved to some other place." said Jacob.

"One thing is for sure though, I have to find that man again. The rider who gave me these wounds." grunted Greg. "He was no ordinary man. I have to figure out why."

Celica gave him a worried look. "That might not be wise. If he could give you those wounds so effortlessly, he might be beyond any of us."

"Perhaps, but I'm not giving up. I left my home because I felt something big was going to happen. Perhaps that man is part of it. I don't know, but I need to find out for sure." said Greg, not budging on the subject. Jacob smiled at him.

"Well, you're certainly driven. I don't think I have anywhere else to be right now." said Jacob. Celica had a worried look on her face, but Greg wasn't surprised. Celica was known as a princess who honestly despised fighting. Going head straight into a war was not something she desired.

"You don't have to come if you don't want to Celica." said Greg. Celica then looked him in the eyes.

"No, I would rather be with you. I don't want either of you to die, so I'm going to keep it that way." she said, a little more resolute.

"That's the spirit!" laughed Jacob as he rose from his sitting position. "Well, shall we get going? One way or another, we need to be on the move."

"Agreed." said Greg. All three of them packed up their gear, and they were all soon on the road, heading towards wherever the path took them.
15511111112.title: Ready to move out

155111111122.content:
The trio walked down the road, through the ruins of villages that met their demise. Celica looked at it gloomily. "How can there be so much violence here?" She said.

Greg walked next to her, "Don't worry," he said smiling warmly, hoping to cheer her up, "We'll return and put an end to this once we're ready!"

Celica looked back with a determined nod and smiled as they continued down the road. They soon reached the gate of swirling power, and stood before it. "Alright," Jacob said, "Let's see where we go." The three looked at each other and then entered.

They traveled through swirling light and colors when Jacob held a hand to his head. "Jacob," Greg asked, "Are you al-?" Just then Greg felt odd, and so did Celica as they all went unconscious.

---------

Greg awoke a little later, and sat up. He was normal and he saw Celica waking up a foot or two away. Greg stood and headed to her and helped her stand, then they realized Jacob was gone. They spent a few seconds looking around when they heard something by a tree. The two looked and saw Jacob bound to a tree with shackles and gagged.

"Jacob?! What the hell happened to you?!" Greg said shocked, running to his side along with Celica. Jacob shrugged and tried to pull free.
