When he pulled his back away, Greg saw a symbol behind Jacob's back drawn against a tree. "What's that?" Greg said pointing at it. Jacob strained to look but couldn't see it.

"Hmmm...it looks like a dark magic seal." Celica pointed out. That didn't make Jacob feel any better, as he strained at them more.

"Alright, give us a second," Greg said, when he heard the noise of crows. They turned and noticed a murder of crows flying above them in a close formation. They flew around until they suddenly disappeared and a boy with white hair and a plegian dark Mage outfit in front of them.

"What are you doing with my test subject?" The boy said.

Jacob had said something under the gag, but it couldn't be understood. "What do you mean test subject? This guy's our friend!" Greg said.

"What?" The boy replied, "You mean he's alive? But when I found him he was dead as a....well, dead thing. Can I at least test on him?" The boy asked pleadingly.

"No!" Greg and Celica said in unison.

"Awwww! It was gonna be a pretty explosion! Especially with a live subject, and with him having more blood in his body." Jacob was struggling more than ever trying to get out. "Alright. Give me a second." The white-haired boy took out a key and unshackled Jacob as he pulled the gag down.

"The hell's wrong with you, kid?!" Were the first words out of Jacob's mouth.

"Hey! Don't blame me for testing magic! And my name's Henry." Henry now said.

Greg and Celica helped Jacob out when they heard someone coming toward them.

Who was it?
155111111122.title: Coming across an Outrealm Gate

1551111111221.content:
"Daaaaaaaaad!" came the loud voice from whomever was approaching. As Greg saw the figure come into the view, it was clear that it was a young female, probably in her late teens. She appeared to be a mercenary, wearing a yellow-ish outfit with long red hair. Greg could see that the girl was quite good looking. Although, one part he couldn't get past was the scowl on her face.

"Yeeees, my dear daughter?" said Henry, his smiling face not missing a beat.

"Daughter?!" yelled the group in their minds. What the hell was this guy talking about? This girl looked almost older than he was. The girl didn't seem to think much of it.

"What the hell are you doing out here?! Mom's looking for you! Gawds!" yelled the girl. Greg nearly had to plug his ears at her verbal assault.

"Aw, don't be like that Severa. You know I'm always on time." said Henry.

"I don't want to hear it. Let's just get back to mother. Gods, why am I always having to look out for you? It should be the other way around." said Severa.

"Oh, I always stay out of trouble. But when I saw this guy bleeding, I just couldn't resist." said Henry.

"You'll be the one losing blood if you don't move it!" Severa snapped, clearly losing her temper.

"Mm, blood....." sighed Henry, as if the thought made him content.

"What....the....hell?" was all Greg could say. These two seemed to be as mismatched a duo as you could ever come up with. "Well, she's cute, but she's got quite the motor mouth."

Severa's face was beat red as she grabbed Henry's collar, almost dragging the poor guy away.

"Okay, bye bye!" yelled Henry, waving to them like a little kid.

"Okay, that was weird." said Jacob as Henry was dragged away.

"They were interesting characters." said Celica.

"Not in a good way." said Jacob. Then he turned to Greg. "So what now Greg? We've found a new realm and all."

"True. Perhaps we should explore a bit. I don't think we should return to Bryyo until we're fully ready. Might as well take in the sights as we do. I never got to see much in Bryyo." said Greg.

"Sounds like a good plan to me. Should we follow that girl?" suggested Celica.

"I don't think that's a good idea." said Jacob.

"Well Greg?" asked Celica.

Greg thought for a minute about what to do.
1551111111221.title: Severa

15511111112211.content:
"As much as it hurts to say this, I think we should follow them. They probably know a lot about this realm. Will you be okay Jacob?" Greg said to the two.

Jacob grunted, "As long as he doesn't tie me up again."

The three walked through the forest following them. It was pretty easy since the girl kept yelling at Henry, who's somehow her father. They soon followed them to the edge of the forest and saw that there was food laid out. Henry was sitting with the girl as a woman in silver Pegasus armor and red hair with a wing in it. They watched until they realized the woman saw them and began approaching. The thought of hiding crossed Jacob's mind when he decided not to.

He walked out in front of her as Greg and Celica soon followed. "I don't believe we met," the woman said.

"Because we haven't," Jacob replied plainly, "To be honest, we're not from here."

"You've never been to Ylisstol?" The woman replied.

Jacob had heard of it, but never did. "No. But I mean...we came through the Outrealm Gate."

A look of understanding crossed her face, "Oh. Well, what made you come here?" She asked.

"Well, he," Jacob said, pointing at Henry, "thought that it would be nice to use me as a test subject while I was out."

The woman sighed and turned back toward them, "Henry! What'd I say about random experiments?"

"Sorry!" Henry yelled back, "But it was gonna be great!"

The woman sighed and turned toward Jacob, "Sorry about my husband. My name's Cordelia."

"Jacob. This is Greg, and that's Celica." Jacob said, Cordelia unphased by her being Einherjar.

"Well, why don't you join us?" Cordelia offered.

Jacob exchanged a glance with Greg and Celica, and they decided. "Sure."

Cordelia smiled, "It's nice to meet you. Come on." She led them to the food as others showed up and joined them.

What happens next?
15511111112211.title: Follow Severa

155111111122111.content:
"So where did you come from really?" asked Cordelia.

"I came from a village named Kirada in the Outrealms. Jacob has no idea where he's from." said Greg, to which Jacob gave him a little glare. "Personally, I'm surprised that you weren't surprised at all by me saying that."

"We've had our own runs through the Outrealms. Not the most enjoyable times. We kept fighting Risen who kept stealing stuff." said Cordelia. Celica gasped a bit.

"That's horrible. Wait, what's a Risen?" asked Celica. Most of them gave her an odd stare. Greg realized that Celica would naturally know nothing about the Risen, having come from the Einherjar card and all.

"Sorry, not many Risen have come around where she lived. They're reanimated soldiers that destroy anything in their path. Although I see our friends here have said that they often have other interests." said Greg.

"Nya ha ha, that's for sure. Too bad they never noticed the curse I put on them. Oh, it would have been so good...." Henry trailed off, making Severa sigh.

"Seriously dad, couldn't you act normal for once?" she asked.

"But I am normal." replied Henry, his smile not fading.

"That's what concerns me." thought Greg. This "family" didn't seem to be that functional. Henry and Cordelia seemed to really like each other, but Severa was 100% different from both of them. Suddenly, Cordelia turned to Celica.

"Oh, you never told me where you're from." she said.

"I'm from Zofia on Valentia." said Celica, smiling as she said it. Cordelia's eyes widened in confusion.

"Valentia? But that's...." she started to say before Greg interrupted.

"It's a different one. Not the one you know." Greg said quickly, his face going red. Most of them looked at him confused, but seemed to accept his answer. Jacob then spoke up.

"So, I heard Severa say something about Henry being her dad? What's up with that? She almost looks older than both of you." said Jacob.

"I guess you wouldn't know since you're not from here. We recently had....well, some problems, and Severa and some other kids from the future came back because their world was destroyed." said Cordelia. Severa turned her head away, not in the mood to remember something like that.

"Well, I guess that explains it. Although last I checked, time travel really screws things up sometimes." said Jacob.

"Maybe, but I never would have met my cute little daughter without it." laughed Henry as he one-armed Severa.

"H-Hey, get your hands off me!" she struggled against him.

"Your daughter is quite the firebrand." said Greg. Cordelia smiled at his remark.

"She certainly independent. She had a rough time as you might imagine." said Cordelia.

"Fair enough." said Greg. By this time, Severa had gotten out of Henry's grip. Still mad, she got up and walked away, stomping her feet as she did.

"Just give her time to cool off." said Cordelia, as if she was used to it.

"Sure." said Greg, face still a bit red from earlier. Unfortunately, Henry misinterpreted his face.

"You know Greg, she is single. Nya ha ha!" laughed the dark mage. Greg's face then went as red as Severa's hair.

"W-What?! T-That's not....!" Greg protested.

Everyone laughed at that, except for Severa, who had just came back and heard her dad's remark, her face as red as Greg's.

"Why do the gods hate me?" Greg mumbled.
155111111122111.title: They speak with the family

1551111111221112.content:
Jacob did wait around as the family and them chatted with one another. Jacob wasn't in the mood though for eating with a man who wanted to see the blood blow from his body, so he just stood and listened. Doing that, he heard something back in the direction of the forest. Jacob turned back to the group to see then talking quite a bit. It seems Henry made another embarrassing comment, starting another conversation. Jacob didn't want to worry any of them, so he went on his own.

He walked through the forest when he reached a small opening from where he heard the noise. He looked around and saw nothing. When he turned to leave, from out of nowhere he was surrounded by...rose petals?

Jacob watched in confusion as rose petals flew around him from nowhere. He then heard a voice of a girl laughing, then he heard a Pegasus neigh, then he was hit by something.

Jacob flew backwards and hit the ground as something landed on him. His vision was somewhat blurry, but he saw that a girl with blue hair was now sitting above him holding her head. "Ugh! What just-...?" She stopped when she saw Jacob. "Ohmigosh! Are you okay?" She said, still sitting on top of him. Jacob replied simply with a thumbs up and weak stare. Just then he heard something to the right and saw two people. A man in royal-like armor and another Pegasus rider with grey hair.

"Cynthia? Are you alright?" The man said when they both saw Jacob.

The Pegasus rider crossed her arms smiling, "I didn't know you had a boyfriend Cynthia."

If Jacob wasn't being sat on, he would've pushed away. But luckily the girl, Cynthia, jumped up and faced them, "Mom! He's not my boyfriend! I was practicing entrances and my Pegasus knocked me off and I hit him."

The man stood above Jacob as the other woman joined him, "There are better places to sleep than on the ground you know? Come on," the man reached a hand out as Jacob took and stood.

"Thanks. My name's Jacob, by the way." Jacob replied.

"My name's Chrom, Captain of the Ylissean Guard. This is my wife Sumia and that's out daughter, Cynthia." The man explained.

Jacob recognized the name and knew it seemed important, "Sorry, I'm...we're not from this realm."

"Excuse me, but who's 'we'?" Sumia asked.

"Me and my friends met another Pegasus Knight named Cordelia and her family, and-"

"Cordelia?" Chrom said, "We're just going to see her. Come on."

Jacob went along as Cynthia helped him along a little bit. "I'm so sorry! I honestly didn't mean to!"

Jacob chuckled dryly, "It's alright, I'm okay."

Sumia turned and looked at them, "You sure you aren't boyfriend and girlfriend?"

Both Jacob and Cynthia went red in their faces, "Mom!" Cynthia yelled back as she and Chrom laughed. After a few moments the arrived at Cordelia's picnic with others already joining.

What happens next?
1551111111221112.title: Anyway.....

15511111112211121.content:
"Well, that was a great time." said Greg.

"Yes, I've never met such interesting people." agreed Celica.

"They were certainly unique. I'll give them that much." said Jacob, not quite as enthusiastic as his friends, as he still remembered his run-in with Cynthia. She didn't talk much to him after the incident, probably out of embarrassment. Greg noticed that Severa didn't talk much to him either, probably out of the same thing.

"Well, now what?" asked Jacob.

"We should decide whether or not to keep on moving or perhaps stick around a while. To be honest, I didn't mind these people that much. Hanging around them could be fun." said Greg.

"I guess, but we should probably keep on going. Who knows if whatever we faced in Bryyo will chase us here." reminded Jacob.

"I guess you've got a point." sighed Greg. Looking out over the hill, Greg could spot an Outrealm Gate. They needed to make a decision now on how to proceed.

"What do you think Celica?" offered Greg, since no one had asked her yet.

Celica closed her eyes in thought for a minute.
15511111112211121.title: Later on...

155111111122111211.content:
"If that thing from Bryyo is chasing us, I don't want it here. I say we leave." Celica said determined.

Greg nodded approvingly, "Alright then. Let's go." The trio then set off to the Outrealm gate as they pushed themselves through it's colorful barrier and into a new realm.

They were only walking through a few seconds when Jacob felt odd and began to keel over, "G-great...not this..again..." Jacob then collapsed, Celica and Greg following a few seconds later.

----------

Greg awoke and knew something was wrong. He looked at himself as he appeared to be in some kind of blue cloak and seemed shorter than before. He looked over and saw Celica, in a red dress laying there, when he noticed her ears were pointy. He walked over and shook her. She awoke with a start as Greg explained what happened. "I think we became Manaketes here," Greg explained that Manaketes were powerful dragons. Celica stood as Greg noticed a few more of his feature as his limbs were skinnier, and his ears pointier.

As he did this, he heard Celica start giggling. He turned to see what she was looking at and stifled a laugh.

-----

Jacob's eyes opened slowly. His body felt...wrong, in almost every aspect. Feel, shape, senses, all of it. Jacob stood up on all four feet before looking at Greg and Ce-.

Four feet?!

Jacob turned his head toward his body and saw he was a dark brown wolf with the Tactician robes draped over his back like a coat. Jacob looked at his form and growled, obviously angry at the sudden change. Then he realized that Greg and Celica were awake a few feet away and watching him. His face went red, even as a wolf as he looked embarrassed.

Celica walked over and petted Jacob on the head, "Poor thing," Celica said, "First you have that card curse, and then that Mage captures you, and now you're a Laguz." Celica ran her hand over his head and smiled.

Jackb growled back lowly but finally worked a grin up. Jacob then saw a pouch hanging from their waists. He poked one with his nose. "Oh. What are these?" Celica inquired as her and Greg opened then and pulled out small stones.

"Uh, Celica?" Greg began before each was engulfed in light and in there places was Greg as a blue dragon, Celica a pink one. They looked down at Jacob awestruck. They soon turned back and looked at each other. Jacob seems to have trouble switching forms as he's stuck like that. Celica walked back over and knelt next to him. "This realm seems...to weird to me," Greg said. "If we have to stay here fine. But I don't think it'll bode well for me or Jacob."

Jacob nodded. "What do you wanna do Celica?" Greg asked again.

Celica decides to...
155111111122111211.title: Leave through the Gate

1551111111221112111.content:
"If that thing from Bryyo is still chasing us, then we need to stay here and lure it away," Celica said.

Greg walked over and stood next to them, "Alright, we'll stay for awhile. You okay Jacob?" Jacob let out a low growl but then nodded. "Good. Let's find a town to settle around."

The three soon found a nearby road and walked it. Greg and Celica seemed to already be handling their forms well, Jacob on the other hand, not so much. He felt awkward walking on all fours, even though it wasn't uncomfortable. Jacob tried to keep the coat on him as he walked which was only slightly difficult.

Finally they reached the town and saw many of the people had animal features. Ears, claws, tails even, it was weird for the trio to see this. Houses were made and looked similar to modern ones, with the exception of a few shacks. Then they came across a cart selling stones, food, and etc. Greg walked over and grabbed two Dragonstones for him and Celica. He turned to see Celica with a piece of meat.

"What are you doing with that?" Greg asked curiously.

Celica bent down and held it in front of Jacob. By instinct, he tore into it and devour it. After finishing he looked back at them, embarrassed. Celica laughed and Greg smiled as he petted him twice and looked around a bit more.

What happens next?
1551111111221112111.title: ...stay here.

15511111112211121111.content:
It soon began raining suddenly as it got darker out. Greg and Celica pulled up their hoods on their cloaks, then Greg turned and saw Jacob just getting wet. Greg smiled and walked over and pulled the hood on his tactician coat on his back over his head. Jacob nodded thankfully and barked quietly as the three entered a nearby inn. The girl at the counter had cat ears and a tiger tail. Greg approached the counter and got a room with two beds. As they walked away, the bartender said, "That's a cute wolf you got there. Interesting that you dressed him up though."

Jacob let out a barely audible growl and just kept walking as Celica held a giggle in. The room had two beds and not much else besides a nightstand in between them. Greg took one and Celica the other. As they were getting ready, Greg realized Jacob had nowhere to sleep and was still drenched. Greg smiled, "Hey Jacob, come on." He walked over and hung Jacob's coat up as he walked Jacob up onto the bed as he laid on it. Greg finally got on too and petted him before Jacob moved to the foot of the bed. The three fell asleep quietly.

-----------

Greg had a recurring dream of the rider who took him down at Bryyo. Only this time, it attacked his family and village back at Kirada. As soon as he would reach his sister, the man's lance would of already beat him to it.

-----------

Greg woke up in a cold sweat. He opened his eyes and above him was Jacob looking down at him, whimpering for a second or two, worried. Greg smiled and placed a hand on Jacob's head. "Oh, sorry I had to wake you. I'm fine, really." He petted him as Jacob just sat there and let him. Greg looked out the window to see it was early morning. "What do you say about leaving now?" Jacob nodded as Greg got up and packed a few of their belongings. Jacob jumped on Celica's bed and walked next to her face and licked her. Celica woke up and looked at Jacob, who's face was red with shock at what he just did. Celica laughed and hugged him as she got up and packed up.

The three left and went down the next road until they found the next gate. "Alright Greg, ready to leave?" Celica asked.

What happens next?
15511111112211121111.title: Enter an inn

155111111122111211111.content:
"Yeah, I think we should leave. This realm isn't bad, but it's kind of weird for me." said Greg.

"Well, there could be many of those." said Celica. They seemed to get a nod from Jacob on that.

"Alright, let's go then." said Greg.

The trio packed up anything they had and went downstairs. They waved a brief good bye to the lady at the desk and walked out on to the street after grabbing a little bit to eat.

"Well, at least the food is pretty good." said Greg, which also got a nod from Jacob.

"Yeah, although being surrounded by all these beast-people gets a little unnerving after a while." said Celica. They got a little whine from Jacob, which seemed to say that he agreed. Anyway, after getting their little bit to eat, the trio walked their way out of the town, heading out on the road. They needed to find another Outrealm Gate to escape to.

"So what kind of realm do you think we should go to next?" asked Greg.

"Hasn't it been kind of random?" asked Celica.

"Yeah. I just figured I'd ask where you'd like to go." smiled Greg.

"Oh, I see. Well, I'd really like to visit Valentia sometime. I'd like to introduce you to everyone back home." smiled Celica.

Hearing her say that brought a pang to Greg's heart. Celica, being an Einherjar, believed that she was the real Celica, when in reality she was a mere reflection of the ancient queen. Greg felt sorry for her. He didn't want her to learn that she was really just a phantom. She believed that she was real, and Greg didn't want to take that away from her. But at the same time, he figured that she might figure it out sometime. He barely managed to escape explaining back when they stumbled upon Ylisse.

Anyway, before Greg could think further, they saw the familiar swirling energy of the Outrealm Gate.

"All right, say good bye to beast world." smiled Greg, as he and the other subtly passed into the energy of the gate.

When Greg came to inside the gate, he felt his old body back, complete with his old gear. He turned to Celica, and she was back to normal too. They both heard groaning behind them, and saw Jacob standing up, fully returned to normal.

"Nice to stand on two legs again." he mumbled.

"I imagine so." said Greg.

With that said, it was time for the trio to continue on.
155111111122111211111.title: They leave

1551111111221112111111.content:
They wandered through the realm until Jacob felt his body begin changing. He looked over toward Greg and Celica and saw that Celica was changing, but not Greg. "Gr-Greg, Celica....?" As soon as they turned and looked, Jacob fell unconscious along with Celica.

----------

Greg walked through the portal at Jacob's disappearance and saw a sword lying in the ground where Jacob was. Greg walked over it and grabbed it, and then he heard a voice. "Ugh...the hell happened...?" It was Jacob's voice.

"Jacob?" Greg said kinda freaked out. "Is that you?"

"Greg? Why do you seem so much bigger? Where am I? What happened?" Jacob asked.

"Don't panic, but you just became a sword."

"What?!" Jacob said in shock. In a reflection he saw he was a long silver sword with a purple gem in the hilt and a gold encrusting around it. His sheath was purple and black. "What do we do? Where's Celica?"

Greg looked around when he saw a wind tome on the ground. He opened it and...

"Greg! Greg! Help please! Please Greg!" He heard Celica yell, fear in her voice.

"Celica! Shh shh, it's gonna be okay, alright? Please trust me." Greg then explained what happened and that Jacob and Celica were able to talk to each other already.

"What now," Celica asked.

"I guess we can explore it. It looks like this realm has a bit of fighting to do with it." Greg said, making Celica uneasy.

Jacob groaned, "Fine. Just keep me around. And try to polish me off, I feel...weird." Jacob said as Greg slid him into the sheath on his hip now and tucked Celica under his arm.

"Heh heh alright. Just let me find a town and I'll try some maintenance on you two." Greg chuckled.

The man, the sword and tome moved down the road to a nearby town.

What happens next?
1551111111221112111111.title: New Realm #1

choices: Greg finds a weird seal in the forge
15511111112211121111111.content:
"This is kind of weird." muttered Greg as he kept walking towards a town that was nearby.

"I'll say. Why didn't you change?" asked Jacob.

"Well, I don't make the rules. Maybe it was because you were an Einherjar or something." suggested Greg.

"Well, what about me?" asked Celica. Greg didn't know what to say. He didn't want to reveal to her that she was in Einherjar too. He had to come up with some explanation for her.

"Maybe it also has something to do with where you're from or something. I don't know. I don't make the rules of this realm." said Greg. As he said this, he got a good look at Celica's tome form. It was a wind tome, but it seemed to have a design of her tiara on the front cover, and on the back had some designs from her sage outfit.

"I guess so." said Celica. With that said, Greg neared the nearby town. When he got to it, he was quite surprised. Everyone is town seemed to have some sort of weapon on them. Even the women had at least a dagger or something. It kind of creeped Greg out to some degree. Looking to his left, he saw a man sitting there nonchalantly.

"Excuse me. I'm not from around here, but could you tell me where I am?" Greg tried to ask politely.

"This is ForgeRealm. A place where everyone has at least something to protect them." said the man simply.

"Oh, well thanks." said Greg as he walked further in. "It's a good thing I'm a Dread Fighter, so you guys fit the look perfectly." said Greg.

"I guess so, but what now?" asked Jacob.

"Well, there seem to be a lot of forges, but not a lot of people next to them. I wonder if we have to use them ourselves." pondered Greg.

"Do you know how to?" asked Celica.

"Not really. Never used one before." said Greg.

"Well, we gotta do something." said Jacob.

"I know. Don't worry. I'll find something for you two." said Greg. After some more walking, he turned to a little nearby forge. It seemed to have everything one could want, including anything to forge a weapon.

"Wow, talk about well stocked, but how to do maintenance?" Greg pondered even more.

What now?
15511111112211121111111.title: The town

155111111122111211111112.content:
Greg looked around the forge for something he knew how to use when he found a seal next to it. "What is that?" Celica asked.

Greg picked it up and saw it was a gold seal with a hammer inside. "I'm not sure...Only one way to find out." Greg activated the seal and was engulfed in light. When it cleared, Greg was now in a green apron with tan work clothes underneath. Greg looked around the forge and now knew what everything was and how to use them. He unsheathed Jacob and held him out. "You ready?"

"I guess," Jacob said. Greg placed Jacob in the fire and took a nearby hammer and waited until Jacob was glowing hot, and placed him on an anvil.

"Is he alright," Celica asked.

"I think so. Right Jacob?"

"Yep," Jacob replied. Greg continued and ended by engraving the name "Jacob" into the blade. He held Jacob up as he glistened in the light. Greg placed him on a table.

"Sorry Jacob. I'll get back to you when you cool down and finish with Celica." With Celica, all he did was read through the tome and translate some of the text inside, making it preform more efficiently. He then placed her on his hip as he picked Jacob up and sheathed him again. Greg wiped the sweat from his head.

"Thanks," Jacob said. "I feel...better, I guess."

Greg nodded and walked out from the forge.

What happens next?
155111111122111211111112.title: Greg finds a weird seal in the forge

1551111111221112111111122.content:
As Greg walked out of the forge, straight ahead of him was a huge arena.

"Wow, that arena is pretty huge." said Greg.

"You're not going there are you?" asked Jacob. Greg looked down at Jacob.

"What do you mean?" asked Greg.

"What if you break us? That would be bad." said Jacob. Greg could see the reasoning in Jacob's words.

"That's true. However, you're made of silver, so you won't break easily. Besides, we could use the extra gold." said Greg.

"I trust Greg. I think we can do it." said Celica with some confidence.

"Thanks." said Greg with a smile.

"Sigh, fine." said Jacob, seemingly readying himself for any problems. With that decided, Greg walked towards the arena, walking into the main hall. He walked forward towards what he imagined to be a registration.

"Hello. I'd like to sign up." said Greg. The man nodded at him.

"Right right. Go on in and wait your turn." said the man. Before Greg could leave, the man tossed a seal at him.

"Here. I see you found one of our Blacksmith seals. Good for craft work, but not so much for combat. Use that to return to what you were before." said the man.

"Okay thanks." said Greg.

As he walked in, Greg touched the seal and activated its power. Soon enough, he felt the blacksmith garb subside and his dark blue Dread Fighter garb replaced it.

"Ah, in the good clothes again." smiled Greg.

"Just make sure you get us all through in one piece." reminded Jacob.

"I will. Don't worry. We will all win as a team." smiled Greg.

"Yeah!" cheered Celica, while Jacob groaned.

Soon enough, after Greg heard many different fights, he finally heard his name called.

"All right, to battle we go." said Greg, readying for his first fight in quite some time.
1551111111221112111111122.title: Combat?

15511111112211121111111221.content:
Greg passed under the large arc door and entered the dusty arena. There wasn't anything special, but it was quite large and pretty packed. He looked around and saw that at the other side was a man in Trickster uniforms. They looked at each other until the words, "Fight," were bellowed from a speaker. Greg unsheathed Jacob and held him out in front ready to strike.

The Trickster jumped and missed with his Iron Sword as Greg jumped out of the way. He took the opportunity to strike and did so again as the man went down. The crowd roared in approval. Greg looked at Jacob to see the blade glisten red.

"Good job Jacob." Chuckled Greg as he spun Jacob a bit.

"Yeah yeah. Just make sure I'm not stained with that guy's blood." Jacob replied.

He waited for a moment when a Falcon Knight emerged from the other side of the arena and flew around. This got the crowd excited as the fight began. The Falcon rider began tossing spears from a distance landing near Greg. Greg saw no way of using Jacob to hit her, so he sheathed him and pulled Celica out.

"You ready?" Greg asked his royal wind tome.

"Alright!" Celica said back determined.

Greg fired a large gust of wind up as the rider quickly lost control and her and the Pegasus crashed below. The crowd roared again as Greg smiled.

"Good work Celica," Jacob complimented.

"Not bad yourself," she replied.

What happens next?
15511111112211121111111221.title: Arena Battle

155111111122111211111112212.content:
The crowd cheered for Greg as he took down those opponents. He imagined that he was probably done now.

"Phew, well that was something." smiled Greg.

"Yeah, but I'm glad it's done. I don't want to deal with more blood." said Jacob.

"True. I guess you're lucky in a sense Celica. You didn't have to deal with blood." he smiled.

"Yes, that's a relief." agreed Celica.

With that done, Greg gave a last wave to the audience in the arena. As he did, he began walking out of the main area, heading back towards the waiting room. He finally sheathed Jacob and held on to Celica.

"Well, after that, I'm feeling kind of hungry. How about you guys?" Greg asked before stopping and rubbing the back of his head and sheepishly smiling. "Oh right, I forgot. You don't really have mouths right now."

"True, but I really do feel like some food though." said Jacob.

"Me too." said Celica.

"Hmm, perhaps it would be best then to leave the realm once I get our gold. We can head straight for the next Outrealm and get something to eat for you two." said Greg.

"Sounds like a plan." said Celica.

After that conversation, Greg went over to the registration, where he received a large sum of money for his fights. Accepting it happily, Greg walked out of the arena.

"Well, at least it's a beautiful day." said Greg. "So, do you guys want to leave now or stay around a little longer?" he asked.
155111111122111211111112212.title: Collect the gold

1551111111221112111111122122.content:
"This realm is actually pretty interesting now. I wouldn't mind saying for awhile," Celica replied.

Greg soon grabbed his sheath, "What about you Jacob?"

"I don't mind if we stay around a little longer," Jacob said, "Can you wash that guy's blood off me though?"

Greg chuckled, "Yeah."

Greg found a small pond on the outskirts of the town and knelt beside it. He unsheathed Jacob and placed him under the water, using his hand to wash away the blood. "Wow...I'm still trying to wrap my head around this. You two just became weapons."

"It is pretty odd," Celica added.

"It's weird that I'm talking to my weapons," Greg said.

Jacob then chimed in with, "Yeah? Well it's even weirder to BE the talking weapon."

Greg chuckled, "True, true."

He finished polishing Jacob off and drying him, then sheathing him. Greg walked back into town as the sun began going down. Greg walked to a nearby inn and rented a small room. The room had a bed, nightstand, and a chest. Greg held Jacob in his hands, "See you in the morning Jacob." He then laid him against the chest as he said goodnight to Celica and placed her on the nightstand before falling asleep.

----------

Greg awoke the next morning and sat up. He looked over at Jacob and grabbed him. "Jacob?" Greg asked.

"...Huh...oh Greg...morning." Jacob replied.

"You fell asleep?" Greg said, surprised a weapon could do that.

"Well...I guess." Jacob replied sheepishly.

Greg chuckled and woke Celica up as he stood and packed his gear. "You guys ready to go?" Greg asked, which they both agreed to.

Greg then moved down the road to the Outrealm Gate.

What happens next?
1551111111221112111111122122.title: Stay around a bit longer

15511111112211121111111221221.content:
Greg actually hummed on his way down the road, heading towards the Outrealm.

"Could you stop that humming?" asked Jacob impatiently.

"Kill joy." muttered Greg, but he ended up stopping anyway. Soon enough, after about 20 minutes down the road, Greg finally approached the Outrealm Gate. He looked back over the ForgeRealm once more.

"Honestly, it's not a bad place. I'd like to see it again, hopefully under better circumstances." he smiled.

"I agree." said Celica.

With that said, Greg turned and entered the swirling energy of the Outrealm Gate once more. Once he got inside, he felt the weapons in his hands shift and transform, turning into rays of light that reformed back in Jacob and Celica.

"Phew, back to being normal." said Jacob.

"Well, sort of." smiled Greg, looking at Jacob's light blue Einherjard aura.

"Very funny." said Jacob. With that said, the three friends were off again. "So what do you think the next realm will be like? We've seen so many interesting ones." he said.

"Guess we'll find out soon." said Greg as he pointed forward, seeing the familiar burst of light that indicated the next realm was upon them. Greg shielded his eyes as the light engulfed all three of them.

When Greg came to again, he noticed that he couldn't see that well.

"Where are we?" asked Greg. To his left, he found a nearby torch which he grabbed and waved around. They were in a dark place. Something that reminded Greg of a temple.

"I think this is the Temple of Eisa. I feel like I've heard of it before. Not the nicest of places." said Jacob.

Celica had a worried look on her face, and Greg looked almost as worried. "Well, not all Outrealms are nice. We might as well around." he said.

With that said, the group was on their way, searching for a way through the dark temple.
15511111112211121111111221221.title: Temple of Eisa

155111111122111212.content:
"You know, this place has some truly fascinating people. I'd like to stay around if that's alright." suggested Celica.

"I have no such objections." said Greg.

"I hope that thing from Bryyo just doesn't find us here." said Jacob, still feeling worried.

"I understand your concern Jacob. Although, we have seen no indication that whoever it was is following us. If we do find out it's following us, then we'll just have to lead it away from the area." said Greg.

"I wish I had your confidence in that, but I guess it can work." said Jacob.

"Great!" cheered Celica, actually glad to see sticking around this world for a bit longer.

"It's a good opportunity. I actually haven't been able to explore many worlds since I left Kiradia. This could be fun." smiled Greg. Jacob actually smiled at that too.

"That's true." said Jacob. Suddenly, a new voice surprised them.

"Hey, what'cha guys doing over here?" they heard the voice of Henry. The dark mage was now approaching them, and Jacob was slowly backing away, something that Henry noticed.

"Oh don't worry. I'm not going to string you up again." he said.

"For some reason, I have trouble believing that." said Jacob. Celica smiled at Jacob.

"Relax Jacob. I think Henry's a good person, even if he has a weird sense of humor." she said.

"Nya ha ha! You think I have a weird sense of humor? No one has a weirder sense of humor than Lucina. She can't see a joke coming even if it smacked her in the face!" Henry laughed.

"Who's Lucina?" asked Greg.

"Chrom's other daughter. She's Cynthia's older sister." explained Henry.

"Oh gods, I bet she's worse than her sister." groaned Jacob.

"You'd be surprised." laughed Henry again.

What's next?
155111111122111212.title: Stay around a while

1551111111221112122.content:
The three soon returned with Henry back to the picnic where Chrom and the others had already joined Cordelia. The three sat around a little longer, more listening to them talk then saying anything, trying to get as much info on this realm as possible. Jacob sat a little ways outside the group when he saw a sword laying against a nearby boulder. He looked at it's odd shape and recognized it to be Falchion. He looked at it's craftsmanship before a voice stopped him. "Excuse me?"

He turned and saw a woman with long blue hair and in a uniform strikingly similar to King Marth's. "Oh, sorry. I was just seeing what it was. Is it what I think it is?" Jacob inquired.

"If you mean Falchion, then yes. I got this from my father before..." She trailed off before Jacob saw her eyes get watery. Jacob think he pieced it together though.

"...Before your future was destroyed?" Jacob said. The woman pulled her head up.

"What? How did you-?" The woman began.

"I was told this by Cordelia and Captain Chrom, who I'm guessing is your father correct?"

She nodded and wiped one of her eyes. "Yes, he's my father."

"So then that rider who slammed into me must be your younger sister."

"Wait. That was you Cynthia told me about?" She began before she started laughing, "About being knocked off your feet by her. How was it?"

Jacob chuckled, "Hurt like hell. Thanks for your sympathy." Jacob added smiling.

The woman smiled back, "I'm Lucina."

"Jacob."

Lucina nodded, "You should head back before they wonder where you went."

"Why don't you come along? I'm sure you'd enjoy it and it looks you could use a break." Jacob said.

It took her a second, but she nodded and sheathed Falchion as they returned to the others.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122.title: They rejoin the others

15511111112211121221.content:
Meanwhile, while Jacob was off somewhere, Greg was finishing up a sandwich he got from the picnic and walking around himself. The scenery was quite nice, so he decided to take a look around.

"Nice to see a place not totally destroyed yet." he smiled.

He had seen very few worlds intact since leaving Kirada. It was something that often weighed heavily on him. He was surprised to see that this world has very little remaining scars from its own wars.

"Guess it says alot about Chrom's leadership." smiled Greg before he heard something to his right.

"I am Cynthia! Now taste my lance, evildoers!" He heard before a loud CRASH impacted him to his right. He turned and saw a pegasus getting itself off the ground a few yards away. Closer to him, he saw Cynthia, face down in a little crater, which Greg imagined she just made herself. Slowly, he saw the girl crawl her head out of the dirt, her face and hair almost completely covered.

"Oh pegasus poop, not again!" said Cynthia as she dusted the remaining dirt off her face. Greg gave her a sympathetic smile. This girl somehow reminded him of both his sister and Celica, except much more clumsy.

"Are you alright?" asked Greg as he knelled down and offered her a hand. Cynthia turned her head in his direction, giving him her classic smile and allowing him to help her up.

"Phew, thanks. I'm sorry if you heard that. I thought for sure I had it down that time." she pouted, getting some remaining dirt off of her.

"It's all right. What were you trying to do?" asked Greg as he got some dirt off her armor.

"Oh, it was awesome! I was doing this maneuver where I swoop down on Palla and just before we reach the ground, I land on my feet spectacularly. Except....I tripped on my harness and landed facefirst." she grumbled.

"Ouch." said Greg. "Sounds like this happens often. Why do you keep doing it?" he asked.

Cynthia just smiled at him. "Practice makes perfect. I'll try a thousand times if that's what it takes. A real hero never gives up!" she exclaimed.

Greg had to admit; the girl was highly amusing, yet her dedication was second to none. Greg found it kind of charming in a way. It must take a lot to get this girl down, if anything could get her down.

"Well, if you're done practicing, would you like to head back to the site with me? I'd say you could use a break." offered Greg.

"Sounds good to me." said Cynthia.
15511111112211121221.title: Greg's Experience

155111111122111212211.content:
A lot of time passed since both Jacob and Lucina and Greg and Cynthia returned, as the sun began heading down and either finished off what was left or rationed them. Cordelia, Henry, and Severa had already returned to camp as Chrom and the others were ready to go to. But before they left, Chrom turned back to the travelers, "Hey, you people have anywhere to stay?" Chrom yelled to Greg and the others.

They shook their heads, "Not really. We just arrived at the realm." Jacob replied.

"Well we'd be willing to have you join us for now." Chrom offered up.

Jacob and the others saw no reason to say no (beside the crazy dark Mage Henry). "Sure. Thank you."

"Alright. Now we can't spare anymore tents. But perhaps there may be an area nearby the camp you could-" Chrom began when he was interrupted.

"Um, father?" Lucina asked, "I actually wouldn't mind to share my tent with one of them." Chrom and Sumia both exchanged confused, somewhat worried glances.

"You sure about this Lucina? We just met them. We have no idea-" Chrom began again before Lucina stopped him.

"I know. But he seems...different. I feel as if he knows how we felt before. No future to return to or have." Lucina said.

Sumia and Chrom exchanged another look, before he sighed and finally relented, "Alright go ahead." After that, Cynthia offered the same, and, after more exchanged glances, was allowed to do the same.

-----------

Jacob walked through the camp with Lucina as they passed rows of tents and a few soldiers. "Thanks for lending me your tent," Jacob said. Lucina nodded back and entered. As Jacob was, he heard a man with gray hair and a bow say something to another with some chain thing on his neck. He ignored it and entered.

What happens next?
155111111122111212211.title: Back to the others

1551111111221112122111.content:
"By the way Cynthia," started Greg as he got situated into Cynthia's tent. "Why did you allow me to share your tent? I figured you would want some privacy."

"Oh, I wanted to thank you after digging me out of that hole. Besides, that's what heroes do, they help people." smiled Cynthia.

"You're really hooked on being a hero huh? Why is that?" asked Greg. Suddenly, Cynthia's demeanor took a 180, and her face got a little gloomy.

"I'd....rather not talk about it." said Cynthia as she finished taking off the rest of her armor, getting situated into her cot. Greg figured that it would be a good idea to talk more about it. If what they heard was true, then Cynthia no doubt carried some kind of scar from the ruined future she came from. As Greg got situated in himself, he wondered if he could help in some way. What he experienced in Bryyo probably couldn't compare to Cynthia's future, but he hoped he could help.

*****The next morning*****

Greg got himself a pretty good sleep, something he hadn't had often. However, as the morning began to come, he heard some weird things nearby.

"This soup is.....too cold....I can't swim in this."

In addition to that, Greg could swear he felt something heavy on his chest, and there was something wet there too. Yawning a bit, Greg's eyes fluttered open, and he saw something obstructing his view.

"What?" he asked as he tried to get a better view. As his vision cleared up, he could see a mop of blue hair covering his view. A quick look to his right saw that Cynthia was no longer in her cot, but rather, she was on top of him now.

"Oh man, how in the world did she get over here?" wondered Greg. Was this a subconscious thing? Or did she sleepwalk? Greg had no idea. However, a quick look down showed him that the slightly wet feeling was her drooling on him.

"Eww, gross." said Greg, trying to slowly move her head from his chest. This reminded him of his sister, who unfortunately had a similar problem. To be honest, he had the same problem too. Meanwhile, he kept hearing her mutter in her sleep.

"There you are....evil pasta.....I'm going to force feed you cheese....and make you like it.."

After getting her head off him, Greg slowly backed away. Apparently, Severa wasn't joking when she said that Cynthia was the "most nonsensical sleep-talker" in the army. However, she had a smile on her face, which Greg had to admit he liked much more than her gloomy one from before.

"A gloomy face really doesn't suit her." said Greg as he got himself together and began to get out of the tent, letting Cynthia sleep a bit longer.
1551111111221112122111.title: Greg and Cynthia

15511111112211121221111.content:
Jacob awoke in the middle of the night to a thud sound. He lifted his head and looked across the tent, he saw the flap closed, the bed, and a weapon rack, chest and nightstand. He was ready to go back to sleep when he realized what was wrong.

No Lucina.

Jacob looked back up and stood from a sleeping bag-like bed in the corner of the tent and looked around. He walked around the other end and saw Lucina laying on the ground. "Lucina?" Jacob whispered as he knelt beside her.

"N-no...Grima...I have to...stop him..." Lucina said in her sleep.

Jacob was familiar with the Grimleal and who they worshipped. He realized just how bad it must be for Lucina to live in such a future. Jacob then remembered what Henry said about her not getting a joke. No wonder, since she came from a era of death and destruction. Jacob smiled and lightly picked Lucina up and placed her on the bed again and covered her up. He turned when he felt a hand grab his. "J-Jacob?"

He turned back and saw Lucina eyes opened slightly, her face covered in pain. "Lucina? Are you okay? You fell out of bed."

"I'm sorry. I..." Her face turned gloomy and turned away. "I'm okay. Thank you."

Jacob sat on the bed next to her and placed a hand on her head gently, "I understand. I'm sorry do what you've been through. You keep fighting for everything and work yourself endlessly, but are still haunted by the future. I...I'm here. For you. I know what it's like to have everything stripped away and be forced to start anew." Jacob was ready to get up when Lucina grabbed his arm and pulled herself into his chest.

"Thank you, Jacob. Your words give me strength, but can you stay? Just until the morning?" Lucina asked.

Jacob nodded after some thought and laid against the bed with Lucina.

-----------

Jacob woke up again in the morning and saw Lucina had grabbed his arm in her sleep. Jacob smiled and brushed some of the hair from her face and got up and covered her in a blanket before leaving the tent and changing. He stood outside the tent and saw Greg as well. But was also curious as to why his chest looked a little wet....

What happens next?
15511111112211121221111.title: The new morning

155111111122111212211111.content:
"What's up with you?" laughed Jacob as he saw Greg trying to wipe down the front of his clothes.

"Cynthia somehow ended up on my chest and starting drooling on me." said Greg with some disgust.

"Sounds like she likes you." smiled Jacob.

"Maybe." sighed Greg.

Anyway, some time after that, the others got up. Greg saw Cynthia come out of her tent, yawning with a full head of bed hair. She undid her ponytails before going to bed, so her head was a mess, much to Severa's disgust.

"Ugh, do you ever comb that mop on your head?" she asked.

"That's what I have you for. You know I'm no good at that girly stuff." smiled Cynthia.

"You ARE a girl! Gods, you can be weird sometimes." sighed Severa. Despite her whining, Severa actually did what Cynthia asked and tried to help with Cynthia's hair, which didn't go over well because Cynthia's hair was full of knots.

"Good thing I comb daily." said Greg.

"You do?" asked Jacob.

"Of course. I care about how I look, thank you very much." said Greg as he took a bite of the breakfast that was prepared. As he ate, he saw Celica walk up to them.

"Good morning. Did you sleep well?" she asked.

"Well enough." said Greg as he kept eating.

For the most part, the morning was filled with the group eating their breakfast. Cynthia eventually made it once Severa got at least some of the knots out of her hair, and she still couldn't get all of them.

"This is part of the reason I don't let my hair get too long." said Cynthia to Greg.

"Duly noted." smiled Greg.
155111111122111212211111.title: That morning

1551111111221112122111111.content:
After breakfast, both Lucina and Cynthia had disappeared. Jacob walked by Greg, "Where'd those two run off?"

"I'm not sure," Greg replied, "But we should leave soon. I'll go get Celica."

The trio grabbed any supplies they had left and walked towards the forest when they heard someone. "Hold on!" Cynthia yelled...before tripping and falling into Greg. As Greg and them got up, Jacob saw Lucina, Chrom, Sumia, and Severa.

"Jacob," Lucina said, "I don't know how you or your friends would feel about this, but we want to join you." She said determined. Cynthia smiled and nodded after she stood again.

"Really?" Greg said surprised.

"There's no more danger and you travel the Outrealms stopping it," Chrom said, "So, after discussing it, we allowed them to go with you. But if you harm any of my daughters, I'll find you."

Jacob laughed, "I don't doubt it."

"Cynthia! You better keep your hair straight cause I'm not gonna help you." Severa yelled.

Cynthia laughed as Lucina walked over, "So?"

Jacob smiled, "Alright. You can come."

Lucina smiled back and Cynthia cheered. They waved and said their final goodbyes as they disappeared in the forest and toward the Outrealm Gate.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111.title: After some breakfast

15511111112211121221111111.content:
"Quite frankly, I'm amazed your father was that okay with it." said Jacob as the group was heading on its way to what Greg believed to be the next Outrealm.

"Well, I imagine he was more lenient since we finished the war here. If we were still fighting, I highly doubt it." said Lucina.

"Still kind of surprised since you are his daughters." spoke Greg next.

"We can take care of ourselves." smiled Cynthia before her face got a little more serious. "Besides, I think it might be time for me to take my leave soon anyway."

"Why's that?" asked Greg.

"Didn't you see Sumia? She's pregnant with me, or should I say, the me of this world." said Cynthia. "I don't want to take their time away from the younger Lucy or me." she said.

"That's quite noble of you." smiled Greg. "Although I think you should make an effort to see them from time to time. No doubt they will miss you as much as they would miss any of their kids."

"Thanks Greg." smiled Cynthia. Soon enough, her face did a 180, like it was before. "So I was thinking, when we get to the Outrealms, maybe we could have a grand entrance and...."

"There she goes again." sighed Lucina as Cynthia began to trail off about her newest idea for a grand entrance. Jacob sighed, Celica giggled, and Greg actually listened intently. For odd reasons even he couldn't figure out, he enjoyed hearing what Cynthia could think of next.

"Hey, there it is." said Jacob, pointing ahead of him to what was undoubtedly an Outrealm Gate.

"It's funny. I always figured the Outrealm Gates were in a single location, but I guess not." said Lucina.

"Yeah, they seem to be everywhere." said Greg. With that said, the group walked up towards the gate. Just before they were about to enter, Cynthia turned and faced Ylisse one more time.

"Good bye Ylisse! See you again soon!" she bellowed out. Greg laughed softly and grabbed her hand, escorting her through the gate along with the others. As always, the space in-between was as bright as usual as the group walked through it.

"What do you think is on the other side?" asked Jacob.

"Hopefully something good. I could use a break from fighting." said Greg.

"Amen." said Jacob. Everyone else universally agreed. Soon enough, a white light shone in front of them, nearly blinding them.

"Ugh, that light is bright...And it feels pretty hot too." said Greg as he shielded his eyes. Soon enough, Greg felt the light dim down, but he felt a near sweltering heat once he did.

"What the hell? Gods, is it hot." Greg spat out. He looked up to see a bright and sunny sky, unblocked by any clouds. However, looking ahead, he saw that Cynthia was looking very enthusiastic while Lucina has a surprised look.

"Yay, it's the Hotrealm!" cried Cynthia.

"Hotrealm?" asked Celica.

"We came here once some time ago. It's the best summer resort in all the Outrealms. We couldn't enjoy it last time though because it got overrun with Risen." explained Cynthia.

"Yes. I was practically drenched in sweat by the time it was over." sighed Lucina, obviously not remembering good times.

"Come on Lucy! There's no Risen this time. Let's have some fun Greg!" cried Cynthia as she grabbed Greg's hand.

"Well, I guess a resort is as good as any." he smiled.
15511111112211121221111111.title: Liking it Hot

155111111122111212211111111.content:
Greg was rushed over to a spring by Cynthia while Jacob and Lucina took their time and changed into more appropriate clothing. "Cynthia sure is energetic," Jacob noted as he changed and talked to Lucina. "You said you were here before?"

"Yes," Lucina said around a wall changing as well. "One of the many Anna's invited us as a thank you, but it was infested with Risen. But at least I got a yukata."

Jacob chuckled, "Really? I'd love to see with it."

"Well," Lucina began as she rounded the corner and was wearing a yukata patterned with the royal brand. She blushed just as red as Jacob did.

"Wow. You...look great." Jacob got out embarrassed.

Lucina laughed and grabbed his hand and walked with him to a spring. "Maybe I can enjoy this one." Lucina chuckled as they got into a spring, Cynthia and Greg being dressed up the same way.

"Isn't this great, Greg?" Cynthia said giddily.

"Well it's better than having to worry about a flying arrow every minute coming at us.

-----------

Jacob and Greg took a break a bit later and dried off a little. "That was relaxing," Jacob said, Greg nodding in agreement. Then they looked over and saw Anna in a bikini suddenly appear infront of them and approached them.

"You come with Lucina and Cynthia," she asked with her finger on her chin in a trademark pose.

Surprised, Greg replied, "Yeah. They're are friends."

Anna replied smiling, "Well we really enjoy them, and friends of them are friends of us. And with that," she then pulled out two seals with swimsuits in them, "We wanna give you a gift. Here."

Greg and Jacob took the seals and nodded thankfully, "Thank you." Jacob said.

Anna waved and walked off, with a devious smile on her face. "So what do these do?" Greg asked.

"Only one way to find out." Jacob said as they activated them and were covered in a bright light.

----------

Cynthia and Lucina continued relaxing when they heard a yell in the fog. "Risen?" Lucina said as she and Cynthia got out and ran over to where they heard it. What they found was completely different.

Jacob stood there with new large assets hanging off her body as her brown hair was now long and tied back into a braid. She had a red bikini on, not giving her "uncanny valleys" much privacy. She looked extremely embarrassed along with Greg with red hair tied up similarly to Severa's, with the same situation in a black bikini.

Lucina and Cynthia began laughing, "Freakin' Anna merchant," Greg said.

Cynthia ran forward, grabbed Greg's hand and jumped up and down, "Now we can have a lot of fun too! Come on sis!" Cynthia yelled, dragging Greg away, leaving Jacob and Lucina there.

"Well now look who's looking good," giggled Lucina as Jacob tried to cover herself.

"Um, can you help me?" Jacob said meekly.

"Of course, come on," she took her hand and walked her to another nearby spring.

What happens next?
155111111122111212211111111.title: The Hotrealm - Summer of Bonds

1551111111221112122111111111.content:
"Woohoo! I can finally enjoy the ocean!" cheered Cynthia as she ran towards the ocean. Greg ran up close to her, hardly being able to walk straight with her new body dimensions. The new weight on her chest didn't help either. To be honest, Greg was a bit unsure about entering the water now. Soon enough, he heard Cynthia approaching him, wearing a blue bikini that was similar to her regular clothing.

"Come on. There's nothing to be worried about. That's what I 'm here for." smiled Cynthia.

"I'm not sure about this." said Greg, bringing a hand up at hearing her new voice. "Man, that is the last time I take anything from a random Anna merchant." she said.

"To be honest, most of them are actually good people. She probably didn't mean any harm by it. She just wanted to have a little fun. Besides, it was a seal right? I'm sure you can change back right afterwards." smiled Cynthia.

"Who in the world creates seals just to make people into girls with bikinis?" asked Greg.

"Well, those Annas have created lots of weird things. Perhaps you just happened to end up as the test subject." said Cynthia.

"Great." sighed Greg. Then, Cynthia grabbed her arm again.

"Come on. While you're like this, you might as well enjoy it. This could be our only chance to really enjoy the beach you know?" reasoned Cynthia. Greg had to admit that she had a point, and she didn't want to see Cynthia sad or anything. Besides, it would be a new experience.

"All right, if you say so." smiled Greg.

"Woohoo! Let's go in!" smiled Cynthia as she dragged herself and Greg to the ocean. Greg immediately felt a nice chill as she felt the ocean water over her body. It felt weird, but it was a nice weird.

"Like it?" asked Cynthia, who rose her head out of the water.

"Yeah, it's fun." smiled Greg.

"Good." laughed Cynthia who immediately starting splashing Greg. To Greg's embarrassment, she let out a bit of a girly shriek at Cynthia's splashing, to which Cynthia started laughing. That began a nice splashing war between the two girls.

"Heh heh, that was fun." smiled Cynthia as she got a little tired, just floating on the water.

"Yeah it was. What to go underwater and see what we can find?" smiled Greg.

"Yeah, let's do it." smiled Cynthia, and both girls went underwater for a little deep sea watching.
1551111111221112122111111111.title: Just swimming around

15511111112211121221111111112.content:
Lucina walked with Jacob over to the Ocean's edge helping her new figure. "You okay," Lucina asked yet again worried.

"I'm okay...I guess," Jacob said with her new feminent voice. "I just need some help getting used to it."

Lucina smiled and removed her yukata until she was in a blue bikini as well. "What happened anyway?"

"Some Anna merchant gave these seals to us and..." Jacob trailed off.

Lucina smiled, "Well it does have some disadvantages, but you seem tough enough."

Jacob smiled back shyly, "Thanks Lucina."

Lucina grabbed her hand and walked her into the water slowly. It was chilly, but after the hot spring, it was exactly what she need. Jacob floated on her back as Lucina held her hand to help keep her afloat.

"Hey Lucina," Jacob asked.

"What is it?" Lucina asked.

Jacob then dove under still holding Lucina and pulled her down too. They were looking underwater and saw fish, underwater plants, and color swirl infront of them. Jacob turned and looked at Lucina, who was smiling back as her hair floated around her. Jacob then pulled them up and they resurfaced. "That was fun." Lucina said, Jacob nodding in agreement before diving again.

What happens next?
15511111112211121221111111112.title: Meanwhile.....

155111111122111212211111111121.content:
"I've got it!" called Cynthia as she batted the ball back over to Greg. Greg jumped right up and tossed it back.

"Coming back!" she laughed back. Cynthia tried to back it back, but unfortunately for her, she ended up tripping on the ground as the ball fell to the ground.

"I win!" cheered Greg, jumping up and down although she stopped when she felt her breasts jiggling a bit as she jumped, embarrassing her a bit. Cynthia got back up and rubbed the sand out of her face.

"One more time." she challenged.

"Fine with me." said Greg.

"What are you two doing?" asked Jacob as she and Lucina were walking back.

"Cynthia found this ball near this net. We've been tossing it back and forth over it? Want to play?" asked Greg.

"Sure. Sounds fun. What do you think?" asked Jacob to Lucina.

"Sounds like fun." she agreed. However, right then, Jacob looked around.

"Where's Celica?" she asked.

"She was enjoying the hot spring for some time. She'll catch up with us soon." said Greg.

With that settled, all of them started hitting the ball back and forth over the net. Greg and Cynthia were obviously one team, with Jacob and Lucina being the other. It was all really in good fun, especially since while Greg did a good job, Cynthia would occasionally fall on her face.

"Ouch! That's gonna bruise!" she said after perhaps her 4th trip since the game started.

"Oh, you look fine. Come on." said Greg as she helped her up.

All and all,the four of them had a great time playing around. Even Celica smiled at the group when she finally came out to see them.

"Sounds like everyone is enjoying themselves." she smiled at the group.
155111111122111212211111111121.title: Tossing a ball around

1551111111221112122111111111212.content:
After they finished playing ball, the moon arose and took the sun's place. They walked along the beach when they saw torch on the beach and towels laid out for each of them. Jacob walked forward and smiled, "Guess it's the closest thing to a bed."

They each laid down on them and looked up at the moon for awhile as the sand and water sparked.

"Well," Jacob chuckled, "Today was fun."

Each of them had a good laugh as they fell asleep, exhausted from that day of relaxation.

-------------

Jacob woke up wearily, still in her bikini as she looked around and saw Lucina on one side of her and Greg on the other. She woke them both up as they got up and smiled wearily as well. "We should get going."

Jacob got ready as the others did as well. As they left, they heard the merchant Anna yell, "See you some other time ladies!"

Jacob and Greg looked back somewhat frustrated, but shrugged it off. They approached the Outrealm Gate and stood before. "Everyone ready to go?" Greg asked.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212.title: That night

choices: Getting used to a new realm
15511111112211121221111111112121.content:
"Wait a sec! So what about our bodies?" asked Jacob. Lucina, Cynthia, and Celica had already changed back into their normal clothes and noticed that the "boys" still hadn't changed back yet.

"Oh, just go through the gate and you'll change back! Those seals only work in the Hotrealm." smiled Anna.

"Well, I guess that's assuring." said Greg, still a little weird to be going into the realm in a bikini even though she would be changing back soon enough.

"Well, let's get it over with." sighed Jacob. Greg agreed with her, and the group then stepped back into the Outrealm Gate.

Right as they entered, Greg felt something flow over his body. Immediately looking down, he saw this body was back to his normal Dread Fighter looking self. Looking to his left, Jacob was back to normal too.

"Guess she knew what she was talking about." said Greg.

"If we go back there sometime, we should ask to do those again." smiled Cynthia.

"And why is that?" asked Greg as they began walking further in.

"Cause it was playing with you like that." explained Cynthia.

"Oh, and playing with me as a guy isn't?" asked an exasperated Greg. Cynthia just giggled, which got Celica and Lucina giggling a bit as well.

"Well, let's just continue and get to another realm. I'd like to put some of that behind me." said Jacob.

With that, the group walked further into the gate, until they came across a familiar burst of light.

"Guess this is the next realm." said Lucina as she covered her eyes. The entire group closed their eyes as they awaited whatever realm they were going to next. As Greg kept his eyes closed, he suddenly heard lots of really loud noises.

"What the..." started Greg as he opened his eyes and rubbed them a bit. All he saw was a lot of buildings, with numerous things moving back and forth at an incredible pace.
15511111112211121221111111112121.title: New realm

155111111122111212211111111121211.content:
Jacob, like the rest if them, couldn't make sense of anything happening. Large pieces of metal passed by as high speeds, massive buildings laid about overhead. Jacob quickly led them off the street and into an alley. "What is this place?" Lucina asked in confusion and awe. While they stood nod watched everything. It looked as if all the buildings were part of a massive kingdom of somekind, each one being as tall as castles themselves, made out of metal. Jacob also noticed that clothes other people wore were dramatically different to theirs.

"I'm not sure," answered Jacob," But we should try and blend in." They agreed as they left the alley and quickly made their way down to a clothing store.

Upon entering, they looked around and saw blue jeans, different colored shirts, small clothes. "Well they certainly give you a lot of choices." Greg added. Jacob nodded as they all moved around the store and grabbed different clothes.

Jacob ditched the Tactician Robes for a grey t-shirt and blue jeans.

Greg grabbed a pair of jeans and a purple shirt.

Celica got a skirt with a red shirt connecting with it.

Cynthia had gotten a short black skirt and a white shirt along with it.

And finally, Lucina bought blue jeans and a white tank top.

"Why is there string hanging from these shoes," Jacob asked curiously.

"These pants seem pretty baggy...and they don't look armored at all." Greg said.

"These aren't really hero looking," Cynthia said looking at her clothes.

"This is obviously different from any other clothing from our realm." Lucina inquired.

"Didn't you see all those shoes Lucy," Cynthia asked her sister.

"Yeah, if they were shoes," Lucina replied, "There were so many I couldn't see a difference."

They all met again inside the store and looked at each other confusion and awe. "I better pay for these," Jacob said as he walked toward the counter. He reached for his gold when he pulled out some kind of papers. He looked at the green papers and saw that numbers and faces were on them.

After a long and somewhat frustrating experience with new currency, they finally left and entered the streets. They weren't very busy as it was late-afternoon out. They had no clue what to do next.

What now?
155111111122111212211111111121211.title: The Modern Realm

1551111111221112122111111111212112.content:
"Honestly, I think we should leave." said Jacob.

"Why's that? We all knew that there are many kinds of realms. Some are bound to be weird." said Greg.

"Well, I'm changing back and leaving." said Jacob, beginning to run back to the gate.

"He can be a real kill joy sometimes." sighed Greg. Then, he turned to the group. "Well, maybe we can come back later." he said.

"That's fine. As strange as this world is, I'd like to see more of it sometime." said Celica.

"Me too." said Lucina.

"If we come back, I want a re-do at that store. There's gotta be more than this." pouted Cynthia. Greg chuckled a bit.

"Sure." Still sighing a bit, Greg and the others followed Jacob back. Greg did make sure to warn Jacob that they all wanted to come back eventually, although Jacob groaned at the thought.

Soon enough, they were back in the Outrealm Gate. As they walked in, Greg noticed that their old clothes returned, possibly another effect of the Outrealms.

"Hopefully we'll get those clothes back when we come back. Weird or not, we did just pay for them." said Greg.

"That's true." said Lucina.

Anyway, walking far enough in, Greg noticed the familiar burst of light and braced himself for the next realm.
1551111111221112122111111111212112.title: Getting out of there

choices: They return to the modern realm
15511111112211121221111111112121121.content:
The light faded as they were standing in front of an old, dark temple with torches lighting it up. It wa large and old as they stood at the steps into the large altar room. "This place looks pretty freaky," Celica said.

"Don't worry," Cynthia said in a brave voice, "There's nothing to fear with me here!"

Greg smiled, Jacob and Lucina sighed, as they entered the temple. It was dark, with only the torches illuminating the temple. They walked towards the center in a group when Lucina pointed at something ahead. Jacob saw two things:

1. A pedestal that looked as if it was meant to hold some spherical object.

2. A spear hurtling toward Lucina.

Lucina had brought up Falchion to block it, but Jacob cut it in half in midair as it missed Lucina. Jacob ran out ahead of them when he saw a figure rush at him. The man held a massive axe, almost as big as Jacob as it swung down and struck his chest fully. If that wasn't enough, the force sent Jacob hurtling towards a wall as he smashed through it. Greg rushed toward the man with Celica and Cynthia at his side. Lucina had charged off toward the wall Jacob just got tossed through. Greg then realized the man to be the rider back in Bryyo.

"You!" Greg yelled, his voice filling the air with rage.

"Didn't I kill you already?" The man said coldly yet calmly.

"Yeah right," Cynthia said, "Greg's a hero you villain! And villains never kill the hero!" Cynthia yelled, trying to intimidate the rider.

Celica pulled out her tome, "I can't stand men like you! Hurting others for your personal gain! You'll pay for what you did," Celica yelled.

"As fun as that sounds," the man began, "I already finished here." The man then held a gem that glew red ominously. He then summoned a rift gate and ran through as it dissipated before any of them could get through. As soon as that happened, they ran toward the shattered wall.

-----------

Jacob opened his eyes as his vision was blurred from the blow and the blood over his right eye. He saw a woman above him shaking him. "...-cob!...J-...Jacob!"

Lucina.

He couldn't bring himself to move anything but his arms and head. He turned to Lucina, "Lu....cina? A-are y-you okay...?"

Lucina smiled with tears in her eyes. "Always worrying." She said. "Come on. I'll...help...you."

Lucina held a hand over her mouth as she saw a piece of shrapnel coming out of Jacob's chest. The tears began to fall as she began sobbing. Jacob reached up and grabbed Lucina's shoulder as his hand glided slowly across her cheek. "I-I'll be fine...Pl-please help me up."

Lucina tore a strip of cloth from her uniform and bandaged his right eye. She then lifted him up and pulled an arm around her shoulders as she dragged Jacob along, Jacob trying to continue moving. Greg and the others then came and helped Jacob as they dragged him. "What are we gonna do," Cynthia said worried.

What happens next?
15511111112211121221111111112121121.title: A dark temple

155111111122111212211111111121211211.content:
"I think we have to go back the way we came." said Greg. "Jacob needs a place to rest. However, I think we should patch him up a bit here first. Celica, could you do that?" asked Greg.

"Of course." said Celica resolutely. Lucina and Cynthia gently put Jacob down, allowing Celica to start doing some basic healing.

"At least get him patched to the point where all he would need is just some rest. We'll head back to that realm we were just in." said Greg.

"Really? You want to go back so soon?" asked Lucina.

"I think we have no choice. We'll need to go somewhere safe for a while. That realm is unusual, but at least it's safe enough. I'd say we can easily hide there for a time." said Greg.

"You're right." agreed Cynthia.

For a little while, the group waited as Celica gave Jacob a good patch job. After about 15 minutes, Celica deemed that he was well enough that they just needed to get him to rest. Picking him up, they helped each other get back to the gate they came through before. They walked through as fast as reasonably possible, going through the bright flash that awaited them every time.

Soon enough, Greg heard the familiar sounds of things moving back and forth and the sky-high pieces of metal from earlier. Greg and the others looked down and saw that they were back in the clothes they bought earlier.

Shrugging it off, They walked a ways from the gate until Cynthia spotted something.

"Hey, that says "Hotel". It kind of looks like the inns we use." she said.

"You're right." said Greg.

The group entered the place, surprised to see the doors open by themselves, but Greg decided to put that aside for another time. He went to what he imagined to be the desk and asked for a couple of rooms, since they would probably need them.

"Thanks." said Greg as he got the keys for the rooms, although he noticed that they looked like cards instead of keys. Greg decided that he would figure out what was what once they got to their rooms. Judging by the number, Greg imagined that they were a floor up. He gave one card to Lucina and kept one for himself. They found a staircase nearby, not noticing the elevator.
155111111122111212211111111121211211.title: They return to the modern realm

1551111111221112122111111111212112111.content:
Lucina kept Jacob near as they climbed the stairs, having the floor above them. Greg, Cynthia, and Celica decided to share one room, leaving Jacob and Lucina the other. "Alright, we'll see you guys in the morning. Take care," Greg said as he and the others waved as Lucina waved for both herself and Jacob.

Lucina and Jacob worked their way up the stairs until they reached their floor and moved down a brightly-lit hallway to a room with the same number as the one on the card. Lucina didn't see a keyhole, but instead a small black box under the handle with a slit in it. She assumed the key would go in there as she pushed it in. She reached and tried to turn the handle, but nothing happened. She pulled the card out to try again when the door made a quick "click", noise. Lucina hesitated, but reached and turned the handle as the door opened. She looked at Jacob, who, even though was weak, shrugged as they entered the room.

There was a large bed, made of some incredibly soft material, a large window overlooking the realm, a table with two chairs, and a large glass box with a window in the front that showed nothing. Lucina would've paid more attention to these, but focused in Jacob for the time being. She laid Jacob on the bed and used the blankets to cover him up. Lucina walked to the other side of the bed and sat next to him, brushing his hair gently. "Th-thanks, Lucina..." Jacob said, mustering a smile. Lucina smiled back, but then turned her head away. Jacob could still hear her sob lightly. "What's wrong?"

"Y-you....you took the spear for me. And then you rushed over to attack who did it," Lucina said as she wiped a tear away, "You got hurt saving me. If I had only been more careful..." Lucina began, when Jacob cut her off.

"No." He replied simply.

This alone took Lucina by surprise, "What?"

"This wasn't your fault," Jacob began, "I saved you because I didn't want to see you hurt. I didn't and still don't care if I have to break myself over and over again to keep you safe. I...I'll always be there for you."

Lucina was taken back by such a speech. She soon felt her tears coming, but out of joy this time. She hugged Jacob, who was surprised quite a bit by that. It took him a moment but he finally wrapped his arms around her. She looked at Jacob as he wiped a tear away. "Thank you, Jacob. I don't know how to thank you."

Jacob held her hand and said, "Stay with me for now, just until morning," Jacob said, mimicking Lucina's first request from before. She smiled and nodded as she removed her new clothes and slid under to covers next to him. Jacob turned his head to face Lucina as he ran a hand through her hair. "Lucina," Jacob began.

"Yeah?"

Jacob leaned in and kissed her in the forehead. Lucina blushed, but then smiled back before saying, "That it?" Jacob was a little confused until Lucina planted a kiss on his lips. Jacob's face turned red, but he embraced the kiss, now kissing back and pulling her close until their bodies hugged each other. The two fell asleep a little while later, Jacob cradling Lucina's head on his chest with her arms wrapped around him.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111.title: Getting situated in

15511111112211121221111111112121121111.content:
Meanwhile...

"Wow, these beds are bouncy!" cheered Cynthia as she bounced a bit on one of the two beds. Greg, herself, and Celica had taken the next room next to Jacob's. Greg had looked around in amazement at how everyone was. It was certainly a lot cleaner than any inn at any of the other realms.

Surprisingly though, Cynthia had actually taken to this realm's conveniences much more casually. She looked everywhere, from the bathroom, to the lamps, and the "black box" in front of the beds. She liked the beds the most though. They were amazingly comfy.

"Sounds like you're adjusting just fine." smiled Greg.

"Of course! I mean, this world is kind of weird, but I think I'm starting to like it." smiled Cynthia.

"But what kind of world do you think this is?" asked Celica. Greg gave it some thought.

"If I had to guess, I'd say it was the future or something." said Greg.

"How do you mean?" asked Celica.

"Well, truthfully, I've noticed a lot of things here that are very similar to the ones in our world, except that they seem to run better and more efficiently. I mean, the bathroom looks like it brings all the water you need right to you." said Greg.

"Yeah, and I like the brushes they have for your teeth. I don't think my mouth has ever been cleaner." smiled Cynthia. Celica smiled at her.

"Well, every world has its strengths." she smiled. Then, Cynthia got up.

"I want to see what this black box does. Either there's nothing inside it or maybe there's a special method." said Cynthia. Celica looked closely at the space under the screen, where she saw something that said "On".
