"Maybe this does something." said Celica as she pressed the On button. Immediately, the screen turned on, causing Cynthia to jump back a bit. What was on the TV turned out to be a movie, Thor. And it just so happened to be during one of the movie's opening action scenes.

"Woah! How did those people get in there?" asked Greg. He looked over at Cynthia, who surprisingly wasn't questioning the "little people".

"Wow, look at that guy with the hammer! He's crushing all the bad guys!" cheered Cynthia, as if she had just found a new idol. Greg just chuckled at how Cynthia could not allow herself to be bothered by how things work and just enjoy it while she has it.

Eventually, they had all changed into night outfits (that they thankfully still had after all this time). Cynthia had a white nightgown on and had her blue hair down. Celica's was similar, and Greg used a spare shirt and shorts he had. However, they didn't all go to sleep for a while. Cynthia insisted on seeing the rest of the movie.

"Now that guy is a real hero. He didn't let his shortcomings get him down and he got his power back." smiled Cynthia as she movie came to a close. Mimicing what Celica did, she pressed the On button and the box turned off.

"I do wonder how that thing works though." said Celica.

"Well, we'll have to be careful about who we ask. I bet those things are rather common here. If we come out asking a whole bunch of questions, people will think we're weird." said Greg, with Celica nodding. Anyway, Celica got her own bed, but Cynthia insisted on sleeping with Greg.

"This way I can make sure that no one jumps you in the dark." she smiled with her trademark grin.

"Sure, you do that." said an amused Greg. Reaching over, Greg pulled on the lamp like he did earlier and it caused the light to go out. Greg couldn't see that well, but he could tell that Cynthia was on his chest.

"Hey Greg." she said.

"Yeah?"

"Tomorrow, you think we can go back to the store?" she asked.

"I suppose, since we apparently have quite a bit of money here, but why?" he asked.

"Well, I actually saw some things I'd like to check out. And personally, I'd also like a new sleeping outfit. I honestly don't like this gown." said Cynthia.

"Heh heh, sure Cynthia." smiled Greg as the two fell asleep together.
15511111112211121221111111112121121111.title: Meanwhile....

155111111122111212211111111121211211111.content:
Lucina woke up the next morning, curled up by Jacob with her head on his chest. She looked up at Jacob who was still asleep. She smiled, having not seen Jacob with any restful sleep. Lucina shook him for a moment as Jacob's eyes opened slowly. He turned and saw Lucina looking up, smiling at him. "Well good morning," Jacob said as he ruffled Lucina's hair a bit.

"Feel any better," Lucina asked.

Jacob smiled back warmly, "Yeah, thanks. Celica can really do some healing." Lucina simply nodded in agreement.

Lucina stood up and walked towards a seperate room inside the room with a tub and washed up as Jacob stretched himself, trying to get his body back to original performance. Lucina walked out a little later in her original clothes. "This realm's still pretty weird," Lucina said walking out, "When I finished washing up, the water just disappeared."

Jacob shrugged that off, "I know. None if this is really making sense, but we should keep that to ourselves and the others. Other people might get suspicious if we don't what any of this stuff is." Lucina nodded. "Also, I found some kind of box that asked me if I wanted breakfast, so I asked for two for us." Lucina was suspicious about getting food from this box, but they decided to play along and see what happens.

A few minutes later, there was a high toned ring that came from the door. Jacob opened it as a cart of food with two plates of food on it. Jacob wheeled it in and placed the plates on the table. There was a large, circular piece of what looked like wheat cooked, a yellow mass of something, and red strips that smelled like pork over fire. Jacob looked at Lucina from across the table as they looked at the "food".

"This looks...interesting," Jacob said. Lucina, curious, cut a piece from the wheat circle and placed it in her mouth. Jacob waited for a moment when Lucina smiled and ate some more, including the yellow thing. Jacob joined in later as they ate the food, which Jacob found later to be called "eggs", "bacon", and a "pancake".

As they went towards the door, Lucina asked him something, "You think I could get a change of clothes back at that shop?"

Jacob smiled, "Sure, let's go get Greg and the others and head with them.

Lucina nodded and smiled as they walked down the hall to Greg's room.

What happens next?
155111111122111212211111111121211211111.title: Morning

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Jacob and Lucina knocked on Greg's door, and it wasn't too long before Greg answered it. He didn't look like he was in the best mood.

"What's wrong?" asked Lucina.

"We went downstairs for breakfast sometime ago. Cynthia apparently wanted to make a "bagel", and she nearly broke what they use to make them. Gods, that was embarrassing." he sighed.

"I said I was sorry!" called Cynthia from the bathroom. Jacob could hear water running from inside, meaning that she was washing up. A few minutes later, Cynthia walked out the bathroom, her normal clothes on and a towel around her neck.

"Wow, that was the best wash I've ever had. These bathrooms are really convenient." she smiled. Soon enough, they were all dressed up and ready. Jacob told Greg that Lucina would like to go back to that shop and get something new. Greg agreed, saying that they had the same idea, now that they know a bit more a bout this realm. They all walked out of the room, and ended up following some other people to what they called an "escalator." Needless to say, the brief loss of gravity freaked Lucina and Celica out a bit, although Cynthia cheered the whole way down.

*****At the store*****

As the group got to the store once again, they noticed that there were quite a few more people there this time.

"Guess we came during the busy hour." spoke Greg. They ended up splitting up a bit, deciding to look out for themselves.

"What are you looking for Lucina?" asked Cynthia.

"I'm trying to see if there's something lighter. This white top feels kind of tight." said Lucina.

"Well, how about that?" said Cynthia, pointing to a dark blue blouse. Lucina seemed to like that one better. Cynthia on the other hand wanted to find something more fitting. They had figured out by now that these were likely all casual clothing, and the fact that there was no armor likely meant that there was no war they really feared. In the end, Cynthia found a turquoise tank top that wasn't too tight and got some black shorts. Lucina was a bit surprised by her choice, but Cynthia found the rather free-moving clothes to be a it nicer than the ones she got before. She even grabbed a grey sweatshirt on top of it.

Eventually, the entire group got back together. Greg was wearing blue jeans with a dark blue shirt. Jacob had normal jeans and a small black coat on. Celica was wearing a red sweater with a red skirt with some moccasin boots. Lucina was wearing the dark blue blouse she found earlier with jeans, and Cynthia was wearing everything she found earlier. Except for Celica, all of them were wearing sneakers.

"Well, they're a bit more comfortable than before." said Greg. The rest agreed. Greg payed for everything. Apparently all that gold they had translated to a good amount of money for them here.

Soon enough, they were outside again.

"So many people. It feels like this city could host every single person from Ylisse in it." said Greg.

"Feels a little too crowded for my taste." said Jacob.

"You really are a downer sometimes." smirked Greg. Jacob gave Greg a light thump on the shoulder for that. Suddenly, Greg couldn't see where Cynthia was. However, she was apparently a little ways in front of them, looking at a bunch of those "boxes" in the window.

"Hit him in the mouth!" she cheered on. Greg wondered what she was watching. He caught up to her and saw that boxing was on the screen, although he didn't know that.

"Why are they fighting each other like that?" asked Celica.

"I see a crowd cheering them on. Perhaps it's like the arena." said Jacob.

"That's my best guess. Interesting how they fight though. I haven't seen a single sword since we got here." said Greg.

"And I've seen no magic tomes either." added Celica.

"Maybe this world doesn't normally use magic or something." said Greg. With that, once they pried Cynthia away from the screen, they kept walking down, until something caught Lucina's eye. A large business building loomed in front of them, but the words on the front caught her attention.

"Exalted Center Inc.? Huh?" she asked.

"That's quite a name. You think it's a coincidence?" pondered Greg.

"Maybe we should take a look" suggested Cynthia.

"I agree." said Lucina.

However, right as she turned around, a figure rushed out of the door, knocking Lucina straight to the ground.

"I'm so sorry! I was in a a bit of a hurry." said who was apparently a young woman, picking some of her things from the ground.

"Oh no, it's my fault! Let me help with those." offered Lucina, who picked up a few things for her. However, right as Lucina picked them up, she and the woman looked straight at each other. Lucina stared right into the face of....

Herself?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Modern Day

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Lucina and the woman stared at each other for a few moments, staring at the others' resemblance to themselves'. It was almost like looking into a mirror for her, but with a few differences. As she began to pick herself up, Jacob and the others jogged over to help them. "Lucina! Are you al-...right?" Jacob stopped as he saw their resemblance. "Um..." Jacob said, obviously speechless.

Cynthia couldn't help but blurt out, "Wow Lucy! I didn't know you had a twin!" Lucina sent a quick, faint glare back at Cynthia, before turning back to the look-alike.

"I'm sorry there," Lucina apologized yet again.

The woman waved her hand a smiled, "No worries, it's alright." The woman began placing the stuff in her bag. "I've been stuck in an office working FOREVER!...And I finally finished, so I'm ready to kick my feet up and relax."

Greg smiled, "That sounds nice. I guess we'll see you around."

The woman nodded, smiled and waved as she began walking away. They all looked back at each other, "Whoa...the odds of that..." Celica said.

"I know. She looked so much like you, Lucina," Jacob told her.

Lucina responded, "I guess, yeah. I don't know why, but there's something else about her..."

Before she could continue, the woman suddenly appeared and walked back up to them, "You're not from around here are you," she asked them.

"Well, no," Lucina said back to her look-alike.

The woman smiled before saying, "How about you come with me? Almost as a welcome to the city."

They all exchanged a look with each other, but decided that this woman seemed harmless, and they could use some rest. "Sure," Jacob replied.

"Alright, um..." The woman said, not yet knowing their names.

Lucina them introduced all of them to her, to where the woman replied, "My name's Faith."

"Well Faith," Cynthia began, "Where were you gonna go?"

"There's a bar not far from here I hang out around, let's head there." Faith said.

"All right," Jacob said, "Lead the way Faith."

Faith spun on her heel as they moved farther into the city.

------------

They bar wasn't very big. It reminded them of a tavern or something from their realm. There were more of those boxes with people in them, most of them showing men in colored uniforms throwing something around as they ran across a field, being knocked down by others. They soon got situated at the bar and ordered a meal.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: A Chance Encounter

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"This place is really....excitable." muttered Jacob as they all sat down.

"Quite a few people come here. It's a really easy way for adults to calm down after work. I can barely even remember the last time I got a break." said Faith.

"What were you doing in that building?" asked Greg.

"Doing some reports for my dad...er, I mean, my boss." she corrected herself, going a little red.

"Your dad?" asked Cyntha, catching on to her little slip-up.

"Yes. My dad is the CEO of the company. Needless to say, what he says goes." Faith gave a small laugh.

"Sounds like Chrom." whispered Greg.

"So you're the daughter of the guy who runs that place? That must be interesting." said Celica. Faith smiled, but sighed.

"True. I do love working for my dad, but it can be frustrating sometimes. A lot of times, people think he plays favorites with me." she said.

"That can't be true. Judging by how fast you were running out, I'd say you take things very seriously." said Lucina.

"Almost too seriously. People always say that I have no sense of humor." pouted Faith.

"Hey, just like Lucy!" laughed Cynthia, who in turn got a glare from Lucina. Faith giggled lightly at the both of them. Soon enough, someone came around to ask what they would like order. Most of them got what they usually got at a bar/tavern, although Faith helped a bit on that. Cynthia and Celica just went for water.

All and all, it was a good time despite how much louder it was than what they were used to.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: At the bar...

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
They finally left the bar as the sun began going down. "Well, that was actually pretty fun," Jacob commented.

Faith let out a long sigh, "It feels so good to finally relax."

Greg looked over and saw the sun going down. "We should be going," Greg began when Faith stopped them.

"Um, this is gonna sound weird, but I have some clothes of mine I was gonna give away. Perhaps Lucina would want them?" Faith proposed.

Lucina thought about it for a moment and smiled. She always enjoyed new clothes, "Sure, I'll look at them."

"Great," Faith said as they were all led off to Faith's house.

---------

Faith's apartment was a little bigger than the hotel rooms the others were staying at. It had a living room, bathroom, kitchen, and a bedroom. They entered as Faith hung her coat up and dropped her back, "It's great to finally be home." She began, "Make yourselves at home, Lucina, follow me and I can show you the clothes." Lucina nodded and followed Faith into her bedroom.

Faith handed Lucina a red nightgown as Lucina began taking her clothes off to try them on. "I'm gonna change as well if you don't mind," Faith said, laying her coat down on her bed as she began unbuttoning her shirt.

"Of course. Take your ti-" Lucina stopped when she noticed something on Faith's right back shoulder. Lucina stood in the nightgown and pulled Faith's shirt down, revealing the Brand of the Exalt. She turned Faith to face her, "Faith? What do you know about that?" Lucina asked, trying to keep her cool.

"Oh yeah," Faith began, "Our family has a long generation of Kings and heroes born in the city here, all with this same mark. Are you okay Lucina?" Faith said.

Lucina straightened Faith and told her, "Faith, look into my left eye." Faith did so and saw the same Brand on her back.

"What is it? Is this a prank?" Faith said, obviously freaked out. It took awhile, but Lucina finally told her everything, about the Brand, the Outrealms, her realm, everything.

"Whoa," Faith said, when there was a knock on the door. "Come in," Faith said, already changed. Jacob stood in the door as he looked at Faith.

"Everything all right?" Jacob asked.

Faith suddenly stopped and said, "Wait...Lord Lucina and Sir Jacob! That's you two!"

Jacob and Lucina both blushed, since that would mean they...

"I'm gonna need an explanation for this."

Lucina and Faith explained it all as Jacob listened.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Later on

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"So you're telling me that Faith is our descendant and the town she works in was once Ylisse?" Jacob said, double checking the information that Lucina and Faith just told him.

"Pretty much, it seems," Lucina said.

At that moment Faith grabbed Jacob's shoulders and Lucina's shoulders and hugged the two into a tight squeeze. "Well..." Jacob got out as he gasped for air from the hug along with Lucina, "She's certainly...has our strength..." Jacob finished.

Lucina smiled as Faith loosened up on her hug, "Sorry! This is just great though! I'm meeting my ancestors from so long ago! Wait, then that means..." Faith began as Cynthia and Greg soon entered along with Celica. "...that Greg and Cynthia get married too!"

Greg and Cynthia went red instantly as they looked at Faith in shock, "Um...what?"

Jacob explained this time to the three of them, looking back at Faith and Lucina from time to time for confirmation.

"Wow," Cynthia squealed, "I have children, and I'm meeting probably my great-great-great-great..."

"Cynthia," Lucina said a little stern.

"....grandnephew!" Cynthia finally finished as she hugged Faith quickly.

"Wow, the odds that we would find future Ylisse in the realms, and find your descendant Lucina," Greg said.

"Indeed," Celica nodded.

Faith stood up, "We should celebrate! I ordered some food, maybe I can get my relatives over a-and..." Jacob stopped her with a hand on her shoulder.

"Slow down there Faith!" Jacob said smiling, "I know your excited, but it might be a little too much. However, I would like to meet any siblings you may have and/or your father."

Faith nodded, "Uh-huh. But could you at least stay here with me. It's the least I can do."

They all exchanged a look and nodded, "Alright."

Faith smiled as she set up beds in the living room. Jacob was still surprised by how technological everything was. He watched a couch suddenly transform into a bed as Faith pulled on some handle on it. They each went to bed tired, Faith, was excited about tomorrow however.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Revealing Part 2

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Jacob woke up to the smell of breakfast. Well, what breakfast was here anyways. He looked up to see the rest awake and eating food similar to the food at the hotel. Jacob sat down next to Lucina, already eating and made a plate ready for Jacob. They ate quickly, especially Faith, excited to show them her sister. They all dressed in their modern attire and left a moment later.

Moments later, they were walking back into Faith's workplace, dwarfed by the massive structure. "So Faith," Jacob began, trying to start conversation, "What do you do here?"

"I co-manage with my cousin, Stella. Where is she anyway?" Faith said, looking around the factory floor.

"FAITH!" A voice yelled. The group turned to see a girl with blue hair tied into ponytails hurry towards them. "Faith! Fai-" was thing the woman said before she almost fell and Faith caught her.

"Stella! What's the rush? Are you okay?" Faith said, holding her cousin and Cynthia and Greg's descendant up.

"I was gonna tell you that we get off early today and if you wanted to hang out. Would you-" Stella stopped when she turned and saw Cynthia. The two looked very much alike, Stella having a few more blemishes than Cynthia. Cynthia knew Stella was her descendant, and could barely hold back. "Who's this Faith," Stella asked.

Faith allowed them to introduce themselves, then asked Stella to head with them back to her place. There, Faith explained their Brands they had since they were kids and Lucina and Cynthia's. She then explained how Jacob and Lucina would be an Aunt and Uncle, while Cythia and Greg would be her Great-something grandparents. "Wait, so those stories as kids that we heard were true? And so..." Stella turned to Cynthia, and was on her in a second. Cynthia hugged back, the two close to tears overjoyed. She then reached over, grabbed Greg by the collar and pulled him into the hug. Jacob, Lucina, Faith and Celica couldn't help but smile. They soon pulled away, to where Stella turned back to Faith. "When did you realize this?"

"Just yesterday," Faith said still smiling.

"Hey Faith, would you mind if I hung out with you here?" Stella asked.

"Of course," Faith said.

Cynthia soon put an arm around Stella and sat her down, "So what do you like to do?"

"Um," Stella said, pondering her thoughts, "I like watching action movies with heroes in them. Have you seen any?"

Cynthia recalled to that movie with the guy named 'Thor'. She nodded, "Uh-huh. I only saw one, but it was really cool!"

Stella then got an idea, "What if we had an action movie marathon?"

"That sounds fun," Faith said back.

Lucina and the others agreed as they went out and bought food for this 'marathon'. They also got more movies, titled 'Captain America', 'Iron Man', and 'Batman'. They watched them into the night until only a few of them were awake. He leaned over next to Faith and Stella. "Listen. Remember that Outrealm we came through? We're gonna have to leave through it again soon," Jacob told them.

Sorrow instantly covered their faces, but before they could speak Jacob stopped them, "This doesn't mean we're gone forever. We may return, and we'll come straight to you if we do. Okay?" He said it smiling, hoping to keep them from crying. Faith hugged Lucina and Jacob as Stella did Greg and Cynthia.

"Please come back," the two said almost in unison.

They smiled and held their descendants, finishing the last of the movies. Soon it was just Jacob awake, he was falling asleep but could recall something appearing on the T.V. Some kind of scene for something called "Fire Emblem: Awakening." As much as he wanted to stay awake to see it, he fell asleep.

----------

They each woke up the next day, Faith and Stella with somber faces. Jacob and the others comforted them as they left toward the alley where the Outrealm Gate had been. They stood in front of it and said their goodbyes.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: The next day...

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Well, that realm was fun." said Greg.

"Yeah. It was so cool! I want to see all those "movies" again or whatever she called them." said Cynthia.

"We'll have to return sometime then. I am curious about what they do there." said Celica.

"Well, I suppose we'll make a note to return. Although, we might want to do something about that rider though, and the war on Bryyo. Otherwise, that might continue to haunt us for who knows how long." said Jacob.

Jacob's mention of Bryyo suddenly brought Greg back to reality. In his excitement, he had almost totally forgotten about Bryyo. He had often wondered in the past if he should return sometime. He didn't want to leave that world at war for so long, especially with that rider on the loose. In fact, Greg still wondered how that rider even appeared at that temple. The only way that could happen was if he was possibly world-hopping like they were.

"You have a good point Jacob." said Greg. "We'll need to take care of Bryyo sometime."

"Don't worry. We know a thing or two about ending long wars." smiled Cynthia with her cheeky grin.

"I don't know if that's a good thing or not." said Lucina.

As Cynthia said what she said, Greg was reminded of what Stella said back in the future Ylisse. He looked over at Cynthia, and honestly wasn't sure about that that future envisioned for him and her.

"Um, Cynthia?" started Greg as the group continued walking along.

"Yeah?" asked Cynthia, still smiling.

"Um, about before..." started Greg before he trailed off.

However, before he could continue, the group felt as if they had been hit by an earthquake. The "ground" beneath them began to shake and turn.

"Whoa! What's happening?!" cried Celica.

"Is the Outrealm becoming unstable?" wondered Jacob. "We need to move before this place engulfs us!" said Jacob.

"What happens if we're caught when it breaks down?" asked Lucina.

"I don't know. Anything could happen. And I mean anything." said Jacob.

"Duly noted. Run!" cried Greg.

With that, the group tried to run, hurdling through the shifting and unstable Outrealm.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Problem

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
The next Outrealm's entrance was just in front of them, the closer they got, the more unstable the realm became. Jacob and the others pushed through the gate, but were met with a flash and blacking out.

----------

Jacob woke up next to Greg and Celica, who were still laying down. Jacob shook Celica as she pushed herself up to her knees. Jacob then shook Greg, who groaned, but finally picked himself up with Jacob's help. As they did, Celica pointed out that Cynthia and Lucina were gone. They looked around until Jacob saw an odd, ancient, legendary-looking sword glistening in the sun with a blue glint as it laid next to a lance Jacob identified as the lance "Luna", being able to rip through defenses in a single blow, radiating a blue glow and shining with blue-gray color with the Brand of the Exalt on the flat part of the spearhead. Jacob walked toward the sword and examined it. It was long blade with and interstingly hooked hilt, colored silver like the other parts of the sword, but glistened with a blue tint and a Brand of the Exalt on the bottom. Jacob picked it up, and at that moment...

"Jacob? What..Nngh..what happened?" Jacob heard the sword say.

To Jacob, it sounded like Lucina. "L-Lucina? Is that you?"

Her voice replied back, "Yeah. What's happening?"

"Um...Lucina? Please don't freak out, but you're a sword now."

"What?!" Lucina exclaimed. Celica created a quick reflection showing Lucina to herself as a sword. "H-how'd this happen? W-What happened to me? What if I'm stuck like this? Jacob, what if-"

"Hey, hey hey," Jacob said trying to calm her down, "You're gonna be fine, alright? Trust me."

A few moments later, Lucina replied, "Alright. Thanks Jacob."

Jacob turned back and saw Greg having a conversation with he lance. "It's okay Cynthia. I'm gonna take care of you," Greg said.

The two turned at each other and back at their weapons. "It would be best if we found out where we were." Celica said.

Jacob nodded as he attached a sheath next to his waist and slid Lucina inside, a hand still in her hilt. "Don't worry, Lucina. I'm gonna take care of you."

Lucina replied, "I trust you, Jacob. Thanks."

Greg held Cynthia and slid her onto his back, "You'll be alright. I promise."

Cynthia said, "Thanks Greg. I hope at least I can do something heroic like this too!"

With that, they left down the road.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Making it out

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"I wander what caused them to become like this?" asked Celica as the group moved on.

"Maybe this realm doesn't like human girls." snickered Jacob. Somehow, he could feel Lucina slam into his side after that comment. "Ow!"

"This isn't the time for jokes." said Lucina.

"Perhaps there's just something about you two that caused you to transform." suggested Greg.

"Maybe, but what about Celica?" asked Cynthia.

"True, she's the only girl who didn't get changed at all." said Greg.

"I wonder why." pondered Celica. Greg wondered if being an Einherjar perhaps kept her from changing, but he didn't want her to know about that yet. Then, Jacob brought up another point.

"Something else I've noticed. How are you even able to equip a spear here? You're a Dread Fighter." said Jacob. Greg looked a but taken back at the comment.

"That's....a good question actually. I guess she just feels pretty comfortable in my hands." said Greg.

"Maybe it's because you two have a special connection." said Celica with an honest smile. Greg's face went beat red, and if you looked closely, you could see the Luna spear turning slightly purple at the spearhead.

"D-Don't say stuff like that!" said Cynthia. Celica giggled.

Soon enough, a town came into view. It looked nice and quaint, a bit small but having plenty of people. The group walked up the front, where Greg saw a man sitting down casually.

"Excuse me sir, do you know what realm this is?" he asked.

"What? You kids from out of town?" chuckled the man.

"Yeah, kind of." said Greg. The man caught a look at Lucina and Cynthia.

"Those look like some might fine weapons you got there. They your favorites?" asked the man.

"In a manner of speaking." said Greg, a bit unsure how to answer.

"Well, if you love weapons, you're in the right place. This is the Forgerealm, the finest place to look to take care of a weapon. You can do whatever you like here, from maintenance, to adding whatever you like to them." said the man.

"Wow....that actually sounds awesome." smiled Greg.

"You bet your britches it is." agreed the man.

With that said, the group walked further in, letting the man's information sink in.

"Sounds like we could do some pretty cool things here." said Jacob.

"You sound as if you like the idea of doing work on me." said Lucina.

"Well, I guess we might as well enjoy these realms while we can. Besides, we deserve a bit of of fun after the Hotrealm incident." said Greg.

"Hey, that wasn't even our fault!" cried Cynthia.

Greg, Celica, and Jacob laughed as they kept walking forward.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Forgerealm

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
The group passed through the town, awed by the weapons everywhere. It looked like a normal Ylissean village, but ready to fight an army of Risen. Jacob walked with the others until they found a row of huts, each with a forge inside. "Look at that," Celica said impressed. "So many forges in just a small town."

Jacob looked at them and then turned toward Lucina, "Hey Lucina, you wouldn't mind if I check you up and preform some maintenance?"

"Huh?" Lucina replied, "You know how to work a forge, Jacob?"

"Yeah, luckily in the village I came from they had their own."

Lucina was silent for a moment, "I guess you can. Just...be careful with me, please?"

Jacob walked toward one of the forges, "Wait," Greg yelled. "What should we do?"

"You can check with Cynthia and try to forge her, or just explore some more. I'll find you later." Jacob said as he entered the hut and closed a curtain behind him, leaving the hut lit by the forge's light.

Jacob pulled a chair up by the forge and unsheathed Lucina as he placed her in the flames. A few seconds later, he pulled the red hot blade out and laid it on an anvil, smoothing the blade and toughening it. Jacob was finishing his work when he realized Lucina hadn't said a thing. "You alright?"

Jacob held the blade on his knee, and in the reflection, he saw Lucina's face/head. "I'm fine...just... What if I don't change back? Or what if I break? What would happen if-"

"Lucina." Jacob said. "Listen, I understand all of your concerns. I'm not gonna jeopardize you and break you. That's part of the reason I brought you here. Look, I promise you, you'll be fine. You okay?"

He saw Lucina's face turn to look at him in the reflection and smiled. "Yes. Thanks, Jacob."

"And besides, Chrom would probably kill me with you if I returned with you as a sword." Jacob joked.

The blade bounced and clanged against Jacob's knee, Jacob grabbed for a sec and saw Lucina's face with a mischievous smile. "Alright, I deserved that one," Jacob chuckled. Lucina laughed and Jacob slid her into the sheath. "Feeling better?"

"As a matter of fact yes. Thanks." Lucina complimented.

Jacob exited the hut and went to meet with Greg and the others.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Exploring the town

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Well, now what?" wondered Greg with Cynthia and Celica in tow.

"Hey, why don't we see what I can do?!" Cynthia seemed to hop in excitement on Greg's back.

"You're that excited to do something rough? What if you break?" asked Greg.

"Well, I imagine that as long as you put me back together, it'll be fine." Greg felt as if Cynthia was smiling at him. He turned and took the Luna lance off his back and looked it over. It was a nice shade of blue, kind of like Cynthia's hair. Although, he suddenly could faintly see Cynthia's face in the reflection of the spearhead.

"Woah!" said Greg, taking a few steps back as he saw that. "I didn't know you could do that. How does it feel anyway?" he asked.

"I'm not sure, but it doesn't feel bad. I feel like I've something inside me just waiting to come out." said Cynthia.

"Maybe you should test it." said Celica.

"Perhaps." said Greg.

In a nearby forge they were passing by, Greg saw a sheet of metal on the side. "You know, if you really have Luna, then maybe we should test it. Luna can pierce through any defense after all." said Greg.

"Fine by me!" cheered Cynthia.

Greg walked over to the side of the forge, grasping Cynthia in his hands. He honestly hadn't handled lances that often, but he felt as if he could use Cynthia. Taking a deep breath, he lunged towards the metal, striking it dead center. However, it only did little damage.

"Ouch!" cried Cynthia.

"Are you okay?" asked Greg, hoping she was.

"I'm fine. It just felt like something bonked me on the head." said Cynthia.

"Well, Luna does activate based on Skill level. Perhaps you should try once more." said Celica.

"All right, you up for one more?" asked Greg, to which Cynthia nodded.

He tried again. As he got ready, the spear seemed to glow blue briefly as he lunged. The spear broke through the metal easily.

"Woo-hoo! That was awesome! What a rush!" cheered Cynthia.

"Well, I guess someone's happy." smiled Greg. Their test done, they left the forge area.

"So, are you okay being like this for a while?" asked Greg.

"I don't mind. At least I'm not an iron lance." smiled Cynthia.

"That you aren't." smiled Greg.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Greg and the others

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Greg walked back after testing Cynthia's Luna ability as Jacob spotted them. "Hey Greg," Jacob said as he made his way over.

Greg nodded and turned to meet him. "How was it," Greg asked. Jacob nodded for Lucina, "It was great. Lucina is now one of the finest swords in the land." Jacob said. "How about Cynthia and you?"

"Turns out she can use the Luna ability." Greg said.

"Really? Well that's pretty effective!" Jacob said impressed. They talk back and forth until Celica interrupted.

"Guys? The sun's going down already," Celica pointed out. They turned and saw the sun half hidden as it descended.

"You're right," Jacob said, "I'll grab us a room at the inn."

They entered and got a room with three beds. Jacob sat on his and unsheathed Lucina a bit, enough to see her face reflecting on the blade. "You sure you'll be alright?"

Lucina chuckled, "I'll be fine. You made sure of that right?"

Jacob smiled, "Right." He slid her back into the sheath and leaned her against the nightstand on the bed. He turned and saw Greg doing the same with Cynthia as he finished saying good night.

"Don't worry," Celica began smiling, "If they break I'll mend them up."

Greg smiled, "I'm not sure fusing metal is the same as healing wounds, but thanks."

They all fell asleep shortly after.

--------------

Jacob woke up to see Lucina still leaning against the bed. He reached over held her with one hand. "Hey Lucina?"

"Oh...*yawn*...hey Jacob..." Lucina replied sleepily.

"Did you just yawn," Jacob asked surprised. "I didn't know swords can do that."

Lucina laughed, "They can when descended from an Exalt."

Jacob laughed as he reequipped her and woke Celica. Greg woke up a second later and held Cynthia. From Greg's words, she was obviously energetic even as a lance. They left the inn and decided to....
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: After the test

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Well, perhaps we should get going." said Greg. "While wielding a Luna lance is pretty cool, I think I'd rather see Cynthia actually walking alongside me."

Greg could see the Luna spearhead turning a little purple after he said that, which made him turn a little red.

"Yeah, I guess so, although I would like to have seen what Lucina can do. A sword from the exalted bloodline must surely be powerful." said Jacob. Lucina blushed a tiny bit at that.

"Well, I guess we should go then if we're in agreement, we should get going." said Celica.

After the group nodded, they began walking off, heading out of town towards the next gate. They made sure to take in whatever sights they could before doing so though. Cynthia actually hoped that they would return someday, perhaps the next time she could see it as a human.

"That's quite an arena they've got there." noticed Jacob as they reached the outskirts of the town. Greg made a mental note to go there sometime. He wanted to check it out when he didn't have war to think about.

However, they didn't get far out of town when they heard screaming.

"Someone's in trouble!" said Jacob. Nobody even had to say anything. They immediately started running towards the sound. Soon enough, they saw a red-haired woman being surrounded by bandits.

"Anna? Or at least one of them." said Greg, grabbing Cynthia from his back. There was no disputing this. They were going to help. Jacob then grabbed the hilt of Lucina's sword. Neither objected to being used. They wanted to help too.

"Hey, pick on someone your own size." said Greg as he instantly began charging. The bandits noticed Greg and began charging. Jacob and Celica ended up coming right behind, ready to go.

Perhaps thanks to the special connection, handling the Luna lance was no problem for Greg, who even got off many Luna strikes at the bandits. Jacob's blade cut right through them, showing no mercy.

"So this is what it feels to wield an exalted weapon in a sense." he muttered to himself. Meanwhile, the bandits couldn't get near Celica either, who short from afar with Celica's Gale.

There weren't alot of bandits, so they were finished soon, allowing Anna to get back on her feet.

"Phew, thanks for that. Don't think I would have made it without you guys." smiled Anna.

"It was no problem." said Greg as he wiped down the spear a bit. They were going to leave soon, but he figured he didn't want to leave too much blood on Cynthia.

"Hey, you guys heading out of town? I'm about to head home myself." said Anna.

"How about we join you? We have no real destination in mind." said Jacob as he wiped his sword down.

"No problem at all. I'd love some company." smiled Anna.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Combat?

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Following the red-headed merchant, the walked through the Outrealm gate. Then Lucina and Cynthia glew as the turned into rays of light, as it then faded and Lucina and Cynthia stood in front of them again. "Heh heh. Nice to have you two b-" Before he could finish, Jacob felt light-headed. He turned and saw the rest of them not looking great either. Jacob then collapsed with the others.

----------

Jacob opened her eyes. "Nngh...What ha-?" Jacob stopped mid-sentence to a new high-pitched voice. He sat up and saw four other Anna's laying by her. Then he looked down and saw her body's new assets being openly displayed with merchant gear around her. She was about to yell in shock, but remained calm. 'Their probably the other Annas here.' Jacob thought as one Anna woke up, wearing a Trickster outfit.

"Nngh..." She said as she turned to Jacob. "Anna? Where's the others?"

"Um...Greg?" Jacob asked.

She nodded as Jacob then revealed to Greg her body. Greg almost freaked if Jacob wasn't there to stop her. "Alright. I think we should wake the others up and find out who's who."

Jacob woke up the Anna in a Yukata with black hair and a blue shine. She woke up oddly an uncomfortably. "Anna? What happened?...Why am I in my Yukata?" She asked.

Jacob remembered that Lucina had a Yukata back in the Hotrealm, and she thought it was hers. Anna explained her identity as Jacob and helped Lucina. Jacob turned and saw Greg helping an Anna in a Pegasus uniform, almost instantly recognizing her for Cynthia. They looked around and tried to get used to their new bodies. Then a merchant Anna awoke, having to be Celica. They all looked and saw they were in a forest next to the Outrealm Gate.

"Alright. As weird as this is, we should look for a town. Maybe the Anna we were traveling with is there," Greg began.

"Yeah. The problem's gonna be how to find that Anna. If this realm makes people become Annas, how will we find the same one?" Jacob inquired with the other Annas.

"I don't see another option. Let's go." Lucina said as the five Annas walked down the road.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Leaving Forgerealm with Anna

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
They ran through the Outrealm as the colors swirled and the shaking intensified. Jacob saw everyone get hazy and collapsed along with them as well.

----------

Jacob awoke on his back. He felt himself laying on grass, looking up at the early morning sky. Jacob held a hand to his head and noticed that his hand seemed...different. He also noticed the armor he wore changed and was now white. Jacob sat up and saw something "she" didn't expect.

Jacob felt a new weight hang from her chest under her white coat. She felt a chilly, morning wind blow her light-blue hair into view. "What's h-?" Jacob began to say but stopped as she heard her new voice. She recognized herself as Lucia. She then heard a noise to her left.

Greg awoke with both her hands to her purple hair, noticing the change instantly. "W-what happened?" Greg said, looking at her new body that belonged to Katarina and her new voice.

"The Outrealn collapsed. That's what happened," Jacob said as she stood and held her hand out to Greg to help her up.

"You mean that made us like this?" Greg inquired.

"It's a possibility," Jacob said. They then heard another noise and turned to see a woman who looked like Lyn rise. "Lucina?" Jacob asked.

"Huh? Wh-who are you?" Lyn(Lucina) replied.

Jacob walked over to help her up. "Lucina, it's me, Jacob. And, um.....You aren't yourself."

Lucina looked at her body and gasped. "I...I look like Lyn, noblewoman of Sacae. How'd this happen?" Lucina asked as Jacob helped her up.

"The Outrealm collapsed. You alright?" Jacob asked as Lucina nodded in reply. Then they heard a noise behind them as they saw the Pegasus knight they recognized as Palla.

"Hey guys. So this seems pretty weird Huh?" Cynthia said to them in Palla's body. Greg noticed how she wasn't freaking out and seemed more mature. "You guys alright?"

"Yeah," Greg replied, "Thanks Cynthia." They then saw Celica sit up, unchanged. Jacob and the others knew she was Einherjar and already of a legendary figure, so it made sense that she didn't change. Jacob looked around to see they were in the middle of a field, but saw a road a distance away that would lead to civilization.

"As weird as this is," Jacob said in Lucia's voice, "we need to keep moving and find out where we are...And I'll need help to get use to this." Jacob said. Lucina smiled and put a hand on her shoulder.

"I can help with that." Lucina smiled, "Everyone ready to go?"

Cynthia nodded and stood straight as she walked with them alongside Greg, who followed behind Jacob with Lucina and Celica by them as they got on the road and walked it.

What happened next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Caught in the Outrealm

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Greg and the group continued on their way, while still trying to get used to their new looks. Greg looked all over her Grandmaster outfit, especially seeing how parts of his thighs were exposed. His short purple hair seemed to fit with her, given how short her hair was as a guy. Being the Lost Tactician didn't look so bad. Looking through her items, she saw that she had an Eliwood's Blade and a Katarina's Bolt, perfect for a Grandmaster. Her skills seemed to be Shadowgift, Tomefaire, Rally Spectrum, Focus, and Tomebreaker.

Jacob fidgited a bit in her white garb. She saw that she had a Balmung sword attached to her waist. She often stumbled in her heeled boots, and her long light-blue hair whipped around in the breeze. Her skills were Swordfaire, Dual Support+, Astra, Vantage, and Avoid +10.

Lucina, in Lyn's DLC garb, looked at calm as ever. She noticed that she had a Sol Katti equipped, although she kind of mourned the loss of her Parallel Falchion. She wondered where that had gone in the disturbance. Nonetheless, being Lyn, the Noblewoman of Sacae, had an interesting appeal to her. The skills she saw she had were Aether, Vantage, Astra, Avoid +10, and Acrobat.

Cynthia was the Elder Sister, Palla, and to Greg's view, she seemed to look the part. Apparently, she even had her pegasus here. Unlike the Cynthia she knew, Cynthia seemed more calm, cool, and collected. Despite this, Greg seemed to sense some wonder in her, like she was living a dream. To her and Greg's surprise, she actually had Gradivus with her, one of the most powerful lances around. Her skills seemed to be Galeforce, Sol, Counter, Rally Skill, and Lancefaire.

"This is almost too bizarre." muttered Greg, although she was getting used to it.

"I just wonder why we always end up as girls, yet everyone else stays the same." muttered Jacob, combing her long hair behind her ear.

"Guess it just happens." said Celica. "By the way, why didn't I change?" she said out loud.

"Maybe it doesn't work on you for some reason." explained Greg. She didn't want to tell Celica about her own status as an Einherjar.

"Well, how about we just get to town and then figure what to do next?" offered Lucina.

"Sounds good enough." nodded Greg. Cynthia nodded as well, but she didn't say anything.

With that said, the group kept going. They kept seeing the ocean all around them, making them wonder if they were on an island of some sorts.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: The trip to the town

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
They moved down the road, getting closer and closer to signs of civilization. Jacob looked around, passing by small houses, farmland and other areas of life. She finally had gotten used to her heeled boots and was now able to walk more comfortably. As they did, Jacob spotted someone who he had never seen. But as soon as she saw her, this green haired woman, thoughts flooded into Jacob's mind that were not his own. "Queen Elincia!" Jacob yelled as she hurried forward, impulsed to do so.

The woman, Queen Elincia, turned and saw Jacob approach. "Oh! Lucia, I didn't expect to see you out here. What are you doing out here anyway?" Elincia asked her.

"'Twas merely wandering through, milady," Jacob said, her voice taking a tone of respect toward Elincia.

"We don't need to be so cordial outside the city Lucia. I would enjoy to be in your company but must take my Pegasus out to keep her in shape," Elincia said as she petted the white Pegasus.

Jacob nodded, "A wise choice, milady."

With that, Elincia nodded as she rode the Pegasus upward and flew in a random direction. Greg and the others had been watching, wondering what the heck Jacob was doing.

Greg approached Jacob from behind, who had remained unmoving since Elincia left, and tapped her shoulder, "Um, Jacob? Who was that? What happened?"

Jacob turned and looked at Greg, "What do you mean? That's Queen Elincia. I serve under her."

Greg's face held a look of worry and confusion. "Jacob?"

Greg then saw Jacob's face change for a moment to a confused look. "I...I'm sorry Greg. I..." Jacob trailed off before she recollected herself. "Let's find the city and see what we can learn about it." Jacob said as she continued down the road.

While they talked, Lucina had been talking to Cynthia. "You alright, Cynthia?" Lucina had asked.

"Of course," Cynthia replied cordially. "Why? Is something wrong?"

"N-no. You just seem more....mature, almost," Lucina tried to explain.

Cynthia looked at Lucina, an eyebrow raised, "That seems...odd I guess. You expected me to have childish dreams and fantasies?"

Lucina was surprised by Cynthia's attitude, "No, it's just...nothing."

"I'm sorry if I offended you in any way Lucina. Apologies." Cynthia replied.

The odd group wandered into the city a little whiles later.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Along the way

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Wow." said Greg as the group entered the city.

Compared to most cities they had been to, this one was pretty lively, having people fill the streets from corner to corner. It was perhaps the most lively place Greg had ever seen.

"What a place." she muttered to herself. The others took in the sights too in their own way.

"I don't think I've seen a place like this back in Valencia." said Celica.

"This is Norna, one of the largest cities here. It's known for fast array of seafood they get from the port." Cynthia pointed out. Lucina gave her an odd look.

"How did you know that?" asked Lucina. Cynthia seemed a bit stunned by the question.

"Um...well I'm not sure." she said softly. Lucina raised an eyebrow at her "former" sister.

"Anyway, how about we look around some more? Might as well blend in while we can." said Jacob.

"That sounds good, as long as everyone doesn't travel too far away." said Greg.

"That's a good idea. I could use a stable to put Achaeus away while I can." said Cynthia, pulling the reins of her pegasus behind her.

"Um....sure whatever." said Greg.

With that, the group decided to split up for the moment, looking around the various parts of the city.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: The City

choices: Greg and the others find Jacob and Elincia
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
They moved through one of the streets of the city, avoiding crowds and taking the sight in. Jacob seemed to be enjoying herself, then down an alley to another street, she saw Elincia again. "Head on without me. I'll catch up with you later," Jacob told the others as she walked down the alley toward Elincia. She found it odd that the Queen was wearing a hood outside, especially since it was hot out. "Queen Elincia?" Jacob inquired.

Elincia turned, almost startled, but quickly warmed up with a smile. "Lucia, what a pleasant surprise." Elincia stated.

"If I may milady, why do you wear a hood on a day such as this?" Jacob said, curious to her wardrobe choice.

Elincia smiled again, "I like to move about my people as an equal. Therefore, I hide my face under a hood."

Jacob bowed slightly, "Clever plan milady."

Elincia smiled yet again and turned. "Walk with me, would you Lucia?"

Jacob smiled and nodded, "Of course Queen Elincia." Jacob walked down the streets with Elincia as they stopped at vendor's stands and little shops. Finally they walked into one of the alleyways.

Elincia pulled her hood down and looked back to Jacob. "Thank you, Lucia," Elincia commented smiling. "I enjoy being with you."

Jacob smiled and bowed her head yet again. "The pleasure is mine milady," Jacob said respectfully. "I've promised to serve you as a knight to a Queen. It's an honor to speak to you like this." Jacob then knelt down in front of her.

Elincia walked over by her and had her stand. She smiled to her loyal servant, "I'm glad to have a knight like you Lucia. Come on." They then exited the alley and continued walking.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Jacob sees Elincia again

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Meanwhile, through all the commotion, Cynthia had checked Archeus into a stable for a while. She gently patted the animal before leaving. As she left, Greg had approached her.

"You feeling okay Cynthia?" asked Greg. Cynthia gave him an odd look before giving him a smile that seemed like a fusion between a mature smile and Cynthia's typical wide grin.

"I'm doing just fine. I'm quite enjoying this." she said.

"Really? Kind of seems a bit out of character for you." said Greg. Cynthia shook her head.

"You remember my pegasus back in Ylisse?" asked Cynthia, to which Greg nodded. "I named her Palla, after the legendary pegasus knight herself. To actually be her, even if it's just an Einherjar thing, it's quite exciting." she said.

"I guess you do seem to be enjoying it." smiled Greg. Cynthia's smile became more reserved again.

"Yes, I am. I wish I could try the Triangle Attack for once. Hmm, I wonder if Catria and Est are in this realm. Perhaps I should go check. Good day Greg." said Cynthia who gave a small bow and left. Greg reached out to her, but to no avail.

"Well, this is kind of weird, yet also ironic. Cynthia's not her usual energetic self, but she gets to be her idol for who knows how long." Greg sighed before a thought just came to him.

The unstable Outrealm Gate turned them into this. Would they ever get out of it? Greg hadn't seen any other Outrealm Gates around lately. He was beginning to wonder.

"Well, I guess I should enjoy myself first. Hmm, you know, this book was rather interesting. I should go look for some more." said Greg, having a change of thoughts.

Meanwhile, Lucina had been touring the stores by herself, looking at all the wares. Celica was also looking on her own at the moment.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: What are Greg/Cynthia/Celica/Lucina doing?

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Lucina had been moving from store-to-store, looking at the wares collected. She had split up from the group after Cynthia put Achaeus in a stable. All this still worried her. Cynthia seemed to be acting more her age, which...wasn't her age. It was as if everything Cynthia dreamed about being, a great, legendary hero, just vanished in seconds, only to be replaced by knightly actions.

It also worried Lucina that everyone had split up, but she wasn't so worried. She was a great tracker back in Sacae, both as a girl and as herself. She'd be able to find-

Lucina held a hand to her head in confusion. 'Wait. W-where THAT thought come from?' Lucina thought to herself. Either way, she believed it was time to get everyone back together.

Lucina walked outside. Celica was looking at wares from a nearby vendor. She turned and saw Lucina, who motioned her to follow, which she did. As they did, they saw Greg sitting on a crate reading a book, with three more stacked beside her. "Greg," Celica said trying to get her attention, but to no avail. Greg seemed glued to the book.

"Hey, Greg," Lucina yelled a bit louder.

Greg jumped a bit and turned to them. "Oh. Hey guys. Sorry, I was just reading a few of the books I bought. What's up?"

"We're gonna look for Jacob and Cynthia and see about getting an inn to sleep in. How's that sound?" Celica asked.

Greg nodded and hopped down from her crate with her books. "That sounds good. I think we could all use a rest."

They soon rented a room in a nearby inn and rested, deciding Cynthia and Jacob could probably find their way back on their own.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Lucina takes a break

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Meanwhile, Cynthia was walking down the streets, supposedly trying to see if her "sisters" were around.

"Wait, are they my sisters? Lucina is my sister too right?" she asked herself while shaking her head. "Sure, they are all my sisters." she said with a smile.

Her mannerisms continued to remain calm and collected, even while avoiding all the walking people. However, Cynthia began to wonder a bit if they were even here. What if they were in another town? Perhaps she should have asked to see if their pegasi were in that stable too.

"Where could they be?" asked Cynthia as she put a hand to her head. However, through the crowd, she soon saw a flash of blue and pink. She instantly recognized them and smiled.

"Catria! Est!" she called.

The two figured turned around and gasped in happiness as they saw their elder sister. The blue-haired dark flier was Catria, while the pink-haired pegasus knight was Est. Each were still wearing their armor and such, although neither had their pegasus around.

"Sister, there you are! We've been looking for you!" cried Est as she happily hugged her big sister. Catria sighed as Cynthia returned the hug.

"Est, stop acting like a kid! Palla has a reputation to uphold." she reprimanded.

"You're no fun." pouted Est.

"Okay you two, enough." smiled Cynthia, not responding to Catria calling her Palla.

"You should try to motivate her more. She's the only one who isn't even promoted yet." said Catria, referring to how Est was still a tier 1 class. Est pouted at that.

"Hey, I'll get better soom. Just you wait!" said Est.

Cynthia smiled at Est's behavior. It kind of reminded her of her own before she became like this. At the thought of that though, Cynthia shook her head and composed herself again.

"So what are you two doing right now?" asked Cynthia.

"Well, we've been given a day or two off from duty, so we've just been exploring. I feel weird though. I think I should be practicing." said Catria. Cynthia lightly giggled, with Catria's behavior reminding her of Cordelia to an extent.

"Well, if it makes you feel better, I have no problem with a little training, just to get you settled for the day." said Cynthia.

"That would be great." smiled Catria.

"Well, let's get it done then. I want to look around some more." giggled Est.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Cynthia with her "sisters"

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Jacob and Elincia had wandered until Elincia turned to Jacob. "I believe I should return to my home now."

"I'll follow behind you," Jacob replied.

Elincia turned and gave Jacob a caring smile, "That won't be necessary, Lucia. You can head off too."

Jacob looked at Elincia almost shocked or hurt by what she said. "But milady, who'll protect you?" Jacob said in a worrisome tone.

"Now now Lucia," Elincia began. "You know I have other knights at my disposal, you don't need to cover for all of them."

Jacob looked toward the ground, "Of course. But I...just making sure you're safe, milady." Jacob said solemnly.

Elincia smiled and did something Jacob didn't expect and hugged her. Jacob was taken by surprise, so it took a second for Jacob to reply. "M-milady?"

Elincia smiled, "Thank you Lucia. I know that I'll always have a good knight...as my friend." Elincia finally pulled away from the hug. "Go rest. Thanks again."

Jacob smiled and bowed. "It was all my pleasure, Queen Elincia."

Elincia giggled for a quick moment and turned and walked down the street. Jacob then turned and placed a hand on her hip. "Now, where's the group I was just traveling with? Perhaps they retired to the inn. I shall check there then." Jacob walked down and looked for the inn.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Meanwhile.....

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Jacob walked casually down the street, looking for where her friends might be.

"I imagine they might have found an inn by now. Perhaps I should start there." she said. Walking down, having pretty much no problems walking in her heeled boots now, Jacob spotted an inn to her right. "Ah, that might be it."

She opened the door and walked right in, seeing Celica and Greg resting in the lobby. Celica turned her head, smiled, and waved Jacob over. Greg was reading another book and didn't notice. Celica went over to her.

"Hey Greg, Jacob is back." she said, shaking Greg's head a bit. Greg seemed to snap out of something and looked over at Jacob.

"Oh hello, didn't see you there." said Greg before turning her attention back to the book. Jacob smiled and took a seat near them. She looked around for the others, but didn't see them at all.

"Where are the others?" asked Jacob. Celica seemed to notice the tone Jacob was speaking with. She imagined that he was acting like this woman again.

"Lucina went out to see what Cynthia was up to. We don't want to go too far now." said Celica.

"That's reasonable." sighed Jacob.

"So what have you been up to Jacob?" asked Celica. The mention of the name seemed to briefly bring Jacob back to her senses, although it wasn't much.

"Huh? Oh, I've just been looking around. Seeing the stores and all." she explained. Celica nodded.

"That sounds good." said Celica.

With that, Celica excused herself as she had to go relieve herself for a bit, leaving Jacob alone with Greg.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Jacob finds the inn.

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Cynthia had gotten Acheaus from the stable as Est and Catria got their's. A few moments later they were flying right outside the city. "So, you two want to train in any way in particular?" Cynthia asked her sisters as they flew by each other.

"I was hoping to train Est a bit in dodging and attacking," Catria said. Est gave a determined nod after that.

"We'll alright then," Cynthia said. "I'll sit out and let you two start."

Catria nodded as she flew lower than Est. "Alright Est, I wanna see you try to attack me." Catria said.

Est smiled with a determined grin and replied, "Okay! Watch out," she said as she moved towards Catria with an iron lance ready. She was moving side to side then lunged forward at Catria. Catria however had moved out of the way and dodged her attack.

"Hey!" Est pouted as Catria flew higher than Est.

"You did a good job, but you lunged to early. That gave me time to react and move out of the way." Catria stated very clearly. "Now, let's see you try to dodge this!"

Catria lunged forward and rushed at Est. Est was already on the move and trying to dodge, allowing Catria to track her. But Est made a sharp turn and dodged. However, this startled her Pegasus and she lost her grip and fell off. She was falling until she felt something hit her. She opened her eyes and saw Palla looking at her, holding her in her arms. "You alright?" Cynthia asked worried.

Est smiled and nodded and gave Cynthia another hug. Cynthia put Est on her Pegasus and flew up to Catria. "Alright, now me and Catria will train."

They trained for awhile until landing again. Cynthia said bye to Est and Catria, as she went to put Acheaus in the stable. After she did that, she saw Lucina walk up to her. "Cynthia! I was wondering where you were." Lucina said relieved.

"Well I'm here, what is it Lucina?" Cynthia asked curiously.

"Me, Greg and Celica rented a room at an inn. I think we should stay together for the rest of the night." Lucina inquired.

Cynthia nodded, "Smart. Alright, let's go."

Lucina still felt odd around Cynthia. She was like a completely different person. "Well, at least the night is calming. I remember back when I was in the Lorca tribe's camp. They had a celebration on one of the greatest nights I'd seen. The stars were shining so bright I-" Lucina stopped and shook her head.

Cynthia stopped for a moment. "You alright Lucina?"

Lucina nodded, "Yes. Thank you, let's just find the inn."

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: With the others

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
After Cynthia bid farewell to her "sisters" for the night, the two of them walked back to the inn. Cynthia seemed a bit worried though.

"You think it's alright for me to leave them behind?" she asked Lucina.

"I think they'll be okay. They said they'll still be here tomorrow." said Lucina. "However, I think they have something to tell you tomorrow, but I don't know what." she added.

"I see." said Cynthia, giving a gentle smile.

Oddly enough, Lucina was still really worried about Cynthia's shifting change in tone, although a part of her wasn't having a problem with it. Was it because of the influence of her own transformation? She wasn't sure.

Anyway, the two girls made it back to the inn, where the others were just having a bite to eat. They waved the two over.

"Here, have some." offered Celica.

"Thank you." smiled Cynthia as she took a bowl and a seat. Lucina did the same. However, she noticed that Jacob wasn't there.

"Where's Jacob?" she asked.

"He felt like going to bed a little early. Guess he felt a bit tired." muttered Greg.

"That's understandable." nodded Cynthia.

"So, you feeling okay Cynthia?" asked Celica.

"Of course. Why do you ask?" asked Cynthia.

"Oh nothing." replied Celica, deciding to drop it for now. Eventually, after a few minutes, Greg and Celica left. Cynthia soon got up as well as Lucina.

"You know, you've been acting a bit strange lately." said Lucina. "Normally, you're all about being a hero and all that, and letting everyone know about it."

Cynthia turned to her. "Well, as a pegasus knight, I have responsibilities. I have to put my comrades before such things. Don't you agree?" she asked.

Lucina saw much sense in that. It just didn't feel like Cynthia."I guess I do." she said.

"Okay, well I'm retiring for the night." smiled Cynthia as she walked to the next floor. Lucina began to follow her until she got an odd sensation, like she left something outside. She took a walk outside, as if she was looking for something, until she got to the edge of town near a forest. For some reason, she smiled as she saw that and laid down near a tree, seeing the cloudless sky above her.

"Hmm, this feels better." said Lucina as she just watched the night sky, eventually dozing off. Thank goodness it was a warm night.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: They return to the inn

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Jacob woke up early the next day and stood up. She stretched her arms and saw everyone asleep but Greg, who was reading another book. "Morning," Jacob greeted.

Greg looked up from her book, only a little startled. "Oh, morning Jacob." Greg said and smiled.

Jacob donned her white coat and garbs and walked toward the door. "I must head back to town. I find the rest of you later," Jacob said as she waved.

Greg looked up from his book and nodded, "All right, just don't stray to far from the city."

Jacob nodded and left, entering the city again. She stopped by a vendor and grabbed a quick bite to eat before leaving. Jacob walked through the streets and moved toward one of the palace-like buildings. She recognized the Crimean styling from anywhere. She knocked on the red doors three times swiftly as she waited for an answer. The doors opened as a man in Crimean armor stood there, "Lucia. Queen Elincia thought you'd show up."

Jacob nodded, "Of course. It's might duty to be at my Queen's side." The man nodded and walked Jacob to one of the larger rooms. Elincia sat at the other end as one of the soldiers left.

"Lucia. It's so good to see you." Elincia answered, offering Jacob a seat.

Jacob smiled and moved toward the seat, "The pleasure is all m-" Jacob stopped. She sensed something was wrong.

They weren't alone.

Jacob spun around, pulling Balmung from it's sheath and ducked as a Killing Edge cut off some of her hair, making it much shorter. She then swung at an assassin who had dropped from to ceiling rafters. She dropped the man in a fell swing. Elincia gasped as the man fell. "Milady! Are you alright? We must get you out of-" Jacob was saying when something stopped her mid-sentence.

That something being an arrow that tore through her gut. She grunted and fell to her knees as a second assassin out his bow away as he dropped from the rafters and pulled a dagger out. Jacob saw him coming, but knew that this could not stop her from protecting Queen Elincia.

As soon as the man reached her, she knocked him down as she threw herself into him. The man grunted and fell as he dropped his weapon. Jacob then grabbed the weapon and brought it down on him. All was silent, until the footsteps of Crimean guards was heard getting closer.

"Lucia!" Elincia called out, catching Jacob before she collapsed. The arrow had gone through her gut and was bleeding profusely. "Get a healer!" Elincia called out.

Jacob's vision was getting blurry. She felt blood trickle from the corner of her mouth. "M-milady....b-be....s-s-safe...." Jacob then fell unconscious.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: The Next Day

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Meanwhile, the others were just beginning to wake up.

"Where's Lucina and Jacob?" asked Celica as she got up.

"Jacob went out somewhere, but I don't know exactly. Lucina I believe spent the night outside. Guess she liked it since she never came inside." said Greg, her gaze not leaving her book.

"Is that a good book? You've had your nose in it all of yesterday too." said Celica.

"Yes, it's pretty fascinating. I never had anything against books, but they have some truly fascinating ones here. There's a lot on battle strategy. Perhaps I can use this when I go back to King Marth and....." Greg said the last part a little lower to himself, King Marth and some other guy appearing in his mind.

"What was that Greg?" asked Celica.

"Oh, it's nothing." said Greg, her face turning a bit red but she went back to her book anyway.

"This world is really having quite the effect, although I guess I can see why. Unlike all the other realms, this one is really relaxing." said Celica as she sat on her bed. "Honestly, I could probably see myself staying here long-term, although I imagine Alm might get really worried if I do that." said Celica, still unaware of her own status as an Einherjar. Anyway, she looked to the other side of the room and saw Cynthia wiping down her Gradivus.

"What are you up too?" asked Celica with a smile. Cynthia smiled back.

"Gradivus was looking a little dirty, so I'm wiping it down." said Cynthia.

As odd as Cynthia acting so mature was, Celica couldn't help but admire it a little bit. Sure, Cynthia hardly acted like herself, but she seemed a lot more capable and stronger now. It was a bit on conflict for Celica. You could make the argument that Cynthia was now achieving more than she would have before: leading a pegasus knight squadron, being well-known for her deeds rather than her clumsiness, and everyone in the land seemed to love her for it. Believe it or not, in a matter of speaking, Cynthia was achieving her dream in some way or form.

Which was what made it hard for Celica to say anything wrong about it.

"Well, she's enjoying it for now, so I see no reason to tell her not to." said Celica as she went down to get herself something to eat. She was hungry.

Soon enough, Cynthia got up too. "Greg, I'm going to go meet my sisters after I eat, okay?" she informed.

"Sure sure." said Greg while waving her hand.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Greg and the others.

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Lucina opened her eyes to see the light-orange and blue sky above her, being early in the morning. She stretched her arms and yawned, then realized she was under a tree. "Did I really sleep out here instead of the inn?" She thought.

Granted, it was very comfortable under the tree, but it just surprised her that she was able to. She stood and smiled, she walked back toward the city and eventually found her inn. She entered and headed to the room they had and saw Greg still reading. "Hey there," Lucina smiled.

Greg looked up from the book yet again and smiled, "Hey Lucina." She replied as she read again.

Lucina looked around and noticed it was just Greg. "Where'd the others head off to?"

"Jacob left to town early this morning, but I'm not sure why. Celica was going to look at a few more shops, and Cynthia was gonna meet with Est and Catria." Greg finished.

Lucina nodded and walked to a mirror, she walked in and saw everything perfectly normal as she began to l-.

She doubled back and saw herself in Lyn's body. She looked again and held a hand to her head. 'D-Did I really think Lyn is the real me?' She thought to herself. She couldn't complain though, it really did feel like her body now. She couldn't help but grin. She then walked out and went to the door, "I'm gonna see where Jacob and the others are ok?" Lucina said.

Greg nodded, "I'll be here." She said, her nose in the book.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Outside with Lucina

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Jacob opened her eyes slowly, both because of her weakness and her eyes adjusting to the light. She woke up and some soft bed by the looks of it. She could only remember what happened in bits. There were assassins, and Queen Elincia, and-.

Queen Elincia! Jacob tried to sit up but fell back down in pain as it radiated from her gut. She looked and realized the first white coat was gone and she was just in the white suit underneath. She saw bandages wrapped around her middle as they had a red blotch on them. Just then he saw someone next to his side. Queen Elincia.

"E-Elincia...are y-you hurt? Did-?" Jacob began until Elincia placed an arm on her shoulder.

"I'm fine Lucia. You though, took a nasty arrow in your gut protecting me. Barbed and everything, the healers I had were only able to partially heal it. But....thank you, Lucia." Elincia said smiling an radiant smile.

Jacob looked tired, but kept her determined mindset. "It's my duty, milady. I would cast my life out in order to save yours." Jacob said.

Elincia smiled even more as she felt Jacob's hair down mid-way to her neck, since it was cut by the assassin. "Lucia. Please don't speak like that."

Jacob returned her a confused look, "Did I t-trouble you, m-milady?" She asked, still recovering from the wound.

"You're a good friend Lucia. I know that you are a knight, a profession that risks your life every moment. But don't just waste fully cast your life away for mine. You mean just as much to me as I do to you, Lucia. Thank you." Elincia said. She cupped one of Jacob's hands in her own.

Jacob smiled, and her face did get red a little. "Th-thank you, m-milady. I..." Jacob began when Elincia stopped her.

"Shh. You need rest," Elincia said. But before she could leave, Jacob stopped her.

"Wait. M-my friends need t-to know I'm here. Could you find them and tell them?" Jacob asked.

Elincia smiled, "I'll send a few men to deliver the message." Jacob smiled and gave Elincia Greg's and the others appearance as she finally left Jacob alone.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Jacob

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Meanwhile, as things were going on, Cynthia had retrieved Archeus from the stable, bringing him along with her outside town. She figured that Catria and Est would already be out there. She got her answer soon enough when she saw two pegasi flying around with them on. Cynthia smiled and waved up to them, to which they descended and landed down on the ground to talk.

"Good morning, how was your night?" asked Cynthia.

"Good enough. Thank goodness there were 2 beds, because I wouldn't have been able to stand Est's constant fidgeting." groaned Catria.

"Hey!" retorted Est. Cynthia lightly giggled at them.

"Well, that's nice." smiled Cynthia. "By the way, Lucina told me that you two were considering telling me something?" she asked.

Catria raised an eyebrow before gasping lightly. "Oh right, now I remember. I did have something to say." she said.

"Well, what is it?" asked Cynthia.

"Well, first I wanted to ask about those people you were traveling with. Who are they exactly?" she asked.

"Oh, they're friends. Very good friends. I met them along the way. Seen some fascinating places with them." smiled Cynthia.

"Is that a fact." said Catria. "Well, they seem like good people. Anyway, I was thinking that we should head back to the other side of the island. King Marth is a nice man, but I'm not sure if we should be taking too much time off. We have to set an example after all. Well, you and me anyway." said Catria.

"Hey, I can be an example too!" pouted Est.

"An example of recklessness maybe." replied Catria.

"Alright enough you too." replied Cynthia, not missing a beat with Catria's suggestion. "Anyway, that doesn't sound like a bad idea..." said Cynthia.

She trailed off a bit near the end, as she seemed to have second thoughts. Was she doing the right thing here? What about Lucina? She was her sister too right? Maybe she should bring her along as well.

"Would it be alright if we brought someone along? There's at least one person I'd like to introduce to everyone back home." said Cynthia.

"Of course. I don't see why not." replied Catria.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Cynthia

choices: The trip to the other city.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Greg was still reading her books outside the inn, as she wanted to enjoy some fresh air. The books were incredibly engrossing to her.

"Wow, I never would have thought of that...." she said as she nibbled on some snacks from the inn. To be honest, she was a bit worried about how much his Katarina persona was affecting her, but she couldn't see a problem so far. If anything, a little learning could go a long way. However, she was soon interrupted as she saw Cynthia approached.

"Oh hello Cynthia. You done with your sisters already?" asked Greg as if it was natural.

"Not quite. I have to go somewhere for a bit. I was wondering where if you've seen Lucina nearby. I'd like to take her with me." said Cynthia.

"Sure, she's...." started Greg before Celica came running.

"What's wrong Celica?" asked Cynthia.

"Jacob's been hurt. He's at the castle right now. I just heard from a messenger." said Celica, a bit out of breath.

"Oh dear, that's awful." said Cynthia with a sad look. Greg closed her book and put it in he pack with the others.

"I'll go with Celica and sort this out. Lucina should be around one of those stores right now." said Greg. At seeing Cynthia's worried look, she continued. "Don't worry, it doesn't sound too bad. Celica and I will just take care of things ourselves. You grab Lucina and do whatever you want to do. You don't have to worry." smiled Greg.

"Well, if you insist. Please take good care of him." said Cynthia as she ran off to find Lucina. Greg and Celica ran towards the castle.

After a bit, Cynthia found Lucina at one of the stores.

"Oh Lucina, I have something to ask of you." said Cynthia.

"And what is that?" asked Lucina.

"My sisters and I are taking a short trip over to the town on the other side of the island, where King Marth is. I'd love it if you would join us." smiled Cynthia, her new knightly persona still on right now.

The thought of meeting King Marth struck an odd cord within Lucina, but she shrugged it off.

"Sure, why not." said Lucina, allowing Cynthia to bring her along for the ride.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Back to the town

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
After Greg and Celica passed by the other Crimean knights at the gate, they were led into a bedroom, Jacob laying on the bed. One of the guards entered and explained what happened and informed them that they gave her a herb to help her sleep, so when she wakes, she could be a little drowsy. They sat by the bed for awhile. Greg wondered why Jacob's hair was shorter now. They sat there for a few minutes when Jacob began stirring...

----------
