Her body pretty much felt like a puddle, not bringing her to be able to move much. She remembered the herb they gave her. Just...not what it did. She heard a soft voice say her name. "Jacob," Celica said quietly. That seemed to snap Jacob back as she forced herself to open her eyes. She lolled her head to the right and saw Greg and Celica sitting there.

"Oh...H-hey, guys.." Jacob said, she tried to reach toward them but barely moved her hand. Celica reached out and took her hand a squeezed it lightly. She was glad Jacob seemed okay.

Greg smiled and patted Jacob on the shoulder lightly. "Back with the living?" Greg asked smiling. Jacob was able to give a smile back. "But, I mean what happened?"

Jacob tried to look at them, but the herb was still working a little bit. But as Jacob remembered what happened and Queen Elincia, Lucia came back. "I..protected Queen Elinica from t-two men w-who wished to do harm." Jacob replied. Then "Jacob" still remembered Lucina and Cynthia. "W-where are Lucina and Cynthia?"

"Cynthia was looking for Lucina. They're still in town," Greg said back. Just then, Queen Elincia entered as well. This brought Lucia back in Jacob's head.

"M-milady..." Jacob got out.

"These are your friends, I assume?" Elincia said, smiling radiantly. She then bowed, "A pleasure."

Greg and Celica both bowed back, "Majesty." Celica addressed.

Elincia turned back toward Jacob. "Lucia, are you feeling a little better?"

Jacob pulled then pushed her head to turn to the other side of the bed and see Elincia. "I...think, yes."

Elincia smiled and nodded. "Good. Lucia, I'm sorry, but you should leave until you recover."

Jacob looked back, still trying to look determined, "What? Why...?"

"If those men attack, I can't have one of my finest knights unable to defend against them. Is there somewhere you could go?" Elincia asked.

Celica stepped forward and said, "I can bring her back with us. We can take care of her."

"Good," Elincia said, turning back to Jacob. "You'll stay with your friends until you're better."

"B-but....m-milady..?" Jacob stuttered out. She was burning up and shivering now.

Elincia put a hand on her head, "Shhh...Please rest, Lucia."

A determined look grew on Celica's face, "Don't worry Highness. I'll take care of her."

They pulled away the sheets and, to everyone's surprise, including Celica's, she was able to pick Jacob up. Jacob laid in Celica's arms and leaned against her. They then left and departed for the inn. They entered a few minutes later and laid Jacob on one of the beds.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: To the castle

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Celica sat in a chair next to Jacob as she looked the wound over. "Looks like that arrow did a lot damage. You're lucky you didn't bleed out." Celica said.

"I guess I am," Jacob replied. From the words that came out and how he said it, they understood that it was actually Jacob. Celica began to heal Jacob as she laid there.

Greg was still reading, when she looked up from her book and realized something. Jacob's blue aura that surrounded him was fading. It was now a dim blue glow, barely noticeable. Greg cast it aside as a simple thing they occurred with Einherjar and continued reading.

Jacob looked from side to side as she laid. She looked over at Greg and saw that she had an aura glow around her like he did. However, her's looked dim. Jacob thought it could be the injury making her see things or if it was just lighting, but she ignored it.

Celica finished healing a few minutes later, but Jacob was still dreary from the herb's effect. She sat up as Celica kept her balanced. "Where's Cynthia and Lucina?" Jacob asked.

"Not sure," Greg replied not looking up from the book.

Celica then spoke up with, "Oh! I meant to tell you two, but in town, I heard that a city across from here is where King Marth resides."

Greg looked up from her book at Celica, "That's great! I can finally share these tactics with him and then we'll-" Greg stopped.

"You alright there?" Jacob asked, worried.

"I'm alright," Greg replied. He knew that the Katarina persona was growing stronger and-.....I mean, it can't be that bad. What's the worse that could happen?

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Celica tends to Jacob

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Meanwhile, while the group settled back at the inn, Cynthia and the others were flying towards the other side of the island. As they did, Lucina often looked down at the landscape.

"Funny, the outline of the island seems to resemble Talys, but each side of the island has a ruler. Fascinating." said Lucina. Cynthia turned back and smiled.

"If you liked Norna, then you'll enjoy Irena too." she said.

"Huh?" asked Lucina.

"Norna was the city we were in. Irena is the other city, where King Marth is." explained Cynthia.

"Oh, I see." nodded Lucina. "So, about how long is it from each side of the island to the other?" she asked.

"On foot, it's about a day. On a pegasus, about an hour or two." said Cynthia.

"How convenient. Reminds me of when Florina would...." stopped Lucina before she went further.

"Are you alright?" asked Cynthia.

"I'm okay. Are you feeling alright Cynthia?" asked Lucina. Cynthia just smiled back.

"Of course I am. I'm really enjoying my time here, and I have a lovely family to protect." she smiled. Lucina couldn't argue with that, although the knightly tone still felt off. However, looking at Cynthia, Lucina nodded the Einherjar glow dimming a bit. She still glowed, but it seemed to be smaller than before.

"What does that mean?" wondered Lucina.

Anyway, after a couple of breaks, Cynthia pointed out where Irena was.

"There it is." she pointed to a city that looked a bit like Norna, with some minor differences. Lucina gasped in awe.

"Wow, it looks amazing." she smiled.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Cynthia, Est, Catria and Lucina

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Alright, we're finally here." said Catria as they all began to descend to the ground. Their mounts made a graceful landing just outside the city.

"Let's head straight to the castle. We can give these guys some much needed R&R after the flight here." said Catria as she dismounted.

"A good idea." said Cynthia as she got off her mount too, helping Lucina off. Once they were all off, they walked into the city, just as busy and crowded as Norna. The sisters got quite a few waves from the crowd, and they waved back happily.

"Wow, you're like celebrities here." said Lucina.

"Nah, I think it's more about Palla." said Catria. "She is the lead of the pegasus knights after all. She's like a hero to everyone here." she added.

"Yeah, it's pretty awesome." smiled Est.

Lucina smiled softly at Cynthia, who seemed to take in the praise happily. She did smile a bit. People hailed her as a hero here, despite her not really being herself, but Lucina couldn't really bring herself to deny her what she had gotten here.

"Well, come on, let's go." said Est, going ahead with her pegasus.

The others all followed her, making their way towards the castle. They made a slight detour to head towards the royal barracks where they could let their mounts go for now. Cynthia gave Achaeus a nice brushing before leaving.

"Okay, he should still in the castle right now, so let's go." said Catria, already on her way.

"Wait up sis!" followed Est.

"They're so eager." smiled Cynthia, calmly following them with Lucina in tow.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Landing in Irena

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
They walked through large doors as they reached a long hallway with a throne at the end. Sitting there was King Marth.

Lucina gasped for a moment. It was him. The man she made her name from right there. The Legendary Marth. She regained composure quickly, and walked up alongside the Pegasus riders. They stood a bit away from the throne before they all kneeled. "We've returned, Sir." Cynthia said.

"That's evident. I could hear the crowds from here," Marth chuckled. He stood and walked toward them. He stopped when he saw Lucina. "Palla, who's your friend here?" Marth asked.

Cynthia stood along with her "sisters". "This is my friend, Lyn." Cynthia said with a smile. Lucina felt weird having been called "friend" instead of "sister" by Cynthia, but she understood why.

Marth smiled a radiant one, "It's a pleasure to meet you, Lyn." He then turned back to the Pegasus knights, "I'm glad you finally returned. For now, you're free to act as you wish until needed. Rooms here have been offered for you to stay in." Marth smiled. "You can go now."

Cynthia turned and saw an excited look on Est's face. She was glad Est was able to control herself. She raised her well as an older sis-.

Something about that sentence felt off as she said. She nodded toward Marth as they turned and left. Lucina was thinking along with Cynthia if they should stay or head back to Noma.

What do they decide?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Meeting Marth

choices: Lucina sees something in the distance
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Hey Cynthia.." started Lucina. The name seemed to catch Cynthia a bit off-guard, but she responded.

"Yes?" she said.

"Perhaps we should head back to Norna now. I'm a bit worried about the others." said Lucina.

"That's a good decision. I'll go retrieve my pegasus and we'll be off." smiled Cynthia. Lucina nodded in thanks.

"Thanks. At the very least, we'll have to talk about what to do. I mean, this realm is very....comfortable." said Lucina.

"You're right. It feels like I have a home here. I have you and my sisters with me." said Cynthia. Lucina nodded a bit at being called a friend again essentially, but she honestly didn't seem to mind that much. Then, Cynthia spoke up again.

"Perhaps we should talk with King Marth again once we get back. You can talk with him all you want." said Cynthia, making Lucina blush a bit.

"D-Don't say weird things. I mean, he is the Hero King...." Lucina trailed off before turning her back and leaving, Cynthia giggling behind her.

Soon enough, they had retrieved Archaeus, and were soon on their way. Cynthia said a brief good bye to her sisters with the promise of coming back once her errands were done.

"I just remembered, we should bring Katarina the next time. I imagine she has much to tell King Marth." smiled Cynthia. Lucina looked a bit confused at the statement before remembering.

"Oh right, Greg. I forgot about that. Yeah, we should bring her too. She's almost like how Lucia is to Queen Elincia." said Lucina.

"Of course." smiled Cynthia as they continued on their way.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Back to Norna

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
They landed back in Norna just a little ways outside the city. They walked back through and put Achaeus into a stable before they returned to their inn. They walked in and saw Jacob sitting up now, stretching. Celica was looking out the window, enjoying the view. And Greg was still reading to her heart's content. "Hey guys," Lucina says with a smile.

Jacob and the others turn to see her as they all greet her. "Where were you guys," Jacob asked.

"We visited King Marth on the other side of the island," Cynthia said. "We were thinking of taking you guys there sometime."

"Yeah!" Greg said, "I get to see him again! And now, from all these books, I'll be so much more-" she stopped again and Jacob walked over.

"Don't worry Katarina. We'll be able to see King Marth with Lyn and Palla soon." Jacob said. Lucina saw something wrong. All their auras have almost vanished, only being seen through their motions. Glancing at Celica, she saw she had the same thought too.

"Hey, guys," Lucina asked. "Maybe we should find that Outrealm gate and get-" Lucina then had a sudden reconsideration. 'Why? In fact, maybe some of my friends from Sacae are here.' She thought as she warmed up to the idea.

Celica saw what was happening. She needed to get then out of the realm. And fast.

Is she able to though?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: In Norna again

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Oh man, what is going on?" muttered Celica as she watched the auras grow smaller. She needed to talk to them somehow. She didn't know if she could talk to all of them. Almost instantly, she grabbed Greg and pulled her over to another room.

"What was that about?" asked Lucina.

"I don't know." said Cynthia.

Over in the other room, Celica had to catch her breath after the sudden rush.

"Are you okay? Is there something wrong?" asked Greg.

"Something is wrong. I fear that we're getting sidetracked. What if that dark rider comes and finds us here? And these new forms are affecting the way you think. If we don't leave, what if you guys stay this way forever?" she asked.

Greg seemed to think it over, although the diminishing aura didn't help Celica.

"I...I still remember Celica." said Greg. "It's just that, you're right. This world is pretty comfortable. Somehow it feels like these roles took everything we liked about ourselves before and made them better." said Greg.

"I...I guess that's true. But, you were a guy. Can you really be a girl the rest of your life?" asked Celica.

"Well, I'm kind of thinking like a girl right now, so I guess I'd be able to live with it. I can't quite explain, but if I were to use percentages, I'd say only about 10-15% of me is the same as before. Most of me is really liking being Katarina." said Greg, feeling a bit uneasy trying to explain. Celica actually smiled. It sounded like Greg wasn't being totally erased here, so she didn't have to worry about that.

"You like being a strategist for King Marth? I thought you didn't like being in wars." she giggled.

"Hey, it's an honor fighting for King Marth! He gave me a second chance, even after I..." started Greg before stopping. Memories of being part of a group of assassins filled her head, but she always saw Marth saving her and making her his top tactician.

"After you what?" asked Celica, a bit curious.

"Nothing important." said Greg, shaking her head. "But maybe we don't need to rush. I may be Katarina right now, but I still haven't forgotten everything. It's just been...pushed aside I guess. I clearly remember a family here, but I can still remember Karen and the others back in Kiradia." she said.

Celica nodded, sighing as well.

"I guess it's not too much of a problem. But I do worry about getting too used to it. I'm not sure about Palla...." said Celica before her hands covered her mouth. "Oh no, now I'm calling her that." she worried.

"Well, it is her name so to speak." said Greg. "How about we go to Irena now? I really should go see King Marth."
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: She doesn't

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Celica sighed. This was just weird now.

"Fine." she said finally, making Greg smile. With that Greg grabbed Celica's hand and brought her back out to where everyone else was, their auras still just barely visible. Celica imagined they might disappear any minute now. Cynthia smiled as she looked at them.

"Ah Katarina. Are you and Celica alright?" she asked honestly.

"It's alright. Celica just had some worries." said Greg, walking over to pick her books up. "Anyway, you think he could soon head back Irena? I think I should get back to King Marth." she said.

"Sure, but how about some lunch first? Acheaus is a little worn out from backing the trip two times in one day." said Cynthia.

"Good idea Palla." said Greg. Celica sighed again. It was nice that they were enjoying this, but she did wonder how long it would go on. Then again, they had only been there a day or 2. Spending some time there wasn't going to kill them, unless the rider came around.

Anyway, the group settled for some lunch later on. Celica kept a watch on the auras which were still hanging by a thread.

"By the way, I think I'm going to take a trip back up to the castle after we're done here." said Jacob.

"I figured you would." said Lucina. "Just make sure the coast is clear when you do." she added.

"No problem. What will you do Lyn?" asked Jacob.

"Well, I'm not sure. I'm interesting in seeing Irena again, but we shouldn't tax Achaeus with 3 passengers. Maybe I'll go out and explore and see if there are any other towns. I'd like to find some of my other friends." said Lucina.

"Sounds good." said Cynthia.

"Celica, would you like to come with me?" asked Lucina.

"Sure, I guess." said Celica. She figured she might as well stay with one of them.

After that, everyone went their separate ways for the day; Jacob heading to the castle, Lucina and Celica heading out of town, and Greg and Cynthia heading back to Irena.

"King Marth will be glad to see you finally return." smiled Cynthia.

"Really? It's been a while. I hope he hasn't forgotten me." said Greg.

"I don't think that will be an issue." smiled Cynthia.

"Thanks Palla." smiled Greg as they flew back through the sky, the sun in it's late afternoon phase.

Who to follow right now?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Celica lets it go

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Jacob walked back to the Crimean doors housing Queen Elincia. She knocked on the door three times before a guard opened it. The guard seemed surprised, but knew why she was here. "This way," he said.

They were led to a similar room that had a throne-like seat, Queen Elincia sitting upon it. She seemed surprised to see Lucia, but smiled all the same. Lucia stood in front of the throne and her queen and bowed. "Lucia. It looks like you've recovered well," Elincia said.

"Yes. And, may I add milady, that you seem safer," Lucia said rising from her bow.

Elincia sat back in her throne. "I am now. After what happened, I had guards tighten down the security." Elincia then stood and walked toward Lucia, straight as could be. "Thank you, for saving me."

"It's the knight's honor to serve her Queen, milady. There's no need for thanks." Lucia replied.

Elincia smiled then said, "But with you, I must thank you. And I am offering you leave."

Lucia looked up surprised. "Milady?"

"You deserve it Lucia. You work yourself to the bone protecting me. I won't be able to take no for an answer. And I'll be fine."

Lucia was worried, but trusted her Queen. "Very well," she said and nodded. She wondered what to do when she got an idea. "Milady. Could I acquire a horse from our stables?"

------------

Lucia rode out of Norna and toward the city of Irena, where King Marth is. She also realized that she felt...well, better. For awhile she thought she saw a blue aura around her, but it was gone now...

...and so was Jacob.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: "Lucia" heading back to the castle

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Palla and Cynthia landed just a ways outside of Irena as Palla dismounted and walked Achaeus through the city, Katarina still riding on top of the Pegasus.

"We just need to stop by the royal stables to put Achaeus in and then we can see King Marth," Palla said.

Katarina could barely contain her excitement, which she showed. "Really? Oh I can't wait! I learned so much since we last met!"

Palla smiled. A few people greeted her as they passed through the streets. Palla also wondered where her sisters are. She could deal with it later as she continued.

While still riding Achaeus, Katarina continued reading. She wasn't as focused on it though, just excited about getting to see King Marth again. It's been...how long?

Palla soon entered the royal stables with Achaeus and Katarina. She looked and saw that the two pens next to hers were empty. Est and Catria must be out. Palla put Achaeus in the pen as Katarina jumped off Achaeus and ran to the gates into the castle. Palla and Katarina noticed something about one another as well. They each had lost what they thought was a blue glow around each of them. They were glad to know everything was "normal".

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Katarina and Palla

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Excuse me. I'm here to see King Marth." bowed Katarina as she approached the gate. The guard nodded, obviously recognizing her and allowing her in. Palla came in right behind her.

"Why are you going to do?" asked Katarina.

"I'm thinking of heading down to the training barracks. It's been a while since I've seen the younger pegasus knight recruits." said Palla.

"Good idea. They often run like chickens without you." smiled Katarina.

"Unfortunately, that seems to be the case." sighed Palla as she took her leave of Katarina and went a different route in the castle. With that out of the way, Katarina walked forward, looking for the throne room, where Marth most likely was.

"Ah, here it is." she smiled as she opened a larger pair of doors. True enough, the blue-haired king was right there, just finishing up with someone else.

"Ah Katarina, good to see you again after so long." smiled Marth. Katarina smiled as she and Marth shared a brief hug.

"It's great to be back milord. I've learned so much since leaving Irena." she smiled.

"Heh, that's good to know, but I'm more glad that you enjoyed yourself." said Marth.

"Would you like me to report my findings to you now?" asked Katarina.

"That kind of business isn't necessary right now. For now, how about we walk and chat. I'd rather learn more about your journey more than the war information." smiled Marth, making Katarina giggle.

"Of course milord." she said.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Palla, Katarina, and Marth

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Celica and Lyn were still traveling down a road, enjoying the landscape. Celica noticed that Lyn seemed to be really enjoying the view and everything. She smiled, as least Lyn was happy.

"What's got you so happy?" Celica asked grinning.

Lyn turned back to her and smiled, "Land like this, untouched by blood, battle or war...it's beautiful." Lyn said.

Celica couldn't help but agree. She then looked back to Lyn, "I guess there weren't a lot of places like this back in Ylisse huh?" Celica asked.

Lyn turned, a look of confusion on he face. "Ylisse?"

"Yeah. Remember?" Celica said, now curious as to why she didn't remember right away.

"It...it sounds familiar. But I'm not sure from where." Lyn replied.

Celica was now seriously worried. She didn't remember where she was from? How could that-? Celica then asked Lyn, "Where are you from?"

Lyn turned, "I was part of the Lorca tribe, but then I was revealed to be a Noblewoman of Sacae." Lyn replied.

That was all Celica needed. She needed to get them through an Outrealm gate. And fast. "Come on!" She called and ran down a fork in the road leading towards Irena.

"Where are we going?" Yelled Lyn, wondering what was happening as she followed her from behind.

"I'll explain. Just hurry up please." Celica yelled as the two hurried from where they were to Irena.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: With Lyn and Celica

choices: Celica and Lyn arrive much later on
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Meanwhile, thanks to horse travel making things a bit quicker, Lucia arrived in Irena pretty quickly.

"Hmm, I wonder where everyone else is." she wondered as she left the horse in a nearby sable and left it there to be taken care of. She then walked into the city, soon finding Palla coming out out of a shop.

"Oh Palla, what are you doing out here?" asked Lucia.

"I was just looking around. It's been a while since I've seen the shops here. I just got done tending to the young knights at the castle." said Palla.

"How are they holding up? Probably not to your high standards." laughed Lucia.

"Not quite. They're trying their hardest. They try too hard whenever I'm watching them.' said Palla.

"Hey guys!" called Katarina as she was running towards them, catching her breath for a bit after she did.

"Oh hi Katarina, what are you doing here? Did you meet with King Marth?" asked Lucia.

"Yes. We talked about much. He said he was quite proud of my work." Katarina giggled, her face blushing a bit.

"Sounds like you'd really like to spend more time with him." grinned Lucia who laughed a bit. Palla held a hand to her mouth as she giggled too, as Katarina's face went even redder at Lucia's remark.

"Hey! I-It's nothing like that! It's....just professional." she said.

"Sure." smirked Lucia, not quite believing it.

Katarina's face resembled a tomato by the time it was over. They ended up deciding to look around some more to get themselves more familiar with Irena's shops.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Jacob arrives in Irena

choices: She tells them about the gate
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Celica entered the city with Lyn as the sun was just starting to set. Celica began to search the city up and down for Palla, Katarina, and Lucia. "What's the rush Celica?" Lyn asked, worried for her friends safety.

Celica turned back. "Oh. Sorry to worry you. I just want to find the others quickly." Celica did some searching and heard of a large stone gate in the plains nearby. She concluded that had to be the Outrealm gate. "Let's keep looking."

She needed to hurry, or else she worried that Jacob, Greg, Lucina, and Cynthia would be lost to these ghosts, with only faint, lingering memories to remember them by.

Celica then found them. They were sitting outside one of the vendors, eating something before they probably got ready for sleep. Celica rushed over to them, Lyn in tow.

Palla saw them coming first, "Oh. Celica, Lyn. I thought you were traveling to another city," Palla asked curious.

"We were, but Celica said there's something important we should do an needed to get you guys. Right?" Lyn asked Celica.

"Right," Celica began. "Listen, we-"

She stopped and looked back at them. All the auras were gone from them as well. Celica didn't know what to do now. Should she even tell then about the gate? Will that fix them? She saw that they were all pretty happy, maybe it wouldn't be that bad. But could she just leave them like this?

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Celica and Lyn arrive much later on

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Celica at least needed to try. "I heard about some structure in the fields nearby. I heard it's suppose to be really helpful." Celica said.

Katarina sat up. "What do you mean by 'helpful'?" She asked.

"I'm not quite sure. They say to pass through it and you'll be better somehow. You guys wanna try it?" Celica could only hope they take the bait.

"I guess we have time," Lucia said as she stood. Katarina and Palla soon followed as they stood as well. "Let's go."

Celica smiled, "Thanks. The field isn't that far out." She stated.

Palla asked of she should bring Achaeus, but Celica said she didn't need to. They then left Irena and moved toward a large ridge that overlooked the city. They got to the top and saw a large stone gate with swirling energy around it. "There!" Celica said as she hurried towards it. The others in tow.

They reached it and looked at it for a moment. "So we just walk through and...that's it?" Lucia asked.

Celica nodded, "Seems like it."

They were quiet until Katarina answered, "Alright then. Let's go." She was obviously intrigued. They all then pushed through the energy and entered the gate.

Now, do they change back to their original selves? Or are they still as their Einherjar?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: She tells them about the gate

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
As Celica and the others passed through, she felt a flash of light go past them. She didn't feel anything at all, but she soon heard groaning behind her. She turned back and smiled at what she saw. Everyone was back to normal. Well, sort of.

Jacob appeared to be a bit smaller than normal, and he wore a myrmidon outfit that was mostly white and gold. He still had Balmung equiped too.

Greg was wearing a grandmaster outfit somewhat similar to Katarina's. His body was also a bit smaller and hie hair was a bit shorter, stylized slightly like Katarinas.

Cynthia was actually a tiny bit taller, and her armor greatly resembled what she wore as Palla, including the heeled boots as well. She definitely looked like she was still a falcon knight. Her facial features seemed a bit sharper too, and Celica noticed that it still retained some of Palla's features.

Finally, there was Lucina. Celica noticed that her hair seemed a bit darker than before, and her armor now slightly resembled Lyn's now. One drastic change though was that the bottom half of Lucina's clothes had become Lyn's, showing off her legs which made her blush a bit.

"So, I'm back?" muttered Greg as Cynthia came over and helped him up. He glanced over at her and saw her smile at him. It still wasn't the usual Cynthia grin, but it was a sweet one that still made Greg blush.

"Oh great, I even class changed." groaned Jacob at his new white outfit. "I hope I don't have to go through another girl experience any time soon." he said.

"I don't know. I actually rather enjoyed that." smiled Greg.

"I beat you did. You were thinking quite heavily about Marth then." smirked Celica.

"Hey, I wasn't quite myself there." said Greg.

"So I guess going to another realm knocked whatever was inside us out." Greg continued.

Anyway, once everyone got their bearings, they continued walking through, until they saw the familiar burst of light that welcomed them to another realm.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Themselves

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Jacob was helping Lucina through the realm. She was particularly weak for some reason. Then they finally reached the gate at walked through as the found a temple. What was odd about it was it's location. They saw a few tiles placed out around the temple's exterior, but the temple was actually just an island. The temple seemed abandoned, but was pretty pristine. Greg turned back and said, "Let's rest here for now."

They all seemed to agree with that. Jacob walked Lucina over to a column and laid her against it. He sat next to he felt her body burning up, but shivering slightly. "You okay Lucina?"

Lucina turned back with a smile that she hoped would keep Jacob from worrying. "Yeah, d-don't worry about..." Lucina stopped as she let out a small cough.

Jacob's face showed a bit of hurt as he wrapped his arms around Lucina. Lucina wasn't sure what to do, but was tired and leaned into Jacob. She laid her head on his chest. She looked over Jacob's new Myrmidon armor while she did. "Nice armor," she commented.

Jacob smiled, "I could say the same for you." Noting the leg wear that Lucina now had, causing her to blush. Then Greg walked over to them.

"Hey. You alright Lucina?" Greg asked.

Lucina nodded with her head on Jacob's chest. "She's just a little tired after what happened," Jacob began. "It was pretty weird though."

"Yeah, I actually became Katarina." Greg noted. "Lucina actually got to be Lyn herself, the Noblewoman of Sacae."

Lucina smiled somewhat. "It was quite the experience I must say."

Jacob smiled and laid a hand on Lucina's hair.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: An abandoned temple

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Soon after Jacob got a meal started with some supplies they still had. Everyone was off on their own devices while he cooked. Greg eventually found Cynthia, standing a little ways away. She hadn't spoken much since the event.

"Are you alright Cynthia? Are you not happy to be back to normal?" asked Greg. Cynthia turned her him, her features looking a little sad. A small smile graced her face.

"I guess....I'm just not feeling very heroic right now." she said.

"Well, you're back to using the word hero. There's a start." said Greg. At that, Cynthia turned her head.

"It's just that, that world wasn't so bad." she said.

"Really? But you became someone else." said Greg.

"True, but....I don't know....Everything I had dreamed to have was there. I had a family, everyone loved me, and I was known for something other than tripping on my feet. And I was the head pegasus knight. Sure, Lucy might not have been my sister there, but we were at least good friends." sighed Cynthia.

"I can understand that. When I was there, I was a top-notch tactician." smiled Greg.

"And you had a crush on Marth." smiled Cynthia. Greg immediately went red.

"T-That was just being a professional. Nothing to do with love." said Greg.

"Oh admit it, at the time, you would have loved it. You were for all intents and purposes a girl, so there was no problem." smiled Cynthia.

".....Don't tell the others." said Greg, face still red.

"Promise." smiled Cynthia. She seemed to have a little vigor back, although she was still more modest. "You know, maybe once our journey is over, maybe we can come back. I can be the head pegasus knight and you get to be by Marth's side again." said Cynthia.

"Something tells me you're having way too much fun with this." groaned Greg.

Cynthia just giggled.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Later on

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
The day passed as the nighttime came quickly, the temple being lit by the torches and fire they made. Celica was already asleep as Greg laid next to Cynthia. He laid there when in her sleep, Cynthia wrapped her arms around Greg and hugged him close. Greg smiled and let her.

Jacob found Lucina, who was barely awake and sat next to her. "Hey..." Jacob whispered.

Lucina looked up and smiled lightly. "Hey."

Jacob sat next to her and laid with her as she leaned against Jacob's chest. Jacob smiled and wrapped his arms around her. He smiled and the two fell asleep.

-----------

Jacob woke up with Lucina still asleep against his chest. He smiled, but smelled something cooking. He picked Lucina up and walked over to the fire where Greg and Celica were eating. "Morning," Greg said, offering them some food.

Jacob smiled and laid Lucina down again and sat by the fire. "Thanks. Where's Cynthia?"

"She finished eating and is looking around the temple," Celica said.

Almost on cue, "Guys! Guys!" Cynthia yelled as she ran from the temple. Greg stood to meet her, actually more like catch her when she almost fell.

"What is it?" Lucina said, as she sat up slowly just waking up.

"There's another one of those gate things in the temple, but it's glowing red." Cynthia said. They all got up and followed her as they saw at the end of one of the hallways in the temple was the gate.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Moving on

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Why is it red?" asked Celica.

"I don't know, but I don't think it's good." said Greg.

"Well, let's not wait in suspense. We gotta get going." said Jacob. Everyone nodded and proceeded to enter through the gate.

"Boy, I hope it doesn't collapse again." said Lucina.

"Oh well, if something happens, Celica can bail us out again." smirked Jacob.

"I won't always be able to help." groaned Celica. Meanwhile, Greg was concerned.

"This space feels warped. I wonder if there's something bad up ahead." said Greg.

"Don't tell me it'll collapse again." said Lucina.

"No, not that. It's just that I feel something evil, but it also feels familiar. I have to know what." said Greg as he began to ran, Celica and Cynthia following behind him. Jacob and Lucina soon followed. Soon enough, they saw the familiar flash of light that signaled the exit.

Once Greg got out, his fears were confirmed. He saw a familiar barren landscape before him, one he knew well.

"Bryyo." he muttered as the others soon joined him. Jacob and Celica gasped, while Cynthia and Lucina were confused.

"What happened here?" asked Cynthia.

Greg went into explanation that he left his village because he felt something evil in the air. Soon, he ended up on Bryyo, where he got tangled up in the war there. Nearly killed him until Celica came around.

"Good thing Celica was around." said Greg.

"I still wonder how I even ended up on Bryyo, but I'm glad I did. Otherwise, Greg might have died." said Celica.

"Quite a story." said Lucina. "Anyway, perhaps we should get going. You want to stay I imagine?" asked Lucina.

"Yeah. I first saw the rider here. I got to know what is going on and end this once and for all." said Greg.

"Agreed. I've got a bone to pick with him too." said Jacob, cracking his knuckles.

"Great, let's go." said Greg, moving the group forward.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: The enter/new realm

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Greg and the others walked across the fire scorched ground and through the smoke filled air. Bryyo hasn't changed. Jacob remembered when Greg summoned him. He thought it couldn't of looked worse, seeing fields of dead men, and Greg when his spine had snapped.

Lucina and Cynthia walked close to Greg and Jacob as they walked through the war infested realm.

They walked until Celica stopped with a terrified look on her face. Greg noticed and hurried to her side. "What's wrong Celica?" They turned and looked and saw a symbol carved in the ground giving off a purple glow. The symbol had six eyes. Three down each side. Lucina's mouth dropped in terror, realizing who and what that seal belonged to.

"No....Grima..." Lucina got out in a wavering voice.

Just then, the symbol flashed and something stood in it's place. A dark horse was ridden by the man that started it all. The horse walked toward them as the man taunted them, "You are a hard bunch to kill."

Greg stepped forward with his blade unsheathed. He approached the rider until the were feet away. Jacob and the others readied behind him. "I'm done. I'm gonna save this realm from you, you Grima-Worshipper!" Greg yelled.

The rider laughed a laugh that should never of existed. He then charged at Greg, but before reaching him the man stopped and rode around Greg in between him and the others. A field of purple energy blocked Greg and Jacob off from Lucina and the others. "Lucina!" Jacob yelled. But was knocked away by the horse colliding into him. He hit the field and yelled in pain before collapsing. The rider then turned his attention to Greg.

"Kneel to Grima!" Screamed the rider as he charged Greg. He didn't know what it was, but he felt a little of Katarina in him saying, "Wait, wait.......Now!"

Greg attacked and struck the horse, which disappeared into a purple fog as the rider fell from it. Greg stopped, thinking he died when the rider stood and held his lance at the ready. Greg charged and swung, the man blocked it, he swung, and Greg blocked it. This went on until the man knocked Greg's weapon down before bringing the spear's blade across Greg's chest.

Greg fell clutching his chest, the man standing above him two hands on the spear ready for the killing blow when he was knocked off balance from behind as Jacob hit the man over the head with Balmung and kicked him away. The man spun and hit Jacob as he fell back. The man turned to Greg.

Big mistake.

Greg had recovered and thrusted his blade through the helmet of the man. It was quiet. He heard the man let out a bloody gurgle then collapse. Then Greg did.

-----------

He awoke and saw a woman standing before him. If it was who he thought it was, he couldn't believe.

Naga.

"You have done it," her voice rang out.

"What do you mean, Naga?"

"The man corrupted the entire Eastern kingdom, sending them to war with the Northern kingdom. With his defeat, peace can return. The Eastern kingdom will accept the Northern's peace treaty and the fighting will end. I grant you my blessing. And your friend Jacob...will be freed of his card." Naga spoke with a smile the entire time.

Greg couldn't believe it, but he couldn't help but smile. "Th-thank you, Naga." Naga smiled and a white light enveloped them.

----------

Greg awoke with Jacob picking him up off the ground. He saw the blue aura around him gone. "Jacob...your.." Greg began before Jacob smiled back.

"Naga told me. Greg....thank you." Jacob said as he helped haul Greg through the smoke toward the others. When they saw them, Cynthia through herself at Greg and hugged him as they laid him down nearby and Celica healed him.

"So..." Greg began. "It's all over....we did it..." Lucina smiled and nodded as they all stayed silent.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Bryyo once again

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"It feels so unreal." said Greg.

"How so?" asked Jacob.

"It feels so long since I started fighting in the Bryyo War, when it's only been a few days. I honestly can't believe it." said Greg.

"I hear you. Feels like forever since I've been really human again." said Jacob, giving Greg a one-armed hug.

"Can't believe all that's happened since I happened to find you in that field." said Greg.

"And then we got 3 princesses dragged along with us." laughed Jacob.

"True." said Greg. Then he turned to said princesses. "Well, what do you want to do? The mission has been completed and you don't have to keep traveling with us." said Greg. All three of them gave him a look that suggested that he was crazy.

"Are you kidding? This has been such an adventure. I'd love to keep traveling and doing...well whatever we have been doing." said Celica.

"I'd love to see more than what my world offered, so count me in." said Lucina.

"And I want to stay with you all too." smiled Cynthia. Greg smiled at them all.

"Well, I'm glad to hear it. Looks like this realm will be okay, so I'd say that we don't have to stay long. Shall we head back through the gate?" suggested Greg. Cynthia spoke up again.

"Yes, we should. Does anyone want to go back to that other realm again?" she suggested.

"What realm?" asked Celica.

"The one we were just in. The reason why we look different." said Cynthia. Celica gasped.

"But don't you remember what happened? You became different people. What if something else happens the next time we go in?" asked Celica.

"Don't worry Celica. I think everything will be okay. Besides, we just defeated the bad guy, so let's unwind and have some fun." laughed Jacob. Celica sighed, but had to admit that the laughing was contagious.

"All right, I guess we can do it. I suppose we've all earned some R&R now." said Celica.

"All right, back to Yorerealm!" said Jacob, with everyone putting their hands up in agreement.

Before long, they were back in the red Outrealm Gate, the conflict finally behind them. Greg had never felt so relieved in his life. It was time for him to have some fun.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Back to the Outrealms

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Soon enough, they stood outside of the gate to Yorerealm once again. They all looked at one another before they entered yet again. They all collapsed but Celica.

--------------

Lucia opened her eyes with a small headache. What happened? She remembered Celica having them walk through a gate and then...it's all a blur from there. She turned and saw Katarina sitting up next to her, with Palla and Lyn next to her. "Everyone alright," Palla said in a worried tone, but received a nod of approval from everyone.

Lucia stood and helped Katarina stand. "Well I better make it back to Queen Elincia." Lucia stated.

"I'll come with," Lyn added as they soon began traveling toward the city of Norna. Palla turned to Katarina.

"We better hurry back to Irena. My sisters are probably looking for me and King Marth may be looking for you." Palla stated. Katarina smiled and nodded as she followed her.

Celica stood back and watched. 'There they go again,' she thought.

Celica knew that Greg and Cynthia would be alright, but Jacob got injured last time. She better tag along with them just in case. "Hey wait up!" Celica called after Lucia and Lyn as they walked to Norna.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Yorerealm once again

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Katarina and Palla walked together towards Irena. Thankfully, it wasn't a long walk there.

"So what are you going to do when we get back?" asked Katarina.

"Might as well get back to my sisters. I'm sure they miss me." said Palla.

"True. I wonder if King Marth is wondering where I am right now." said Katarina. Palla gave a sincere smile.

"I'm sure he thinks you're doing fine. He has a lot of trust in you." said Palla, which made Katarina blush heavily. Before long, the two of them arrived in Irena, some of the people waving as they walked in.

"Palla," she started. "Do you feel as if a massive weight has been lifted off your chest?" asked Katarina.

"You know, I do. I can't quite explain, but I feel better now. Maybe I got some kind of business done after we went through that gate." said Palla.

"Yes, I guess so." said Katarina as the two women walked towards the castle, getting past the guard to let them in. Soon enough, they were inside the castle, with Palla just about to break off and find her sisters and the pegasus knight recruits.

"Katarina, nice of you to be back." said a familiar voice. Katarina blushed as Marth approached her, his usual smile on his face.

"Yes milord, I finished what business I had before. I think I can now stay for a while." said Katarina.

"That is nice to hear. You seem to have become quite experienced. I'm proud of that." said Marth, who brought Katarina's hand up and kissed it lightly, making Katarina blush. Palla giggled at the side of the room.

"You've really made it this time Katarina." smiled Palla.

"P-Palla!" cried Katarina, holding her books tightly against her chest.

"Katarina, how about you walk with me for a minute. I'd love to hear what you've been doing." smiled Marth.

"O-Of course milord!" said Katarina as she began walking with Marth. Palla giggled lightly as she left them to themselves. She would surely see Katarina again that night or so.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Palla and Katarina

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Lucia entered the city with Lyn and Celica as they walked through the familiar streets. Lucia turned back to Celica for a moment and asked, "Hey Celica? Do you feel.....different at all?"

Celica looked at them. They were talking about the battle at Bryyo. Looks like they didn't remember, well at least the Einherjar that they are did.....gods it's confusing. "Yeah, I do. See, the portal really does work!" Celica said, not bringing up Bryyo.

"I feel renewed," Lucia said. "I haven't felt so relaxed. Thank you Celica." Lucia smiled.

Lyn turned back and bowed her head, "Thank you Celica." Lyn said.

Soon enough they were outside the castle belonging to Elincia. She turned back to Lyn and Celica. "Do you wish to join me?" Lucia asked them.

Celica smiled, "No thanks. Me and Lyn were gonna look around," Celica stated.

Lucia nodded and smiled, "Very well. I'll meet you two tonight." She then entered the castle while Lyn and Celica walked around the city some more.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Over in Norna

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Lucia soon approached Elincia with a bow. "I've returned, M'lady." Lucia said.

Elincia returned that with a smile. "Ah, Lucia. I'm glad you've returned..."

"Understandable, M'lady. I shall return to my current role and protect-"

Elincia giggled for a moment. "Hold on Lucia. I actually need something from you."

Lucia rose, "Oh. Of course, m'lady. What is it?" Elincia began. "Of few of my scouts found another gate like the one you just explored. I wish for you to go inspect."

"Oh...If you wish m'lady." Lucia said.

Elincia smiled, "Thank you. I sent a messenger to Prince Marth in Irene to send some help. You should await their arrival."

"Of course," Lucia bowed and turned, walking out.

What next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Lucia and Elincia

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Another gate? They seem to be really popping up as of late." spoke Lyn.

"Yes. I wonder why. Is something really going on?" wondered Lucia. The two of them were already approaching the northern part of Yorerealm, where the new gate supposedly had appeared. It wasn't too long a walk, especially since they were given a couple of horses to get them there quicker. They had already sent them back home by now though.

"I wonder if the help Queen Elincia talked about is...."

"Hello!"

The two smiled as they saw who else but Katarina and Palla approaching, with Celica behind them.

"Figured you two would be the help." said Lyn.

"Well, since we've already got experience with these gates." said Palla.

"But we don't even know what happened last time." said Katarina.

"Perhaps this time will be different then." sighed Celica. She knew what would happen. They'd probably just collapse again after going through the gate like always.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Yet another Gate

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
Lucia's hands touched the sword near her waist. She looked back and forth between her mates as they all stared back at the swirling vortex. "If everyone's ready, let's get going." They all soon entered as Celica sighed before following them.

--------

"Guh.....My head..." Jacob groaned as she sat up. She looked down and saw her clothing was white and she had blue hair. Looks like she was still Lucia.

"Oh, you're up."

Jacob turned to see a few others resting and Celica kneeling over a waking Greg. "Looks like you guys are still in your Yorerealm bodies." Celica said.

Jacob stood and stretched. "I guess. It's kinda weird now..." Jacob blushed lightly. "Partly because some people might think we're the actual legends, that and..." Jacob trailed off at the obvious.

Lucina smiled. "I'm sure you'll be fine."

Greg, still as Katarina nodded and looked around before standing up. "Where are we anyway?"

They look outside the cave to see...
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Going through once again

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Wow, so much snow." said Jacob in surprise.

Indeed, they were on what appeared to be a snowy landscape, with mountains as far as they could see. They were currently on a plateau overlooking everything, and they could tell that they were already pretty high up, given the thin air.

"Didn't see many of these back in Ylisse." spoke Lucina, still in Lyn's body.

"It's pretty cool." smiled Cynthia, still in Palla's body.

"Perhaps we should see if anyone's nearby." said Celica. "Every gate seems to at least be somewhat near a town or two."

"That's a good point. Cynthia doesn't have her pegasus here, or Palla's for that matter." said Lucina. Cynthia smiled sheepishly at the remark.

"Well, it doesn't seem as easy as it used to." she replied.

Anyway, since they would have to walk, the group began walking down the trail. Luckily, the sky was clear and the wind was calm, so they were actually pretty warm, despite all the snow. Good news for Lucina, who's outfit was clearly made for warmer weather. Greg was still fidgeting a bit though as they walked, causing Jacob to come over.

"What's wrong? You didn't say much before." said Jacob.

"Oh, I just didn't have much to say. Besides, I've been thinking. That Yorerealm place obviously was home to many old legends, but things still seemed different." said Greg.

"How so?" asked Jacob.

"Well, it seems like certain people weren't there, like many people of Lord Marth's army." said Greg.

"You're right, now that I think about it. I think you, Lord Marth, and the pegasus sisters were the only ones I noticed. What about it?" asked Jacob. Greg unnaturally blushed at the question.

"N-Never mind, it's too embarrassing." said Greg, causing Jacob to raise an eyebrow, but she didn't pursue it further.

Eventually, the group came across a sign, obviously one meant for merchants or anyone else coming this way. Celica gave it a good look, as it was pretty old.

"It says "Mystirealm". Guess that's where we are." she said.

"Does it say anything about a town?" asked Lucina.

"Hmm, it says that "Aldene" is a little ways down the road. It sounds like this realm is not too different from Yorerealm in terms of structure, but I can only wonder how the towns are like." said Celica.

"Well, we won't figure it out standing here." said Cynthia.

"Agreed." said Jacob.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: ...snowy mountaintops.

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
The town Aldene was quite large. The homes were built with either stone bricks or logs. People in the town wore thick coats as they went about their day. The five soon approached the town as Jacob turned and faced the others. "Guess this is Aldene. "

Jacob looked over at his comrades and after looking for a bit began giggling lightly.

"What is it Jacob?" Celica asked.

"We beat the bad guy, and what happens next? We're in the bodies of legends, female ones at that."

Cynthia giggled a bit as well as Lucina followed up. "It is interesting."

"Hey Greg, got any idea what we should do?"

What does Greg suggest?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Heading to Aldene

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"Well, it's not a bad place here. I say we should at least reserve an inn for ourselves. There's quite a bit of people after all." said Greg.

"Great to see that tactical mind working." smiled Lucina, making Greg blush a bit.

"You know I just look like one." she retorted as they started walking down the street.

"One that has Lord Marth's eye." giggled Cynthia a little bit to herself so no one else heard. No one in the streets paid them much of a glance as they walked down the street, as if there were normal people. It stayed that way even when they found a rather nice inn and paid for a couple of rooms. One of them had room for three thankfully.

"No one is singling us out." said Celica.

"Perhaps they don't view us as legends in this place, instead as just normal people. It was the same way in Yorerealm. Perhaps this realm and that realm are related in a sense, where the "legends" are actually around." said Greg.

"Fair enough I guess. Hard to imagine though. We thought these people lived a long time ago, yet here they are." said Lucina with a nod.

"Well, do we want to look around a bit?" asked Cynthia. "I imagine we'll have to leave sooner rather than later."

"Good idea." said Jacob. "I can only wonder what will happen once we leave."
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Find an inn

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
The soon reached the Outrealm Gate after walking, but it seemed different. "This is the same gate we used before right?" Jacob asked.

"Yeah...Isn't it?" Cynthia added in.

"Well, I guess we have one way to find out." Celica said.

Greg nodded, "Right." He then walke through as Cynthia and Celica followed him. Jacob looked over to Lucina and shrugged.

"Looks like we don't have much of a choice." Lucina said as she went in.

Jacob had a bad feeling as he passed through, but it couldn't be that bad...right?

-------------

Julia laid on her back when she opened her eyes. She saw two images above her, blurry, since her eyes were squinted. She could hear them speaking. "W-Wht should we do milady?" One said nervously.

"Well..." The other began when her sentence was cut off and they saw Julia awake. "She's waking up! You alright?"

Julia, still in shock, tired, and weak, nodded. The two leaned down and lifted them up as they held Julia by her shoulders. "W-wh-where...?" Julia stammered.

"Don't worry about that," said one of them. She wore a blue garment with a metal breastplate and shield. The other had a hairband and plain-dress. "What's your name? I'm Khan Gabriel of the West. This here's Hope." Gabriel said, motioning to her servant to Julia's left.

"My name? I-It's...um...." Julia stammered.

"What were you doing out here?"

"I-I...."

"Milady," Hope spoke up. "I think she has amnesia."

Gabriel groaned, but nodded. "Alright, let's get you back to the kingdom."

Julia nodded as she was carried off.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: On the way

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
"You alright?" asked Gabriel as she and Hope escorted Julia through the plains.

"Um, yeah. Thanks." said Julia.

"No problem. Funny, I recently had a dizzy spell a while ago. Don't know where it came from." she giggled light-heartedly.

"You shouldn't be so casual about your health milady." said Hope, briefly twirling her blue hair. Gabriel put a hand on her shoulder.

"Don't worry. You know I'm usually in good health." she smiled.

Julia got a good look at the two women. Gabriel wore the appearance of a Great Lord in a blue out fit, with a circular shield on her left arm. The other girl, Hope, looked quite the opposite, not looking like a fighter at all.

"So, where am I?" asked Julia.

"This is the kingdom of Girel. I'm one of its two rulers; the west khan." explained Gabriel.

"So, there's another?" asked Julia.

"Yeah, although I don't talk much with the guy." muttered Gabriel. Julia giggled a bit.

"Well, it's great to meet you milady. My name is Julia....I just remembered that. How odd." said Julia.

"Ah, that's a nice name." smiled Hope, putting her hands together.

"Yes it is. Well Julia, the town is just ahead. Just a little further and we can rest at the castle." said Gabriel.

"Okay." said Julia.
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: Arriving

1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.content:
The walls seemed high and tiled with stone around the palace as Gabriel and Hope led Julia through as small outer door. They walked through a tunnel that led to a small hatch that ended up in Gabriel's private quarters. They helped Julia to a spare bed nearby and laid her down. "You sure you're fine?" Gabriel asked.

"Y-yes...Thank you, Gabriel. Thank you Hope." Julia replied.

Hope bowed. "Don't hesitate to ask if you need something."

Julia smiled as Gabriel patted her shoulder. "Now you get some rest and see what memories you get back."

Julia smiled and laid down, falling asleep a moment later. Gabriel then stood and walked out of the room with Hope. "What do you plan to do with her?" Hope asked.

"She seems nice. I'll think we'll hold her here until she's better. You get some rest to Hope. You look a little tired."

"Likewise, milady." Hope curtsied and walked down the hall. Gabriel entered the room and fell to sleep.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122111111111212112111111.title: At the castle

155111111122111212212.content:
Greg and Cynthia began walking back together. Cynthia babbled about certain things left and right. Greg couldn't really keep up, but smiled as he watched her babble.

"Oh, I just remembered! Mom needs me for something! See you later!" called Cynthia as she immediately began running towards the site, leaving Greg alone.

"Well....don't mind me.." he muttered, not even getting a chance to say anything to her. However, he heard something in the bushes. He turned his head and saw a familiar red head coming out of the bushes.

It was Severa.

"Oh hi Severa. What'cha doing out here?" asked Greg. Severa's face went red, a mixture of both anger and embarrassment.

"It's none of your business! Gawds, can't a girl relieve herself in private?!" she nearly yelled, her face turning even redder when she realized what she just said.

"Um...I didn't know you were doing that. Sorry." said Greg, turning red himself.

"Well, whatever." growled Severa who promptly turned around and started stomping towards the campsite.

"Man, given how nice Cordelia is, it's almost hard to imagine that's her daughter." said Greg before he ran up to walk back with her to the camp.
155111111122111212212.title: During the walk back

1551111111221112122122.content:
Jacob had wandered back into the forest surrounding them after his encounter with Henry. Jacob saw a clearing up ahead, but he saw someone else too. He only saw her from behind. She had a bow leaning by the log she was sitting on. She wore a green archer uniform as she sat there. She had black hair and a feather against her head. He walked behind her and spoke, "Um...hey...?"

The girl replied with a shriek and fell off the log. Jacob quickly knelt next to her, hoping to calm her down. "Hey! It's alright, it's alright!"

"H-huh? Y-you're not a bandit?" The girl asked sheepishly.

"'Course not. What are you doing out here?" Jacob asked.

"Waiting for my mother's latest curse to wear off." Jacob then noticed that a small tail was sticking out from the girl's rear as it disappeared.

"Your mother did that? That doesn't sound nice." Jacob said, feeling a little sorry for her.

"It isn't."

They were silent when Jacob reached down and stood her back up. "I'm Jacob. You are...?"

"Noire." The archer replied, trying to smile.

"Noire...My friend and I bet some of yours are meeting over in the clearing. Why don't you come along?"

Noire nodded sheepishly as she picked up her bow and walked back with Jacob.
1551111111221112122122.title: Meanwhile

choices: They end up meeting 2 other girls
15511111112211121221221.content:
Eventually, most of the people began gathering at the site. Greg couldn't get Severa to say much after their little encounter.

"Are you okay?" he asked.

"I'm fine okay." she muttered, turning her head away from him. Greg smiled while he shook his head.

Guess you're much for talk." he said.

"I talk....just not about stupid things." Severa muttered.

Anyway, Greg left her to cool off by herself. Eventually, he ran into Jacob who was coming back with a black-haired girl.

"Hey Jacob. Who's the girl?" asked Greg.

"I'm Noire." said the girl softly.

"Ah, nice. I'm Greg." he introduced himself. The girl lightly smiled. Greg felt like something was a little off with her but he shoved that aside.

"So, where's your parents?" asked Jacob.

"They should be around here somewhere. I feel that mother is pretty close." said Noire.

"Ah, I see." said Greg.

What happens next?
15511111112211121221221.title: At the site

155111111122111212212211.content:
Jacob had hung out with Noire while Greg was off with Severa. After awhile, Greg returned. "We should keep moving."

Jacob nodded and stood as he explained their situation to Noire and Severa, who had followed Greg.

Jacob and Greg began to round up their things when Jacob was approached by a pale girl with black hair, Noire following behind her. Jacob turned to look at Greg but saw he was talking to Cordelia and Henry.

"You." The woman said.

"Yes?" Jacob replied, slightly confused.

"My daughter wants to join you in...whatever you're doing. I'll allow it, but first..." The woman them seemed to mutter something. "You don't take care of Noire, you'll be cursed."

"So...you cursed me with a curse to trigger a curse?"

"Yes....Now go." Noire walked up alongside Jacob.

"Your mom, huh?" Jacob said.

Noire nodded sheepishly. Jacob looked back over to Greg and saw that he and Severa were approaching them. "Seems like they want to come." Greg said.

"Then let's get going." Jacob replied.

"Right," Noire replied smiling.

As they walked to the gate, Greg glanced at Severa. "What made you want to come?"

Severa went red and stammered, "Well, b-because!...Gawds..."

Greg held a grin as they approached the gate.

What happens next?
155111111122111212212211.title: They decided to leave

1551111111221112122122111.content:
"Bye Severa, have fun!" called Cynthia as she watched all 5 group members begin to leave.

"Take care of yourself while I'm gone! And take care of your own hair for once!" called Severa.

"No promises there." smiled Cynthia, making Severa hit her face.

"So why do you two really want to come?" asked Celica. "Are you sure you don't have anything else here to do?" she continued. Noire shook her head.

"I don't have much to do, and I'm curious to see these other worlds you all have mentioned." said Noire. "As long as I'm back before Mother gives birth to the present me." she added.

"I can understand that. From the look I got at your mom, she seems to have no problem blowing people up." said Jacob.

"Oh, she can do worse....but I'm not saying what." muttered Noire.

"Can we stop talking about Tharja? I want to see these other places you're talking about as well. We didn't get to see many other worlds during our journey. Besides, at least it gives me something to do." spat Severa.

"But isn't Cordelia close to having you in this time?" asked Noire.

"Yeah, and the new me is probably going to be some momma's girl or something. I'll pass on watching that for a while." she spat, walking forward into the gate by herself first.

"Well, she's an interesting character." said Celica. Greg put a hand on her shoulder.

"It should be interesting regardless. I say we should catch up to her." said Greg.

After everyone agreed, they all went into the gate, catching up to Severa. Anyway, they kept on walking, until Greg began to get that familiar feeling.

"Ah, I think the next realm is coming up." said Greg.

"I hope that rider guy you mentioned doesn't come up." worried Noire.

"Well, Chrom told me you guys took down a giant dragon. I think you should be fine." smiled Greg.

"Maybe." Noire allowed a small smile as the end of the walk came. The group of 5 walked through the light to a brand new place.
1551111111221112122122111.title: Walking through

15511111112211121222.content: Who else does Jacob run into?
15511111112211121222.title: Other

155111111122111212221.content:
Jacob sat at the edge of the picnic, Greg somewhere amongst the crowd as Jacob thought. 'These people seem strong, but a few seem too laid back. Is anyone a serious trainer around here?' He thought.

Almost immediately after he heard the sound of clanging metal from the forest. He turned back toward the picnic to see no one else noticed. Jacob, curious, left to check.

He walked through vegetation until he saw a girl, still in her teens he'd say, in large purple metal armor. Even though she wore such massive armor, she moved quickly as she swung around a lance, striking the air, and trees from time to time. It was not until she had turned she saw Jacob, carefully watching her. She dropped back in a bit of surprise. "Who are you," she asked. "Have you come to challenge me to a duel?"

Jacob shook his head and held his hands up defensively. "No, no, no!" He said, almost panicked at first. "I just heard you training. You seem pretty good with weapons."

"That's needed when you fight a war...What's your name?"

"Jacob," he replied. "You?"

"Kjelle," the armored girl answered. "I suppose you came from the picnic?...Guess I should join you on the way back..." Kjelle said. She gathered her weapon as the two walked back to camp.
155111111122111212221.title: Kjelle

1551111111221112122211.content:
Meanwhile, Greg was doing a little walking of his own after meeting some of Chrom's comrades. He noted how he seemed to attract a large variety of people. At first, he thought Henry was the weirdest, but now he wasn't so sure, especially after meeting a blonde fighter named Vaike. He also met a bouncy cleric named Lissa, who was apparently Chrom's sister. Could have fooled him. They acted nothing alike.

Anyway, he was getting a little fresh air and enjoying the scenery until he came across a small figure sitting on a tree log a few paces away. She wore red and white clothing, and was reading a book. What stood out to Greg though was her long-pointed ears. Apparently though, the little girl noticed him.

"Oh hello, are you lost?" asked the girl, looking up from her book, placing a bookmark.

"Oh no, I'm just looking around. My name's Greg and my friend and I just happened to come across Prince Chrom and his friends. Are you with them?" Greg asked. The girl smiled at him.

"Yes, in fact I am." she said as she got up. "My parents are also in the group."

"Ah, so you fought in the wars as well?" asked Greg.

"Yes....although it's not something I'd like to talk about." the girl mused.

"Oh....sorry for bringing that up." said Greg.

"It's alright. I'm used to it." said the girl.

"Thank you. Would you kindly tell me your name?" asked Greg.

"Nah." she introduced herself.

"Why not? I would very much like to know." said Greg with a raised eyebrow. He could see the girl sigh heavily, mentioning something along the lines of "every time".

"My name is Nah. N-A-H. That's my name." she continued.

"That's.....unique." said Greg, not sure what to think.

"Blame my mom." Nah sighed. "Anyway, I'm ready to head back. You coming?"

"Oh, sure." Greg said in a hurry, as Nah was already past him, heading back to the group.
1551111111221112122211.title: Greg meets someone

15511111112211121222111.content:
Jacob walked alongside the heavily-clad knight as they past through the camp in where the picnic was. A few people in the camp seemed to stop Jacob and Kjelle upon seeing one or the other or both. One had grey hair and sounded quite passionate. Another man approached them named Walhart, who made Jacob feel immediately puny in comparison to him. And a man named Priam who held a sword that Jacob swore he saw somewhere else before in one of his books...

Jacob and Kjelle soon sat at a small fire with food laid out when Jacob spoke up. "You have family here?"

"Yes. They're over there," she said. She pointed to a woman with short red hair and...

...he...he actually couldn't see a father. Jacob would press further, but was too hungry to care at the very moment. Jacob sighed and began eating.

"You?" Kjelle asked, reflecting the question back to him.

Jacob swallowed what was in his mouth before answering. "I did...Maybe I still do...I'm not sure at the moment..." Jacob said, thinking about how long he could've been stuck in the card. He smiled back though, "I'll be fine, I just need some good friends to travel with."

Kjelle nodded as the two continued eating.
15511111112211121222111.title: Heading back

155111111122111212221111.content:
"I didn't expect to see a Manakete right off the bat in this realm." said Greg with slight admiration, something Nah briefly smiled at.

"There aren't a lot, but we're still around. There's me and my mom, and Lady Tiki too. I haven't seen too many others though." explained Nah plainly.

"Ah, interesting. So, how old are you?" asked Greg. Nah immediately raised an eyebrow, and Greg soon felt like that was too sensitive a question.

"Why do you ask?" asked Nah.

"Oh, nothing. I apologize." said Greg quickly. "I didn't mean any offense. It's just that I was curious since I heard Manaketes live so long." Greg tried to defend himself. Thankfully, to his surprise, Nah smiled a bit.

"It's fine, really. I'm not that old, only in my teens. My mother is over 1000 though, although you wouldn't know it from her appearance or behavior." Nah sighed as she uttered that last part.

"How do you mean?" asked Greg.

"She almost looks younger than me, I'll say that much. And she acts like it." Nah sighed again. "Not only can't Mom act her age but she couldn't even give me a real name."

"Sounds rough." said Greg.

"It's not too big a deal though." said Nah before turning her attention to Greg. "But enough about me, what about you? You don't look like you're from Ylisse."

"No, I'm not."

And with that, Greg explained the story of how they arrived here, even finding Celica and Jacob down the line. Nah was genuinely impressed by his stories, engrossed even.

"Wow, I don't think I saw such Outrealms when we went there." said Nah.

"You went to the Outrealms?" asked Greg.

"A few times. Settling some squabbles here and there. However, your journey sounds fascinating. I'd very much like to see it." smiled Nah.

"Well, our merry group could use another member. You sure your parents won't mind though?" asked Greg.

"Mom won't worry, and I'm sure Father won't either." said Nah. "Now, let's find your friend and go. I want to see!"

And with that, Nah grabbed Greg's arm, and rather fiercely at that. It began to hurt a bit as Greg almost found himself being dragged back to the campsite.

"She claims her Mom is immature, but she seems to have her bouts too." Greg smiled to himself. Nah was going to be one interesting companion.
155111111122111212221111.title: Greg and Nah

1551111111221112122211111.content:
After Jacob and the knight Kjelle ate, they moved themselves to the edge of the camp at Kjelle's request. She wanted to spar it seemed, ready with her spear. Jacob agreed, intrigued by her motivation to fight. The two began engaging one another in combat, Jacob using his blades and Kjelle her spears.

It wasn't until long after it started, Jacob's foot slipped as Kjelle stuck Jacob and he flew back and hit the ground. Kjelle stood over him. "Guess...you win..." Jacob said in between breaths. Kjelle nodded and helped him up. "I'm glad we did this, I might need to use these skills soon."

That caught Kjelle's curiosity. "What do you mean by that?"

Jacob explained that he wasn't from Ylisse. In fact he didn't remember where he was from originally. That he was traveling with Greg and Celica exploring the Outrealms.

"We've visited the Outrealms before, but never explored them. Would you perhaps mind if I tag along?" Kjelle asked so 'as-matter-of-fact'.

Jacob was surprised at her sudden offer. "I-I wouldn't mind, what about your parents?"

"My mother keeps telling me to find ways to get stronger. She would let me, but we should talk to them first. " Kjelle said. Jacob nodded in agreement as they returned to the camp around the same time Greg and Nah did.

What happens next?
1551111111221112122211111.title: Back to the site

15511111112211121222111111.content:
"Hey Jacob. Where have you been?" asked Greg. Jacob just laughed nervously at Greg's question, and it didn't take long for Nah to come to a conclusion.

"I imagine he was just getting his butt kicked by Kjelle; judging by the dirt on him."

"Makes sense." laughed Greg.

"Watch it." warned Jacob, getting a bit of a laugh from Greg and the others. "Anyway, as fun as this is, I do think we need to round up Celica and get going. We certainly don't want to run the risk of that rider following us here."

"Couldn't agree more. And Nah here actually wants to join us." said Greg, pointing to the young Manakete.

"Her name is what?" asked Jacob. Greg smiled nervously while Nah just sighed.

"I need to change that name sometime." she muttered to herself.

"Anyway, looks like we have the same idea. Kjelle would be a nice addition. Still have to talk to her parents though." said Jacob. It was the same situation with Greg, so they knew what to do. Luckily, they happened to see Sully and Nowi eating together on a log. Sully was trying to tune out Nowi's loud talking.

"Look Sully, I can do this!"

"Nowi, not while I'm eating."

"Oh come on.....Oh hey Nah!" Nowi waved them over. "You gotta try this sandwich. It's delicious."

"Maybe some other time, mother." replied Nah.

Greg and Jacob didn't waste any time asking for the assistance of their daughters. Frankly, both were afraid that they would refuse. Instead, Sully grinned while Nowi jumped with glee.

"Hey, if you think you can handle Kjelle enough to travel with her, be my guest." Sully grinned at the boys.

"Oooh, the Outrealms sound fun! Don't stress yourself out, okay Nah?" cheered Nowi.

"Yes, mother." Nah groaned, as if being lectured by someone who didn't look any older than her wasn't bad enough.

"What about your dad?" asked Greg.

"He won't mind, and I can probably say the same for Kjelle's dad." replied Nah. "Anyway, I just need to grab my knapsack."

"All right, let's get Celica and leave. The sooner the better." said Greg.

Soon enough, they found Celica and said good bye for now to Chrom and friends. He did wish for them to visit again, something Greg said that they would be happy to do. With that said, the merry group was off, heading back towards the Outrealm Gate.

"So, you think the location will be as random as before?" asked Jacob.

"Probably." spoke Greg. The girls didn't seem to be too afraid, as they just followed them into the gate.
15511111112211121222111111.title: Permission

155111111122111212221111111.content:
The four walked through the gate as Jacob and Greg walked alongside Kjelle and Nah. "What realm do you think we'll see next?" Jacob asked Greg.

Greg replied with a shrug. "It's been random. I have no clue what it could be."

"I'm quite curious about what this realm will be like." Nah said, smiling a bit.

The four then crossed a barrier into whatever realm was up ahead.

As they passed through, they were met by an intense heat and bright light. They soon identified the area around them as a desert. It stretched on for what looked like forever and sand dunes across them.

Jacob used a hand to block out the sun. "Guess we're in a desert..."

Greg and Nah nodded. The four spoke for a moment before they set off in one direction across the desert.

About an hour passed as they wandered. Jacob's body and hair were drenched in sweat as they kept walking. Jacob looked over to Kjelle to see she hadn't even broke a sweat. Jacob wasn't about to ask how she could do that. Greg was like Jacob and Nah only seemed to be working up a small sweat. "Hey Nah, would you be able to use your Manakete power and see where we are?"

"Well...I think this entire realm my be desert so it does no good." Nah said.

Jacob groaned and wiped away sweat with his sleeve.

What happens next?
155111111122111212221111111.title: Through the gate again

1551111111221112122211111111.content:
"Well, what a start to this journey." moaned Celica as she wiped her own forehead. As Greg took a little bit of the water he had, trying to save as much as possible, he looked over to Kjelle.

"Seriously, how in the world are you keeping cool. You're wearing heavy armor for god's sake." Greg panted out. Kjelle just turned a wily smirk in his direction.

"It's called discipline. Compared to where we came from, this heat is nothing." she said with confidence.

"I guess Manaketes also get good resistance from the heat." added Celica in Nah's direction.

"Sure, many Manaketes used to live where Plegia now stands. Besides, it'd be embarrassing for being that breathe fire to get tuckered out by heat." smiled Nah.

"Maybe Kjelle is secretly a Manakete." Jacob muttered to himself. Kjelle responded by slapping him on the back....hard.

"OW!"

That got a good laugh out of Greg, Celica, and Nah. It was enough to get their minds off of the heat for a little while. After the laugh, they continued onwards. Kjelle and Nah even told Greg and the others about when they found their friend, Laurent. It was in a hot area too; so much that they often hallucinated. Greg could only hope that wouldn't happen too much out here.

Suddenly, Nah's ears perked up.

"What is it?" asked Greg. Nah held up a finger; asking Greg to give her a second.

"I hear small waves.....yes, I definitely hear water just up ahead."

"Whoo-hoo!" cheered Jacob.

"Super hearing too. Is there anything you can't do?" asked Greg with a smile, somewhat admiring Nah's abilities.

"Well, I did lose a very comfy pillow when traveling through time." That got another laugh.

"Anyway, onward!" shouted Jacob. He probably needed the bath more than anyone else.
