The group of give continued onwards, a little more inspired now. Soon enough, at the same time hoping that they weren't hallucinating, they saw a tiny group of palm trees just up ahead. If they squinted, they could even see a sign: Osiris Realm Oasis.

"Jackpot!" shouted Jacob, as he began running, which made Kjelle facepalm.

"Calm down! You don't want to fall on the sand and hurt yourself!" She then went after him.

"Well, shall we?" smiled Greg to his partners.

"We shall." smiled Nah in return.
1551111111221112122211111111.title: They find an oasis

15511111112211121222111111111.content:
"Whoo-hoo!" Jacob yelled yet again before jumping into the oasis. The oasis was made up of two equal sized bodies of water seperated by a small patch of land.

Jacob landed with a splash. The water was cold and refreshing. Jacob floated on his back when Kjelle soon stood at the edge of the oasis over Jacob. "You're crazy you know that?" Kjelle said. Jacob scratched the back of his head embarrassed and smiled sheepishly.

"I guess...?" He answered, only making Kjelle face palm again.

Greg, Nah and Celica soon walked up beside her. Celica giggled a bit while Greg and Nah stood there with some small smiles on their faces. "Well, now your clothes are wet." Nah said.

"Let's hope a snow realm isn't next." Greg chuckled. "We should take a break here though."

Jacob pulled himself back to shore and sat down at the edge taking water and washing away some of the sweat. Once he finished doing that, he scooped a handful of water and brought it to his lips to drink...

...when something hit him in the back of the neck...hard.

He spit the water out involuntarily as Kjelle had taken a handful of water and put it on his neck. "What was that for?"

"You still had the back of your neck drenched in sweat." Kjelle answered. Jacob then cupped another handful of water and threw it at Kjelle as it splashed against her."...Was that an invitation to a challenge?"

Jacob grinned as the two soon began splashing water at one another.

What happens next?
15511111112211121222111111111.title: The Oasis

155111111122111212221111111112.content:
"Funny, on one end, it feels really early for a break, but on the other hand, the weather is just perfect for a break." said Greg with a shrug of the shoulders.

"Well, you can never have too many. Might as well make sure you're all well and good before going into battle." said Nah.

"Good point. Besides, we needed a refill in addition."

Greg walked over and allowed himself to be refreshed. He heard the splashing of water over to the side. He shook his head as he looked at Kjelle and Jacob. Nah looked in their direction, shaking her head too.

"Your companion seems rather childish." she spoke.

"Says the girl who looks the youngest appearance-wise." Greg smirked.

"Says the girl who will outlive you by several millennia." she retorted.

"That's true." shrugged Greg with a smile. As he refreshed and refilled his cans, Nah looked over to the others.

"Weird. I thought Kjelle was made of sterner stuff than that."

"She certainly doesn't look the type to mess around." agreed Greg.

After a while, Celica joined their conversation, as they talked about other things by themselves. After a bit of conversing, Nah looked up to the sun in the sky.

"If I had to guess, it might be mid-afternoon by now. Perhaps we should continue." she said.

"Good idea. I'll get the others." said Celica.

"You do that." agreed Greg.
155111111122111212221111111112.title: A Brief Break

1551111111221112122211111111122.content:
After Jacob and Kjelle finished their splash fight, Jacob decided to really wash himself. He walked into the water to the deepest part before fully submerging himself. As he did, a tingling sensation took over his body. He felt himself change and his clothing before he came back up. Jacob let out a sigh as she rose from the water, hearing herself sigh made her look down to see her in a purple bikini, her hair was also neck length with bangs.

She walked out of the water toward the others, who now stood there in shock. "Jacob?!" Greg exclaimed as the girl walked toward him. "What happened?"

"I guess I'm a girl right now," Jacob replied. "Come on guys, you should give it a try too." Jacob said. Then without waiting for an answer, Jacob grabbed both Greg's and Kjelle's arm and yanked them in.

After a few moments, in Greg's place was a girl and Kjelle was now wearing a bikini as well. Greg giggled a bit. "You're right, this is great!" Greg exclaimed before Kjelle agreed.

Celica and Nah watched from the sidelines. Celica sighed with Nah, but was intrigued nonetheless. Celica amd Nah preformed the same action and emerged in their own bikinis. Soon, the entire group was thinking of what to do next here, as they forgot about the reason they left.

Jacob walked out of the water for a moment to see a girl in a bikini with a red ponytail and a pack on her back. "Hey there," Anna said as Jacob walked over to her. "Are you here to swim too?" Jacob asked her.

Anna smiled, "Nah. But you guys look like your having fun, so here." She then revealed a bag full of beach-related items and handed them over to Jacob. "Hope you have fun with them."

Jacob smiled and thanked her as she carried it back to her friends. Anna smiled, "Another satisfied customer."

What happens next?
1551111111221112122211111111122.title: Other Choice

15511111112211121222111111111222.content:
Anna gave the group quite an assortment of beach items, including a beach ball for them to toss around. Nobody knew why, but they couldn't even remember why they were in this realm. They were just focused on the fun. Even Kjelle and Nah were under the influence. Many times, Greg had to comb her long ark hair out of her face, her body looking nice in the blue bikini.

After a while though, after at least an hour passed, the group got a bit tired out. They grabbed the towels that Anna had given them and dried off. However, almost as soon as they did though, they saw a light pass over their bodies. In an instant, their old bodies had returned.

"What the heck just happened?" asked Greg.

"That's the spring's specialty." said Anna. "Those who wade in just lose themselves to the fun so to speak. It's quite a stress reliever really. You'd be surprised at how many people actually come by in this realm."

"Interesting." said Nah, glad to be back in her old clothes to be honest.

"Wait a second, then why make us girls?" asked Greg, raising an eyebrow. Anna just shrugged and winked.

"Well......that was more for personal amusement. Girls in bikinis are far more interesting don't you think" She giggled at the last comment, making the boys blush. Kjelle on the other hand, was pretty mad.

"Wait, you held us up for amusement?! Get over here!!" And with that, Anna started running from Kjelle, the armored girl pretty mad at the moment. It was an amusing sight for the group, watching her try to keep up with the running Anna.

"Well, at least we had an hour with no worries." said Greg.

"I agree. And if my memory is correct, that swimsuit didn't look too bad on you." Celica smiled, making Greg blush.

"I think he looks fine the way he is." said Nah in a matter-of-fact tone. Celica gave her a knowing look.

"Oh, and why is that?" she smirked. Nah's face turned a bit red and she didn't answer.

By the time they got all their stuff, Kjelle was walking back to them, still trying to catch her breath. She apparently couldn't keep up with the merchant, getting a laugh from the group. Still, the brief diversion was fun, and now it was time to hit the road again. They certainly didn't want to be in swimsuits when enemies appeared.
15511111112211121222111111111222.title: A fun day

155111111122111212221111111112221.content:
Another hour of walking passed. However their little swim left them a bit more spry than usual. Still, there was sand in all directions as they wandered. Jacob led in the front when he saw something in the distance.

After studying it from afar, he realized it was an Outrealm Gate. He turned back to the other, "I think I see a gate over there."

Greg sighed in relief as Nah smiled lightly. "Good, I'll be happy to leave this realm." Greg commented. As they began to travel, they heard a noise. A yell.

Jacob ran up a nearby sand dune to see a few men, dressed in loose garbs were frantically scattering as Risen attacked them. As the others ran beside Jacob, Greg noticed a man in dark armor on a horse. He realized it was the black rider from Bryyo. The rider didn't notice them, and rode through a nearby gate. Kjelle unsheathed her spear, "We need to help them!" She yelled.

The others agreed in unison and pulled out their weapons and managed to run down and get in between the two lines. A few men from the defending line had swords drawn but weren't prepared. The number of Risen was fairly small though, so Greg and the others took them out fairly quick. Once the final Risen went down, a man approached them from the group. "Thank you so much! I have no idea what we'd do if you weren't here. Listen, we're returning to a town some distance away, why don't you come with us for a reward?"

What do they decide?
155111111122111212221111111112221.title: Desert walking

1551111111221112122211111111122211.content:
"Hmm, what do you think guys?" asked Greg to the group. Kjelle stated her stance quickly.

"It's a nice gesture, but we only did what was right. Besides, that mysterious rider was the one you mentioned correct? We should pursue him as soon as possible." said Kjelle.

"I agree. Every second could get us further away from him." agreed Celica.

"Besides, who says that we can't come back afterwards." added Nah. Greg could tell that Jacob agreed, and he felt the same way.

"Your generosity is appreciated, but we must be going. We can't let that rider terrorize more people." said Greg. The man smiled and nodded in an understanding way.

"Of course sir. Very right you are. Please feel free to visit our village when you have completed your task. We will welcome you as best we can." said the man.

"Once again, you have our thanks." smiled Greg. With that, the group went on their way, leaving Greg and everyone else at the gate. Greg turned his attention towards the gate. They had no idea if they would even land in the same realm as the dark rider.

"Well, should we run the risk?" pondered Greg.

"True, we might not end up close to our goal. Still, I don't see any alternate solution." said Celica.

"I agree." nodded Greg. "All right, let's give it a try. Hopefully, this will go smoothly."

"One can hope." added Kjelle.

And with that, the group entered the gate, not knowing where they would end up next.
1551111111221112122211111111122211.title: They leave the realm

15511111112211122.content:
The event seemed to be dying down, but by then there were already quite a few others there. Jacob sat on a log resting when he heard a voice that seemed to be getting closer. "Oh, where is she? Doesn't she know she worries me when she wanders off around these...hooligans? Excuse me..."

Jacob then realized the voice seemed to talk to him as he turned around. The woman there wore a pink button-like coat and had curly blonde hair. He also noticed she had a parasol it seemed and was holding it in her hand. "Yes? What is it?"

"I'm looking for my friend Lissa. Have you seen her?" The woman asked. Jacob classes her as part of a regal family, having a more royal sounding accent.

The name seemed barely familiar to Jacob. He remembered hearing the name among the crowd, but never saw who it was. "Sorry, can't say I have."

"Oooh! That girl..." The woman said, a mix of worry and frustration in her voice. Jacob sighed, then stood up.

"Here: my friend is wandering around too, and I should go look for him. Why don't we search together? Maybe we can find your friend too." Jacob added with a smile.

The woman sighed. "I really need assistance from a commoner? Alright, then I suppose introductions are in order. My name's Maribelle." She said, giving a slight curtsy.

Jacob ignored the first part of her sentence before he just smiled back. "I'm Jacob."

The two soon walked through the camp and looked around for their friends.

What happens next?
15511111112211122.title: After the picnic...

155111111122111221.content:
Meanwhile, the picnic had rolled to a close, and most of the members were just talking around. While Celica ended up discussing with Sumia and Cordelia, Greg wandered off to take a look around. The land seemed to be pretty nice, although visible scars from wars were everywhere. Greg wasn't sure he wanted to know what transpired during those times. He probably would hear about it before long though.

Anyway, after exchanging a pleasantry or two with Chrom and taking a walk around, Greg soon found a yellow flash zooming towards him.

"Cleric, coming through!"

BONG!!

And that very yellow flash ran him over, sending him down to the ground.

"OW!" cried Greg as he rubbed his head, which had impacted the ground. The figure that rammed him was slowly getting up, shaking her head.

"Sorry! I didn't see you there! I was in a rush!"

Greg could hear a distinctly female voice as he slowly raised his head. He immediately blushed though as he looked at her. It was a blonde-haired girl, wearing a yellow cleric-like dress. She had a headdress over her hair. Not to mention.....she was quite pretty.

"Oh, um, I'm sorry too." muttered Greg. He helped the girl back up as they dusted themselves off.

"No, it's my fault. I had something to go tell my brother, but I got a little too excited." the girl laughed sheepishly. Greg laughed a bit himself.

"Heh heh, no problem. Here, how about I go with you?" he offered.

"Sounds great!" cheered the girl.
155111111122111221.title: Greg's location

1551111111221112211.content:
Jacob walked alongside Maribelle past other patrons who arrived. The two paid no mind to those around them as Maribelle looked through the crowd for Lissa. She held her parasol horizontally and looked around. She looked more worried by the second. Jacob seeing this, talked to her. "What's your friend look like?"

Maribelle grinned slightly. "Well, she has much more sophisticated clothing then yours," she said. Jacob shook the insult off again as she continued. "She has a yellow Cleric uniform and yellow hair."

Jacob nodded and then started some small talk. "You seem to value manners very much."

Maribelle smiled curtly. "Of course. Manners is what makes a person who they are."

"Well...can't really disprove that. Alright..." Jacob wasn't sure what he felt, but decided maybe he should act a little more, modest. He sighed when he heard Maribelle gasp.

"There!"

She pointed toward a Cleric matching the description with Greg. "There's my friend too." Jacob added.

"Hopefully he's well-mannered." Maribelle said as she hurried to her friend. Jacob sighed and shook his head, grinning a little before catching up.
1551111111221112211.title: Walking with the girl

15521.content:
Name: Jacob

Class: Sage, Lvl 20.

Experience: Tomes A, Staffs C.

Inventory: Valflame, Mjolnir, Forseti, Fortify.

Gender: Male

Appearance: Smaller Sage robes, Black short hair.

Other: Clumsy.

--------------------------------------------------

"Gah!...Oh woah!...nonononoNo!"

Jacob, and all the tomes he was carrying tumbled down a small staircase upon him tripping. When Jacob and his tomes hit the bottom, things went dark...Mainly because he landed on his face and a tome landed on his head.

Personality: Tends to be a recluse around people she dose not know. When she trusts a companion she tends to allow herself to be spoiled. Can be rather brash towards other women.

Austin looked at the cobblestone road as if it were going to give an answer, he shrugged and noded at her. The woman simply gestured at the inn. As soon as the two entered a red haired woman greeted them warmly. His hostess simply pointed at a small table, and he sat down across from her.

The woman ordered a bottle of wine, a salad, and a small loaf of bread then looked at him. He ordered a bottle of rum, steak, and bread, he considered drinking straight from the bottle then decided against it. " I sall you kill the mercenary, very impressive, dont get me wrong it was a just cause. My name is Ashley of the Vincet family. I have been wanting to go to the capital city. As I'm sure you can imagine it is quite dangerous for one of my size and appearence. "

Austin stared at her in slight confusion. " I'm not exactly the best choice for a bodyguard." Ashley sipped her wine daintily before responding. " I'm not interested in common thug, I want a professional. I will deal with expenses from here on out. Well will you join me?

Well I suppose we should get a fast start.. right?"

Ashley stretched and yawned as she prepared her bed for slumber. Her blue nightgown felt so comfortable, the soft candle glow illuminateing the small room. She looked over to her companion who sat fully clothed starring at the moon smoking a cigar allowing the smoke to disappear into the night.

He put it out and tossed the remainder out the window, proceeding to get in his own bed fully clothed. Ashley watched curiously, the damned romance novel was causing her mind to dwell. " Quite enchanting yes, the moon I mean." His stare finally fell on her. " I've always preferred the nighttime." She suddenly felt slightly intrigued " What is it that you fight for?" He finally looked at her. " I suppose I fight to find something worth fighting for." She felt herself blush, she quickly snuffed the flame out to hide her emotion.

Austin starred up at the stars " Do you ever wonder whats up there?" The girl to his left rolled on her side to look at him. " Like what?" Austin shrugged " Maybe someone out their is wondering what its like here." His friend simply looked back up " I guess, do you think we'll ever meet them?" The stars lugh became more and more intense until it blinded him, then a shrill scream. " Wake un Austin, you were thrashing like you had been stabbed. He groggily apologized before falling asleep again.

In the morning the two got an early start. Do the run into someone?

What happens next?

Austin quietly shut the door behind him to avoid waking his employer. The bar was nearly dead, the only people as the bartender and some man sitting alone. He sat away from the lonely man. The red haired woman approached him " Back again, rough night?" He considered buying a drink but then decided against it. " Get the man down their some food, and a drink, here." He handed her gold, the woman smiled at the kindness and disappeared.

A few minutes later she returned placing a loaf of bread in front of him before pointing at Austin. The man got up and sat by him. " Thanks for the food, I'll repay you." Austin shook his head " Austin" he held his hand out " Jacob, do you know of any jobs around?" Austin turned to face him " I don't really know of any, actually I might be able to help you out. I was hired by a woman to protect while she traveled:". I'll vouch for you, if your interested in the job meet her down here in the morning."


The night passed quickly and It was time for them to meet. His thoughts were interrupted by the sound of feminine footsteps approaching. Jacob watched the woman walking towards to his table. Her sapphire colored hair flowing behind her, her elegant clothing leaving much to the imagination. She looked small compared to her guardian, he now wore light armor. His eyes hidden by the shadow of his hood, an impressive blade was in a sheath on his leg, a bow strapped to his back, a knife in a ulster in his cheats armor.

The woman approached the table as her guardian pulled a seat out for her, she thanked him before sitting. He simply stood by her. " Hello I am Ashley, I believe you are the sell-sword By bodyguard spoke of. He believes you to have skills that can aid us. I shall make the same deal as with him, I require skilled warriors."

Jacob nodded to show he was paying attention. " As for conditions, I will handle all appropriate expenses, however alcohol or.... company is paid by your own means. The other condition is that you listen to myself and Austin. Do you accept these terms.

Jacob sat in his current bunk, holding Ragnell in his hands. "Hm. Let's see where this takes us..." He said to himself as he rolled into his bunk to rest. In the morning, Jacob held Ragnell against his shoulder, with his Killing Edge in his sheathe and an axe on his back. He soon left his bunk as he waited in the lobby for his new employers.

As the waled by the door,
15522111121111111.title: House of the dead.

15522111122.content:
The two found themselves on a lonely dirt road for what seemed to go on forever. The illusion ended when they came to a weathered bridge. Ashley was relived to be done walking on the dirt road, she wiped the dirt from her shoes and did not notice the bandits standing in a blockade formation on the bridge.

" Terribly sorry for the inconvenience, but their is a toll on this bridge." Ashley scoffed " Were not paying any toll, especially not on such a rundown bridge. " Well I'm afraid we need something... Perhaps we could work out, another payment method." She brushed a stray hair from her face angerly. The man outstretched a hand to grab her, the advance was interrupted when a blade hacked throuh his wrist.

The theif dropped to his knees " Kall him!" The other bandits stood in confusion " He's goint into shock, I believe he said to "Kill him."" The archer attempted to fire at him before being burned alive by the sorceress. The other three converged on the assassin. The bandit swang his axe as if he was swinging a bat, missing the well trained man only to be stabbed in the side collapseing a lung. The secound managed to hit his blade only to have it thrusted into his assailants chest, dropping him like an empty sack.

The final man dropped his sword apologizeing for attacking. Austin lifted his sword above his head but stopped, instead pointing to the now one handed man. " I thought you were going to kill him. Mercy from an assassin, how will you surprise me next?" She sat besides him as he stared at the water below the bridge now running red. He shrugged " I was more impressed by your firethroughing." He couldn't shake the image, how could a woman her size have that kind of power.

The Sorceress and Assassin found a close by spot to camp. She watched him, she noticed his hand shaking as he once again smoked a cigar, but stopped the shake. " Why do you smoke, surely its a hastle." She expected him to get defensive about the comment, but instead replaced by a smirk while holding his hand out for her to see. " It has a calming effect, not all devices are fully bad. Take Rum for example." He pulled out a flask and gently tossing it, she caught it surpriseed by her own dexterity. " It can calm nerves, treat wounds, help a sleepless man find peace, and free parts of your being. But one of these days my habbits will come back to haunt me. I'm sorry, are these do you mind." She shook her head uncorked it taking a sip. She gaged a bit as it was her first taste of something stronger then wine. She felt the alcohol take effect, she took another sip, the effects grew. She attempted to take another only to have it taken from her " Can't have you too drunk."

As they sat their they heard rustling.
15522111122.title: other

155221111222.content:
The sellsword was ready for whatever stalked in the darkness. The rustling turned out to be a wild dog that ran off. Although it did prove how exposed the area. He quickly jury rigged a tripwire alarm to the oak tree close-by. Ashley felt frightend, as much as she hated, and would never admit to fearing the dark. " Tell me, do you by chanse know any songs?" Austin shrugged reclineing on a log. " A few, why do you ask?" Ashley snickered at the attempt to play coy. " I would like to hear one, and yes this is an order."

" Very well, ach em.
And who are you, the proud lord said,
thatI must bow so low?Only a cat of a different coat,
that's the truth I know.
In a coat of gold or a coat of red
a lion still has claws,
And mine are long and sharp, my lord,
as long and sharp as yours, and so he spoke, and so he spoke,
that lord of Castamere,
But now rains weep o'er his hall,
with no one their to hear.
Yes now the rains weep o'er his hall, and not a soul to hear."

Ashley suddenly felt intimidateed by the lyrics. " Where do you know that song? I've never heard it before." Her companion looked back to her. " It was a song about my city's lord. It made an example out of a disrespectfull lord. Lets just leave it at that." Ashley fell asleep quickly.

" We have to move, now!" Ashley quickly slipped her shoes on and followed him to a natural hiding spot. In the vantage point the spot.

The flyer had a depiction of her face, underneath it read " Attention bounty hunters, Mercenarys, and Assassins. Known apostate, wanted dead or alive. Speak with Roman Sionis." She crumpled it before dropping it and stamping it in an attempt to blur the contents. " What are we going to do?"

choices: One of them falls in battle.

" What!? Y.. you're turning me in?" Austin simply shook his head. " No, I'm loyal to only you, until you dismiss me. What I mean is we find a place to hold up. I go into town to speak with Sionis, then we fortify our hideaway."

Austin had done his research well. It seems that Sionis had hired a mercenary group, as for how many he did not know. If this wasn't bad enough, a single assassin had been hired, a man that he knew like a brother. He was far more worried about him.

The two found an abandoned mine, still housing powder kegs. The holes dug in the terrain were easily converted into pungistake traps. These along with beartraps, Garrote traps, and with a brilliant display of alchemy, Ashley created bottles of Alchemists Fire which were strung up at strategic points.

After a day of rest the night fell quickly, the torchlight from the mercenarys shined like the sun. Their were thirty plus change, will they survive?
15522111122212.title: " First we need to go to town."

155221111222121.content:
Ashley couldn't pretend anymore, it didn't matter now as it may be the last time that she would see him. Austin cursed himself for not making more traps, then he felt something wrap around his chest, it was Ashley. " Just for good luck." He hugged her back before letting go. Austin held his bow, Ashley holding five tomes in her arms prepared for anything.

Their was a large battle cry then the army charged up the hill. The vision was grisly, first two fell into the pits dieing instantly. Then two ran into the Garrotes, it provided time for Austin to end their struggles with arrows. Ashley releaseed the Fire bottles which effectively incinerating five archers. The panic of the fire caused three men to end up in the flames as well. Ashley started throwing dark magic down, the results were hard to watch. The dark magic instantly reducing the targets to smoking skeletons.

Unfortunately twenty men made it passed the barrage unscathed. The two retreated into the mines. " I'm out of ideas Ashley. I'm going to have to hold them back, you stay back go prepare the safe-room..." She argued but he simply cut her off. " Go!"

The men began surrounding him, they were amateurs for sure. He dropped the brave sword before picking up two Killing edges. " Just one word of advise, run." The men began rushing at him, but due to the cramped halls their numbers meant nothing. He watched a flask fly over his head incinerateing most of the group, he then mop-up the remainders.

He walked out of the mine to feel a sudden powerful strike to his head. He went down, but was still conciseness remained, " "Austin!" Ashley tried to run to him only to be lnocked to the ground. but all he could do was watch as a heavily armord man lifted his heavy axe above his head. Suddenly an arrow hit the executioner in the head before Austin passed out. When he came to Ashley was kneeling beside him. He looked to the arrow to see a slip of paper stabbed onto it. It read " All I wan't a final fight. Meet me at the bottom of the hill." Does he fallow the directions, or not.
155221111222121.title: Gorilla Warfare.

1552211112221211.content:
"Who is he exactly?" Ashley asked as the walked down the hill. " Well I have a hunch, I believe Is Joshua, or known as Slade. "Do you really have to fight him?" Ashley asked not fully understanding. " He saved both of our lives... Regardless I owe him for more than that." He stopped as if still in thought. " So how did you know him?" She stepped in front of him. " We were trained together, apart from that we survived hell..."

The duo eventually reached a clearing, sure enough their " Savior" was waiting. He wore black light metal armor, along with a grey mask effectively only showing his eyes. " Looks like you got my invitation! Come on!" Slade drew his blade and rushed at Austin. The clank of metal rang out as the duelests looked for a flaw in the other man.

Ashley could only watch, as much as she wanted to help. Austin slashed Slade in the leg as he felt his opponents blad hack into his left arm. He recoiled back in pain, he sidesteped Slades sword slashing him in the stomach. The upper-hand vanished as the other assassin to slash Austin's arm then dissarming him before swinging back. As Austin watched the edge of the blade hitting his left eye.

Excruciating pain flowed through him, as he felt lightheaded as his assistant through him to the ground. In a moment of deja vu he stared at the blade at his throat. He remember the dagger on his side, in pure reflex he shoved the sword away momentarily before slicing Slades hamstring fallowed by stabbing his stomach region. He struggled to stand and hobble over to his dieing friend. " ..... A... Austin... I noticed you aren't wearing..... the armor...... are you shamed?" The gravely wounded man asked, his lung was pierced. " No, I lost it in a battle." He ignored the fact that he could only see out his right eye. " I brought another suit and mask... Its my honor to bestow the title of Slade.... Our clan lives through you. My only regret is I never sall the ocean."

" We're already at the sea, can't you tell?" Joshuas senses believeing him " .... Oh I can hear the waves... I see..." His friend never finished his thought as he sucumed to his injury. Ashley ran to Austin covering her mouth and emitting an " eep!" Austins eye closed, blood streaming down his face.

After Ashley tended to his wounds and created an eye patch. Austin opened the chest, inside was armor, it was light metal colored black on the chest piece and silver on the shoulders. As for the mask he had to patch up the left eye piece. Ashley admired his armor, he looked like a dark knight, his mask hiding his face.

Will they move on or relax for a few days.
1552211112221211.title: The duel.

choices: "Theirs a town a place not far from here thats having a carnival."

Austin picked up the blade that took his left eye, it was essentially a brave sword but bearing the Lin Kuei emblem. He hadn't realizeed that the clans ranks had been desalinated. He placed the sword on the holster on his back.

He treked back to the mine grabbing a shovel walking back to the cleaning. He began digging a grave, eventually it was a respective grave. He picked up Joshua's Killing Edge stabbing it into the ground, he then placed the fallen mans mask on the hilt as a headstone.

Ashley watched this for an uncomfortable amount of time until she decided to break the silence. " I think we should rest for a while."

" What was the name he gave you, Slade. Isn't that what you called him?" Austin struggled to adjust to his vision. " Its a title in the Lin Que, it refers to a Hero of the Lin Que. It now means I'm one of the last if I was chosen." Ashley wanted to voice her opinion on the confuseing customs, but decided against it. " So do I need to refer to you as Slade?" He shook his head yes. " Very well then, I shall refer to you as such." After a few hours they arrive at the town. It has a large decorated tower in the heart, the surrounding geography was surpriseingly varied a swamp to the west, a long dead valley to the west, and a lake to the east. Theywalked into the inn and were quickly greated by a red haired woman. " Hello, welcome to the Windfall Inn. We fortunatly only have one room available. That will be Fifty gold.

The two head up to their room and quickly pass out. Do they have relax the next few days, or does something bad happen?
155221111222121121.title: "Theirs a town a place not far from here th...

Slade awoke from a horrible dream of what could have been. He felt his face placed the eyepatch on his blind eye and began getting dressed in the armor and mask. He looked at himself in the mirror. Ashley began to awake as well, sighing in annoyance. " Your up early." Slade turned to her waiting for orders.

" I told you, we are here to have fun." She said crossing her arms still mostly under the covers. " Is that an order, mam?" Non ironically. Ashley slowly stood and walked towards him. " Yes it is! We are going to have so much damn fun, you.. Your going to have to hold back tears of joy!" She stood on her toes poking him in the chest. She could tell he was smiling at her under the mask, again she realized just how much taller he was.

Who's day shpuld we follow?

15522111122212112112.content:
Ashley led the way through the crowds. Her surpressed inner-child loving the sights and sounds. She noticed a gamestall nearny and dragged her companion along. " Hit three miss and win a prize." He handed her a bow, she took careful aim but was only able to hit one target. " Damn, I hate archery!" She was surprised to see Slade motion for the bow.

Time stopped as he took aim. His eye twitched as he tried to ignore the voice of doubt in his head. He missed the first shot, he adjusted then perfectly hit one target. Then another, and the third. " Very good sir! Which one do you want? " He pointed to the wall of large stuffed animals. Ashley pointed to the Chicken, it was her favorite animal. She squeezed it with joy.

After dinner they retired to the room, Ashley kicked her shoes off and through on her night gown. Slade however only removed the mask and armor. " What a great day! What better way to end it, than with a nice book.

This may have been a mistake as the chapter detailed an intimate momemt between a knight and maiden. Fortunately Slade had passed out long ago as to not see her embarrassment.

In the morning they find a contract for an assassination, who is it?
15522111122212112112.title: Slade

155221111222121121122.content:
The flyer was pinned to a post outside depicting none other than Evelyn and Bron Crowe . Bron was a grand master of another prominent warrior clan, and his wife. It seemed like a win win scenario.

The two walked through the wooded area. Just beyond the tree-line lay the fortress of the Steel Talon clan. He was formulating a plan when the two heard something that shook him from his thought.
155221111222121121122.title: Ripples through time.

choices: The rise of a new Gladiator.
1552211112221211211221.content:
The two spun around to see knights pointing spears at them. " We hav a cavalry detachment waiting. Lord Sionis has requested an audience with the apostate." Ashley stepped forward " Very well, stand down." Slade reluctantly sheathed his weapon.

The trip took three days, the entire time Slades hands were bound. They arrived at a large estate next to the arena. They soon found themselves standing before the man who had paid to take their lives. " The lead knight wearing the gilded armor stepped forwards kneeling. " Your lordship I have brought the heretics."

The lord looked disapproveingly at his knight. " This is no way to treat a talented sorceress." Ashley could sense the confusion " But I thought." " Now." The lord stated as though his patience ran thin. The knight turned towards her. " Release her, keep him binded." Even though he couldn't see the mans eyes, Slade could tell the armored men were glaring at him.

" I do apologies about the mercenarys, they weren't suppose to kill you. But it seems you made quick work of them." Ashley politely let him continue. " You see, I realized my peers had legions of sorcerers, I only had my trusted Sage. And so I started the witch-hunt, poor choice of words. Regardless the mercenarys proved your strength, not only of you, but your assassin." Slade looked up at his mention.

Before Ashley could protest, Sionis continued. " You see, Mr. Slade is it? Although I am impressed by your skills, I need to see more. Take him to the pit." Three knights forced him out violently.

Who should we fallow.
1552211112221211211221.title: " Hault, lay down your weapons!"

choices: Will he fight in the morning.
15522111122212112112212.content:
The guards opened a large wooden door while releaseing Slade from his shackes and forcing him in, closing the door behind him. Inside were multiple individual cells, and a foyer area. It was a dark, bleak place, not only in appearance, but smell and feeling.

As his eye adjusted to the darkness he noticed a man wearing gladiatorial armor, a helmet and armor tinted with blood. He stood at probably 6'3. " I take you are the new, initiate? I am Marus, I have been fighting for as long as I can remember... I am somewhat of a crowd favorite, an asset that you need to last long." Slade faced the man fully " I am Slade. Are the fights they to the death? I thought the queen royal family tried to ban blood-sport."

The man seemed to ponder for a moment. " I do not know about politics, but lord Sionus is fond of fights, and if he wants a death, he shall get it.... You see there are three main locations you will fight. The Courtyard, the arena, and perhaps a private chaimber. But enough talk for now friend, tomorrow you will need your strength.
15522111122212112112212.title: The rise of a new Gladiator.

Slade inspected the armor, it was a light chainmail chest plate covered with a blue garb. On top of that was a mask, black on top and side with a blue cloth hideing only showing his eyes. " Hey Marus, what is with all the blue cloth." The helmeted man seemed surprised, or his movements did. " It is the color of the gods, they favor you. Someone here is taking a liking to you." Slade put on the armor pondering that, he wasn't sure how to feel. Soon the door was violently opened. " Five minutes you welps!"

Slade watched as the large gate withdrew giving him a spectacular view. Countless people cheered as they walked into the arena. He wasn't able to enjoy the scene as a large man with a spear approached on a horse. He barely sidestepped the weapon as the man road off once more. He noticed Marus tearing through another opponent.

A mam wielding an axe charged at him. He sidestepped the slow man before stabbing his iron sword through his heart. The crowd roared to life at the kill. The man on horseback charged him, he timed perfectly slashing the mans leg, sending him tumbling of the horse. The man lay gravely injured. The crowd went silent to see what would happen. He couldn't tell why, but he didn't want to kill the man.

Slade tossed the blade to the ground, the crowd remained silent until one voice broke the silence. " Mercy, he is a true Hero!" The crowd erupted once more as the remaining Gladiators nodded in respect of the rather graceful act.

He sat on a wooden bench resting. " Their is something special about you. Not only are you becomeing a crowd pleaser, but the other Gladiators are speaking highly of you."

Where will his next event be at?
155221111222121121122121.title: Making fans and allies.

1552211112221211211221211.content:
The guards forced Slade through a long passage. As soon as he walked out he could feel the light rain on soaking through the black hood. In the middle of the courtyard was a stage made of white granet with a sapphire colored falcon in the middle. On two opposite sides where seats for spectator, a throne sat on the top row of the right side. A waterway ran underneath the stage, most likely to remove the grisly aftermath. Surrounding the stage were guards wearing white masks hiding their faces, each carried a spear and had a sword on their sides.

He walked to the stage, he noticed Ashley sitting in one of the chairs. He couldn't stare though as his opponent now stood on the opposite side of the stage. The man wore a garb and masked hood as well, only his was a simple tan color. He looked at Lord Sionis waiting. One of the masked guards stepped onto the ring. " This fight will be an unarmed fight, turn over any concealed weapons. If you do not you wilk be struck with a loss."

The two fighters handed over their swords. Slade was decently fighting stance. His opponent quickly struck first hitting him square on the jaw. Slade spat some blood up, he had to focus, this wasn't some drunkard fighting him, it was a seasoned fighter.

The man throws another punch, this time having his arm grabbed then thrown quite hard onto the stone floor. He quckly stood again striking Slade in the stomach. Slade nearly vomited before regaining his senses and striking the hooded man in the throat. His opponent hacked and coughed in pain before once-over being thrown thrown hard to the ground.

Slade decided to ensure the man stayed down. He grabbed the mans arm at the elbow before quickly twisting it sending out a loud cracking sound. The guard forced the beaten man onto his knees. " Either you kill him, or I will." He stepped away again. It would be more humane, and give him a dignified death. He grabbed the half conscious mans head before swiftly breaking his neck, his lifeless body falling over. The noble men and women began clapping for the display. Sionis roaring in delight.

Later that night as he sat inregret, a knock on the wooden door. " You have a visitor." A guard yelled.

Who is at the door.
1552211112221211211221211.title: Fight to the death.

choices: He would rather stay in the arena.
15522111122212112112212112.content:
Slade didn't care that he didn't have his mask on, he simply put the eye patch back on. As soon as he did the door opened. In a woman with long light blond hair cascadeing down on either side of her face. She wore a ruby colored gown that reached her ankles. Her body was petite in stature as she stood around 5,5. Her eyes were crystal blue and calculateing.

He stood slowly as she inspected her surroundings. " I must ask how you deal with the revolting... well everything really." He stared in confusion " I make do. unfortunately I wasn't born with a silver spoon." Why was she here, who is she, surely she hadn't come down here to talk down to him, or perhaps she did.

She smiled at the comparison to herself. " I assume you don't know who I am. I am Lena, Sionis's sister." She stepped towrds him, still confusing. " I don't know if you sall me today, but I sall both of your fights. It impressed me. I would like you to be my Champion... I assume your mind took that for an inuindo? It means when challenged you fight for my honor. In addition you will ne a member of my " Royal Guard." He stepped back to think it over. " Hmmh, you think its a proposition? Don't be foolish." She stated dryly.

Does he agree.
15522111122212112112212112.title: Meeting with royalty.

155221111222121121122121121.content:
Slade stood staring down at her, her crystal eyes judging him. " Very well, It is better than staying here." Lena smirks at him in victory. " I knew you would see reason. Now, what your wearing is fine for the uniform, but the mask must stay off." He nodded, it was already off, he had also gotten used to the eye patch. " You will refer to me as Lady Lena, or mam. Now please follow me." He followed her up many staircases until she reached a small wooden doors. " This will be your quarters, you will be given breakfast and dinner. Use the night to get used to the palace. Come speak with me when your ready." And with that she turned and walked off, her footsteps fadeing in the distance.

When will he go to speak with Lena?
155221111222121121122121121.title: Who would turn down that?

1552211112221211211221211212.content:
Slade walked down the brightly lit hallway stopping to look out the side of an open terrace. He hadn't realized the palace rested above a grand lake, the wether warm and clear. He eventually reached the elegant door to Lenas room, only problem Tartarus and a few more honor guards stood just outside. " Excuse me, I have an appointment with Lady Lena." He stood knowing the gold-plated knight was glaring from behind the helmet.

" You're no knight." Slade could see where this was headed. " No, but I was appointed to the Royal Guards." Tartarus stood silent for a moment. " You are a cutthroat that doesnt fight with honor, nothing more. Your luck will run out." Slade had heard enough " I sure am. Well I would love to sit here an listen to your insults, but I do need to talk to Lena." He stepped towards the door only to be harassed once more. " Lay a hand on the door, and you loose the hand." Just before it excelated further, the door opened.

" Your late, come in." He followed her in pulling out a chair frow the long table.

What will be the days events?
1552211112221211211221211212.title: The next morning.

15522111122212112112212112121.content:
Slade followed close behind Lady Lena. Eventually he arrived at a long tenament hall. Their was four people already waiting for theme. One of which is Ashley wearing a far more elegant gown. Besides her was the head sorcerer, Jorah Hou. He had long shoulder length jet black hair, his facial hair comprised of a gotee.

Besides him sat a man around 30 with long brown hair, he wore armor under grey wolf fur, he had a silver sword at his side. The last was Lena's brother Drake, who was already famous for his prowess with a blade. He was slightly older than her at the age of 35.

They looked up from the map on the table. " Lena, I take he's the assassin turned Gladiator? I am Drake Lenas brother, and unfortunately means I'm the brother of Sionis as well. He held out his hand out and Slade shook it. " Besides me is Robert, Jorah the Sorcerer, and I believe you already know Ashley. Before we move forward, I must be sure you are loyal."

Who does Slade side with.
15522111122212112112212112121.title: Amongst conspirators and rebels.

155222.content:
Name: Emma
Age: 18
Appearance: 5,5 with long red hair. Wears a simple gown and feminine footwear, but prefers to be barefoot only when indoors.
Personality: Very caring of other people. Quite naive and unexperienced. Dreams of leaving the ranch. She has Arachnophobia, and has never swam before due to Hydrophobia.
Bio: Has lived with her older brother Joshua, and father. Lived of her fathers ranch her entire life.
Class Villager:
Weapon knowledge and handling: Lance E
Skills: Aptitude.
Equipment: pitchfork.
Weakness: Skill, strength, and Defense.
155222.title: The Farmgirl

1552221.content:
Emma awoke to a bloodcurdling scream, and the distinct smell of smoke. She scrambled out of bed rushing to get dressed as her father flung the door open. He was wearing his old armor, now spattered with blood. " You need to leave now!" She followed him outside, which now resembled Hell on earth as flames slowly consumed the Village.

A large group of men were closing in on theme. They wore simple leather armor and bandanas making them look even more intimidating. Emma thought they would be attacked as a gravely voice interrupted. " Stand back boys, this ones mine."

The men parted revealing the most terrifying man she had ever seen. He stood above 6,5 he had a large beard, but no hair on his scalp. He held two large swords, one in each hand that were identical. " What's wrong Knight, don't recognize an old friend?" The man stabbed the blades into the ground leaning on the strong handles. " No I remember you, TwinBlade. I just wish I wasn't looking at your sorry arse."

TwinBlade let out a hardy laugh. " Ha, the two things that didn't change is your armor, and sense if humor. Don't pity me, I,m not the one who became a farmer! The only thing you did was raise a beautiful daughter." He gestured towards her disturbing her greatly.

" Listen to me! You need to run, go find Joshua and escape. Don't argue, I love you Em." She hugged him before turning and fleeing. She began to tire and stopped to rest. As she did she noticed a man lying on the cobblestone road. Her fears were confirmed as she got closer she recognized it as her brother. He had a deep hole in his chest and sword still in hand, Emma couldn't take any more and collapsed on he knees weeping " No, Josh please don't leave me, I can't do this alone!" she heard hooping closing in on her and quickly scrambled under a nearby bridge.

Is she able to evade the bandits?
1552221.title: Bandit Raid

15522211.content:
The sounds of screams and trampling feet filled the night as Emma hid. She heard the man known as TwinBlade above him, but they had given up. She felt her self fall into sleep somehow.

Horrified upon waking, her home was destroyed and her brother Joshua and now most likely her father was dead.

What happens next?
15522211.title: They pass by.

155222111.content:
Name: Jacob
Class: Level 20 Tactician
Weapons: Sword=A, Tomes=A. Eliwood's Blade, Celica's Gale, Micaiah's Pyre, Thoron.
Skills: Limit Breaker, Armsthrift, Ignis, Acrobat, Aggressor.
Gender: Male
Bio: An amnesiac who searches for traces of his past whilst studying, but will stop to help someone.
Personality: Humble, understanding, curious.
Appearance: Black Tactician robes, with a white undershirt and short dark brown hair

---------------

Jacob sheathed his blade as the last bandit fell at his feet. He saw the smoke and had traveled here to find to bandits rummaging through the debris of destroyed structures. He stepped over a few farmers who appeared dead when he saw something poking out from a small crate. It looked like a shoe of somekind. Jacob walked towards it as he heard faint noises from inside. "Are you okay?" Jacob asked as the noise seemed to soften a bit.

"Come on, I'm not here to hurt you," Jacob said as he crouched. Soon the crate gate opened and a girl sat in front of him. "Are you alright? What happened here?"
155222111.title: Someone Arrives (Another Character)

choices: It is a person or persons.
1552221111.content:
Emma stood up slowly, normally she would have felt embarrassed, but now she was just happy to see another person. " Who are you?" " I'm Emma I live on a Ranch in the village, or I did." Her mind had suppressed the traumatic ordeal. Before she could revisit the events they heard a noise like thunder approaching.

Who, or what is drawing near?
1552221111.title: Revisiting Sorrow

choices: It is too dangerous to stay.
They will get by on their own.
15522211111.content:
Jacob and Emma turned in the direction of the sound, and were met with an spectacular sight. From here she could tell they where knights, their armor colors bore the same crest. The men slowed to a stop, they were aweinspireing like the legends her brother told her long ago. Where were they when the village needed them.

The one in front wore very elaborately decorated armor, he was likely the leader. He leaped down demo ding his helmet in respect, he looked more like a king than a knight. "Are you from the village?" Emma simply nodded " I know this may be difficult, but you must tell me what happened." One of the men wearing a black helmet climes down chuckling before removing his helmet. He appeared to be in his mid thirties, bald, and had a long scare on the top of his head.

" What can we achieve from a sniveling farm girl? She waists our time." Some of the other knights laughed at this, the king knight was not amused. Emma looked away in shame of being chastised. " You are out of line Robert. Our duty is to defend from all threats. We are not abandoning them" He motioned towards Jake and herself.

" I am Richard, head Commandant of the Order of the Lion. Here this will help." He handed her a flask of liquid, she uncorked it and sipped from it, it tasted reminiscent of apples. Her body felt like electricity revitalizing her body and mind. She took a deep breath and retold the events.

The scouts returned from the scorched town one carrying a helmet. The green knight bowed his head holding out her fathers helmet. She took it in her hands, it had a gash on the side. She ran her hand over the helmet surprised how smooth the metal was, and how... cold it felt.

" Your father was a grand knight, I wish I could have known him. I can't take back what has been done, but we would be glad to escort you two. One of the capital cities is about a two day ride."

Do our hero's leave with the knights?
15522211111.title: The Knights of The Order of the Lion

155222111121.content:
Jacob soon heard movement around them and low guttural breaths. Wolves. Jacob quickly pushed Emma back into the crate and closed it. "Stay there!" He yelled. As two grey wolves rushed from the bushes. Jacob swung and sliced the first one and followed up by stabbing the other. He soon heard movement in a nearby bush. Revealing Micaiah's Pyre, rained fire in the bush, hearing wolves howl and yip in pain. Then it was quiet.

He turned to open the crate when a sharp pain clamped on his shoulder and leg. Two wolves caught him offguard. One tore at his leg and another brought him down after biting into his shoulder. He quickly grabbed his blade and stabbed the shoulder biter, when the leg biter bit his arm. He yelled and kicked the wolf off, and got up and stabbed it with his left hand, unharmed. Jacob had a deep bite in his left shoulder, an injured left leg and a severely torn right arm. He slowly opened the crate but collapsed soon after breathing heavily.

What does Emma do?
155222111121.title: Wolves

1552221111211.content:
Emma took a deep breath, cowaring like a scolded child wouldent help anything. She looked around quickly picking up a pitchfork. She jabbed the one of the wolves in the shoulder blade, it yelped with pain at the cold metal piercing it. It quickly backed off as the other aggressive beast took notice and ignored Jacob.

Emma stood as tall as she could, pitchfork at the ready. The remaining wolf quickly realizing the shift in favor just stared at her. She noticed a burning piece of lumber and quickly waved the blazing stick back and forth. The wolf turned and quickly decided the risks weren't worth it, slowly backing into the darkness.

Emma sighed in relief as the silence returned. She quickly remembered Jacob and quickly ran to his side. He was passed out due to shock. His wounds were surviveable, as long as she could clean the wounds and cover them his wounds should heal properly. She quickly began rummaging through the creates and found a bottle of pure alcohol, a thick shirt, and an elixir. Luckily she had delt with cattle being bitten, so she in a sense knew what to do.

She quickly leaned him into one of the large creates, she poured the alcohol on his bites, the wounds bubbleing proved the disinfection was working. She then used his sword to cut long strips of cloth, rapping his bites. She brought the elixir to his lips quickly pouring it in.

Emma watched as Jacob's eyes slowly opened looking at her in slight confusion. " Careful... You were hurt bad, just rest for a minute." Jacob sat catching his breath, as Emma sat coping what had happened before turning to him. " We should find somewhere safe." Should they go find an inn, or somewhere else?'
1552221111211.title: Fighting fear.

15522211112111.content:
"An inn...Yeah, people are there. So hopefully we can avoid trouble and find some help," Emma said. Jacob's vision, like his memory, was hazy. He tried to stand, but his leg burned in pain. It wasn't long before Emma stood before him again. Taking his good arm, she put it over her shoulders and hoisted him alongside her. Jacob was looking at the ground weak and confused before his vision wandered up and he saw Emma. "Stay in there alright? We'll get to an inn and you can rest."

Jacob gave what looked like a drunken nod to the girl as they began down the dusty path.

Wasn't long before they found an inn. The moment they entered, Emma immediately laid Jacob against a bench as she and the bartender got into a somewhat heated argument. Jacob soon lost consciousness and passed out.

He awoke in a bed and looked about him. Seemed like an inn's room. He laid there, limbs still in pain when...
15522211112111.title: An Inn would be safer.

choices: He should play it safe and just stay around town.
155222111121111.content:
Emma opened the door with a man following her. Jacob the wan wore robes and carried a staff that had a blade on the bottom as he looked over the injured man befor casting something over him, it caused him to feel like his arm and leg felt far better. " So will he be ok?" The man turned back to her " Well, his muscles will ach fo a good while, but no lasting effects other than that. But don't let him push himself to much.

Emma stepped towards him reaching for her wallet. " What do we owe you." The war cleric waved away the gesture. " You owe me nothing." And with that he walked out. Emma turned back to her bedridden companion. " Well.. I suppose you should take it easy today. Is their anything you would like to do in town?"
155222111121111.title: ...Emma enters.

1552221111211112.content:
"I can't just sit around," Jacob said soon attempting to get up. "I need to-...gah!" Jacob grabbed his side in pain and fell back into the bed. The farmgirl hurried to his side and eased him down.

"Don't. Please," she said concerned. "You still need rest."

Jacob groaned and slumped back into the bed. "Hey..."
His voice was quiet and tired. "Th-thanks..." He said.

Emma smiled a little. "I'm just glad you found me when you did."

"Oh...what happened when I got there?"
Jacob asked.
1552221111211112.title: He hates just sitting around

choices: He lets her help him around, possibly working.
He tries to move on, even iff he has to sneak out.
15522211112111121.content:
Emma sat thinking about how to explain. " Well.. My town had been raded by bandits..." She swallowed the lump in her throught, she fought the tears but then gave in. " You came along and saved me from them.. But a few Wolves attacked, you again fought hard. Two were able to pounce. I was able to keep the two at bay.."

Emma could read the embarrassed look he hid. " After that I helped you get here, we've only been here for about a day." Jacob thought about getting up before decideing to respond. " Look, I get your concern. Really I do, but I cant just lie around."

Emma signed slightly realizeing the argument was about to start again. " You need to rest, I'll help you get around town until your better... How dose that sound?" She aseked retorically.

Dose Jacob let her help him?
15522211112111121.title: Emma explains

choices: ...he manages to move around on his own.
155222111121111211.content:
Jacob nodded slowly. "A-alright. You can help me. But first, help me out of this freakin' bed."

Emma nodded and slowly helped the boy up and braced him up. "How does that feel?" Emma asked.

"L-like hell, but it'll work...th-thanks." He said, he moved to try and advance on his own when...
155222111121111211.title: He lets her help him around, possibly working.

choices: " We should focus on finding jobs."
1552221111211112112.content:
Emma braced the taller boy up, then slowly backed away. She watched as his leg twitched it was clearly painful. He took limped across the room to his pile of clothing on a chair and quickly got dressed. He then shambled over to the door opening it before turning back to face her.

"Well, you coming?" He asked sounding impatient. Emma sighed once more, she would have to try harder to keep him safe, and keep up. " What did you have in mind?" She asked him as they stepped out in the cool of the day. He struggled down the front steps before responding.
1552221111211112112.title: ...he manages to move around on his own.

15522211112111121122.content:
"We'll need cash, and a good bit of it. I say we find a few jobs around town and volunteer for some gold." Jacob said. He opened the door out of the inn with Emma behind him. He looked around, then back at Emma. "Just search around town a bit and see if you can't find yourself a job. We'll meet back here by sunset." He turned and went his own way.

Jacob was grateful and happy that the girl was with him, honest. But his lost thoughts frustrated him. Jacob soon came across a small stable, looking for someone to tend horses. Jacob soon entered and after some negotiating, got a job tending the horses.
15522211112111121122.title: " We should focus on finding jobs."

155222111121111211221.content:
Emma walked on down the town, lost in thought. She got the feeling Jacob was annoyed with her, she felt a ping of nostalgia from it. Like he was trying to avoid his kid sister, her in this case. She eventually noticed a large mansion resting at the very edge of th town. Estates always were needing help, plus she was a great candidate for the job. She could take care of animals, clean, and cook ( not great, but she could get by.) She walked passed the shining gates and up to the elegant door, she pounded the knocker and waited.

She stood waiting for quite some time, and just before she almost walked away when the door opened. Inside stood an entirely armored man the was nearly a foot taller than her. " Yes?" Asked a voice conflicting with the intimidating appearingm sounding like a man her age, possibly slightly younger. " Oh, umm... I was wondering if I could see someone about a job?" she asked her voice shaking from her nervousness.

" That will be all Alfons." The armored man moved aside revealing a tall, slim butler, although the small scar along his hairline showed he wasn't always in the occupation. " Please, follow me miss." He then closed the door behind her and led her up the ornate staircase. She followed him down seemingly endless hallway before knocking on the door at the end before opening the door. She suddenly felt like she made a mistake.

The man sitting at the desk appeared to be in his late twentys and had mid length black hair, not short but wasn't long either. He had green eyes that inspected her, he wore a blue military dress uniform with ribbons and medals, as did most of the other men and women in the estate. He was talking to a woman a little taller than herself, her blonde hair tied in a bun. Her uniform looking identical to the mans, minus the ribbons. The womans blue eyes judgeing her more harshly.

" Excuse me Major Hews, the young lady behind mr was asking about a job." The major still sat with his hands in-front of his mouth. " Thank you Elton...." The grey haired man walked out. The Major motioned towards the empty chair. She swallowed hard before accepting it.

Should we keep following her, or switch back.
155222111121111211221.title: Emma's job

1552221111211112112211.content:
Jacob dropped to a chair after making a final round on the horses. His body was killing him. Aching and hurting, he groaned. Soon the owner of the stable. An old man with grey hair and a worn green outfit approached him. "You finished?" He asked Jacob.

Jacob looked at him and nodded. "Yeah...yeah, I finished." The man smiled and handed Jacob a bag of coin as payment. Jacob nodded in thanks. Guess his work day was up. He grabbed a nearby ledge and braced himself against it, before slowly shambling outside.

Jacob had been thinking of how he was acting to the girl. He groaned, she didn't deserve the crap he was giving her. If her family was really destroyed at that ranch, then he should be nicer. He was mad about his amnesia, but shouldn't take it out on her. He groaned and soon walked back to the inn. He also thought about Emma's current job.

What next?
1552221111211112112211.title: Switch back to Jacob.

15522211112111121122111.content:
Emma steadied herself on the broom as she nearly feel asleep on her feet before jumping awake. The Major inspected her work before smiling at her again. " You did good, real good. Unfortunately the pay isn't as high paying as other jobs, generally the perks are boarding and expenses full paid, typical for maids.. But I pulled some strings and have your pay." He tossed her the bag which she promptly fumbled before catching. " We have room available, you sure you wouldn't rather work, and stay here?" She starred at her payment, the help, and military seemed like a family, she wanted to say yes.

She slowly shook her head. " Well if you change your mind, or need help come talk to me. Oh and keep the uniform, just an added bonus." She smiled tiredly before leaving.

Emma crept up the staircase of the inn before struggleing to open the heavy door. Jacob sat facing the small window. She walked up to the long mirror in the room looking at herself. Her new uniform looked far better then her old raggedy gown, and once again her cherry red hair looked so much pretty then before. She noticed Jacob starring, but in a mor flattering way, she blushed and got ready for bed.

What happens in the morning?
15522211112111121122111.title: Rewards of a hard days labor.

155222111121111211221112.content:
Jacob woke up the next morning to pain in his body. He saw Emma already up and dressed. Jacob groaned, and caught Emma's attention. "Morning," she said. Jacob sat up slowly, "Morning."

"We have some time before work so I thought we could just stay around here awhile longer," Emma asked.

Jacob nodded, "Y-yeah...Sure."

Emma turned and looked at Jacob suspiciously almost. "Is there something wrong?"

Jacob sighed. "I...I'm sorry for giving you crap and for being stuck with me. My freakin' body is in pain and I can't do a thing about it. And I'm taking it out on you. "S-sorry about that," he said.

How does Emma react?
155222111121111211221112.title: They stick around.

1552221111211112112211121.content:
Emma stopped fixing her hair and stared at him for a moment. She was confused about why he was apologizing. " Umm... apology accepted I guess. I tell ya what, I still have time let's go have breakfast." Jacob waved his heans in a "no" fashion. Emma rolled her eyes " Oh, don't even start, Jacob." She tapped her foot impatiently as he got dressed.

Emmas eye's light up when she sall the food the inn had. Her eyes locked on a large bar of chocolate. She always loved chocolate. She bought the chocolate along with apple cider.

She sat at the opposite side of the table. She again noticed Jacob starring at her. " Is.. something wrong?"

Does Jacob stay and talk, or just leave.
1552221111211112112211121.title: Apology accepted

15522211112111121122111211.content:
Jacob fidgeted a bit in the chair. "I...I have amnesia, I guess." Emma gave him a look that seemed a bit confused but surprised.

"The earliest memory I have is waking in a field alone. I wandered to a town where an innkeeper helped me for the moment to get back on my feet. The town clerics couldn't help me or the innkeeper. He gave me some food and gold and asked what weapon I prefer. I knew about tomes and swords. I bought myself some weapons and left the town. A few hours later, I found you at the ranch. I just want to know something about my past, anything." Jacob twiddled his folded hands.

"But maybe I could stay with you a little while...?" Jacob asked while trying to hide his nervousness.

What next?
15522211112111121122111211.title: He stays and talks.

155222111121111211221112111.content:
Emma perked up drawing the conclusion. " You could come live in the estate. Major Hews said if I needed anything to ask." He noded in acknowledgment. Sure enough Emma found herself once again knocking the large brass handle. The door opened revealing the armored man. " Hello Alfonse!" She watched as he eyed Jacob, or she guessed thats what he was doing behind the helmet. " Don't worry, he's with me." Emma felt a strange feeling of dejavu as she and her companion followed Elton down the hall again before she found herself once again standing in-front of the Major. The same woman staring her down again.

" Excuse me Sir, but my friend wanted to speak with you." He switched to looking at Jacob. " I see... Please sit." And with that Emma left the two to talk.

Should we follow Jacob now?
155222111121111211221112111.title: Emma's reaction

1552221111211112112211121111.content:
Jacob sat in the adorned room across from man in a military garb. "Emma says you have something to ask me," Major Hews said. Jacob took a deep breath and nodded. "Yes, sir."

He explained his case of déjà vu and everything up to it. He told him about how he helped Emma and how they ended up here. "Emma said you would allow us to stay here. I hope it wouldn't be trouble..." Jacob said.

"Emma's a good worker and person. I trust her. You can stay," Major Hews said, rising.

Jacob stood as well and bowed slightly. "Thank you sir," Jacob said. Major Hews sent a man to get the room Jacob would be in ready. Jacob wandered around the mansion and...
1552221111211112112211121111.title: Switch to Jacob's pov.

15522211112111121122111211111.content:
Emma sat out on the back terrace looking at the elegantly grounds as the pale moon bathed her exhausted body in its glow. Soon enough Jacob emerged from the door ans sat to her left. " I didn't get to thank you." He gave her little time to respond as he stood and leaned on the railing.

" I can't begin to even understand how you must feel. But you have my condolences." She felt anger building. " Don't you dare pitty me." She said dryly as Jacob looked at her surprised " My father would hate the idea of me stopping my life because of his death. He used to tell me " Em life is full of hardships, you just have to look it in the eye, then walk by."

Emma stood slowly " Now excuse me I need to finish up." And with that she left him alone.

Should we follow Jacob as he gets used to the estate, or follow Emma.
15522211112111121122111211111.title: ...finds Emma.

choices: They are sent out on business.
155222111121111211221112111112.content:
For the rest of the time she was working, Emma berated herself about going off on Jacob. After her workday ended she went to go find him. He sat alone in the parlor until she sat beside him.

" I..wanted to apologize about going off on you. I'm still trying to cope with everything. Well.. good night, maybe tomorrow will bring something great.

What does the next day hold?
155222111121111211221112111112.title: Regret.

1552221111211112112211121111121.content:
Jacob awoke early morning to morning light breaking through the window. He got up and stretched as he soon changed into his regular attire. The room was fairly large, like his new bed. It was nice, but going from sleeping on the ground to an inn bed to this is a little odd for him.

After getting dressed, he walked downstairs to see Major Hews and Emma talking about something. The two turned and saw him. "Morning Jacob, " Emma began. "Major Hews just asked if we could go into town to gather somethings. Wanna tag along?"

Jacob thought of the man he saw in town two days ago that triggered his memory. Maybe he could see him again. Jacob nodded as Major Hews gave an approving nod. The two set off for town.

What happens?
1552221111211112112211121111121.title: They are sent out on business.

1552221111211112112211121111122.content:
It was early in the morning as Emma went about her morning routine. As soon as she steeped out of her quarters Elton told her the Major wished to speak with her. Sure enough he was alone in his usual office. " Please sit."

Emma wringed her hands out of nervousness. " D.. Did I do something wrong?" He smiled at the response " No, Jacob seems like a very capable soldier. He told me about your recent ordeals." She felt the feelings try to surface, but fought to keep them submerged. " He told me how you have been watching out for him. And with that I have set up some possible training for you. You will still be mainly a maid, I don't want you to think that you'll just be thrown on the Battlefront. Mostly you would be aiding Jacob in his assignments. It of course Is up to you." He leaned back in the chair as he awaited her answer.

What shall Emma decide.
1552221111211112112211121111122.title: Same ordeal.

15522211112111121122111211111221.content:
Emma was tired of being useless in a fight, and so she nodded. Sure enough a few hours later she found herself being trained. The training was quite intense on her. The archery trainer told her that her eyesight was impeccable, and she seemed to have pure talent helping her. Staiting that she would be a sniper one day. Every day after her work was done she would retrieve archery training. After the end of two weeks she wasn't just good, she was confident now. But as an archer she lacked the ability to fight up close.

Emma had kept her training a secret from Jacob. It wasn't hard, he was so busy with his personal training, combined with the fact that she still wore her Maids attire daily. Emma finally decided it was time to let him know.

How does Jacob react?
15522211112111121122111211111221.title: Get some much needed training.

155222111121111211221112111112211.content:
Jacob sat at a desk placed in his room. His head was placed on the top asleep. He was reading a book of armor and weapons throughout the night and finally collapsed into slumber it seemed. Emma opened the door to see the sleeping tactician at the desk. Emma took a deep breath and walked over to him and slightly shook his shoulder. Jacob groaned to life as he slowly opened his eyes to see Emma in her maid uniform. "Oh, Emma...W-what time is it?" He asked groggy.

Emma gave a light smile, "About Noon. Um...Jacob?"

"Yeah?"

Emma rocked a little on her heels nervously. "I've been taking combat courses on the side here. I'm good with a bow and think I can be helpful in a fight now...well, at least from afar."

Jacob cracked a small grin and looked at her. "Good, thanks Emma."

Emma smiled and sighed relieved and turned to leave when...
155222111121111211221112111112211.title: He's happy.

choices: " I had a vision, I think."

As Emma turned the door knob she heard a sound of something slaming to the ground. she turned to find Jacob clutching his head lieing on his side. " Jacob!?" She shrieked as she rushed back over to him. She called for help, and sure enough Alfonse rushed in and quickly lifted the injured man onto the bed in the corner then rushed to get actual aid.

Sure enough moments later the blonde woman that always seemed to be inspecting her stepped in. " What happened?" Emma fixed her red hair before responding. " He just grabbed his head before collapseing." The blonde is apparently a war cleric, evident by her quick inspection and well-versed explanation. " He's fine, his body is reacting and coping to something tramatic. See his eye movements." Emma leaned in and noticed the slight, but noticeable movement. " He should wake from it like a dream when his mind decides it's either rested, or what ever threst has passed." And with that the woman quickly left. Emma spent the rest of the day by his bed side untill he awoke.

" Easy do you feel ok?" He stared at the sealing untill he responded.

"I....I saw a man in town a few days ago in a black cloak. When I saw him my head began to hurt. I wasn't able to talk to him. I...just saw him in my dream...Telling me that my time has come...That I shall leave destruction in my wake. I..." Jacob grabbed his head in confusion. "What should we do Emma?"

"Sorry about leaving so suddenly Emma," Jacob said.

What's Emma's reaction?

Jacob took a look over toward the sun as it was soon to be setting. "How would you feel about setting up camp for tonight?" He asked Emma.

" Have you noticed something, odd about these woods?" She nibbled at her food, hardtack wasn't her favorite, but she didn't want to hunt in these woods. " Odd, no can't say I have."

Latter in the night Emma found herself lieing wake on a bedroll. The feeling remained. She couldn't help but notice Jacob fast asleep. Why did only herself sense the feelings, suddenly the feeling grew as if she would be grabbed any secound, she closed her eyes telling herself it was nothing. " Go to sleep, it's nothing, go to sleep."

Is it all her imagination, or is their something dark in these woods?

His face was being hidden by some item that looked as if it was made of bone. "You are an interesting one," he said in a humorous way. "Who are you?" Emma said to the strange figure. The man let out a scoff, "I should ask you. Everything was planned perfectly, and now you're here. I didn't expect that. He should still be wandering alone." Emma realized he meant Jacob. "What do you want with him?" Emma said. The man let out another quiet laugh before...

1552221111211112112211121111122111121121.title: ...attacking Emma with dark magic.

Jacob dodged the smoky substance sent toward him. He saw a few arrows fired from Emma either tear through his cloak or miss barely. She's however did stop him from attacking by making him constantly dodge. Jacob took the chance and rushed the man, but just as he reached him, a dark smoke clouded his view. When he regained his vision, he saw the man standing over a downed Emma who he rushed. He held her down with his foot easily, ready for another spell. Jacob rushed toward him and used the handle of his blade to punch the man across the face as the man fell to a crouch a bit away.

Jacob raised his sword and was ready to strike him down when the man revealed a dagger from his cloak and thrust it into Jacob's chest. Jacob then recognized the man as the one he saw in town. Jacob staggered from the knife as the man stood back up. "Keep the knife. You'll need it," he mocked before fleeing back into the forest and disappearing.

"Wait-" Jacob began before falling over, knife in his chest.

What next?
1552221111211112112211121111122111121121.title: They prevail.

Emma coughed in pain while rubbing her throught, it still hurt from the chokehold she had been in. She crawled to Jacob. The wound was minor given the area. The dagger had been stopped by a rib, saving him from the fate of bleeding out. She quickly covered the wound as he came to quickly remembering the knife. He began inspecting it.

Does he find anything?"

"You know my name, Jacob? The innkeeper I met gave me it. It's not even mine. These robes and weapons aren't even mine. Why can't I remember? Why can't I...?" Jacob spoke in an empty voice. He was on his hands and knees staring at the ground.

What does Emma do?
1552221111211112112211121111122111121121.title: Sorrow

Jacob braced himself against Emma as he rose. "Thanks..." Jacob said quietly. "I...I just wanna sleep for awhile." Jacob said before collapsing from exhaustion.

What do they do when they wake?

The two began to travel back down the road. Jacob was still dreary-eyed from last night. From time to time as he walked his eyes soul close as he did. Emma kept him awake when he did, which either prompted a 'thanks' from him or a nod.

After a few hours, the two saw something interesting. A large palace. It looked from a distance as though it was made of marble. Two flags that had a depiction of a lion hung from the palace walls. Emma and Jacob exchanged a glance as the two mentally decided to go see if they could visit.

"You recognize that banner at all," Emma asked.

Jacob shook his head. "No idea. We'll find out soon enough though."

What happens next?

How are they greeted.
