The heavily armored men formed a wall of shields and spears. The knight on horseback spead toards them, the beast rearing up startling Emma. He wore a much more elaborate suit of armor and helmet then his men, his armor was cobalt blue. " Stay where you are! You have entered the fortress without permission. You will be treated as threats until proven otherwise. Please drop all weapons." Emma still slightly shaken placed her bow on th stone road at her feet, Jacob hesitated but hesitantly did the same.

The man led the two through the palace. Lying in the heart was a large retundra area meant for some sort of council it was empty for now. Even more impressive were the honor guards, each one looking identical, they each wore an onyx black armor with a helmet which held a crimson crest. Every one of them held spears that stood from the floor, and silver swords on their waists. " Separate them both in a separate cell block." Emma felt a hand on her shoulder force her into one of the cells before the bars shut again.

Emma sat on the cot in her cell putting her face in her hands. She realized it was foolish to expect to walk unannounced into a palace.

Eventually they will speak with the lords, how will the meeting go.

Emma was led up beside Jacob, hands bound. The room was full of the ebony-armored soldiers as another man entered. He wore an officer uniform with the same colors as the soldier but with added red and white. He had longer hair and a scruff face, a beard beginning on his chin. He looked like he was in his forties or fifties. "I am Chieftain Valkyr. Why are you here, trespassers?"

Jacob speaks up. "We're looking for work. We left town a day ago and found this fort. We were hoping to find a job here that we could do for a bit."

What happens?

Jacob nodded. "I woke up in a field. I ran into my friend here and we've been traveling since. On our way here we were attacked by a Sorcerer, and-"

Jacob nodded. "He sounded like he knew me."

A few of the soldiers looked to one another murmuring. Valkyr walked toward Jacob. "Listen...This may come as a shock. I think you may be the Dragon Knight...It's a legend of a dragon slaying boy, who will be able to slay dragons. That Sorcerer may have known you and may be a Grima worshipper, and perhaps try and slay you for it. As long as it seems this is the case, you two may stay here." Valkyr unbound Jacob's wrists. "If you wish, we can train you." Jacob just nodded.

Valkyr and a few men led them to a large room on the second floor, along with another down the hall to be given to Emma. The soldiers and Valkyr left to let them rest. Jacob sat on the bed edge and looked at his feet.

What happens next?

Emma knocked on Jacobs door which he welcomed her in. She sat down on a futon like couch, almost falling asleep. " Well I guess I'm a knight." She noticed Jacobs reaction and realized her mistake " Not that I don't have faith in you. If you ever need help, I'll be by your side." With that she walked back to her room.

Emma laid sprawled out, she had missed normal beds. She could get used to this place.

1552221111211112112211121111122111121121.title: A person/People

She was brought back to reality very abruptly " You can sit if you want to." Emma jumped slightly and turned on her heel to the person. It was a man sitting at a small wooden table alone. He had short relatively short black hair and a goatee matching in color with, he looked to be in his mod twenties. His arm reaching for a bottle of rum baring a noticeable scar on his forearm. " She took his offer and sat on the opposite side of the table.

Emma was strangely taken aback by the question despite it was a pretty straightforward question given the circumstance. " well... I guess I am in a way. After a while she realized how late it had got up to leave. She quietly opened the door to the attic door. Jane was asleep on the floor, her cloak as a makeshift blanket. Tharja however was wide awake, she sat in a chair with her feet propped up on an empty crate, her hair acting like a vail." Did you enjoy yourself.?" Thraja asked curious. Emma was taken aback by the fact that the usual dismissive tone was now sounding inviting. " As hard as it may seem, I'm bored with reading these tomes. I would like to do something " fun" tomorrow." 1552311.content:
*****Greg*****

Class: Swordmaster
Weapons: Killing Edge, Silver Sword, Amatsu,
Skills- Astra, Armsthrift, Swordfaire, Luna, Vantage,
Gender: Male
Personality: A bit shy, but friendly. On a journey from his home of Kirada.
Appearance: Dark blue Swordmaster outfit with dark armor. Short red hair and blue eyes.
Age: 16

*****End bio*****

Greg didn't know what to expect when he entered the ruins near an old town. He had traveled aways from Kirada, much to the objection of his cousin, Karin. Still, he wanted to see what was beyond Kirada, knowing what the Outrealms were. After arriving in this realm and asking around the village, he ended up in these ruins. He didn't expect to see a priest of some sorts sprawled out on the ground.

"Um, you okay? I'm pretty sure you're not doing this for fun?" smiled Greg.

"Ugh, no....No, I'm not." groaned Jacob as he staggered to his feet. "Just didn't expect to miss a step there."

"Gotta watch yourself, especially in these dark places." said Greg. "I'm Greg, just so you know."

"Jacob." said Jacob as the two shook hands. "So, what are you doing here?"

"Exploring mostly. I've done nothing but that since I left my own realm." explained Greg.

"Ah, so you've traveled the Outrealms too?" asked Jacob. Greg was a bit surprised to hear him say that so casually.

"Yes, I am. You know of them?" Greg asked.

"I've been here and there, although I'd prefer most of them not ending with me flat on my face." said Jacob, rubbing the sore spot on his face.

"Heh, duly noted." said Greg. "So, what are your plans?"
1552311.title: A tactician appears

15523111.content:
"Well, I came to investigate these ruins here. So I need to stay and see what's here. But if you have nothing to do, you could join me," Jacob said as he brushed off his robes. "What do you say, Greg?"

Greg pondered the offer for a moment before extending his hand to the Priest. "Sure."

"Thanks," Jacob said, shaking Greg's hand. "Let's keep moving then."

Jacob used a staff to light the halls he was in as the two traversed the temple. It seemed to be abandoned for awhile, so maybe it was just an old building, or perhaps it-

"Gah!"

*CRASH!*

Jacob tumbled down a steep staircase, landing square on his face. Greg ran over and stood next to him, "You alright?"

"Yeah...I'll be fine..." He said as he dusted himself off again, but just then he noticed...
15523111.title: Staying in the area

155231111.content:
"Does this happen often with you?" asked Greg with a raised eyebrow.

"Unfortunately...yes." said Jacob as he dusted some more off of him. "Sometimes I tend to get a little overexcited and trip. Been that way since I was a kid really."

"Noted." said Greg. What a strange companion he had found, even if they had just met. However, as soon as Greg helped him up a bit, he looked forward, seeing a light blue flash in front of them. Standing there was an Outrealm Gate, right in the middle of the room.

"Is that...." started Greg.

"An Outrealm Gate, yes." said Jacob. "I'm surprised to see that they could be inside temples such as this. I wonder if this is one of those gates with a specific location."

"Now that I haven't heard of. What do you mean?" asked Greg.

"Outrealm Gates vary. They can link to multiple places, or just go to one place. They all look the same so it's hard to tell." said Jacob.

"Hmm, how interesting." said Greg. He hoped that he could somehow get back to Kirada whenever he completed his journey.

"Well, I'm going to go through and see where this leads." said Jacob.

"I'll come along." said Greg.

"Really? Do you even trust what I said?" asked Jacob.

"Well, seeing is believing after all. I'd rather just see things firsthand." said Greg.

"Good reasoning." smiled Jacob. "Well, let's go then."

"Right."

With that, the two of them walked towards the gate, ducking their heads a bit as they entered the soft blue glow.
155231111.title: ...an Outrealm Gate, which they enter.

1552311112.content:
Jacob and Greg passed through the barrier that connected this gate to wherever. Jacob passed through with an odd feeling as he traveled. The two walked for a few good minutes when Jacob felt himself get numb.

"M-Maybe we should head back...I'm not..." He began when he heard his voice change tones. He soon felt as though his clothes were shrinking with his body as he walked. Jacob saw Greg slowly change as well, but the two fell unconscious.

-------------

Jacob felt like he landed on his face...again.

He groaned and scratched his head. "That's not-" Jacob turned and looked around at hearing a female voice, but saw no one. He suddenly stopped. "H-he-hello?" He said, hearing the feminine voice. He then looked at "herself".

She wore a red shirt and a small white skirt barely reaching before her knees. She had a white scarf around her neck with two tails of it hanging behind her. Her boots reached up to her ankles as her gloves were a little short from elbow-length. Jacob felt her head to see her hair had grown a bit and was a lighter brown. She also looked through her inventory and saw only a Sword and Heal, Physic, and Catharsis. "W-What happened?" The Mist lookalike exclaimed.

She soon noticed someone else slumped nearby and realized it must be Greg. She ran over and shook Greg, trying to wake her up.
1552311112.title: Along the way

15523111121.content:
Greg felt the ground beneath "her" as her eyes slowly began to flutter open. She felt someone over her, trying to arouse her awake. The voice was unmistakably female, although Greg found that odd.

"Did I come across someone?" she thought.

"Greg, wake up!" cried the female voice, shaking Greg further. More and more, she woke up, yawning a bit as she did. She turned her sleepy eyes to who was next to her, a brown-haired female who appeared to be a late teenager.

"W-Who are you?" Greg asked. However, right as she said that, her eyes widened, causing her to stumble down a bit. Nervously, as the other girl looked on, Greg looked down at "herself". She was wearing some kind of white robe, although the skirt part was long and split at the sides, allowing her long and slender legs to be seen. The robe was tied at her waist with a blue cloth, and the top of the robe was long-sleeved. In addition to the robe, there were simple brown boots on her feet. As the wind blew by, she could feel long dark hair blow across her face. Unknowningly to him, he had become a lookalike of Karla.

"W-Where am I?!" Greg asked herself, seeing the form of an adult woman instead of his usual form.

"You're in whatever realm we just passed into." said the other girl. "It's me, Jacob. For some reason, we got changed."

Greg looked at Jacob, seeing that it must be true for her to know that name. Keeping some kind of calm, Greg looked at her body again, blushing a bit at the look of breasts through the robe. Looking at her inventory, she had a Wo Dao, Killing Edge, Silver Sword, and some Elixers.

"I've never seen a sword this small, yet it feels pretty strong." said Greg as she took a look at the Wo Dao. It wasn't exactly common after all. She sheathed it soon after. "Well, this was unexpected to say the least."

"At least you got a good one. I got a kid." pouted Jacob.

"What do you mean? You appear to be almost an adult." said Greg with a small smile.

"But you look so mature. I saw my face in the pond over there and I look like a kid." said Jacob. Greg actually giggled a bit, surprising herself with how she sounded. Being a little older than he was before and being a woman felt really weird.

"Well, at least it looks like we somewhat retained our classes. I'm still a Swordmaster." said Greg.

"It looks like I'm a Cleric, and yet I feel much stronger than a normal one." said Jacob.

"Funny how that works." said Greg as she got up and straightened herself out.

What she saw around them was?
15523111121.title: A really wierd world

155231111211.content:
They soon realized that on both sides of the gate were colossal rock walls that reached up high above. The two realized they were in a valley it seemed, and at the end of it.

Jacob stood herself up and looked toward the other edge of the valley to see near one of it's walls looked to be a town that was set nearby. "Well looks like there's a good place to go for the moment," Jacob said in her feminent teen voice. "Alright, let's g-"

"Aah!"

Tripping on....something(nothing) Jacob fell flat on the ground with her staff. "Ugh...seriously?"

She heard Greg stifle a laugh as Jacob picked herself up and began to move toward the town. Along the way, Greg spoke up. "You alright Jacob?"

"Huh?...Oh yeah, it's just this skirt..." She said fidgeting and blushing at what she just said, not being used to clothing of the sort. "It just seems short."

"Well, it looks good," Greg said, trying to find a compliment.

Jacob smiled only a little, "Thanks," Jacob said, holding Catharsis close to her chest.

It wasn't long before they entered town and walked through the streets. They also noticed multiple caves lined with torches in the wall the town was set by, probably for mining purposes or such. As the two explored, they...
155231111211.title: A valley

1552311112111.content:
"Looks like quite a bit of mining around here." said Jacob as she observed the area.

"Not one of the bigger towns I've seen." said Greg. "Guess it's mostly just a mining town of some kind. I hope they still have some kind of inn here since we don't have anywhere else to sleep."

Greg had reached down into her pack, which she still had despite the transformation, so she still had all the money she had from before. That would be handy in any situation where they needed a place to stay. The duo continued a slow walk through the town, passing by the residents with no problem, although some gave them an odd look like they didn't belong, which was understandable.

"So, you think anyone would know what changed us?" asked Jacob.

"Well, I don't know if anyone would believe us. We shouldn't go crazy with it." said Greg, to which Jacob reluctantly agreed, fidgeting with her skirt again. It wasn't a long one after all. Greg didn't feel too much better. The bottom of her robe also left her legs to feel the slight breeze.

Anyway, after a while, Jacob sighed in thanks as they saw an inn nearby. She had begun to worry if they would have one or not. Without wasting any time, Greg walked in with her, heading towards the front desk. She asked if they had any rooms, and the kind lady at the desk said that there were. So, Greg paid for them to have one room for the night, getting a key for it.

"Now what?" asked Jacob as they walked out.

"Well, it's afternoon right now, so there's still a good amount of daylight left. Perhaps we should look around some more. Exploring new places was part of the reason I was traveling in the first place." smiled Greg.

"You seem to be getting used to this." moaned Jacob.

"Not really, but I'd like to keep my mind on other things. I will admit that the long hair is a bit of a pain." Greg smiled weakly as a soft breeze blew her dark hair into her face again, making Jacob giggle slightly.
1552311112111.title: ...find an inn.

15523111121112.content:
Jacob and Greg soon exited the inn and walked out into the town, surveying it. Jacob had finally given up with her skirt, thinking it should be fine.

The two soon passed by a tavern and decided to take a look inside. It wasn't incredibly busy, but it had a good number of patrons visiting. The two looked around, not planning to stay long when a man approached Jacob. "Excuse me miss?"

Jacob was taken back a bit, "Y-yes?"

"Would you be willing to help me out? Right this way." The man said not giving Jacob time to reply as she was taken into a back room, leaving Greg standing there.

A few moments passed when the door opened and Greg saw Jacob in new attire. She wore a long, brown, sleeveless dress with a white top and matching elbow-length gloves and boots, with her hair also tied back. "I-I guess I got a job as a waitress here for the day," Jacob replied, still reeling from her change.

Greg grinned. "You'll do fine," she said.

"Easy for you to say..." Jacob muttered.
15523111121112.title: Meeting someone

155231111211122.content:
A few minutes later, Greg sat at one of the tables near the counter where Jacob had to go and wash some cups.

"So, what happened in there?" asked Greg.

"That guy took me to the back and gave me something called a Serve Seal or something. It was like a Second Seal, but had a cup-like design in it. All of a sudden, I look like this." Jacob said as she motioned to herself.

"Interesting. I've never heard of a Waitress class before. Only in the Outrealms would you find something like that." Greg smiled to herself.

"Yeah, just great." groaned Jacob as she continued to clean.

Right after that, they started getting more orders, so Jacob got busy along with the other waitresses. Needless to say, quite a lot of people enjoyed being served by her. As Greg pretty much anticipated, her appearance almost made her more endearing in a way.

"I can't handle all those looks." groaned Jacob as she laid out on the counter after getting through the rush. Greg just helped herself to one non-alcoholic cup. A journey wasn't the best time to be drunk or anything.

"Guess that's why the guy in charge called you out, thinking you'd be perfect for it." said Greg.

"Well, luckily, I should be done soon."

And soon it was. A little while later, as business seemed to wind down, the man in charge thanked Jacob wholeheartedly for her work, giving her a reasonable paycheck for all the trouble. He even supplied a seal to reverse her back to her Cleric self.

"Shall we head out then?" asked Greg. "I'm getting a little tired of some of the attention here myself."

"Yes, lets." said Jacob, definitely wanting to get out. "You're lucky that they didn't have any other job to rope you into."

"Yeah, probably."

With that done, and nearly dark, the two treated themselves to some dinner at a local restaurant. Jacob got a good pay after all, and Greg had a good amount saved up. Once they were finished there, it was time to head back to the inn, where supplies for the night awaited them in their room.

"Figures that they'd leave it women's wear for us." said Greg as she searched through the provided clothes.

"Might as well live with it for now, at least until we find out how it happened." said Jacob, already changed into a white nightgown. Greg's wear was the same, agreeing with Jacob's words.

"Well, an interesting way to begin a journey, huh?" said Jacob as any lights were turned out.

"Definitely." said Greg as the two finally went to sleep.
155231111211122.title: Later on...

1552311112111221.content:
Sunlight shattered the dark room as morning of the next day came. Jacob opened her eyes slightly and yawned. She walked over to the side room and got ready.

She brushed her hair with a brush left by the inn. She placed her underwear on a blushed for a moment, still embarrassed about the whole situation. She pulled on her shirt and skirt again, pulling the skirt down again. 'Who could wear something like this?' She pondered as she wrapped a scarf around her neck. She picked her boots and gloves up and equipped them as she was ready.

She walked back out and slowly shook Greg. Greg made a small noise when she woke up with tuffs of hair in her face, which she brushed out of the way. "We should get around and see what we should do."

Greg nodded in agreement sleepily as she stood and walked to the room Jacob just left. She soon came out in her white robe. Jacob then noticed how much bigger Greg was then her. "Out of all I could've become, I get a kid..." Jacob muttered.

Greg giggled slightly as the two left the inn.
1552311112111221.title: Next Day

15523111121112211.content:
"I'm a little surprised you think that." said Greg as she grabbed herself a roll at the inn cafeteria.

"I am too. I wonder if this place is starting to get to me." said Jacob as she took a big bite out of her roll.

"Well, we're not in a rush or anything." said Greg.

"I don't know about you, but I would like to know why we ended up like this. This skirt is going to drive me nuts. My legs feel naked." said Jacob with a blush.

"I can agree to that. Kind of feels that way with mine too." said Greg, looking at her robe. "It doesn't leave much to the imagination for sure."

After that, the two of them returned their inn key and left the inn entirely. The sun was still low in the sky, as it wasn't morning for long. The two of them weren't entirely awake either.

"Perhaps I should get some training in, just to stay loose at least." said Greg.

"You go ahead. Not much you can train with when you're a healer." said Jacob, holding her staff to herself. Greg agreed with that, and the two of them decided to split up for just a little bit, to give each other some space. Greg found herself a good wide area behind some structures and brought her sword out. As she practiced swinging, it felt weird swinging such a lighter sword, and yet it didn't feel any less weaker. Her robe just flowed along with her as she kept at it. Greg didn't know how useful training like this would help in the future, but anything helped.

Jacob just groaned a bit as she came back to see Greg after a while. Seeing Greg so mature and "womanly" seemed to hit something inside Jacob. Perhaps it was the fact that they were the same age prior to this, but this kiddish-like body (despite being a late teenager) seemed inadequate compared to Greg. Anyway, after a while, Greg finished up.

"Hey Jacob. You see anything?" asked Greg as she had a drink of water.

"Not too much. I checked out the mining area. Lots of them around here. Seems that most of the men here are miners. I did ask one of them if they knew anything odd about Outrealm Gates and they didn't know. So, I don't think anyone might know what transformed us." said Jacob.

"I see. Oh well." said Greg as she finished her drink. "Well, shall we go then? Perhaps going back through that gate will yield an answer or two."

"Sounds fine to me." said Jacob.
15523111121112211.title: Greg does some training

155231111211122111.content:
Jacob and Greg gathered their supplies and such and made their way back to the Outrealm Gate. Jacob wandered alongside Greg, "So how was training in a body like that?"

"Well, it felt normal, but wasn't what I was used to at first." Greg said with a shrug.

"I guess that's understandable," Jacob said, pulling the skirt down yet again.

Greg smiled a bit. "That thing has it out for you doesn't it?" Greg teased.

"Har de Har Har," Jacob muttered as the two soon approached the gate. "You think it'll change us back?" Jacob asked fidgeting.

"Only one way to find out," Greg said as the two passed through the gate.

As the two wandered through the gate again, a familiar tingle came over the two. "I think we're changing again, b-but..." Jacob said, the last word getting deeper toned as the two fainted again.

Jacob awoke and stared at the sky. "Ugh...Am I normal?" She asked herself. But judging by her voice, no. Jacob looked around on the ground and heard the crunch of snow on the ground from her movements. Jacob shivered and sat up to see herself in white Paladin and long black hair hanging from her head. Jacob sighed and brushed off some snow and noticed that she seemed to be older now. "At least I'm not a kid," Jacob said as she spotted another unconscious body nearby. The Astrid lookalike walked over and knelt over the person.
155231111211122111.title: Heading back

1552311112111221111.content:
Greg once again felt a nudging on her back as her eyes fluttered open. She could see her right hand in front of her, encased in a white and gold glove, immediately telling her that she was not who she was before.

"Greg!" called a different female voice. Greg turned her head to see a black-haired Paladin wearing white armor and lavender clothes beneath them. Greg imagined that this was the new Jacob.

"I assume that's you, Jacob?" asked Greg, hearing a similar maturity in her voice.

"Yeah." Jacob nodded. "Not that I'm happy that I'm still a girl, but at least I'm grown up this time. You seem to have outdone me again, though."

She pouted on the last part, causing Greg to raise an eyebrow. As she sat up, she got a look at herself. She was wearing some really fancy clothes, almost like royalty. The colors were a mixture of gold and white, with small pieces of armor. The boots also went up to her thighs. They reminded Greg of some old pictures of Pegasus Knights from long ago. Perhaps that was who she was now. She put a hand on her head, feeling long green hair was was mostly tied up on her head, but some strands fell to her shoulders. Standing up, she saw that she was still a bit taller than Jacob.

"Well, this wasn't expected." said Greg.

"Certainly not. You look like a Queen." said Jacob.

"Okay, you have to be exaggerating." said Greg, a bit embarrassed at that comment.

"It's true. I almost feel like bowing to you right now."

Both of them blushed a bit at that, decided to not bring it up again. Anyway, they looked around, seeing that they were standing on a snowy mountain path.

"Well, how are we going to get out of this?" asked Jacob.

"From what I see, you're a Paladin, and I guess I'm a Pegasus Knight of some sorts. Maybe we should try to find a pegasus. That could get us around faster." said Greg.

"It's as good a start as any." replied Jacob.
1552311112111221111.title: Snowy landscape

choices: They find a cave in the mountainside
15523111121112211111.content:
Jacob and Greg soon noticed a road on the mountain that looked like it was used for transportation. The two soon began to follow the trail in hopes of finding something.

Jacob wrapped her arms around herself, "Brrr! My libs ah frrebing!" She said through "freebing libs" as they continue down the trail.

Greg was performing a similar motion, but was taking it better. The two soon came across a stable house. "Maybe we can ask somewhere there where town is," Greg said, receiving a nod from Jacob. The two walked toward the building and knocked on the door when a man opened it.

"Oh, it's you. You two must be here for your steeds," the man said.

The two girls exchanged a confused glance before the man led them into the stable. In one stall was a brown horse, saddled up with fabric on it's back, and another a white Pegasus saddled up similarly. The two approached the animals and pet the manes for a short time before Greg approached the man. "Thanks. How much will this cost?"

"Oh nothing at all! Always willing to help a lady with stature such as yourself."

Jacob stifled a grin while Greg blushed with embarrassment as the two mounted their steeds and rode out down the road.

What happens next?
15523111121112211111.title: Searching around

choices: A bit different, as they both change a little bit
155231111211122111112.content:
The two of them walked their steeds on the ground for a while. Greg wasn't sure about trying to take flight right now, given that she had never done this before. The last things she wanted was to slip and fall. Her pegasus seemed a little old, but it certainly didn't seem to hinder it at all.

"You not going to fly?" asked Jacob.

"I don't want to slip off, and I've never done it before." replied Greg.

"I guess so, though I think it would be cool." smiled Jacob. "So, I guess you have some kind of standing in this world or something."

"I wonder how that even works. I just got here after all." replied Greg with a sigh.

"Maybe it's another one of those weird space-time things or whatever." said Jacob. "Perhaps if we find another town, we'll see what they think of you. Maybe you're a real queen here."

"If it comes to that, it'll just be more troublesome." said Greg. She could barely take care of herself.

Anyway, the two of them came across a cave in the mountainside eventually, deciding to take a little break. Thanks to the previous realm, they were getting at least somewhat accustomed to female bodies, even though it still felt weird. Jacob still couldn't figure out how the realms were changing them, and neither could Greg.

"So, now what?" asked Greg.

How does Jacob reply?
155231111211122111112.title: They find a cave in the mountainside

1552311112111221111122.content:
Jacob not turning from her steed soon said, "The sooner we get you back to town the better the situation m'lady," Jacob said plainly.

Greg nodded. "Good. I hope everything's okay since I left. I wonder if-" she then stopped and looked back at Jacob. "Uhm...what just happened?"

Jacob turned and looked at Greg. "Is something wrong, m'lady?"

"Um...Jacob?" Greg asked.

Jacob soon put her backhand to her forehead. "What...What just...?"

Greg sighed and looked back toward Jacob. "L-let's get going." Jacob simply nodded and got back on her horse, Greg on her Pegasus as the two continued on.

After a few moments, the two saw a town in the distance. The buildings seemed bigger and more adept to the weather. They noticed a very large building deep in the city. The two felt a feeling of familiarity upon entering the town, even though they've never been here before.

As the two rode through town, Jacob leaned to Greg. "Time to see if you're royalty or not."

What happens next?
1552311112111221111122.title: A bit different, as they both change a little bit

15523111121112211111221.content:
As the duo got closer to the town, some other details seem to come up. For such a town on a mountainside, it was a pretty good size. Not as big as a capital city you'd find on plains or such, but close enough. They seemed pretty sturdy, bent to hold against any rough mountain weather, such as blizzards and the like. As the people began coming into view, Greg could see that there were quite a few of them living there.

"Wow, so many." Greg spoke to herself.

"Of course m'lady. They are your people." smiled Jacob, much to both her and Greg's surprise.

"Um, Jacob?" Greg began to wonder.

"Is there a problem?" asked Jacob. Greg seemed to give it some thought.

"Oh, no. There's no problem. Guess I'm just a little lost for words. I haven't seen them in quite a while." said Greg.

"You won't have any problems. Your people adore you after all." said Jacob.

"Thanks Jacob." smiled Greg, shaking her head a bit though. Was there something else going on?

Anyway, the two had just continued on their way, heading towards the entrance. Right as they appeared, they started chanting Greg's name loudly, with some even showing some appreciation for Jacob. However, the people seemed especially taken with Greg, even as she wasn't quite sure what they were cheering. Still, she ended up waving and smiling as the crowd welcomed them. Eventually, some other knights appeared, basically escorting Greg and Jacob to the bigger building deep in the town, which was apparently the castle.

"Welcome home, your majesty." bowed one knight.

"Thank you." smiled Greg who took his hand and got off her pegasus.

"Well, this is a little strange." said Jacob.

"I guess so, but something inside me feels good about it." said Greg.

"Me too." said Jacob.
15523111121112211111221.title: Greg is seen as royalty

155231111211122111112211.content:
Jacob dismounted her horse and followed Greg through the adorned halls. The two reached massive doors with two knights standing at them, who bowed then opened the door. It was opened to a throne room with knights at the far wall. Greg walked to the throne and sat down. Jacob stood in front of Greg. "Quite a change of pace for you huh," Jacob said.

"Yeah," Greg said. "Do you feel as though I acted too well to that welcome?"

Jacob smiled, "You were great."

Greg thought for a few moments. "I feel like we should return to the gate, but maybe we can stay here for a little while."

"Of course m'lady," Jacob said. "The people need their queen."

Greg nodded and repositioned herself in her throne. "Yes. Thank you Jacob."

"If you would excuse me m'lady, I'm to tend the horses."

"Of course," said Greg.

Jacob bowed and left the throne room.

What happens next?
155231111211122111112211.title: Inside the castle

choices: The head for the Outrealm Gate in the morning.
1552311112111221111122111.content:
Greg's day was odd, but seemed natural to him...For being a queen at least. She had advisors asking for orders, details, projects, all of which he overlooked. Needless to say the day was hectic, and was glad the day was over.

Greg's nightclothes were probably worth a pretty penny as she adorned the silken fabric. She walked through the halls of her castle when she saw Jacob. The two stopped and looked out toward the town. "How was it being queen?"
Jacob asked curiously.

"Hectic. I couldn't find time to be alone for a minute." Greg groaned.

Jacob smirked. "You thinking of heading back to the gate tomorrow?"

"Might as well, though I'm sure my people will be nervous," Greg said worriedly.

Jacob turned as she walked toward her barracks, "Your people are strong. They'll survive."

The two headed off to bed.

What happens next?
1552311112111221111122111.title: That night...

15523111121112211111221111.content:
The two awoke early next morning and immediately geared up. The two met in the stables as they readied their horses. "I'm intrigued about what's on the other side of that gate, but I'm worried about the kingdom," Greg said, petting her Pegasus' mane.

"Fret not, m'lady. Your advisors will watch over it for you. Now, let's depart." Jacob said riding alongside her.

The two rode out as a few crowds of people stopped and waved, cheered and bowed as they rode out of the kingdom. Greg looked back and saw the city get smaller as they rode. It took about an hour before they stood in front of the gate. "Be cautious, m'lady."

Greg nodded as the two dismounted and walked through the gate. The two felt their bodies change as Jacob saw Greg collapse. "M-M'lady...?" She said before collapsing as well.

Jacob soon woke up on the cold ground, face down. She groaned and felt her skin touching the stone floor. She stood and rubbed her head and looked at her body. She looked like the same age as she was originally, but also noticed she was in white cleric robes with a yellow top covering only a portion of her larger chest. She blushed and covered them by pulling her top over more. She then felt her hair was in a short and scattered brown ponytail. She looked around and realized that they were in the same ruins they were first in. Jacob groaned wondering what that meant when he heard a groan and saw Greg.
15523111121112211111221111.title: The head for the Outrealm Gate in the morning.

155231111211122111112211111.content:
Against the stone cold floor, Greg felt a bit uncomfortable as her eyes slowly opened up. It didn't take too long before she was feeling someone gently nudging her a bit.

"Greg, are you there?" asked a female voice. Greg immediately knew that it was Jacob, given all the experiences so far.

"Y-Yeah, I'm here." Greg said slowly, still hearing a female voice from herself. She slowly propped herself up on her elbows, feeling much different from the queen she was in the other realm.

Slowly sitting up, Greg rubbed her somewhat sleep eyes and got a good look. She wasn't as old as she was before, more closer to her original age. She felt red hair falling to her shoulders, with a soft face and green eyes. Her attire was closer to that of a mercenary now, with silver armor and a dark blue tunic and leggings. It didn't seem too far from how she was before all this started, but it was better than nothing. Looking over, she could see that Jacob was now a cleric.

"Hmm, that look suits you." smiled Greg with a slight giggle.

"Whatever. I guess yours does too." said Jacob with a wry smile. Soon after, Jacob helped Greg up and they looked around briefly.

"Doesn't this look like where we first met up?" asked Jacob.

"Yeah, it definitely is. Why did it dump us here?" asked Greg.

"I don't know. The pathways of the Outrealms still confuse me as much as they do to you." said Jacob.
155231111211122111112211111.title: Greg's transformation

1552311112111221111122111111.content:
Jacob looked around and sighed. She sat down on a removed stone and looked down. "Greg, what do you think the chances of us turning back is?"

Greg looked a little surprised before she leaned against the wall. "Well, I don't know honestly."

"What about the chances of making it back here? We both know that there are thousand of realms out there. What's the chance that if we leave we'll make it back here?" Jacob said. Greg gave Jacob an odd look.

"What are you trying to say," Greg asked.

Jacob sighed. "I think we should stay, with these bodies. I mean, we've adapted to them, and every realm we go to, we're female. And it looks like we got put with what would be us if we were girls. Maybe...maybe we should deal with it."

Greg had an understanding look and pushed herself from the wall. "Alright...I guess we can for now. So what next?"

Jacob stood up. "Since we don't look like who we used to be, we'll have to find new work. I guess this is where we part. Sorry for dragging you into this."

Greg smiled a bit. "I decided to come with you, it's not your fault. Alright, let's go."

Jacob smiled and nodded then turned on her heel...and face planted. "Oomf...Of all things that stay the same..." She muttered.

--2 months later--

"Julia! There's a new job for you," a man yelled from behind a counter.

"Julia" wore a dark colored Valkyrie set with a white outline to them. Her dark brown hair hung behind her in a ponytail. Her leggings matched her suit, and she was equipped with a Heal, Arcthunder, Celica's Gale, and Fire. She turned and walked to the counter. Jacob sighed at her fake name. "What's the job?"

She had found a position among the town. When not helping people in need, she does jobs for the town. "There's an anomaly somewhere outside the town. Other towns report a similar anomaly, so go see what it is."

Jacob nodded and walked out, and went toward the path when she felt her foot hit something (nothing) and fall in front of an inn, receiving a mouthful of dirt. "Mmgggff..." She groaned through her dirt filled mouth when the door of the inn and opened and there was...

choices: They finally get out of the forest
They take a break in the forest
155232211.content:
*****Greg*****

Gender: Male
Age:17
Class: Myrmidon
Level: 18
Rank: Swords A
Appearance: Short red hair with typical Myrmidon garb. Mostly colored blue and silver
Height: 5'10

*****End bio*****

"So, where are we now?" asked Jacob. Greg sighed at his companion.

"I thought you were the one who had these realms memorized." he said.

"Hey, no one's perfect. I can only remember so much." defended Jacob, making Greg sigh again.

The two of them had been traveling for perhaps a week now. Greg had traveled from his home realm of Kirada, wanting to seek out other worlds and learn more about how they worked. Jacob was in a similar situation, and the two had met each other while traveling. Deciding that traveling together was ideal, the two set out, although they didn't figure that they would end up lost after about a week. Right now, they were in the realm where there was a huge forest.

"Man, if Karen doesn't hear from me every week, I wouldn't be surprised if she hunted me down herself." said Greg.

"Well, you can look at the bright side." said Jacob, looking at his map.

"How so?" asked Greg.

"The town of Saria is just up ahead. According to this, we should find it just outside of the forest, and that should be less than a mark away." said Jacob.

"I hope you're right. I'm tired." said Greg. Jacob smirked at his companion.

"Are you that worried that your cousin will come after you?" he smiled.

"Karen has always worried about me. It's part of the reason she joined the clergy back in Kirada." said Greg. "She's reckless enough at least."

"Good to know." smirked Jacob.

What happened next?
155232211.title: Two Wanderers

1552322111.content:
Jacob and Greg persevered until they reached the forest edge and went into an open clearing with a town only a minute or two away in the distance. "Thank goodness," Greg sighed.

Jacob smiled at his companion's tiredness. "Now you don't have to worry 'bout your sis chasing you down."

Greg groaned. "She still might..." Jacob chuckled as they entered town.

------------

"You're obviously exhausted," Jacob said.

The town seemed quite generic to other towns they visited, except that it seemed bigger. Greg seemed to be down to a crawl as he groaned. "I'd eat anything right now."

Wasn't long before Jacob spotted and heard someone nearbynearby. He saw a shop with a red-haired girl at the counter.

Anna.

She seemed to be selling some new energy tonic that Jacob hadn't seen before. Greg came beside him noticing the calling merchant. "How about that?" Jacob asked his partner.

"Sure," he said as the two approached the smiling merchant, who's finger was on her chin like her sisters.

"Welcome! What can I interest you in?" She said cheery as usual.

"Two tonics, please. For me and my friend here." Jacob said placing gold on the counter. Anna counted it and smiled before handing them the tonic. The two thanked her and walked away and drank the tonic. It seemed to make Jacob feel lighter on his feet as his body tingled and felt more upbeat, Greg also reacting similarly The two now renewed soon walked around town.

---------

Anna was doing inventory when she noticed two tonics missing. She then realized the two that stopped by, she must've given them the experimental tonic. "Oh no...I'm sure they'll be fine. And besides, no refunds."
1552322111.title: They finally get out of the forest

15523221111.content:
"This place ain't too bad. I actually wouldn't mind sticking around for a bit." Jacob smiled as they looked around.

"Last I checked, you said that about the last village we stayed at." sighed Greg.

"What can I say? I find something to like at every village." replied Jacob.

"That I agree with." said Greg, patting his stomach a bit, as they had just drank that tonic about 10 minutes ago. Greg certainly felt better after drinking it, although the taste seemed a little odd to him. It didn't taste like any elixir he had before. In fact, he had no idea what it tasted like. While part of him thought that he was really over thinking this, something just didn't seem right. He sometimes wondered about those Annas after all.

"Hey Jacob, do you ever have trouble buying from those Annas?" asked Greg. "I've seen quite a few in the past myself."

Jacob gave it a minute of thought before replying. "I think they're okay. I mean, sure, they seem a bit money-obsessed, but they've been reliable. I don't think they're the types who would lie about stuff. It could probably hurt their business if they lied and it came back to bite them."

"That's a good point. I remember one time back in Kirada. Karen didn't trust them a whole lot. She said the everlasting smile creeped her out." said Greg with a slight chuckle.

"Sounds interesting." said Jacob.

After that, Greg looked up to the sun, determining that it was probably mid-afternoon at that point. They would probably have to make a quick decision about whether or not to stay. Greg personally felt like continuing on. He didn't want to just wait around too much, as he wasn't the kind of guy that could sit around for long. However, as they walked, Greg briefly looked towards Jacob, and ending up doing a double take. Assuming Greg wasn't hallucinating, there were streaks of red beginning to enter Jacob's normally brown hair.

"Um, Jacob?" Greg started.

"Yeah, what is...." Jacob started as he turned around. Suddenly, he jumped a bit, his eyes wide open. "Greg, I may be wrong, but I see darker strands of red in your hair."

"Wait, what?" Greg asked in a bit of shock. He had natural red hair, but it was a light red, kind of like strawberry-blonde, but Jacob said darker red hair? "Hold on a sec, I see red strands of hair on you too!"

"Huh?" Jacob replied, unable to tell obviously.

Both of them needed some way to confirm this, and they immediately turned to the inn that Saria had. There were mirrors in the break rooms (or bathrooms or whatever), so both of them made their way there, while not bumping anyone over. Once they got there and saw at least a good mirror, they confirmed what each saw.

"Um, did we land in something? Because it's not washing out." said Jacob.

"Your guess is as good as mine." said Greg.
15523221111.title: Changes

155232211111.content:
Jacob tried to wash it down and dry it off like Greg, but the new red was still there. Jacob sighed alongside Greg as they both had same-shaded red hair. "Well...what now?" Jacob asked.

Greg sighed and ran his hand through his new red hair. "Well...I could get a room here for us for awhile. Give me a second..." Greg soon walked off. Jacob waited and was looking through his tomes for any cause with no answers. The door soon opened and Greg walked in.

"Okay I got the-" He stopped midsentence and stared at Jacob.

"What is it?"

"Did you...cast a spell or something?"

"No. Why?"

Greg pointed to the mirror and Jacob turned to see his hair reaching just below his neckline flowing freely. Jacob gave a yelp of shock and felt it. Yep, it was real. "What the heck's hap-" Jacob began before he saw Greg's hair soon grow. Greg noticed and quickly looked too. They both now had long red hair.

What next?
155232211111.title: More Trouble

1552322111111.content:
Now, it wasn't just a few strands of red hair. No, it had spread, completely covering both of their hair now. In addition to that, it had begun growing, flowing past their shoulders freely.

"What in the world just happened?" Jacob asked, trying to keep his cool throughout this.

"I don't know." said Greg, surprised himself. He could feel his new hair tickling the middle of his back now, and the same seemed to appear for Jacob. "I certainly don't know any magic that causes changes this radical. You sure you didn't cast something?"

"Nothing I know can do this." defended Jacob. "I'm not made for spells that can change people."

"I wonder if someone casted this on us." said Greg.

"For what reason?"

"I don't know. I'm just guessing." said Greg as he looked outside. The sun was beginning to set, and it probably wasn't a good idea to begin traveling again with night falling. It was with that in mind that Greg decided to get them a room here at the inn. Hopefully, no one would find them strange.

Leaving Jacob to himself for now, Greg went out to the counter and got a single room key for a certain amount of gold. No one paid any mind to his hair, to which he was grateful for. For some reason though, he could swear that he had seen that shade of red before, but shook it off as nothing. He returned to Jacob, bearing the key with him.

"I think we should get some rest here. Panicking won't do us any good right now. Perhaps a good nights sleep will clear our heads." said Greg.

"I guess it could work." sighed Jacob, not feeling too confident.

After that, they got themselves a good dinner at the inn, and decided to turn in for now. Jacob just hoped that perhaps they could leave the realm in the morning. Perhaps that could take care of the changes. Greg wasn't too sure, but he agreed with hoping that they would be behind them. They got into some sleep clothes and went to bed, hoping nothing else would happen.

*****The Next Morning*****

"Greg!"

Greg awoke to Jacob nearly shouting at him. He hoped that the whole inn didn't hear that.

"What is it?" asked Greg.

"Look at yourself...and me!" said Jacob. Greg groggily looked at Jacob before gasping and looking at himself.

Both of them looked a bit smaller than before, probably around 5'4 or somewhere around there, and their overall body frames seemed to be smaller too. Their muscles didn't seem as big, although they weren't bad. Still, they looked really weird, alarming both of them.

"Now I'm really worried." said Jacob.

"Okay, let's think through this. We should try to leave as soon as we can." said Greg, much to Jacob's agreement. Right before they left though, and packed up their things, both of them did their best to wash their face and all that. However, something came over both of them, finding a couple of hair ties in front of them. Without really thinking about it, both of them weaved their hair through them, forming their hair into a couple of cute ponytails.

"Um....how did we do that?" asked Jacob, a finger briefly touching his chin as he did.

"I don't know.....I guess it looks nice." said Greg, briefly touching his chin too.
1552322111111.title: They head to sleep (and change)

15523221111111.content:
Jacob and Greg soon exited the inn as they walks out, their bodies seemed completely different but natural almost. Jacib couldn't describe it.

The two walked when Jacob noticed a small shop. Jacob told Greg to continue for a bit as he walked to the owner. What caught Jacob's eye was a Second Seal and a Silver Sword. "Excuse me? How much for those?" He asked pointing at the two items.

"1500 gold." The owner replied plainly.

That seemed fair, but for some reason, Jacob couldn't accept that. After some haggling (and perhaps a bribe or two) Jacob got his items for 500 gold. Jacob walked away smiling with a finger on his chin for a moment. He entered a small outhouse and thought about what class to be. Obviously one that can use swords, he thought as he activated the seal.

A moment later the door opened and Jacob donned a new Trickster outfit. Colored red down the sides and yellow down the front. A small teddy bear also hung from the Silver Word's sheath. Jacob grinned a little before catching back up to Greg.

What happens next?
15523221111111.title: Leaving the Inn

choices: Something holds them up in town
155232211111112.content:
Greg hadn't traveled too far from where Jacob had gone. He was kind of worried as to what Jacob was thinking. Splitting up wasn't exactly the best case for them right now. It was with that in mind that he had actually ended up eavesdropping on the conversation earlier, and his jaw had dropped a bit from hearing it.

*****During the previous chapter*****

"1500 gold." The owner of the chop was talking to Jacob, who seemed to be eyeing a couple of items. Greg could see that it was a Second Seal and a Silver Sword. What in the world did he need those for? He wasn't a swordsman. Even if he used a seal, how would he suddenly get to use a Silver Sword. Still, Greg observed them, and he saw an odd look on Jacob's face.

"1500...." He heard Jacob mutter to himself. He then saw him shake his head slightly, as if something was amiss. As the streets were a bit busy, Greg couldn't hear much of what happened next. However, he saw Jacob talking to the owner, which almost seemed like an odd discussion. He could even see Jacob holding out a couple of things, although he couldn't get a good look. The talk went on for about another 5 minutes, until he suddenly heard the owner say that he only had to pay 500 gold instead. That seemed to make Jacob happy, and he had a finger on his chin.

"What did he say to him?" Greg asked himself as Jacob disappeared into the nearby outhouse. He could swear he saw a brief flash from inside, meaning that the seal was being used. Greg had no idea where this was going, but he didn't think it could be good.

*****Back to the present*****

"Um, what's up with the get-up?" asked Greg as he approached Jacob, now wearing a red and yellow Trickster outfit. He was also wearing the Silver Sword he bought, and it had a little charm on it.

"Oh, hey Greg. Find out anything?" asked Jacob.

"Um....well not much. What's up with the new class?" asked Greg. Jacob looked at himself, actually looking not quite sure.

"To be honest, I'm not sure. I guess I kind of went on autopilot back there. This does feel nice though." said Jacob.

"I guess it does. Though, what about your Dark Mage items?" asked Greg.

"Well, if I stay like this, I won't need them. Maybe I'll sell them." said Jacob, not sure about that either.

"I see." nodded Greg. He wasn't sure how to handle this, but they had enough confusing things on their minds right now. "Anyway, we do kind of need to consider our next move."
155232211111112.title: What in the world is happening?

1552322111111122.content:
As the two ponytailed adventurers went toward the edge of town, they noticed a large battalion of guards nearby. "I wonder what's happening," Jacob said as the two soon went toward them.

Apparently there is a threat of wolves in the surrounding forest and a battalion was sent to dispatch of them. They have also given orders that no one should leave town until the wolves are routed or flee. Greg sighed and out a finger to his chin.

He also felt odd for another reason. While he had a finger to his chin, his arm seemed to press against something on his chest. Looking down he saw two breasts. Greg felt as though "she" should be surprised, but it felt to natural to be bad. Greg soon felt a finger tap her shoulder. "Everything okay?"

Greg turned to see Jacob had undergone a few changes herself. Her hips and butt actually seemed to grow a bit along with a pair of breasts on her chest. "Yeah, I'm fine."

Jacob smiled and turned back to town. "Guess we're stuck here 'til those wolves leave. Guess I could set up shop here...maybe the guards will need new weapons." Jacob said smiling with a finger to her chin.

Greg couldn't help but smile, not noticing her hips and rear changing as well. She nodded and soon wandered alongside her Trickster lookalike.

What next?
1552322111111122.title: Something holds them up in town

15523221111111221.content:
"Is that a good idea? I mean, we had intended on leaving earlier." Greg spoke.

"Might as well make the best of it." said Jacob. "We can't do much until the barricade is done after all. We could use a little more gold anyway. We've got quite a bit of stuff that we don't need anymore anyways."

"I guess that's true." said Greg with a finger to her chin. Briefly, she brought her legs together, somewhat thinking that something was missing. It was, as what was originally between her legs was gone, same with Jacob. So they really couldn't be called guys at all anymore. Still, that thought didn't seem to cross Greg's mind, although he still worried about what was going on.

"Actually, I think I saw an open area down the street a bit. Conveniently, it's near where some of the guards are. I think this could work." said Jacob. Greg ended up nodding, smiling as she did.

"Well, you're right, so let's do it."

As she said that, she felt a brief wave wash over her face. She twitched slightly as her eyes became a nice red color, along with her cheeks and nose softening. A certain glint seemed to remain in her eyes afterwards. Looking towards her friend, Greg saw Jacob's own eyes becoming red, her own features softening as her face became an exact replica of her own.

Without a doubt, except for Greg still having her mostly unfitting Myrmidon clothes, the two girls were now virtually identical. As if noticing this, in a new tone of voice, Jacob looked at Greg's attire.

"You know, that outfit really doesn't work for what we need to do." said Jacob. Greg looked over her unfitting clothes, getting a sense that she was right.

"You know, you're right. I could use something new." she said
15523221111111221.title: Changes continue

155232211111112211.content:
Jacob walked aside Greg looking at the shops they passed, trying to find a suitable bit of clothing. Jacob soon looked back over to her friend. "What made you even buy that?"

Greg shrugged a bit. "I honestly don't know why I would." Jacob smiled a put a finger to her chin.

"Maybe I should have them charge you extra for that." Greg gave a smile back.

"You can try, but I won't go down easily." The two soon saw one of their sisters at a stand selling many things. They approached her and asked for a Second Seal. Anna smiled, "800 gold."

Jacob and Greg shared a glance before both shook their heads. "That won't do." Greg said.

---------

As Anna talked to them, she saw an empty bottle in Greg's pouch, recognizing it as her energy tonic bottle. "Hey, maybe I could take that flimsy bottle off your hands," Anna said mentioning to it.

Greg pulled it out. "Drop your price to 400."

Anna sighed and agreed. She handed over the seal and Greg handed over the gold and bottle.

Anna looked at the bottle as they left and realized it was a different tonic then what she even thought it was. She shrugged, but soon smiled.

Greg exited the outhouse wearing a exact copy of Jacob's outfit but without the charm and a few added coin pouches. "That looks better," Jacob commented.

"Thanks sis!" Greg said before Jacob smiled as the two went to set up shop.
155232211111112211.title: Getting that sorted out

1552322111111122111.content:
"This spot looks pretty good." said Jacob, giving the place a good look.

"Yeah, it does. However, do we have enough to really sell?" asked Greg with a puzzling look on her face. Jacob didn't seem overly worried.

"Well, we've got a lot of stuff to get rid off that the soldiers might be able to use. If we run out, well then I guess we go get more stuff and either keep selling here or leave to another realm. I think it's been a long time since we've seen RealmAnna."

"That's true. Actually, I think I see a soldier coming over right now." said Greg as she and Jacob set up whatever extra stuff they had at the current moment. The soldier had a blade of his own, but it looked old.

"Hey, you got any good swords? My men and I could use a few." said the soldier.

"Wow, what do you have to do to bust up a sword that much?" asked Greg, a bit surprised.

"Traveling here took quite a bit out of it. I don't think it'll be really necessary, but you can never be too careful." said the soldier.

"Good words, and I think we can help." smiled Jacob.

And with that, the shop was open for business.
1552322111111122111.title: Setting up shop

15523221111111221112.content:
After about two days of business the two Annas had made a fair profit. Routing the wolves took longer than expected and they got more soldiers coming in before the wolves were removed. The second morning, Greg awoke in the back of their small store to see Jacob gone from her bed. She got up and got dressed, tying the ponytail behind her head.

She walked out when she saw Jacob carrying a few crates and a large bag almost her size on her back. She dropped the goods in the shop. "Morning," Jacob said, cheery as usual.

"Did some shopping? What is this?" Greg asked, putting a finger to her chin.

"Our sis at the other stand was going to be heading out and couldn't pack everything. So she us excess items." Jacob smiled and copied Greg's stance.

"Did she charge you?"

"Yeah, but we can sell it for twice the amount we paid for it."

The two smiled as they began to display the new items. One of which seemed to be an energy tonic that looked familiar to the two, but they don"t know why. Shrugging it off, they continue their business.

What happens next?
15523221111111221112.title: Later on

He possesses an average build, and wears a light black leathers best and shirt underneath, plain trousers, and black reinforced boots.

Appearance: Black thief outfit (similar to that of Gaius)
Personality: Grateful and sneaky, clever and somewhat cold. However has a soft spot for cute things.

-----------

Jacob felt another blow cross his face. The jailer was beating him...again. Jacob spit the blood puddling in his mouth out. He was caught pickpocketing again, giving him another week in prison and beatings each day. Jacob's hands her shackled behind him along with his legs. Jacob was kicked over before receiving a kick to the head, making a large wound open on his forehead and bleed.

Jacob's vision began swimming when...
1552322211.title: Continuing On

15523222111.content:
Greg was just walking out from a shop, having packed a couple more items to prepare him for the road ahead. Suddenly, as he was walking by, he started hearing noises. Confused, he looked left and right to see what was going on. He couldn't see anything new, but he was hearing sounds of fighting coming from a building to the side. It didn't look as nice as the rest of the city. It was more old and definitely not maintained. Frankly, Greg wanted to avoid most trouble, but his curiosity was getting the better of him.

He walked closer to the building, hearing the punching noises get louder. Just as he was going to look in, he heard them stop, hearing stepping noises near the door. He popped down near a bush, out of sight when someone passed by him. The person slammed the door in anger so hard that it actually left it slightly ajar. He didn't notice it however and kept on walking by. Curious, when the man was out of sight, Greg walked over, taking a brief look inside. It seemed like a small prison, although it wasn't that bad. Perhaps it was more a place for detainees instead. He only saw one occupant; a thief laying on the ground, badly injured.

"Woah, what happened to you?" asked Greg to the still-conscious thief. He smirked at Greg.

"Oh, nothing too much. Apparently, this is what happens when you pickpocket just a couple times." the man laughed a bit.

"You appear to be a thief, so I guess it's not surprising. What's your name?" asked Greg.

"Jacob."

"Greg."

"Ah, nice to meet you." replied Jacob, slowly getting up. Some more blood fell as he tried to stand, hands and legs still bound.

"Did that man do that to you? I wasn't aware that jailers were allowed to abuse inmates." said Greg.

"They aren't, but he didn't get the memo. Still, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't in dire straits right now. You mind helping me? I got his keys right before he left. The ogre was so mad that he didn't even stop to think." Jacob added a smirk as he revealed a set of keys underneath him. Using some flexibility, he shoved them past the bars to Greg. Greg didn't seem to think that the man was evil, and besides he might die if nothing was tended to. Wounds like that went beyond vulneraries and elixirs. Without another thought, Greg popped the keys in, walking inside and using his Steel Sword to cut the ropes.

"Well....you responded quickly." said Jacob.

"I'm not fully confidant about you, but you clearly need help and don't deserve to bleed to death. We'll have to find someone though because I'm no healer, and it'll also have to be someone who won't call the knights or whoever on us." said Greg.

"Agreed." said Jacob, a little winded and woozy thanks to the blood loss. He could barely stand as Greg helped him up.
15523222111.title: ...he saw Greg walk in.

155232221111.content:
Jacob's vision swam when he turned his head as Greg helped him out. Jacob soon felt Greg taking a bandage to his forehead after some time passed. Greg soon found down an alley a room in a building that seemed abandoned. He dropped Jacob off there q nd then went to get help.

Greg walked out in the street to see someone near the street. A small girl with long silver hair with a yellow cleric outfit. She had a yellow flower in her hair as well. She was kneeling down and looking at a small flower with her stave at her feet. Greg walked over and approached her. "Excuse me?"

The girl looked over and smiled at Greg. "Yes? What is it?"

Greg knelt down as well. "You're a cleric right? I need help. My friend is hurt and needs some medical attention. Can you help him?"

The girl stood with Greg. "Of course. I'm still training but I'll do what I can." She was led to the room by Greg as she knelt beside Jacob and held the staff over him as she began to heal him. She finished a few minutes later and walked to Greg. "Can I wait until he wakes up, just to make sure he's okay?"

"Sure, thank you." Greg said as they waited for their friend to wake up.

Abiut three hours passed before Jacob woke up again. He sat up with a hand to his bandaged forehead. He then looked to his side to see Greg sitting there. "Feeling better?" Greg asked.

Jacob stretched. "Y-yeah. Thanks." He replied. Greg also had bought a loaf of bread and a flask of water for him and handed them over. Jacob ate and drank the meal. Jacob laid on his back when he was finished. Jacob thought something over in his head before asking the question.

"Hey Greg, I'm not sure what you're doing, but could I tag along perchance?" Jacob asked.
155232221111.title: Getting Help

1552322211111.content:
Greg looked at Jacob with a straight eye. On one hand, he wasn't sure. As much as he believed that Jacob wasn't as bad as he made himself out to be, he wasn't sure if he wanted a thief tagging along. He was doing fine on his own. Then again, Karen would always tell him that "the more the marrier". He hardly listened to Karen's advise, but perhaps this could work out.

"All right....I guess you can. Perhaps you can block a stray arrow or two." Greg added with a smirk.

"Hey!" That got a bit of a laugh from the two men. The extra member of the group pulled her cowl over her head, almost feeling like she wasn't needed here. However, Greg soon rectified the situation.

"Oh Jacob, this is......" Greg actually blushed out of embarrassment. He totally forgot to ask the cleric's name. "Actually, what's your name?" Jacob laughed at the situation. Greg was so eager to find a healer that he totally forgot his manners. The girl smiled at him though, not minding.

"My name's Kuo, and it's very nice to meet you." She said with a bow. "I don't think I've seen either of you two in town before. Are you new to town?"

"Well, he was just in jail, and I was traveling through." said Greg, getting a look from Jacob. Kuo gasped a bit at the "jail" bit, but a quick explanation fixed that.

"Anyway, thanks a bunch for the save. You're pretty good." said Jacob. Kuo smiled gently, although she shook her head at the words.

"I'm no where near as good as Mother Hera. To be honest, I just started training a few months ago. I'm glad my staff helped you enough though." said Kuo. Then, she kept talking. "By the way, you're both travelers?"

"Well, I am for sure, and he's apparently decided to tag along." said Greg. Kuo smiled again.

"That's great. Then, would it be all right if I accompanied you as well?" She asked sincerely. Both Greg and Jacob dropped their mouths at that.

"Why would you ask that?" asked Greg.

"Part of my training involves traveling and developing my skills. I still have a lot to learn, and I promise you that I can be of help. Please." The girl looked pleadingly into Greg's face. To be honest, it started reminding him of when Karen would try to guilt him.

"Man, this girl is really naive to trust traveling with people she doesn't even know." Greg thought. The girl was around 14 years old, and quite frankly, barely looked it. She had a childish kind of face, thought it did bring out her yellow eyes.

"Well, a healer is always helpful on the road. So, I guess we'll be happy to have you." said Greg. Kuo instantly brightened.

"Oh really?! Thank you so much. Can I meet you at the North exit? I need to get my things and tell Mother where I'm going. See you then." And with that, she was off like a bolt of Thoron.

"That girl has a really innocent way of getting what she wants." said Jacob.

"Yep." spoke Greg.
1552322211111.title: Greg agrees

15523222111111.content:
Jacob was a bit wobbly on his feet. It was his first time being able to stand on his own for a week. Being tied and beaten for a few days can mess with your sense of balance. He struggled a bit and propped himself on a wall before Greg stood up and opened the door. "Let's get you some supplies." Jacob nodded and walked with him.

The found a nearby blacksmith with weapons and armor for sale. Jacob bought a killing edge and silver sword. He also somehow procured an Arms Scroll. Jacob walked up to Greg and nodded, showing he was ready.

They soon reached the North Gate when they saw Kuo standing there with a small pack and a staff. She noticed them and smiled. She ran over to them. "Are you guys ready to go?" Jacob nodded and Greg nodded alongside him. Kuo smiled as the three set off down the road out of town.

What happens next?
15523222111111.title: A Group of Three

155232221111111.content:
And so, the little trio began walking, although they really had no destination in mind.

"So.....now what?" shrugged Jacob.

"Well, all I've done is just travel through place after place. I never really had a destination in mind." said Greg, looking to his new travelmates. "And how did you convince everyone so quickly, Kuo?"

"The other clerics didn't really pay much attention. They mostly just shook their heads without really thinking. I'm still really young in my training." she said.

"How long have you been doing it?" asked Jacob. Kuo paused in thought.

"Um, I guess about 2 years now, so I was around 12 years old. I got started later than others. Truth be told, my parents live in a nearby town, and my Dad's a blacksmith. I actually wanted to learn how to use a sword when I was a child." She spoke to everyone, surprising them a bit.

"Really, and yet you somehow ended up a cleric?" asked Jacob.

"It didn't take too long for me to realize that I didn't like inflicting pain on others. Besides, my Mom was a cleric herself, so I decided to follow in her footsteps instead." She pulled her cowl down again, feeling a little embarrassed at her little speech.

"Hey, don't feel bad. People have different talents." smiled Jacob.

"Such as your talent for stealing things." quoted Greg.

"Exactly.....Hey!" Greg and Kuo had a good laugh at Jacob's expense, which made him laugh a little later. They at least seemed to be bonding somewhat, although Greg didn't know what to fully think of his comrades. To be honest, looking at Kuo reminded him of Karen back home. Boy, she must be worried by now as well. She was also a cleric, well, a war cleric to be exact. She was pretty far along, since she started when she was 4 years old. By comparison, Greg didn't start his sword training until much later.

"Hey, is that an Anna?" Jacob spoke up. Greg looked up to see a merchant caravan traveling its own path along the rail, with said person at the ready. The two parties noticed each other, and Anna stopped her horses.

"Hello there, is Delian this way?" she asked. Delian was the name of the town they just went by, so Greg nodded yes. "Great, thanks! Stop by some time why don't you!"

And with that, she was cheerfully on her way, leaving the trio behind.

"Those Annas are always so cheerful." shrugged Jacob.

"I wonder where they get it from. I even wonder where they all come from." said Greg.

"I once heard a rumor that there's an entire realm where they come from." Kuo spoke up.

"Really? That's news to me." replied Jacob.

"Let's not think about it. An entire realm of them? Brrrr...." Greg didn't want to think much more of it. Hopefully, whenever he goes into another realm, he'll be able to avoid this "Anna realm" or whatever it was. Besides, there were surely better places to see.
155232221111111.title: During their travel...

1552322211111112.content:
As the trio traveled silently for a while longer, another Anna merchant appeared with a stand on the side of the road. The three were about to walk by when Kuo spotted an interesting staff for sale. She told Jacob and Greg to go ahead as she looked at it. "What is that?" Kuo asked innocently.

Anna smiled with a finger on her chin as usual. "That's a special staff there. It's called a 'Polymorph staff' it can make anyone anything. You can have it for 5000 gold."

Kuo dug through her money and found a small amount no where close to that. Being a Cleric and staying in town didn't make much money since the monastery provided for her. Anna, taking note of this decided, "How about you just take it?"

"Really?!" Kuo said wide-eyed. Anna smiled and nodded as Kuo thanked her and ran off with the staff.

Jacob and Greg turned back to see Kuo running happily toward them with a new staff. "Nice," Jacob said. He would inquire more but they found an Outrealm Gate and were ready to pass through. So they did without questioning the staff.
-------------
The trio walked out the other end before being met by heat. Their eyes adjusted and they saw a long beach in front of them. Kuo giggled excitedly as Jacob stretched and sighed. "Guess we can rest here."

Greg nodded, "Too bad I don't have my swimsuit with me."

Kuo walked to a nearby shack with another Anna inside and asked about swimsuits. Anna replied, "We have a lot of swimsuits, but only for girls." Kuo then looked at the staff and then at us.

What happens next?
1552322211111112.title: Another Choice

15523222111111121.content:
"Why in the world would you only have girls' swimsuits?" asked Greg. Granted, he had never been to somewhere like this before, but what kind of beach only sold girls' suits? Wouldn't that put a damper on tourism?

"Hey, I don't make them. I just sell them. Besides, I think some got lost. Trans-dimensional travel and all that." responded Anna with a wink. Greg just groaned. What a load of BS. He was really getting tired of these Annas. Why did they all have to be so weird compared to the average merchant. From the look on Jacob's face, he seemed to share the same sentiment. He had no business being here if he wasn't wanted. Perhaps they should just walk away and find somewhere else to waste their time.

At least, they considered it before....

"I'll take some." said Kuo, running up to Anna. "I've never seen these before."

"We plan on selling them to more realms soon. You wouldn't believe how most places aren't even aware. Gives this place kind of a special feel, don't you think?" Anna winked again at them. "So, you want three or just for yourself?"

Kuo gave a bit of a thinking look, looking kind of cute with that childish face of hers. Greg wasn't sure why she was briefly looking at her new staff. Then, she immediately smiled. She held up three fingers, asking for three suits. Anna wasted no time in handing her three sets of bikinis.

"Thank you for coming, and enjoy your stay at BeachAnna." Kuo gave a respectful bow in thanks to Anna, grabbing all three sets and running away from the the stand. She motioned for the boys to follow her. Both of them could only wonder what was going on in the Cleric's head. Still, they followed her, heading to a small area where some blankets and umbrellas were set. It was kind of surreal for all three of them; you don't see this in their hometowns.

Anyway, Kuo stopped, smiling cutely at the boys.

"I think I have a solution to our problem." Kuo immediately whipped out her Polymorph Staff, which allowed Greg a better look at it. It had a unique unique, with a violet jewel in there, almost like a Restore Staff. "I'm going to fix this."

"Fix what?" smirked Jacob. "What can that thing so anyway?"

"Guess we'll fine out." Kuo smiled again as she aimed her staff at them, making them raise an eyebrow. "All right, let's try this. Polymorph!"

The flash emitted itself from the staff, enveloping both boys in light-purple light. Greg wanted to ask what was going on, but felt his body go stiff for a couple seconds as he was enveloped entirely. After a few seconds, the light dimmed down, and both Greg and Jacob felt disoriented. However, they looked straight to Kuo, who was covering her surprised mouth.

"Oh my, it does work!"

"What does---" Greg immediately stopped, hearing a distinctly feminine voice. He looked down to see himself definitely a girl; petite with good proportions and a darker shade of pink hair. She immediately looked to Jacob, who was now Kuo's size very good proportions and short purple hair. She was just as shocked.

"What the hell was that about?!" Jacob almost yelled. Kuo just gave a childish smile.

"Well, the merchant who gave me this said that it could change anything, so I wanted to try it out. I guess that's what you look like because that was the image in my head at the time. Now we can all have fun!" Kuo smiled again. Greg and Jacob looked at each other oddly. Hopefully this was just a temporary thing. Kuo helped them change into bikinis. For now, they could live with it. They needed a vacation after all, especially Jacob after her stay in prison.
15523222111111121.title: Kuo "fixes" the problem

155232221111111211.content:
Kuo didn't hesitate as she jumped into the ocean. She was laughing the whole way calling her friends along. They walked a little slowly and awkwardly. "This is embarrassing," Jacob said to Greg, fixated over her bikini and how it covers her. She groaned as Greg shrugged.

"Might as well though. Could be fun," Greg said as Jacob sighed with her. They reached the water's edge as Kuo walked up toward them.

"What are you waiting for? Come on!" Without warning, Kuo yanked the two girls into the water. She soon got the two to begin swimming with their new bodies.

The three girls changed games. Either playing tag in the water or splashing one another, they played games for awhile. The two used-to-be boys having fun all the same.

They soon took a break. Jacob and Greg were floating next to each other when Jacob asked Greg, "When Kuo transformed us, she said we ended up looking like what she thought. So why did she think of these bodies when she saw us? These bodies share almost no similarity to us."

Greg thought it over but just shrugged it off. "Don't think about it too much."

Jacob sighed as Kuo swam over amd they continued playing until...
155232221111111211.title: BeachAnna

1552322211111112111.content:
"Phew, that was really fun!" Kuo smiled as she came ashore, drying herself off as she did. Greg and Jacob soon got out as well, grabbing their own towels as well. As awkward as these bodies were, they had to admit that they enjoyed themselves. Jacob couldn't remember that last time she had this much fun since before prison.

"Hey Kuo?" Greg called out.

"Yes?"

"So, why these bodies? This isn't even close to my natural hair color." Greg pointed out to the long pink hair down her back. Kuo just smiled at her.

"Oh, I just thought whatever came into my head and went with it. Besides, I thought pink and purple would make you look more exotic. That's what a lot of people say about my silver hair." She smiled at them while saying that. To be honest, Greg never got a good look at it before. Kuo always had her cowl up, so Greg never got a good look. However, her hair was now in full view, going down a little bit past her shoulders. He had to admit; it did make her look exotic. The last time he ever saw such a thing was when he was reading about the Priestess of Dawn, Micaiah, in the old tales of Tellius.

Eventually, Jacob had finished as well, drying herself off.

"Well, as fun as this was, I'd say it's time to change back. Think you could do that?" asked Jacob.

"Aw, already?" asked Kuo with a little pout.

"Yes, I'd say so. Going beyond this area in these bodies might not be good for our psyche. Besides, our old clothes don't fit these bodies." said Greg. Kuo then brightened up.

"Maybe I can try to see if the staff will change your clothes too." she offered. Greg found it a bit cute, but it was time to put it to rest.

"Kuo, please."
