"Oh, okay." Kuo relented finally. It was fun while it lasted. They walked back to their spot, where Greg and Jacob changed back into their now too-big boy clothes. Kuo changed back into her Cleric outfit and grabbed Polymorph. Reciting the same words as before, Greg and Jacob were enveloped again, and soon found themselves back to normal.

"Oh, sweet mercy." Jacob smiled as he flexed a bit, making Greg groan a bit. He couldn't help but notice Kuo looking a little sad though. While Jacob was enjoying the return of masculinity, Greg walked over.

"What's wrong? Are you okay?" he asked.

Kuo's face seemed like it couldn't make up its mind between happy or sad. "I'm sorry. It's just that I was kind of sheltered by my parents. I never got a chance to play with other girls. Even when I joined the clergy, they're all business and little else."

Now Greg felt a bit sorry about before. So Kuo had a reason for being so passionate about their forms before. He gave a smile and put a hand on her shoulder.

"I'm glad that we could help you then." He gave her a soft smile as she looked at him. "Tell you what, the next time he need a vacation, you can do whatever you want. We'll have some more fun."

"Really? Thank you!" Kuo then hugged him, almost reminded Greg of when Karen would do the same. He smiled as he patted her on the back. This girl reminded him quite a bit of his cousin back home.

"You okay with that idea?" asked Greg to Jacob, who heard the whole thing. He shrugged.

"I guess I'm okay with it, as long as it's not every other day."

"Agreed." The group had a nice laugh after that. Anyway, after saying good bye to the Anna in charge, the group decided to head off. The sun was in its afternoon cycle by now, so they had to figure out how to proceed next.
1552322211111112111.title: ...they finish.

15523222111111121111.content:
The three soon began traveling in silence again. Jacob stretched himself out again as they walked, "This walking is gonna kill my legs," when Kuo spoke up. "Um, is it okay of we stop here for a second?"

The trio stopped and looked at her. Jacob walked a little closer, "What is it Kuo?"

Without warning Kuo readied the Polymorph Staff again and pointed it at Jacob as light enveloped him. It soon cleared and in Jacob's place was a girl Jacob's height with fire red hair in a ponytail and wearing her tight thief uniform. Jacob yelped for a moment and looked at Kuo. "K-Kuo?! What are you doing?" Jacob said in shock

Kuo justified it with, "Anna said you can become anything, but I only used it to turn you into someone. I wanna see what it can do." Woth that she pointed it at Jacob again.

"Wait what are you-" She was enveloped by light before she finished and in her place was a pale blue horse that just seemed to neighed and eat some grass. Kuo giggled a bit in awe as Greg was still watching. She soon used it again as the light enveloped the horse and then laying on the ground was a white, pristine and expensive looking dress with blue outlines.

Kuo somewhat squealed and picked Jacob up. "He looks so good like this right?" Kuo said turning to you.

What happens next?
15523222111111121111.title: Travel along the path

choices: Kuo decides to have fun with Jacob and Greg
155232221111111211111.content:
"Um, what?" Greg wasn't sure what to think. All of a sudden, Jacob looked like Anna, then a horse, and now....this? It was a pretty elegant dress. It almost reminded Greg of a Cleric dress, but much more elegant and strapless. It almost reminded Greg of that supposedly special class that existed only in the Outrealms, known as the Bride class. So that wasn't just a legend? Well, the more you learn.

"Oh my, it's so beautiful." Kuo's eyes practically sparked in delight, as if she was forgetting the issue here.

"Um, Kuo? I'm not sure Jacob is okay with this." said Greg.

"Oh, I think he is right now. He seems content actually." As Kuo said that, she suddenly stopped, as if she just had some kind of realization. "Amazing. Greg, I think this staff can affect someone mentally too. I don't sense any hostility or anything from him."

"First of all, how do you "sense" something from a dress?" asked Greg. His mind was overflowing with questions right now.

"Maybe because I changed him or something? I'm not sure. All I know is that this is pretty cool!" Kuo got excited again.

"Okay, I know this is kind of fun for you, but I'm not sure if this is the place for that." said Greg.

"Well, we're not in a hurry, right? Besides, I want to find out everything this can do. I wonder if anything new will happen if I use it on you. Please?" asked Kuo. Greg sighed, but didn't resist. She would probably just do it anyway.

"Just get it over with. Man, I feel like I'm dealing with Karen here." He mumbled the last part to himself so Kuo didn't hear. She put Jacob down for now, and focused Polymorph on Greg, enveloping him in light again. However, the sensation felt a bit different this time, and he felt totally different once it stopped. He saw Kuo's jaw open as it stopped.

"Huh? Who's that?"

Greg raised an eyebrow as she looked at himself. "She" gasped a bit as she looked around, seeing herself in a pink War Cleric-like outfit. Familiar pink hair tied in a ponytail flew behind her. It didn't take long for Greg to see who she was.

"What the heck? How did you turn me into my cousin?" Greg asked. This was Karen's body; Greg's own cousin who joined the clergy herself at a young age. She was so good that she even advanced to the next class by the time he left.

"That's your cousin? I was actually thinking of you looking like some kind of prince. How did that look come around?" asked Kuo, just as perplexed as Greg was. However, after a minute, Greg came to a conclusion.

"I was just thinking about her as you hit me. Perhaps the spell also reacts to whatever the transformee is thinking." said Greg.

"Huh, really? Wow, that's some magic." said Kuo, as she smiled again. "So, why does she have pink hair but you don't?"

"My Mom and her sister have pink hair, and Karen inherited it." Greg explained simply.

"Fair enough." said Kuo. "At least you don't think like her. I wasn't trying to change your mind."

"Well, how thoughtful of you. Could you change me back now?" asked Greg.
155232221111111211111.title: Greg steps in

choices: Make Greg a girl and have him wear Jacob.
1552322211111112111111.title: Kuo decides to have fun with Jacob and Greg

15523222111111121111111.content:
Kuo grinned for a second and then smiled brightly. "Okay." She told Greg cutlets as she pointed the staff at her. But instead of him turning to normal, he changed into something a little different. Her pink hair went to neck length behind her head as hair hung from the sides. She also seemed to become a bit younger with a softer face. She finally stopped changing as she looked at Kuo. Kuo looked a bit nervous until Greg smiled happily.

"What are we waiting for? Let's keep exploring," she said. Kuo giggled with glee and agreed. Then she turned to see where she left the dress that was Jacob. She found him and then looked at Greg and grinned. She walked over and handed Jacob to Greg. "A dress?! Thank you Kuo!"

Kuo was a little surprised. It seemed like Greg had forgotten Jacob was the dress. She smiled anyway as Greg found a few bushes to change behind. She dressed into her new attire and giggled a bit before the "three" went off.

What happens next?
15523222111111121111111.title: Make Greg a girl and have him wear Jacob.

155232221111111211111111.content:
The "trio" walked off down the trail, hardly looking like one you'd expect to travel. You had one girl wearing a dress you'd hardly expect to travel in, and some Cleric that acted like a child. Still, the new Greg just chatted about the strangest things, almost like some high-strung noblewoman. Still, even that worked for Kuo. She just enjoyed the company.

Heading down the trail from BeachAnna, a sizable town soon came into view, called "Telion" judging by the sign. Kuo walked down the path with her friend, heading in without much trouble. Nobody really seemed to pay attention to the odd little duo, which Kuo was grateful for. She was not the standout type.

"My my, such a busy town." said Greg with a smile. "How big do you think this town is?"

"Bigger than my hometown for sure." responded Kuo. Soon after that, both of their stomachs rumbled, which made them laugh a bit. They made a turn for the local inn, since they served food there for sure. It was nice and quiet, although Kuo could have sworn that Greg got some favoritism from the waiter. Was it the dress? The breasts? The smile? Kuo almost felt a little inadequate.

"Are you alright?" asked Greg. Kuo shook her head of those thoughts, and smiled.

"Oh, it's nothing." she replied. They finished up their meal with their gold and left. However, Kuo decided to change things up, and lead Greg behind the Inn. Waving Polymorph, she released the mental hold on Greg, and she suddenly came to.

"Kuo! What was all that about? Gods, the things that came out of my mouth." Greg spat. Obviously, she remembered what she said while under the mental influence of Polymorph. Kuo gave a sheepish smile and put her hands up.

"I'm sorry! Really, I am. I just wanted to have fun." she defended.

"I'm aware of that, but is this really the time. I mean, the things I said back there. So embarrassing. If my family ever hears of this, there goes my credibility." Greg put a hand to her head, feeling really frustrated.

"Well, at least you're back to normal, right?" Kuo said.

"Only in mind. Could you please change me back so I can change to my normal clothes?"

"All right." sighed Kuo. Guess the party was over for now. She waved the staff again and Greg slowly reverted back to his male form. He soon got back into his normal Mercenary garb, feeling much more comfortable now. Now, all that was left was the Jacob dress.

"Now, as funny as it is for a thief to be a dress, could you please fix this?" asked Greg.
155232221111111211111111.title: They find a small town

1552322211111112111111111.content:
Kuo laid out the pristine dress that was the thief amd waved the staff as it was enveloped in bright light.

When it faded, Jacob sat dazed on the ground. "What....How...." He seemed to be out of it a little.

"What was that like?" Kuo asked.

"I felt...weird. Empty, airy, pretty even. But then someone put me on and it was weird from there..." Jacob said somewhat embarrassed. Greg also went red somewhat, realizing the one he was talking about was him. Kuo smiled sheepishly. "Could you...warn me next time at least?" He asked.

Kuo nodded simply as Greg helped Jacob up. They soon went off again.

What happens next?
1552322211111112111111111.title: Fixing the problem

choices: They find a town to stay in.
15523222111111121111111111.content:
The trio approached an Outrealm gate in the town and looked about. "What do you think? Start going?" Jacob said. Greg nodded and Kuo seemed a bit excited to continue. They then entered to the next realm.

They entered and saw a dark thundering sky. Before them was a tall tower with broken ruins before it. As soon as they entered, Kuo jumped behind Jacob shaking. "Huh? Kuo?"

"I-I don't like it here...I wanna leave!" Kuo said urgently.

"We begin shortly milord."

The three stopped and quickly hid against the ruins walls and looked to see a man in dark robes before a large open room. The man was met with a loud thunderous voice. "Good. Before long, I will return to the realms. I can finally return to my rightful place."

Jacob then realized it was a dragon. They needed to get out. Now.

He saw an Outrealm Gate straight to their right. He motioned to Greg to go to it. He did so and stood next to it ready to pass through. Kuo and Jacob then ran for it and entered with Greg.

The three ran into a field on the other side and took a breather. "That was creepy," Greg commented.

Jacob thought, "What was that lizard talking about?"

Kuo was still a little shaken. "Maybe we can just relax a little and maybe find out later." Jacob and Greg sighed in agreement as they began to travel again.

What happens next?
15523222111111121111111111.title: They find an Outrealm Gate

155232221111111211111111111.content:
The three of them were still breathing hard as they collected themselves on the field. This realm was different from where they were before, but anything was better than those ruins. What in the world was that thing? Greg had certainly never seen anything like it. Sure, he read books about various legends throughout history, but....seeing was truly believing.

"What do you think it was?" asked Jacob.

"Well, I've read legends, but who knows for sure. There have been quite a few dragons that have had quite an impact on history." said Greg, still breathing hard.

"Really, like who for example?" asked Jacob.

"Well, there was the Shadow Dragon Medeus. He was so strong that it took the Hero-King Marth to take him down, and even then it wasn't a sure thing. Outside of him, there was Loptyr in the Jugdralian legends, and I even heard another dragon recently ravaged against the land of Ylisse. Forgot his name though." said Greg.

"You don't say. Boy, I don't want to meet any of those." said Jacob.

"And who's to say who we saw was any of them. Who knows what evils are throughout the realms."

"Quite the bastards. So dark and evil and....."

"Quiet!"

Instantly, Greg turned to see Kuo aiming Polymorph at Jacob, enveloping him in light once again. Greg barely blinked before Jacob disappeared, only leaving a dress where he once stood. This one was considerably more frilly than the last one; a pinkish-white color with some frills. It definitely looked more girly than before. Kuo ran up and hugged it, seemingly feeling more content. Greg narrowed his eyes at her. The way she acted just before using Polymorph.

"Kuo, are you alright?" Greg asked. Kuo jumped a bit before talking.

"O-Of course, why wouldn't I be?" Greg wasn't buying it though. She freaked out just before using the staff, and judging by the way she just embraced the dress right after it happened told the whole story.

"So....this is your way of relieving stress?" Greg asked. Kuo looked down, seemingly a bit guilty.

"Um..well I...." Greg could easily tell she wasn't well. From the moment they set foot in that temple, she's looked even paler than she normally did, and she was fair to begin with.

"Greg...please....can I? Just for a little bit?" How in the world could Greg resist that? Perhaps the girl needed a little security to get her mind off it. Besides, the dress seemingly had this "ready to be worn" feeling, which Greg imagined meant that Jacob's mind was changed again. He sighed, knowing that Jacob wouldn't like it, but perhaps giving Kuo this brief time would be good for her mental psyche.

"All right, you can go on." said Greg.

"Thank you." said Kuo, flashing a brilliant smile.
155232221111111211111111111.title: Kuo uses the staff again

choices: They find an inn for the night in a nearby village
1552322211111112111111111111.content:
Kuo donned the frilly dress that was once the thief of the three. She ran her hands along the frills and designs. She inhaled and exhaled before looking back to Greg. "Thanks."

The two and the dress began walking down a small road when a question came to Greg's mind. He was worried about asking it for multiple reasons, but asked anyway. "Hey Kuo? How come both times you made Jacob the dress?"

Kuo kinda blushed a little, looking slightly embarrassed. "W-Well...it's hard to say but...he feels nice..."

This answered confused Greg a bit more. "What does that mean?"

Kuo had a light red face as she gave her answer. "He feels...warm. Almost like a hug...I don't know but...I like it..." She hugged the frills of her dress as she looked back to Greg. "Why do you ask? Are you wanting to try?"

This immediately put Greg on the defensive, denying wanting to try. "But, that must be what calms you down."

Kuo nodded. "Yeah...How would it be if I wore Jacob to bed?"

Greg have her a look thay said 'No', but made her giggle all the same.

What happens next?
1552322211111112111111111111.title: Kuo feels much better

15523222111111121111111111111.content:
"You know, it's hard to tell that you're a Cleric when you're wearing that." spoke Greg as he and Kuo began to walk down the trail.

"Well, it looks pretty doesn't it?" she asked.

"On you? Certainly." Greg responded, much to Kuo's delight. Man, his insides just became mush around this girl. Why did kids have to be his one weakness? Well, not much he could do about it now. The next village seemed to be in sight. This one looked circular in design, with some large structure in the middle; a really tall one too.

"Wow, is that a monastery? It's huge!" spoke Greg as he looked from the nearby hill. Kuo clapped her hands together when she saw it.

"Oh good, perhaps I could do some training here. I've never been to any outside of Bryyo." Kuo said happily.

"Perhaps it would be good for you. Although, it's really late now. Perhaps we should turn in once we get in. You can do your thing tomorrow."

"Okay!"

After that, the duo walked into the town of "Aldean" as it seemed to be called. Shops were closing down for the night, so they went straight to the inn. They only had to pay for two, which apparently was at least one benefit of the staff. Kuo suggested turning Greg into some clothing for her and they would only have to pay for one. He turned it down for now. Maybe next time.

After some dinner, the two retired to their room, which would be more than big enough. Kuo hung Jacob up on a rack and changed into some provided sleepwear, as did Greg.

"So, why are you so desperate for companionship like this? You've taken to turning us into clothes at times and even girls entirely." said Greg. Kuo sat down on her bed, combing through her hair a bit.

"Well, I wasn't born in the town you arrived in. My parents were really cautious with me. I didn't get to really play with anyone my age; no girls or boys. Eventually, I was just left at the monastery, where the Head Cleric decided to take care of me."

"That's rough. What kind of parents are they to leave their daughter like that?" Greg asked with a hint of anger. He couldn't stand parents who left their kids to the dogs like that.

"But, I'm sure they're nice people." Greg looked to see Kuo giving a sad smile. "I'll be a good Cleric, and then I'll go back and show them how much I've grown up, and....I'm sure they'll let me back."

Greg gave her a soft smile.

"I certainly hope so."

*****The Next Day*****

Both of them woke up the next day, got ready, and Kuo changed Jacob back. His memory was a little hazy, but at least he apparently sleep well, for what it's worth. Greg and Kuo got a good laugh either way. They went down and got themselves some breakfast. However, right as they left, Greg spotted something to the side. There were some shady people heading in the direction of the monastery in the center of town. Perhaps he was a bit paranoid, but he was worried. The last thing a peaceful town needed was shady people infiltrating the clergy.

Apparently, Jacob and Kuo saw them too. They all nodded that something seemed off in this seemingly peaceful town.
15523222111111121111111111111.title: They find an inn for the night in a nearby village

155232221111111211111111111111.content:
The three finished their food quickly before heading outside and around a building to where they peered at the group making their way to the monastery. They certainly looked suspicious enough. Dark cloaks, hoods and all that. The group seemed to enter the monastery all at once.

The trio soon pulled into a nearby alley to discuss what to do. "I don't like the look of this." Jacob said. Those kinds of people walking in mass to a monastery worried him. Greg seemed to share a similar feeling about it.

"So what are we going to do?" Kuo asked the two.

They thought for a moment before Jacob sighed. "Well, we could sneak in with them if Kuo used the Polymorph Staff." Jacob said. Greg seemed to nod in agreement when Kuo smiled and pointed the staff at the two. Light enveloped them as their clothes morphed and bodies tingled. Soon they finished. Jacob put his hood down for now. "Thanks Ku-" She stopped about halfway to realize she had a female voice. She looked down at her clothing to see the cloak and everything, but also a skin tight black covering across everything below her neck, similar to what most Sorcerers wear. She saw his hair was long and dark purple. She looked to see Greg given the same change with light pink hair tied into a braid.

"Kuo? Why did you make us girls?" Greg asked.

Kuo smiled brightly, "That was my own choice." The two looked at each other then back at Kuo who just smiled.

"Just stay out of sight for now and we'll find you here alright?" Jacob said, Kuo nodding. The two began toward the monastery when Jacob said, "I think that girl's growing on me."

Greg chuckled, "If anything, you're going on her."

Jacob went a light red at the dress involvement. "H-hey...!" She said as Greg gave another chuckle. The two soon put up their hoods and entered.

What next?
155232221111111211111111111111.title: The Aldean Monastery

choices: One of the thieves sees them
One of the local clerics sees them
1552322211111112111111111111111.content:
"I'm really starting to doubt us leaving our disguises in Kuo's hands." said Jacob as they entered the monastery.

"I guess she just went with this because it's all the reference she has. Seems like she based most of this off her appearances at the beach. I get the feeling that she'll keep it up too." spoke Greg.

"Yeah, I guess so." sighed Jacob as she looked at herself again. "Although, I guess the outfits overall aren't too bad. It looks like she gave us Sorcerer looks, so that isn't too bad."

"I guess you have a point there. Still, the skin-tight stuff makes me feel a little self-conscious." muttered Greg.

"That's true." said Jacob.

"They're over there!"

Greg pointed to the back end of the large entrance hall, where the black cloaks were mostly heading into. The two of them rushed over in an attempt to find them, heading up to the doors, which were still slightly open. They could overhear some things being discussed.

"What are we looking for here, sir?"

"There is something in this monastery that can help with our lord's resurrection. Spread out and search for anything suspicious. Steal the portraits around here if you have to."

"Yes sir."

Greg and Jacob saw most of them split away, heading off in different directions.

"So, they're looking for something here it seems." said Greg,

"That could take forever. This place is enormous." said Jacob.

"Yeah. Might want to get looking ourselves though if we don't want anyone calling us out." said Greg.
1552322211111112111111111111111.title: Inside the Monastery

choices: ..."We need to find a place here to lay low a bit."
15523222111111121111111111111112.content:
"Where would we even start?" Greg asked, looking around the town.

"Well, this is a monastery, so maybe one of the clerics know." Jacob suggested. With that they went off searching. It wasn't long until they got an answer. Apparently a special item was kept in the monastery. A chipped shard from a dragon's claw. She said it was deep inside the monastery and on display, but practically impossible to obtain. Greg thanked the cleric as the two entered the Monastery. As they did, Jacob wondered, "How did the other guys not notice this?"

Greg shrugged her shoulders, "Maybe they didn't even know what they were looking for. Maybe they only knew it was here." Jacob shrugged as the two soon saw the key in a locked box. The covering seemed to be enhanced magically so the glass wouldn't shatter easily.

Just then, Jacob began searching herself frantically. "Do I still have it.....Ah-ha!" He soon removed a key looking object and stuck it in the lock and began fidgeting with it. Greg looked to her confused before Jacob explained. "It's a skeleton key. I can try and usually pick any lock with this." A few minutes later and Jacob opened the case and grabbed the claw shard.

As the two exited, a small group of these cultists saw what Jacob had and ordered her to stop. This sent Greg and Jacob in a run. They re-entered the alley with Kuo who was waiting and said, "Hurry, can you hide us?"

Kuo stammered a little before casting a quick spell. The cultists approached the alley and looked down it to see a brown dog along with a black one in the alley. The cultists moved on as Kuo came out of hiding from behind corner. She looked at the two and gave them their original clothes and bodies. Soon Jacob said...
15523222111111121111111111111112.title: One of the local clerics sees them

155232221111111211111111111111121.content:
"We need to head out somewhere, and fast!" said Greg, getting quick nods.

They saw the cultists quickly running around near the monastery, searching every which way to find the trio. They ran in the other direction, behind the monastery and towards the north side of town, which almost seemed like it's own city. Seriously, this town was big enough for two cities. The north side even seemed to have its own identity, so perhaps that would work in their favor. They ran down the road a bit, avoiding some passers on the way, with Kuo trying to say sorry to most of them before Jacob pulled her along. As the crowds got a bit bigger, they kind of blended in, and went down a small insertion between a couple of buildings. There was a quite a bit of commotion as many cultists ran by their hiding spot, looking everywhere with anger. One of them came near the hiding spot, and Greg had to hold down a yell from Kuo. Soon enough, they didn't hear much, and Greg took one look out just to make sure.

"Phew, looks like we might be good....for now."

"I doubt they think we've left the city, so they'll still be around." said Jacob.

"So much for a peaceful town. I just hope none of the citizens get seriously hurt." said Greg as he took a brief look at the item in question. "A claw of all things? Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"

"Yeah, I bet it's related to whatever we saw in that temple. Looks like whoever it is can go between realms too. That isn't good." said Jacob.

"Well, I certainly didn't expect to run into things like this when I left Kiradia. Still, I guess we're in the middle of it now. It's nice though that Kuo's staff actually proved useful for once." Greg added with a smirk.

"Agreed. For once, it served a good purpose."

"Hey!"

Kuo pouted indignantly, getting a good laugh from the boys. Greg looked up to the sky, seeing that it was now about midday, given the sun's location. They had quite a bit of time before nightfall, so they had to decide what to do next. Kuo looked like she didn't want to leave. She wished she could have seen more of the monastery, but that might be a hornet's nest by now.
155232221111111211111111111111121.title: ..."We need to find a place here to lay low...

1552322211111112111111111111111211.content:
"I think we should leave town," Kuo suggested. "While you guys went in, I saw a merchant enter town and tell someone he just got back from a town called 'Mikado'. We should head there."

Greg and Jacob agreed. But as they were getting ready, Jacob found a nearby merchant and bought a Second Seal. This caught Greg's attention. "What are you doing?" Greg asked, catching Kuo's attention now.

"It looks as though those cultists will be a problem, so I wanna be helpful in a fight." With that, a light enveloped Jacob and he stood their again in blue Myrmidon outfit with an iron sword at his waist and a headband. "I might not be experienced, but I can help." Greg nodded in approval as they continuing packing. Soon they left town and went Northeast.
------------------
After about two hours of travel, they found a village much different from the one they left. Houses were made of straw and other foreign materials. There was a large creek running through the middle of the town, and alongside the coastline were cherry blossoms. It looked quite relaxing to the trio. As they wandered into town, they looked around. It didn't seem like there was a good place to stay. As soon as they considered turning around...

"E-excuse me?"

The trio turned to see a girl with long black hair tied into a ponytail behind her. She looked about 15, 16 years old and wore a pink Swordmaster outfit. Her voice seemed somewhat firm, but timid. "C-can I help you with something?"

Jacib nodded. "We're looking for a place to stay for a day or two, could you help us find an inn or perhaps a-" He was cut off as the girl replied.

"Y-you can stay at my home. It's fairly large so I'm sure it can accommodate all of you."

The three were somewhat shocked, but accepted gratefully. "I'm Isabel." She said as she led them into her home, located near the river in a grove of cherry blossoms.

What next?
1552322211111112111111111111111211.title: Making a decision

15523222111111121111111111111112111.content:
"What the heck is this place?" said Jacob.

"Hey, be nice, Jacob!" Kuo gave him a stern look. Jacob laughed a bit at it, until Greg also gave him a look.

"Sorry for my friend. He's a bit...abrasive."

"Hey!" The group got a little laugh out of that, except for Jacob. The girl in question didn't seem to mind.

"It's no matter. I assume you've never seen a town like ours. We're a little bit separated from most other places on this continent." said Isabel.

"You don't say. You're not that far away from Aldean." said Greg.

"Aldean is pretty much the closet settlement to us. Other than that, you've have to travel a long way to find another city. We mostly only get merchants and perhaps a tourist or two." Isabel spoke.

"Interesting." spoke Greg before stopping. "I'm sorry, I don't believe I introduced myself. I'm Greg from Kiradia."

"I'm Kuo from Bryyo, and the loudmouth is Jacob from who-knows-where."

"I can introduce myself, thank you very much!"

After another laugh at Jacob's expense, the group walked a bit through the village, as Isabel waved a bit to some villagers who passed by. Eventually, they came up to her "house", which as she said was pretty big compared to the others.

"Wow, when you said big, you weren't kidding." said Greg, giving a whistle as he did. Isabel smiled at the compliment.

"Well, it suits the leader of the village, so it makes sense." said Isabel. Kuo gasped at that.

"Wait! So, are you a princess?" she asked, making Isabel blush a bit.

"Well, sort of..." she trailed off a bit.

"Awesome!" Kuo squealed as she hugged the girl a bit, almost knocking her off balance. It was an amusing sight to the boys of the group.
15523222111111121111111111111112111.title: Introductions

155232221111111211111111111111121111.content:
The house was somewhat elevated on poles under the house that kept it off the ground. The doors seemed to be more of a sliding mechanism. The floor was made up of furnished planks of wood and the ceiling had a cloth interior. "Cozy," Jacob stated as they walked around the house.

Isabel stepped forward. "This estate was left to me when I was young. I can show you to your room if you want," she said, signaling that they would sleep in the same room. As Jacob followed though, he looked out a window to see a large area open in the back. Jacob strayed away as he walked outside not being noticed by his friends as he left. He walked into the clearing as a hand reached toward his sword as he unsheathed it. He took a stance and began swinging in motions.

After about 20 minutes, "Your form's off." Jacob turned and saw Isabel leaning against a tree.

"Huh?"

"Your stance. It's-...here." Isabel approached him and began to push his legs and arms into different positions. Jacob was glad she couldn't see his face, he felt like it was on fire. He went through a few more motions with Isabel's help before they finished. "Good. Your learning. If you want, I can teach you."

Jacob's felt his face flush again as he answered. "Uh...sure, I guess." They soon met Kuo and Greg in the house when...

What happens next?
155232221111111211111111111111121111.title: Talking

1552322211111112111111111111111211111.content:
"By the way, what are you all doing here exactly? You don't look like tourists." said Isabel. Greg gave her a bit of a sad smile.

"Well, we're not, technically speaking. It's a little hard to explain really. Let's just say that we ran into a bit of trouble with some cultists back in Aldean. Last I checked, they were scouring the city, looking for us. It got a little crazy, but we snuck out of town successfully. After that, we just ran on whatever trail we could for a few hours. And then, we just ran into you and the town." Greg explained.

Isabel's eyes widened a bit as he explained. "Cultists, you say?"

"Yes, have you heard of them?" asked Greg.

"Were they in black suits and cloaks?" asked Isabel.

"Yeah." Kuo answered this time. Isabel put a hand to her head.

"I was in Aldean a few weeks ago, and I happened to see people of that description hiding around when I was sent for business. I didn't think much of them then, but something about them felt really off." Isabel explained.

"Oh boy, so this isn't the first time." Greg sighed. "This is getting a bit out of hand."

"What were they chasing you for?" asked Isabel. Greg whipped the bag that had the dragon fang shard in it. Isabel took a look at it, as if trying to find something.

"You seen it before?" asked Greg.

"No, I don't think so, but it must be worth something." said Isabel.

"You're telling me. I just hope that they weren't tracking us. If they were, your village might in danger sooner rather than later." said Greg. The last thing he wanted was to invite disaster on this seemingly peaceful town.

"It might not be good for us to stick around. Those guys were already peeved enough, and we have no idea of how strong they are if it comes to a fight." said Jacob.

"I agree completely." Greg then turned to Isabel. "Thank you for your hospitality, but we don't want to invite harm on your village. Would it be alright if we restocked for a bit before leaving?"

"Absolutely. It sounds like you'll be busy." said Isabel.

"Tell me about it, especially since Jacob wasted 1000 gold on a Second Seal."

"Hey!"

And that got another good laugh.
1552322211111112111111111111111211111.title: ...Isabel asks why they're here.

15523222111111121111111111111112111112.content:
Greg had gone out to look for supplies while Jacob and the others remained at Isabel's home. Isabel had gone and had drawn a bath for herself while Jacob and Kuo looked around the house. "Interesting design huh?" Jacob commented to Kuo.

She nodded. "Yeah. I've heard about places like this. They usually have items of relaxation here. They even have cool clothes like Yukatas. I wish I could try one..." Then Kuo looked at her staff then smiled cutely as she looked to Jacob. "Hey, I wonder what kind of yukata you'd be."

Jacob knew for a split second what was going to happen when it did, his mind changing to fit his new form. He floated onto a piece of furniture as a yukata, white with blue artistically curved streaks going vertically on the yukata.

Kuo giggled amd made her way toward Jacob when she saw Isabel enter. She wore a towel around her chest that reached her knees. "Excuse me, Kuo. Have you seen a-" she cut off seeing Jacob. "Oh never mind. I found one."

Kuo stammered a bit as Isabel picked Jacob up and walked out closing the door behind her. Kuo thought nervously on how to tell Isabel when she walked in in her new yukata. Kuo stammered seeing Jacob hang on Isabel's figure. "How does it look?" Isabel asked.

Kuo replied. "G-good...uhm...Isabel?" Isabel looked at her while tying the yukata around her waist. "I...have this staff that can transform people into anything. And I was reminded of Yukatas as I looked around and wanted to try one...S-so I made Jacob one..."

Isabel was surprised at hearing that the one she taught about half-an-hour ago was now just clothing. "So...where is he?"

Kuo looked down at the floor. Isabel must've been able to put it together. "W-wait...Th-this is..."

"I'm sorry! I wanted to try one on but then you came and took him and-" Kuo began, trying to be reasonable.

"I-It's not your fault. So...would you change him back now please?" Isabel grabbed another bath towel as Kuo used the staff again. The light dimmed amd Jacob sat in front of Isabel. "What did I just-" He then saw Isabel in front of him. "Wait...YOU were the one I was on?" Jacob amd Isabel went red immediately and turned to avoid the other seeing their face.

Greg entered with supplies in his pack. "What's happening?" He asked.

"N-nothing. Nothing at all. I just got out of a bath and was going to change." Isabel said quickly. She soon went off to change as Jacib sat there still. Greg shrugged it off. Must've been nothing.
15523222111111121111111111111112111112.title: Someone brings up another topic

155232221111111211111111111111121111121.content:
Jacob didn't say many words after that, though he did sent a glare or two Kuo's way, who just smiled and waved. Greg raised an eyebrow at the antics. Then again, it probably wasn't too hard to guess. Jacob's only beef with Kuo could be because of one thing; Polymorph. Greg kind of chuckled to himself. Would Kuo ever get tired of making people into clothes?

"You know," Jacob said to her while they were eating some dinner. "That spell might be useful if we kind some corrupt lord or something."

"Oh, you would punish a corrupt lord by making him clothing?" Greg chuckled.

"Something like that, or maybe some ditzy girl. Whichever sounds worse at the time." Jacob more whispered that last part, as not to tell Kuo and Isabel about it. The four of them were just enjoying a nice dinner, since Isabel did ask that they at least spend the night. Greg wasn't sure about putting the village in danger, but given everything that happened, they needed the rest, so he accepted the offer. The place was nice enough anyway.

*****Next Morning*****

Greg and the others woke up at the crack of dawn the next morning, which gave them a nice look at Kuo's bed hair. That got a good laugh before she ran into the restroom to wash up. Kuo wasn't much of a morning girl after all. Anyway, the group was soon all supplied and ready to go after some breakfast. Greg went up to where Isabel's room was to thank her for the hospitality. However, when he saw her door open, he saw her getting a bunch of supplies.

"What are you doing?"

"I want to come with you."

"What?" Greg was surprised to say the least. "No offense, but your people here need you. You can't run off."

"My cousin can fill in for me. He was actually in charge for a while until I got older. The village will be just fine. I'm more worried about you and your friends. This looks like something that could affect many realms, and I want to help."

Her stance seemed firm on this, so Greg sighed.

"Well, I guess it's fine. Besides, you're pretty good with a sword it seems. Perhaps a few tips for Jacob and I?" Greg asked.

"I'd be happy to." Isabel smiled.

So, the word got out about Isabel's decision, which Kuo really liked, replying with a fierce hug. The villagers seemed to be just fine with her decision, and said cousin was quite confident of her. Without much else, the group of four went off, aiming to find just what was going on in the Outrealms.
155232221111111211111111111111121111121.title: They head to bed

1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.content:
The group made a travel back to Aldean after about an hour walk. They soon approached the city, which still seemed shaken from the cult's visit. "Looks like those cult guys are gone," Jacob said looking around as they passed through.

"Yeah," Greg replied, "Those guys are trouble."

Isabel looked about and soon spoke. "Guess it's good they're gone, this place looks bad." They returned to the same inn as before and looked about the town. There were some destroyed stands and merchant carts but the big main damage was at the monastery.

"Any idea on who those guys were?" Isabel asked Greg as she set down her supplies.

"Nope," Greg shook his head. "We're just as clueless as you."

Jacob soon leaned in. "Well, maybe a cleric knows. It looks like they've returned to the monastery. Also," Jacob pulled out the stolen relic. "I should return this."

Greg nodded but added, "What if they don't let you in? They'll be suspicious if two strangers ask questions like that."

"What if you aren't strangers?" Kuo said off to the side.

Then...
1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.title: Back to Aldean

1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.content:
Without so much as a warning, Kuo raised her staff above her head, encasing Greg and Jacob in light once again. Isabel watched in wonder as the light took only a second or two before dying down. In the place of Greg and Jacob were two well-dressed clerics, both of whom with their cowls up,hiding their heads. The basis for them seemed to be similar to their female forms from before, with longish hair covered by the cowl.

"Ah, so cute!" Kuo squealed at both of them.

"Haven't you learned to at least ask by now?" asked Jacob out of exasperation.

"Apparently she hasn't. Let's just go." A female voice didn't even phase them now. They had gotten pretty used to them as well as Kuo's antics. Isabel wished them good luck, much to Jacob's slight embarrassment. Anyway, adjusting their white cloaks, the two of them began their walk to the Monastery. Perhaps it was because they were Clerics now, but the tension in the air seemed higher now.

"They certainly left their mark on the place." said Jacob.

"This cult certainly means business." Greg didn't feel confident about this at all. He could only imagine how Karen, a Cleric as well, would handle this situation. Probably not much better. Anyway, they got inside the building, hoping to find the right person to talk to. They found one cleric hanging around the nearby staircase, apparently doing some clean-up. Her cloak was the typical garb, with dark blue hair around her shoulders. Greg figured that was their target.

"Excuse me, miss?" Greg walked over, relic in hand from Jacob, to the woman, who gently smiled at them as they approached.

"Oh hello. I don't believe I've seen you around before." She spoke gently, but it wasn't a demure tone. Greg cleared "her" throat before talking.

"Oh, yeah, we just came around here. I'm.....uh.....Kris." spoke Greg, coming up with something on the spot.

"It's nice to meet you. I'm Celdia....what is that you have?!" She immediately noticed the relic in Greg's hands. Greg smiled and handed it right to her.

"Those cultists from earlier stole it, but we got it back." Greg started. "Do you happen to know who they were?"

"I don't know much, but they're part of some kind of dragon cult. At least, that's all they ever talk about. I've sen them as far as the country along the sea too."

"Huh? That far?" Were these cultists everywhere? What a hassle. "How would you know that much?"

"Oh, I sometimes head back home there. I live in another country, but the Monastery here is tops in the realm."

"How do you travel that fast?" Greg asked, genuinely curious right now.

"Simple. I fly."
1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.title: ...Kuo turns the two into clerics.

1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.content:
"Wait. You...fly?" Jacob asked curiously.

Celdia smiled, "Yeah. You see, I'm actually from another country, Adamah. In fact, I was planning on returning there today. "

Jacob soon leaned toward Greg, "Why don't we ask to travel with her? Maybe we can help her. She seems to of had dealings with this cult. Maybe we can learn more about them."

Greg nodded lightly, "Alright." She turned back to Celdia, "Hey, uhm, we're wondering if we can come with you. I know it seems weird and out of the blue, but we-"

"Sure you can." Celdia replied. Greg and Jacob were both surprised by her carefree demeanor and shocked at how fast she made the decision.

"Oh, thanks." Jacob said, but soon followed up with, "But we need to show you something before we head out." Celdia nodded and followed them out toward Kuo and Isabel. Jacob quickly explained the plan to the two, who agreed. Then Kuo, without hesitation waved the Polymorph Staff and a light enveloped Jacob and Greg changing them back into their normal selves.

Celdia looked surprised, but began laughing, making Jacob and Greg feel more embarrassed before. "So, how do we get to Adamah?" Isabel asked.

Celdia pointed toward a nearby dock, "We can take the boat straight to the capital, Riviera. "

Kuo giggled, "A boat? I never actually rode one before." Jacob remembered the fact that she was mostly isolated for her entire life, making it understandable. The group soon made their way toward the dock, Celdia paying for the fare as we boarded a fairly large ship that soon set sail.

What happens next?
1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.title: A Flying Cleric

1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.content:
The ship was fairly large, though not too much to be considered grand. It cut through the sea fair enough though, leading to an overall smooth ride. Well, mostly smooth anyway. Isabel's stomach wasn't taking too kindly to her first boat trip. On the other hand, Kuo was as bouncy as ever, while Greg and Jacob enjoyed the overall smooth ride. Greg didn't get to take many boats in the past, so this was a rare chance for him.

"Nice, isn't it?" asked Celdia, her cowl laying off of her head.

"Yeah it is." Greg responded. Though he had much more to say as he turned to her. "So..um, Celdia?"

"Yes?"

"Why did you just accept what happened back there?" Greg asked.

"What do you mean?" she asked.

"Well, two strangers, plus a little girl and Isabel, just come right up to you and ask you for a ride, and you grant it and even pay. Not to mention, there was the fact that Jacob and I were in...certain disguises." Greg began to trail off a bit, almost feeling embarrassed by it. It was bad enough for Isabel to know, but Celdia too? Still, Celdia just laughed gently at Greg's words.

"Oh, I don't mind at all. I'll admit that I was surprised to see a staff that can change appearances like that, but I'm fine with that. There are many fun things in the world, and I'd like to see them all someday." explained Celdia.

Greg gave a small smile as she said that. "Fair enough I suppose. Though, it must be expensive for all of us."

"Oh, I'm not short on funds, trust me." Celdia smiled. "I've got a bit more than the average cleric so to speak."

"Speaking of which, you said that you "fly", but you never explained as much." said Greg, who had been wanting to ask that for a while.

"Oh, that's easy. I'm a Pegasus Knight." Celdia instantly laughed upon seeing Greg's confused face. "Yeah, I inherited it from my grandmother. Poor thing was sick though so I couldn't fly here. So that's why I'm on a boat."

"Interesting...and yet you're a cleric too?" asked Greg.

"Well....I kind of took it more as just expanding my horizons. I'll can tell you more later." said Celdia. "You bunch seem to be the most bizarre yet fascinating people I've ever met."

"Thanks." Greg said sarcastically. Celdia meant well, though that didn't mean much for his image. However, Celdia perked up upon hearing another lurch from Isabel.

"Looks like your friend isn't holding up too well." Celdia said as they both turned around to see her on the opposite side.

"I...hate...this....boat...."

Greg and Isabel shared a brief laugh, even as Kuo tried her best to soothe the poor girl.
1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.title: On the ship

choices: They stop by somewhere on the way
1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.content:
For Isabel's sake, the boat soon reached it's destination at Celdia's homeland. It was much bigger than Jacob had expected, with much more designs and cultural appearances that made it stand out from any past cities. "Welcome to Riviera everyone," Celdia announced happily. Kuo could barely contain herself, 'ooo'-ing and 'aww'-ing over each thing. She ran around to various stands, looking at each item across it, being new clothes or items, all were new contenders for her Polymorph Staff.

"Wow," Jacob said surprised as he looked around. "This is amazing, especially being royalty here."

Celdia smiled, "If you guys want we can visit the castle."

Everyone seemed in agreement for it.

Greg was just as impressed as Jacob, and Isabel was surprised at the difference of her town to Celdia's. It was not long that the group decided to head off.
1552322211111112111111111111111211111212.title: Celdia's Home

155232221111111211111111111111122.content:
"Let's get out of this realm," Jacob said immediately.

"Why?" asked Kuo. "I didn't get to go in."

"For once, I agree with Jacob." shrugged Greg. "We may have been in disguise inside, but I get the feeling they're figure the whole thing out eventually. I'd say that we need to head back to the Outrealm Gate."

"Do we know of any others?" asked Jacob.

"I don't know any, aside from the one we came through. We don't have the time or leisure to search for a new gate." said Greg, much to Kuo's displeasure. From the look on her face, you could swear that she was close to changing them both just do she could go inside the Monastery. Still, she seemed to calm down, albeit with still some pouting.

"Let's go." Greg said, grabbing Kuo's hand as they began to head down the street at a brisk pace. They didn't run too much to attract attention, but they knew that time was not on their side here. They could see some of the black members hunting around, even some shouting near the Monastery. They quickened their pace a bit as they heard more of it. Eventually, they reached the edge of the city, taking one quick look back before increasing their pace, retracing their steps back to the Outrealm Gate. They ran over the nearby hill, which mostly took the city out of view.

"Hopefully they won't know we're out here." Greg said, catching his breath. Kuo was out of breath at this point, not used to such a quick pace.

"That....was....too....fast..." she huffed.

"Kids have no endurance these days." Jacob smirked, getting looks from both Kuo and Greg. He sweated a little bit under their gazes. "A-Anyway, can I ask something?"

"What?" asked Greg.

"Before we go, I'd like a class change." said Jacob out of the blue, with Greg raising his eyebrow at him.

"Well, that's random. Besides, we don't have any Seals." said Greg.

"That's why I'd like the staff to be used."

And so began a little argument as Kuo didn't want to use the staff for something so "boring" as she put it. Not to mention, Jacob apparently wanted to be a Tactician, which both of them thought was weird. Greg could never understand people who use magic anyway. Well, in the interest of just moving along, Greg just told her to do it, since they didn't want to get caught. Sighing, she went ahead and did it, requiring no effort at all. Needless to say, Greg wasn't impressed.

"Why do Tactician's have such odd clothing choices.." He muttered to himself.

Well, regardless, they soon reached the gate again, wasting no time in going in. Greg and Jacob were both a bit uncertain though. These gates weren't just one way. The same gate could go to many places. They mostly remained silent as they walked through, taking whatever path between dimensions that they could. Eventually, they found an exit, and it definitely didn't lead to where they were before.

"Brrrrrrr!" shivered Jacob instantly.

The place they ended up in was a lot colder than normal, with snow highlighting the trail around them. Mountains were everywhere, and the sky was cloudy. It was probably late in the day at this point.

"Great....a cold region....well at least no one might look for us here." said Greg, since they hardly had any other options to go with. A town was just ahead of them anyway, so they made the short walk there.
155232221111111211111111111111122.title: ..."Let's get out of this realm."

1552322211111112111111111111111221.content:
The trio soon make a detour into a small cave off the side of the path. Each of them had their arms wrapped around themselves trying to keep themself warm. The three soon stopped and Kuo turned to them. "Why d-d-did th-this realm h-have to b-be so c-co-cold?" She said out of chattering teeth.

Jacob shivered, "Just seems to be our luck. But I've been worrying about something," he spoke up. "What if those cultists follow us? They might get suspicious of our actions if they find us here. We should find a place to lay low."

Greg nodded. "I agree. Those cultists finding us is the last thing we need right now. Now we just need a way to hide."

Both Jacob and Greg turned toward Kuo, who already began to smile. "I have an idea, but you have to let me do it alright?"

Jacob sighed, he had a good prediction as to what would happen to him. But he and Greg had no other good plan. Jacob sighed. "F-fine. Just get it over with..." Jacob said.

Kuo smiled as she readied the Polymorph Staff. "Come on, once it happens you'll enjoy it." She said as she casted her spell. Jacob disappeared and fell into a folded pile of clothes. The dress was made of a thicker material and colored black with a large purple ribbon on the front. Alongside the pile were elbow-length gloves and purple leggings. The inside was made with a warmer material that covered the wearer's neck.

Kuo quickly went on to Greg and casted another Polymorph spell on him. Soon a girl who seemed to have a resemblance to Greg stood in female mercenary garbs. Kuo also decided to change Greg's mind. Kuo smiled and picked Jacob up, holding the clothes to Greg. "Here you go, I got you a warm dress. So how about we visit the nearby town?" Kuo said with a smile.

Greg smiled back gleefully. "Okay!" She soon equipped the dress as Kuo gave herself some gloves and such. The "trio" then set out for the town. Kuo decided the most they'd be like this is a day, just to be sure. But for now, she thinks she'll enjoy this.
1552322211111112111111111111111221.title: A cold visit

15523222111111121111111111111112211.content:
The village was decently sized, perhaps a tiny bit smaller than the realm before. Despite the conditions, it didn't look poor at all, and was even a bit lively. Kuo was amazed actually, since where she grew up didn't get much snow. The cold was a little hard to deal with, but the snow looked fun.

Honestly, she giggled a bit as she walked hand-in-hand with Greg. To the average person, they might an older sister escorting her younger sister. Well, Greg obviously didn't get that conclusion. They certainly blended in well, so hopefully they wouldn't have to deal with the cultists at all. That being said, perhaps she could finally have some fun before they would have to turn in. It was hard to tell with all the clouds but it was likely late afternoon.

"Hey sis!" Kuo jumped a bit. "I want to see that market!"

"Okay okay, settle down. We'll go." Greg smiled at her. Kuo didn't get any less excited though. They walked off to the market, which was quite large. Obviously, people were making sure they had enough in case of some terrible snow storm. Actually, Kuo just hoped that no one would ask for a backstory. She didn't come up with one for them, other than Greg being her big sister.

Anyway, they took a look around, relaxing and enjoying themselves without a care for now. Kuo actually got tangled up in some scarfs, which was quite humorous to everyone else. Greg seemed to take a little pity on her though, helping her get untangled. She even got Kuo one of the scarfs, since she didn't have one and the price was right.

"All right, let's get some dinner. We'll need an inn for the night." Greg said.

"Oh okay." said Kuo.

Thankfully, there were some good shops here, with some food Kuo had never seen before. It was a nice evening, since the place had a working fire and everything, and Kuo enjoyed the light conversation. You'd hardly think anything was going wrong with them.

Eventually, it was time to find a place to stay and hit the hey. Greg got them a room, which worked with what coin they had. The night was pleasant enough, though Kuo's new scarf came in handy during it.
15523222111111121111111111111112211.title: The Winter Village

155232221111111211111111111111122111.content:
Kuo awoke to a stream of morning light coming through the window. She seems to have slept in a bit. She sat up and stretched and looked over to see Greg still asleep, who seemed to continue wearing the dress through the cold night. Kuo looked outside and admired the snow, sparkling from the light.

She walked over and removed her scarf as she equipped her cleric uniform, draping the scarf around her shoulders and close to her neck again. She looked back over to Greg and decided to get some dinner. She returned with rolls and some drinks and set them on the small two-person table nearby. As she finished doing so, Greg woke up and smiled over to Kuo. "Hey, morning." Greg said with a stretch.

Kuo smiled and nodded. She decided to leave her as is until after breakfast. She'd miss this Greg (and this Jacob somewhat), but she made a deal...

...Plus she could change them again whenever.

Kuo smiled back. "Morning sis. I got some breakfast for us." Greg smiled and stood up, readjusting her hair and brushing off and straightening her dress. The two sat down to a lively discussion as they ate. As they finished Kuo smiled somewhat sadly, grabbing her Polymorph Staff. "Alright sis. We should do this again sometime." She cast a spell at Greg as her body didn't change but he was back in control.


Greg rubbed her temple with her gloved hand. "Ugh....Kuo, you really need to be a bit more creative with these changes instead of doing the same thing over and over. Bet he feels the same," groaned Greg, motioning to the outfit she adorned.

Kuo smiled, "Alright, I'll be sure to make you two even girlier." Greg groaned and removed Jacob as Greg was turned back to normal.

Jacob followed suit as he sat on the bed dazed. "Mmmm..." Jacob groaned, fighting a headache. "I feel like I'm getting too use to that."

Kuo smiled, still in a good mood, "To the point of taking the position as one for me permanently?"

"Hell no!" Jacob yelled, getting a chuckle from the two.

What happens next?
155232221111111211111111111111122111.title: Next Day

1552322211111112111111111111111221111.content:
With Greg and Jacob thankfully back to normal, the trio then had to think of a plan.

"Well, now what?" asked Jacob.

"We don't know if the cult has followed us or not. One way or another though, they'll want the claw fragment back." said Greg. "I suppose there's the idea of trying to infiltrate them, but I think that's too risky."

"I agree. Besides, we're not that good at acting." said Jacob.

"So what then?" asked Kuo.

"Well, we could perhaps try to at least see if anyone else knows of them. Perhaps ask around here a bit?" suggested Greg.

"That sounds fine to me." said Jacob. "Hopefully they haven't already entered the realm."

"Agreed."

It wasn't the best of plans, but it was enough for them to at least start. They got their winter gear and left the inn together, deciding to split up as they did. Jacob decided to go on his own, while Kuo went with Greg. At that, they split up and tried asking around discreetly if anyone could tell them anything.

"I wonder if they have even heard of such a thing out here." wondered Kuo, given the town's location.

"That's true." said Greg as he approached a passing merchant. "Excuse me sir, have you heard of this black group running around the realms?"

The man's face scrunched up in confusion for a second, before paling slightly. "How do you know of them?"

"Well let's just say they weren't too happy with us." said Greg. "Start talking."

The man looked left and right for a second, and then motioned Greg to come closer. "Rumor states that they are always traveling the Outrealms, seeking to revive their master."

"And who would that be?" asked Greg.

"No one knows for sure, but it's rumored to be a dark dragon of great power." said the man.

"Dark dragon? You mean like Medeus or Grima?" Greg asked.

"No one knows for sure who it is. It could be one of them, or maybe something else. One thing's for sure: don't get in their way." the man said. Greg nodded his head at that.

"Well, thank you for the information." said Greg respectfully as he lead Kuo out. "Well, that gave us some things to think about?"

"Greg, who's Medeus and Grima?" asked Kuo.

"Oh right, you haven't traveled that much before. They are both dragons of great power that sought to conquer continents. It took the Hero-King Marth to defeat Medeus, and Grima was also defeated not too long ago. Though, both dragons had quite the following. Maybe one of them is behind the cult...or perhaps it's something else."

"Sounds scary." said Kuo.

"Yeah it does. Let's get Jacob." said Greg. It wasn't too long before they found Jacob, trying to get his own information out of a random woman who apparently didn't know anything and almost hit him.

"Well, that went well." groaned Jacob. After smiling for a bit, Greg relayed the information to him.

"Hmm, so that's how it is. Sounds like we've got our hands full if we keep going like this." said Jacob.

"We're already involved enough." said Greg.

What's next?
1552322211111112111111111111111221111.title: A plan

15523222111111121111111111111112211111.content:
Jacob, Greg and Kuo were ready to go when they noticed people moving somewhat hastily in the other direction, as though they were afraid of something. Jacob soon caught sight of men in black robes, obviously the cultists that were after them. Jacob pulled Kuo and Greg off to the side. "They found us!" Jacob spoke sternly as he kept his voice down as well. "We need to find an Outrealm Gate."

"But the only other one is that way," Kuo spoke up, pointing off toward the direction of the searching cultists. Jacob turned and looked at Greg and the two nodded in acknowledgement.

Jacob had Kuo find a place to hide nearby, but told her to be ready to run. Jacob and Greg soon began to snake through the alleys, trying to get a flank on the Cultists. "You up for battle after your recent class change?" Greg said, readying his own arsenal. Jacob looked through his inventory to see a Silver Sword, Thoron, Levin Sword, and Bolganonne. He nodded back to Greg as they waited for the Cultists to past.

As soon as they did Greg attacked the closest one with his blade, and took the man off-guard, downing him immediately. Two more turned to face him when Jacob launched a Thoron bolt into the chest of a cultist, interrupting the other's attack. He was soon attacked by Greg as Jacob fought another with his Silver Sword. After the two men fell, Jacob called to Kuo as another group of Cultists from the other end of town.

The trio soon fled the small icy town as they ran through the mountains again. Kuo seemed a bit shaken from the fight. Jacob checked over each of them to see no serious injuries. "We need to get moving before those cultists pick up on us...Please take us to a good realm..." Jacob hoped as the three entered.

What kind of realm is it?
15523222111111121111111111111112211111.title: Cultists enter the town

choices: Try to force their way out
155232221111111211111111111111122111112.content:
The trio never stopped running even as they entered the gate. They couldn't see anyone behind them, but then again they couldn't see much of anything at the moment.

"Could you not go so fast?!" Kuo cried as she bounced up and down on Jacob.

"Well, we can't exactly stop!" said Jacob back.

"There's the exit!" Greg cried as he broke up the argument, seeing the bright flash that signaled the end as usual. They began to see something materializing before them, though they couldn't see much as they approached it. Immediately, they leaped out of the gate, and into a dark area.

"What is this?" asked Jacob.

"Don't know. It's too dark to tell." said Greg. "Too bad we have no torches."

However, right at that moment, torches lit up around them. It wasn't for good reasons though. They were being held by many Cultists instead. They had stumbled right into an even worse situation.

"Not good." Jacob said, getting his sword out with his free hand. It was going to be hard to fight while keeping Kuo safe as well. Greg readied his sword too, backing up a bit as he hoped to get them back to the gate. However, he immediately heard other members coming through the gate, boxing them in.

"Well, this just went from bad to worse." Greg said.

"What do we do?" asked Jacob.

Greg honestly didn't know.
155232221111111211111111111111122111112.title: Bad Realm

1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.content:
"I might have a plan," Kuo says amongst them. Jacob was already thinking of what kind of plan she may possibly come up with. The cultists seemed to be biding their time to strike. Jacob looked toward Kuo, "Fine. What now?"

Kuo only smiled as she waved her polymorph staff, and smoke filled the cave. Everyone seemed to try and shake it away and blow it away. Everything was the same once it cleared...except for the fact that a large dragon was now in Jacob's place. It seemed that Jacob was still in control too. Jacob felt different, as if knowing how to use his new form. He roared, flames launching towards cultists as a staircase was quickly made vacant as it led outside. "Go!" Jacob yelled, fighting off the other cultists.

What happens next?
1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.title: Kuo speaks up

1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.content:
Greg barely had enough to grab on to Jacob before both me and Kuo were riding on Dragon-Jacob.

"Wow! This is fun!" Kuo laughed as they tried enduring the bumpy ride atop Jacob.

"And here I thought you'd turn him in a naked woman to distract them," Greg chuckled to himself.

"That would have been fun too!" Kuo clapped to herself, making Greg sigh.

Greg immediately ducked though as he felt a Fire spell wiz by him. He turned to see cultist mages firing Fire spells in their direction, hitting pretty much everywhere. Also, the staircase was pretty small, but that didn't seem to stop Jacob. Greg and Kuo ducked as Jacob smashed into the staircase, making their way through it and heading outside into another room. Without even stopping, Greg looked around, trying to see where they could go.

"That way!" Greg pointed, seeing a small light at the end of one hallway. Apparently acknowledging Greg's words, Jacob turned and ran that way, delivering another roar as he ran past a few more cultists. With one final leap, Jacob burst through the entrance, reaching apparently warm sunlight.

"We're out!" Kuo cried.

Jacob kept running through, until they could at least get further away from them. He ran as fast as he could, as he wasn't really big enough to fly with the weight on him. Running on what eventually looked like a beachside, Jacob slowly came to a stop. Greg looked back to make sure, and there were no cultists.

"All right, we're clear." said Greg.

"Awesome!" Kuo cried again, waving Polymorph again to change Jacob back. After the flash of light, Jacob was a bit wobbly.

"That was cool...and also totally weird." Jacob said as he tried to keep his balance.

"You did well," smiled Greg. "Now we just need to figure out what's next. Whatever those cultists have, it ain't good."
1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.title: The trio flee to safety

1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.content:
"I think it may be a good idea to rest here. We DID just run away from crazy cultists." Jacob said, giving a stretch. He looked around at the beach, deciding it to be good.

"Yeah, that sounds good." Greg agreed. "Should we start with the tent or maybe jus-". Before he finished, the two boys were enveloped in light and smoke.

It faded and revealed two girls, one wearing a tactician robe (which now seemed more Kuo's size) and another in mercenary garbs. "Gah! KUO!" Jacob yelled.

Kuo smiled. "Greg said it would be fine. Remember? You said next time we needed a vacation, do whatever you want. So come on, let's set up camp." Kuo began to pitch a tent.

Jacob put her hand to her neck, under her pitch black hair, left hanging behind her back. "Why would you tell her that?" She groaned. Greg looked back. "Just shut it and help pitch the tent."

What happens next?
1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.title: Resting there.

1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.content:
Greg and Jacob worked on another side of the tent while Kuo was on the other.

"Seriously, what made you tell her that?" Jacob asked with anger.

"Will you stop whining?" Greg sighed as she combed her somewhat long red hair back out of her face. "I had to say something to calm her down at the time. Just be lucky that she didn't go too overboard like the last time we were at the beach."

"I guess...." Jacob sighed.

"Truthfully, I'm just glad she knows what class I'm supposed to be," Greg gumbled at the end. After that, it didn't take too much longer to finish putting it up.

"Think those cultists will find us?" asked Jacob.

"We'll have to keep a close eye, though I don't think so. I think you ran us out to a fairly isolated spot. Hopefully, they won't find us here."

"Good, because I don't need to fight in this." Jacob groaned. Greg actually laughed a tiny bit at that.
1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.title: Pitching the tent

choices: The two attempt to get dressed
1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.content:
Jacob dropped into the sand, laying on her back. They finished the tent, setting up a fire pit, and everything else. She sighed. "Finally..." she laid there only a few seconds before seeing Greg enter sight.

"Were you planning to lay there the rest of the time?" Greg asked.

Jacob shrugged, "Kinda hoping. Why?"

Greg scratched the back of her head. "Well I think that Kuo won't let us off with that. Just saying. "

Jacob looked at her. "You didn't promise her something else again did you?" Greg shook her head. "No, but I did say anything last time so..." Just then the two were tossed swimsuits, colored as their clothes by the girl with the staff.

Jacob sighed and sat up. "You really wanna torture us don't you?"

Kuo pulled on Jacob's hand, "Come on. It'll be fun!"

Jacob looked at the clothes thrown and shook her head, chuckling. "What the hell...alright. Just let us try and figure this out a bit..." Jacob said. Kuo smiled and nodded, heading off to adorn her own suit. "Let's get changed I guess."

What happens next?
1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.title: All Done

1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.content:
Jacob walked off to a rock form that jutted out of a small cliff nearby. She began to remove her purple robes amd white undershirt. It seemed that only then did she realize something. The outfit seemed to constrain her form a bit. Now that it was off she noticed a few new things about her form.

She was much taller than before it seemed. She also seemed to have much larger....assets. She was actually pretty surprised that her clothes actually held all of this in. But it did explain why it was so tight. Jacob moved on to the swimsuit and...

...to not mince words or split hairs, it didn't go well. She kept having to readjust, all the while unsure of whether or not this was how it was on. "Having trouble?"

Jacob turned to see Kuo standing there, quite a bit smaller and dressed in a silver swimsuit. Jacob just nodded. Kuo smiled. "Here. We this strap? Take it, and..." she said as she walked the girl through the steps. As she finished, she was dressed in a black and purple bikini. Kuo grabbed Jacob's hand, "I helped Greg with hers, so let's go."

Jacob sighed, ready for whatever Kuo had planned.
1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.title: The two attempt to get dressed

1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.content:
Eventually, the tent was fully pitched. Still, the day wasn't even close to being over, judging by the sun's position. This essentially left the group to their own devices.

"Ugh, it's so hot in this get-up," Jacob groaned at her Tactician cloak and wear. Greg smiled a bit as she sat down, her red mercenary suit.

"Look at the bright side, at least Kuo knows some suitable classes," Greg said. "It's funny how it doesn't even really feel all that odd anymore."

"That's what I'm afraid of," Jacob said with another groan, pulling her legs up to her chest. "Feels hard to do any kind of relaxing like this."

"Could be worse." Greg muttered, though she really didn't want to know what that was.

Still, at least the quiet and sound of the water was soothing enough to at least get some rest. Kuo took the time to play around in the shallow water, where Jacob eventually joined after taking the cloak off. Greg kind of kept to herself the whole time.
1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.title: Later that day

1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.content:
It took a while for both girls to dry off after their little fun in the ocean.

"Had enough?" Greg actually smirked as they came back.

"I would have been out long ago if Kuo hadn't pushed me down headfirst!" Jacob nearly screamed, causing Kuo to run away in laughter.

"Well, hopefully you'll dry off well enough. The sun should take care of that." Greg just said as she laid down.

"What about you? You did nothing but lay down?" asked Jacob.

"Oh...I don't really feel like swimming. Maybe some other time perhaps," Greg shrugged off.

Jacob didn't ask anymore about it, as the two just looked out at the ocean for a bit. At least the scenery was peaceful enough for them to just lay back with no problems. It took a while for the clothes to dry off thanks to Kuo's exuberant splashing earlier. Eventually though, the sun was beginning to set. After a quick bagging for some dinner, the trio decided to get to sleep, though Kuo still hadn't changed them back.
1552322211111112111111111111111221111122.title: After that

155232222.content:

1552322222.title: Boring as hell, next choice

15523222221.content:
Name: Xanadu

Gender: Female

Age: 17

Appearance: Darker toned skin, long black hair turning a pinkish red up toward the front. Red eye color. Built.

Personality: Strong-willed, energetic, persistent, athletic, helpful.

Class: Mercenary

Skills: Armsthrift, Strength 3+, Master-of-Arms (allows use of any non-magical weapon)

Bio: The youngest champion in Arena Ferox. She lives a life just better than being poor from her tournament wins. Raised by arena fighters and a Khan.

-----------

"How much longer?" Xanadu called up to the soldier driving the carriage. She couldn't help being bored. She was off to represent Ferox and go on buisness. Xanadu reclined, her red armor and buckler always on.

"It will be a few hours more." The man called back.

Xanadu sighed audibly and began to look through her weapons and played games outside the opening in the carriage. It was going fine as they were being transported through a path in a forest near a mountainside. She was getting close to Ylisstol, her first stop. Everything was going fine until the carriage stopped. "Huh? Oi! Why'd you stopped the carriage?"

The soldier fell off to the side, arrows in his neck. Xanadu immediately went for a Steel Sword and Throwing Axe and waited. Out of some bushes begin the cart came men in robes. Grimleal. Xanadu lunged toward them, dispatching two quickly and getting another with her Throwing Axe. Switching to her Steel Axe, she swung but missed one of the Assassins.

She felt two arrows make their mark on her back and a dagger stab her leg. That was nothing to her, but then the assassin vanished....she felt him grab the back of her head. She yelled as almost a searing hot pain engulfed her entire being. She was dropped to the floor like a doll. Life was drained from her eyes, yet, she lived.

The man ran off as Xanadu gasped and coughed, hoping to be found.
15523222221.title: Yeah!

15523222222.content: A boy who discovers a portal?
15523222222.title: Nay!

155232222221.content:
