Age: 17

Appearance: Black hair with a dark blue Swordmaster variant outfit.

Gender: Male

Class: Swordmaster

Skills: Armsthrift, Luck +8, Astra, Limit Breaker

Weapon: Killing Edge

Bio: Well-cultured Outrealms traveler. Very interested in ancient times and such.

Any character joining him?
155232222221.title: Yes

1552322222211.content:
Name: Greg

Age: 18

Appearance: Red hair with a navy blue Hero outfit

Gender: Male

Class: Hero

Skills: Limit Breaker, Sol, Armsthrift, Resistance+10, Axebreaker.

Weapon: Silver Sword

Bio: Naive traveler who just left his home.
1552322222211.title: Yes

15523222222111.content:
Jacob wandered about an Outrealm, traveling it's wondrous green plains. He had left his own Outrealm in search for ancient knowledge and history, loving all he could find. He soon spotted another gate and approached it. The feel he got off this one was different from the other gates he used. That just intrigued him more as he went to it. It looked identical to every other Outrealm gate, but it seemed...off. He decided it was time to leave this Outrealm and search the next one. Jacob searched through his inventory as made sure he had his blade with him at all times, as well as his journal he had been using to record his journeys thus far.

It was soon after that he noticed another boy seemed to be approaching the gate.
15523222222111.title: Start

155232222221111.content:
It hadn't been too long since Greg left his hometown. Maybe only 2 weeks or so? Well, it was hard to tell in the Outrealms. He had gone through at least 2 so far and was taking a break before meeting this 3rd one. Granted, it looked bizarre compared to the others.

"Hey!" Greg jumped a bit as he heard something behind the rock he was sitting on. He saw someone heading towards him; another guy apparently.

"Who are you?" asked Greg, taking a bite out of his food.

"Name's Jacob. You new around here?" Jacob asked.

"Yeah. Haven't been here too long. Just resting before going through that gate." Greg replied before looking Jacob over. "What's up with you? You look worse for wear."

"Heh." Jacob smiled sheepishly before sitting down himself. "Yeah....I think I may have been gone too long. Can't tell the last time I took a break. I've been traveling in these realms for longer than I can tell."

"Must be pretty experienced by now." Greg smiled.

"Yeah, I guess you could say that." Jacob replied before turning to the gate. "Have to say though, that one looks odd. I have this weird feeling about it. I've been through quite a few gates, yet that one....gives me a sense of dread."

"You can tell? Guess I don't have that sense yet." Greg said as he took one last sip of water. "Well, thankfully I'm pretty good with a sword myself."

"Yeah, me too." Jacob smirked, showing his sheathed sword. "For someone who seems new, you look pretty strong."

"Well, I had a lot of help." Greg said as he and Jacob began walking after the little break. "My cousin is a War Cleric you see, and she wouldn't stop until I could fight well, even if she constantly had to patch up injuries."

"Sounds lovely." Jacob snickered.

Well, that aside, the two of them reached the gate. It had an....odd shade to it, like something was up. To be honest, something in them suggested maybe they go somewhere else....but like they said, nothing ventured, nothing gained.

It was with that in mind that the two of them stepped into the gate.
155232222221111.title: Two Travelers

1552322222211111.content:
It was odd. Jacob had entered the gate with his new partner for the moment...but everything after that seemed a blur. The gate was weird all right, but to a degree Jacob wasn't expecting. His body went numb upon passing through as the two were soon spit out to the other side.

"Oof!" Jacob groaned as he hit the ground, laying in an area with sparse grass. He groaned and rubbed his head. But then he noticed something. He had some bracelet on, with....something pink connected to it? He decided to look down and gasped. Jacob wasn't a 'he' at the moment. 'She' wore a pink, white and black dancer outfit. She had her Killing Edge on her hip, her hair a bit longer, going a bit down the back of her neck and curling. That wasn't her primary concern though, it was just how little the outfit covered. She instinctively tried to cover herself with her arms and crossing her legs, blushing embarrassed.

However, Jacob noticed something weirder. Looking around, it seemed the Outrealm Gate was gone. Also, the land around them....smoke filled the sky and Jacob couldn't tell if it was nighttime or if the sun was being blotted out of the sky. The land seemed barren and dead, civilization seemingly gone. The ground burned in a few locations. The place looked horrid.

"Wh-what happened here? Is there a war?" She said. She began to search about for Greg and ended up finding him....well...sort of.
1552322222211111.title: The Future Past

1552322222221.content:
Alright, a love story it is.

So, shall we start?
1552322222221.title: Sure Why not?

15523222222211.content:
Character bio

*****Claire*****

Age: 17

Height: 5'3

Class: Pegasus Knight

Appearance: Typical female build, though perhaps a bit on the slight side. Has short blue hair that's chin-length. Wears a headband. Wears a dark tunic, with short skirt with white-styled armor. Wears thigh-high boots of the same dark color as her tunic, and socks of a light purple color.

Level: 2

Items: Slim Lance, Iron Lance, Vulnerary.

Backstory/Personality: The young daughter of a merchant, she joined the army to help her warring country. She's mostly a newbie in the Pegasus Knights, but always tries her best. Always wants to help in whatever way she can despite her humble origins. Her pegasus is named Elincia.
15523222222211.title: Character #1

155232222222111.content:
Name: Jacob

Age: 17

Height: 5'9

Class: Mercenary

Appearance: Short brown hair, going to the nape of his neck. Soft face and expression, and nice build. Has a standard leather and metal armor set colored a dark green, with pants, headband, and torso matching that color.

Level: 4

Items: Steel Sword, Silver Sword, Vulnerary.

Backstory: With no memory of a family or any home, he feels as though an explanation for himself being as such lies beyond the Outrealm, so he traveled in search for a meaning to his life.

So, where will this take place?
155232222222111.title: Character #2

1552322222221111.content:
"HAH!"

Claire drove her lance into the shoulder of an enemy mercenary, a critical blow but not enough to kill it. She pulled Elincia back in an attempt to pull back, but the sword-wielding mercenary was turning around and coming right at her. Before it could though, a javelin impaled him from the side, rendering him dead instantly. Claire exhaled a breath that she didn't know she had been holding. A Falcon Knight came over and retrieved the javelin.

"You need to work more on delivering a killing blow." said the woman. "They won't offer you the same mercy."

"Yes, captain." Claire nodded in understanding. She was right. She should have finished that rogue on her own. She needed to be better.

"As long as you understand." the captain said with a firm nod, surveying the battle field and then turning to the remaining soldiers. "Good work ladies. Not a single casualty. They'll be pleased to hear of this at the barracks."

"Might have been easier if the newbie wasn't missing vital spots." spat a red-haired pegasus knight, getting a stare from Claire.

"Enough Petra." the captain said. "For now, let's clean up this area. Work on gathering any information we might need." She got a nod from all the girls, though she stopped two of them. "Claire, Natalie, I'd like you two to scout around. Make sure we're clear.

"Sir!" the girls cried, taking off in separate directions.

"Come on Elincia. Let's take a look" Claire urged her pegasus, getting a tired neigh from the steed. "I know you're tired, but we have our orders."

From the clearing, Claire flew around the area close to a forest. It was a place not many went to; some thought it to be cursed or something. Claire didn't really believe that though. She was just focused on doing her job. After some time though, she was about to turn and rendezvous back with everyone.

"Okay, let's head....Hmm? What is it?" Claire turned to her steed, which was raising a bit of a fuss. "You see something, girl?" Claire asked, surveying the ground below.

At first glance, nothing seemed out of place. However, upon closer look, Claire seemed to see a small outline of something behind a rock. It looked....like a person!

"Oh my!" Claire cried, directing Elincia down to the ground nearby. With her lance out for protection purposes, she slowly approached the person.

"Um...hello?" she asked, gently nudging the person, who was face-up.
1552322222221111.title: On a field of battle

15523222222211111.content:
Jacob didn't remember much from when he entered this realm. Just wrong place at the wrong time. He had received a blunt strike to the head, and cuts and a semi deep jab into his torso. He was in pain but worst of all, could not move. He felt himself get jabbed lightly by something and found the strength to open his eyes.

His vision was red, bloody. He turned and saw who did it. A girl, no older than himself with blue hair framing her face and a look of worry on it. He tried to speak, only to hack amd cough blood up, putting him in more pain. He just looked at her amd crooked out..."H-h-h-h-help....." before fading back into unconsciousness from blood loss.

Next....?
15523222222211111.title: A Stranger

155232222222111111.content:
Claire had initially brought her lance to the front when she saw the man move, wondering if he was going to pull a weapon. However, immediately when she saw him cough blood and speak one word, she gasped in surprise.

"Oh no!" she cried as she ran over to the man, looking over the cuts he had. She couldn't tell how bad they were, but they were enough that he had lost a lot of blood.

She reached into her pack, bringing out the one vulnerary she had left from the battle. Knowing how to use one, she patched it on some of the wounds she saw, though not nearly enough to cover them completely.

"*whistle* Elincia!" she called her steed over, getting it's attention as it galloped over to her position. Claire tried to pull the man up with all the strength she had. The man was of average size for his age, though Claire was a bit on the small side. Her pegasus seemed a bit nervous too. She could tell. "I-It'll be fine, girl. Just...put up with it."

Somehow, with a considerable amount of effort, Claire got the man situated on to her pegasus, letting her hop on behind him to keep him steady. "Okay, be gentle now." she commanded her mount, the pegasus picking its wings up and beginning to pick up speed into the air. Thankfully, this wasn't the first time Claire had to escort someone unconscious before. She made sure to keep a good pace until she reached the point where her captain was waiting.

"Captain!" she called out. "I found someone! He needs help!"

Captain Mina turned to see Claire's passenger, surprised to see him. "What happened?" she asked.

"I found him unconscious near the woods." Claire said. "He doesn't seem to wearing anything customary with the rogues here. I think he might be a civilian." she reasoned.

Mina gave it a bit of thought. "Well, we can't be absolutely certain, but we'll see when he comes to. What's his condition?"

"I patched him up with my vulnerary, but he was coughing up blood when I found him." Claire said, her worry increasing a bit. She didn't want to be too late for the man. Mina came up to give him a look of her own, checking his pulse as well.

"I think he might be okay until we can get him to the barracks. We're not too far anyway." Mina said. At that time, the other scout, Natalie, was returning. "Ah, perfect timing. Natalie, please go back to the barracks with Claire. Get this man some treatment."

"Of course." Natalie, a brown-haired young girl said.

"Thank you, captain." Claire gave a slight bow, getting herself situated as she and Natalie's mounts took to the air. They could already see their destination anyway.

"You just had to pick up someone on this trip." Natalie have a slight tease.

"You know it's not like that." Claire said back indignantly.

The fly back to the barracks was filled with a bit more bickering between the girls.
155232222222111111.title: Claire reacts

1552322222221111111.content: He soon woke up again, body still in pain, but not as much as it was originally. He felt heavy bandages covering him, including one across his face, covering an eye. He soon looked around, in some tent of some sort. He tried to move, still no good. He sunk into the bedding he was laid on, upset about it. He was wondering what would happen to him. Would these people interrogate him, maybe even just kill him. His weapons and armor were removed it seems, leaving him no fighting chance if being wounded was not enough. It wasn't long when he heard someone approach slowly.
1552322222221111111.title: Getting patched up

15523222222211111111.content:
"Oh, you're awake." Claire smiled. "About time. You've been out for quite a while."

"Ugh...." Jacob groaned as he struggled a bit. "...How long?" he asked.

"Hmm, about 3 hours or so." Claire said. "You're at a camp just outside the Pegasus Knight barracks in the capital." she smiled a bit wider. "It's a good thing I was there. With that much blood loss, who knows what would have happened to you."

Jacob seemed to understand much of that, though his head still hurt too much to fully get it. At the very least, the girl didn't seem to want to hurt him. Hell, she could have easily just left him in the clearing if she had wanted to.

"What...what's your name?" Jacob squeaked out. Claire gave a small teasing smile.

"It's proper manners to introduce yourself first." she smiled before straightening herself out. "My name is Claire. I'm a member of Squad 7 in the Pegasus Knights, under Captain Mina. And you are?"

"....Jacob." Jacob said simply, his head kind of pounding as he tried to stay up.

"Ah, well nice to meet you." Claire smiled, before walking over and helping him down on the mat. "You're still badly injured though. Don't move so much unless you want to reopen some of those wounds. I don't want Sarah to put you through another healing session."

She giggled a bit at that, knowing how exasperated her friend would be if this guy had more problems. Jacob didn't seem to object too much as Claire helped him rest a bit more.
15523222222211111111.title: Claire

choices: ....eventually makes it out of the camp entirely.
155232222222111111111.content:
The moment Claire leaves, Jacob sits back up. As dizzy as he was, he needed to keep moving, needed to keep searching. He found his weapons and armor bundled up in a sack and collected them before he continued on. He had to try and leave or find something related to what he was looking for.

He tried to blend into the chaos of the camp, and attempted to sneak away, actually getting out of the edges of the camp. He was pretty impressed and could've done better, but soon...
155232222222111111111.title: Claire takes her leave

1552322222221111111112.content:
Jacob finally got away from where the tents had been set up around the barracks, getting him away from most of the knights there. There were so many of them after all. However, he wasn't done yet. The barracks were inside the capital city, and Jacob got a birds-eye view looking down at the city from the vantage point. The barracks as well as the castle were on a hill overlooking the surrounding capital city.

"Oh boy...." he sighed to himself. He would have to navigate through the city somehow, no easy task. Well, if he wanted to get out, he would have to find a way eventually...

*****Back at the barracks*****

"Hey, how are.....you?" Claire had come back after about half an hour to check on their little pick-up. However, she was surprised to see an empty tent. She noticed that the gear that they had in a nearby sack was empty, leading to one conclusion.

"Oh...you have GOT to be kidding!" Claire groaned in frustration. Just her luck that that one person she was supposed to look after ditched the place after just waking up. She'd need to give Jacob a stern talking to when she found it. That is, if she found him. If he was already in the city, then it would be harder to look for him. With a sigh, she realized that she had to find him. Her superiors would kill her if they found out that an unknown man was now among the civilians.

Acting quickly, she ran back over to where the pegasi were kept, calling for Elincia again. Patting the horse again, she made sure she was saddled on correctly before taking off. As a knight, she had permission to fly above the city if needed, and this was definitely a need.

"Okay, time to find that guy!" she said to herself, Elincia taking a leap into the air as she began to fly above the city.

Thanks to her training, Claire was pretty good at spotting things from above, giving her a good look as she flew above the city. Of course, the place was pretty huge, so it was going to be hard. She just hoped she could find him in time.

However, after about 15-20 minutes of looking around, she finally caught a break. As she was looking over some back roads, she saw a familiar mercenary outfit. The bandages even confirmed it.

"Ah hah!" she cried to herself urging Elincia down since there was enough room to land. She dove right in at a great speed, and as she got close to the ground, she made a leap off of Elincia, pinning Jacob down.

"Found you, you little deserter!" Claire cried out.
1552322222221111111112.title: ....eventually makes it out of the camp entirely.

15523222222211111111121.content:
Jacob was making good ground, getting some distance from the barracks, and keeping a pretty low profile. He would've gotten away, but a wooshing sound filled his ears and then a quick thud. He fell on his face as the Pegasus Rider from before, Claire he thinks, jumps onto his back. He groans, pain lighting up in his body again.

"Found you, you little deserter!" The rider cried out and pinned him down. "O-ow....my...my every thing....ooowwwww....." he groaned. She dragged the boy to the side of the road and sat him up.

"Just what did you think you were doing?" Claire asks, standing in front of the boy, Elincia nearby.

Jacob groaned and sighed. "I-I'm looking for something....but I...don't know what."

Claire scratched her head, trying to make sense of what he said. "Uhm....maybe your wounds are worse than I thought..."

Jacob shakes his head, "No...I....I come from an Outrealm and....the most recent memories I have go back only a few months. I need to know why or find something to help me...I don't know...." he stared at the ground by his legs. "Just...don't lock me up....."

What happens next?
15523222222211111111121.title: Jacob found

choices: Claire suggests stopping at a chapel outside the city
155232222222111111111211.content:
Claire didn't think he was lying, though she was a bit skeptical. I mean, he seemed genuine, but what could she do.

"Well...I'm not going to lock you up." she started. "I mean, I don't think anyone believes that you're dangerous. Still, regardless of what you're looking for, you are still not fully healed. How are you going to to be able to find this thing you're looking for when you're like that?"

Jacob didn't have much of an answer. "Still...I need to go....I can't waste time..."

"Ugh...stubborn..." Claire groaned. Still, it wasn't like she wasn't stubborn either. "Well...I can't really let you out of my sight. You are kind of responsibility now." Okay, this was probably the most reckless thing she was going to do. Still, there was....something about this guy. She honestly wasn't sure, but there was something genuine about him, that almost made you really sympathize with what he was going through.

Of course, Jacob interpreted her words as meaning she was bringing him back.

"Sorry....but I can't go back..." he said again, scrambling to his feet.

"I won't take you back..." Claire sighed. "If you won't go back, then I guess I'll have to tag along and make sure you don't get in more trouble."

Jacob's eyes widened in shock. "W-What?!"

"You heard me. I'm coming with you. I'm not going to let you get yourself killed when I just went through the trouble of helping you get patched up." she smirked. "No questions asked either."

With that, she called Elincia over, patting her gently. "It'll take forever to get you through the city on foot, so we'll fly out."

"On her?" Jacob asked.

"Yes. Her name's Elincia. Cute huh?" Claire smiled. "Named her myself."

"Um...sure." Jacob mumbled.

It took a while to convince Jacob to come along though, even with the offer. Still, Claire eventually got him on. The weight was nothing for Elincia.

"Just one thing though....you are going to help explaining to my captain if we both end up on most wanted posters."

And with that, Elincia took off from the ground, soaring above the capital city. It was the first big view Jacob had gotten of the city. It was...amazing to behold.
155232222222111111111211.title: Claire helps Jacob

1552322222221111111112111.content:
Jacob hated this. This was his first time on a Pegasus, and he did not like it one bit. He groaned behind Claire, who simply looked back and said. "Stop complaining, I don't weigh that much." She said. Sure, yeah, okay.

"Being stacked in armor and jumping off a Pegasus and landing on someone can hurt them y'know....wait, where are we going?" Jacob asked, realizing they had gone off course.

"Oh. We need to get those wounds patched up, so I have a friend that could help, so we're gonna meet them." Claire smiled.

Jacob groaned and just tried to avoid looking down as much as possible. "I hate flying."

They arrive shortly after, landing outside the large and rather impressive chapel. Jacob rolled off the back of the Pegasus, not wanting to do more movement than that. Soon, Claire looked down at him. "Really?" She asked with a sigh as Jacob groaned.

The door to the Chapel swung open, and there was...
1552322222221111111112111.title: Claire suggests stopping at a chapel outside th...

15523222222211111111121111.content:
Claire and Jacob turned to the doors, seeing them open. A rather homely, yet cute, cleric was there, and Claire seemed to smile instantly.

"Who is....Ah! Claire!" the brown-haired girl smiled, running out and right into Claire's welcoming arms.

"Hey, Sarah!" Claire smiled, returning the hug. "How have you been doing? Judging by your wear, I'd say you've been moving up."

Sarah blushed a bit at the compliment, smiling all the same. "Y-Yeah, they've been really proud of my work so far."

Claire smiled, before turning to Jacob. "Jacob, this is Sarah. She's been a friend of mine since forever. She can finish patching you up."

"Hmm?" Sarah raised an eyebrow at the only man in the group. "And what happened?"

"Long story." Claire sighed. And so, she began to go into detail about what happened. Sarah couldn't help but gasp at some of the things that happened, in particular that Claire decided to help while basically abandoning the knights.

"He's not going to stay put. I can tell." she sighed. "And since I have to look after him, I just...came to a decision. I do wish I could have notified the captain though."

"I see...." Sarah nodded in understand. "Well, if he needs to be healed, I can give it my best shot. I trust anyone you trust." she smiled.

"That's my girl!" Claire laughed in reply. Jacob just raised an eyebrow at the two girls. Didn't think he'd ever understand them.

Anyway, Sarah welcomed them inside, going to a room so she could at least heal him properly. She noticed that many of his wounds seemed patched up already, but Claire noted that they didn't really finish with him. Nodding, Sarah brought her staff out, focusing herself to heal Jacob. The feeling Jacob had was a lot more pleasant than he normally felt.

"Ugh....thanks." Jacob smiled back, getting one in return from Sarah.

"They're still tender though, so be careful." she noted.

"Thanks a bunch." Claire thanked her. "I don't know what we would have done without you."

However, right when they got out of the room, heading back through the main part of the chapel, there was an unexpected visitor. One that made Claire shiver to her soul.

"Hello Claire." stood Captain Mina.
15523222222211111111121111.title: ...a cleric.

155232222222111111111211111.content:
"Oh crap!" Claire squeaked as she saw the Captain in front of her.

"Imagine my surprise when not only is our visitor gone, but so were you. Care to explain?" Mina crossed her arms. She didn't seem mad, probably just more stern than that. Claire sighed, motioning Jacob to stand back.

"Captain....Jacob here is looking for something...and he is pretty much incapable of staying put." Jacob seemed to want to retort to that, but Claire shushed him. "I...actually caught him getting away just a while ago..but when I heard what he was on a journey for..."

"And?" Mina asked.

"I...I'm responsible for him right? So...I want to give him some help." Claire said a bit more fiercely. "I...I know I should have told you first. I'll accept any punishment for it."

"Oh, that will surely be arranged." Mina smirked, sending another chill through Claire. She hung her head a bit, confident that she was going to get chewed out for this. "However...that can be done once you return."

"Captain?" Claire sprung up a bit.

"I can see that you intend to see whatever this is through to the end..so I'll allow you to do so on temporary leave." Mina said. "Just be prepared for a lot more work once you return. You'll have a lot to make up for." she said curtly with a nod, turning around to leave the chapel herself.

"T-Thanks captain!" Claire called back as the Captain left. "Well...I guess I'm stuck with you for now, so I hope once we leave that you have some kind of plan."
155232222222111111111211111.title: Explanations

1552322222221111111112111111.content:
Jacob watched Claire explain the situation, not letting him talk. He was a bit peeved at that for a moment and only a moment when she then took responsibility for him. He felt sorry for the girl. Surely that Captain won't let her get off easy. Great, guilted with her now.

They returned back to Pegasus, Claire saddling up. "So where to next?" She asked, looking at Jacob, currently studying a map.

"From this, we need to go north, but it's pretty late already....This says ruins are north along the way to the location. We should stop there and rest, then continue the next day." Jacob said, folding the map up.

"Sounds fine by me. Ready to go?" Claire asked with a smile and hopping on Elincia.

On that? No, but...if it's the only way...He gets on with Claire and holds tight as she takes off again. The ride lasted a few hours. Soon they saw old structures close to collapse, the ruins. The moment they landed, Jacob bailed, wanting off Elincia.
1552322222221111111112111111.title: Flying off again

1552322222222.content: Use this section as a gap for any Fire Emblem Fates interactive?
1552322222222.title: More

155232222222211.content:
All right then. In that case, here's the first character.

Name: Mikasa
Age: 15
Appearance: Typical height with shoulder-length dark hair and green eyes. Wears a handband in her hair. Wears a typical Samurai outfit with white clothes and typical armor.
Class: Samurai
Level: 5
Skills: Vantage, Flowing Strike
Alternate class: Archer
Weapons: Iron Katana, Vulnerary

Personality: A very young Samurai employed in Hoshido's army. A fresh recruit though viewed as quite talented for her age. Rather quiet more often than not, though friendly if you got to know her.
155232222222211.title: Story #1

1552322222222111.content:
Name: Laurence
Age: 17
Appearance: Short black hair with some dark purple highlights in it and a tired look under his eyes. Wears a formal white and red outfit under a ragged black cloak.
Class: Nohr Prince
Level: 10
Skills: Nohrian Trust, Tactical Intuition, Heavy Blade
Alternate Class: Butler
Weapons: Steel Sword, Iron Dagger

Personality: Fair and Curious, he was born into royalty and kept sheltered for most of his life. He has only experienced Nohr for the last couple years before completing his training and moving to oversee battles. Flustered easily and wary as well.

So what next?
1552322222222111.title: Character#2

choices: On the other side of the field...
15523222222221111.content:
"Give it everything you've got!" Mikasa's commander called out as the squadron was charging into battle.

It was yet another skirmish between Hoshido and Nohr, the two greatest kingdoms on the continent. The current battle on the plains of Hoshido had only just begun, but already the stench of blood was in the air. Mikasa cringed a bit at the smell. This was her first real battle, having come out of training just a while ago. She wasn't too sure what to think of it as she was marching with the troops. Yet...to be here....

"This...is war?" She said to herself, witnessing the fighting before her eyes.

Suddenly, the whirling of a blade just behind her head caused her to duck down, immediately jumping back up with her katana in hand. The blade hit flesh before she could think, hearing the agony of the mercenary falling to the ground afterwards. She was honestly shocked at how fast she moved, like it was natural to react such a way. The thought of how war could bring this out was both curious and nauseating.

"Ugh...I think I'm going to be sick." she sighed.

"Mikasa! Keep your eyes straight!" Her commander, Soichi, a swordmaster, brought her head out of it's thinking process. "You'll have plenty of time to digest this battle once it's done."

"Y-Yes sir!" She nodded, her hands gripping her katana a bit harder.

She charged forward, keeping close to her squad mates as they clashed fiercely with the Nohrian soldiers. Given how much of the army was cavalry, it was quite the challenge for Mikasa, dealing with the mounted riders. It only proved the point when one Nohrian cavalier got a small slash on her left from a lance strike. Dealing with the pain from it, she kept on fighting. Eventually though, she felt a rumbling beneath her feet.

"W-What is this?!" she cried out, seeing some energy forming around the area where she was. Her fellow soldiers seemed to be alertly getting away.

"It's a Dragon's Vein!" one cried. "It's a Nohrian royal!"

Dragon's Vein? That power of the dragons that flowed through royals? Mikasa didn't get much time to think it through though, before the burst of energy shook the ground beneath her.

"AHHHHHHHHH!" she cried as she was tossed into the air.

She had no idea how long it was or even where she fell, only that she felt like she was tumbling down a hill, the sounds of battle seemingly getting a bit further away. But then, with a loud smack against something, her world went black.
15523222222221111.title: A Battlefield

155232222222211111.content:
Laurence exhaled after having successfully activated the Dragon Vein. After seeing the effects toss around a group of Hoshidan soldiers, he turned to the platoon behind him. "Move in and secure that area before they can send any reinforcements." He said.

"Right away sir!" The lancer replied, as him and a larger group including cavaliers and wyvern riders moved in.

Laurence sighed before hearing the voice of Gaza over his shoulder. "Look at them scatter!" The man laughed watching the battle ensue. Gaza, a berserker, was assigned to Laurence as this was his first battle. "You must be pretty tired." Gaza spoke, an older man with a gruff voice and a grin.

Laurence sighed. "To be honest, yeah, that one took a bit out of me. It seemed so much different when I was training, it was easier there, but here?" He said before looking back out over the battle.

"I think I get it, cause you see..." Gaza began, as he grabbed Laurence by his throat and hoisted him into the air. "...kill or be killed is how the battlefield works!"

Laurence grasped at the man's hand. "Agggkk!!....Ga..Gaza....What're you-" He was cut off by a strike to the head with the blunt end of an axe and tossed out into the field.

"Wouldn't you like to know? Sorry, but I have bigger plans in mind, and they don't involve you kid!" He said as he soon gave off a similar energy. He too, it seemed could control Dragon Veins and he caused massive earthquake to shake the field once more, tossing Laurence around who blacked out sometime during it. The battle violent and brutal ended in a practical stalemate due to all the damage done to both sides...
155232222222211111.title: On the other side of the field...

1552322222222111111.content:
Mikasa had no idea how much time had passed since she was last conscious. One moment she had been on the battlefield, and then the next, she found herself sprawled on the ground.

"Ugh.......uh...w-what....happen....?" She cut herself off, a bit hard to talk with her pounding head.

Blinking one eye slowly open, she could see trees around her. Was....this the forest off to the side of the Hoshido Plains? It was the only thing she could think of, not that thinking was doing her any good right now. Her body was wracked with soreness and discomfort. Her left arm and head were especially hurt due to the fighting and the Dragon's Vein.

She had never seen one used in combat before. The only time she had seen it was then the royal family used it around Shirasagi Castle Town. She had always been amazed at what that power could do to help the people. Now, seeing it in combat for the first time, it was unreal how devastating it could be. In any case though, she didn't think she had time to just lay in the dirt. She...had to get back somehow. She didn't want to worry her friends and parents back home.

"Ugh...my head...." She groaned as she slowly got up, leaning against a tree as she struggled.

A little touch to her head confirmed that she had bleed a bit from her head, though thankfully not much damage total other than nauseusness. Making sure she still had her katana strapped tightly, she tried taking some steps, which again was easier said than done. The pain aside, where in the woods was she? That earthquake could have tossed her anywhere.

"A-Anyone?" she sputtered out, her throat a bit sore too. "C-Commander? Iayasu?"

It didn't seem to be much good. Even in the place where the plains and forest seemed to met, there was just silence, though the scent of blood was still in the air. Finding it a bit overwhelming, she fell to her knees, using her sheathed blade to hold herself up a bit. She was really lost out here, with only a Vulnerary to patch up small wounds.

Though...after a minute, she heard some slight groaning somewhere to her left. She gripped her blade a bit, turning a bit to try and get a better look. Slowly inching closer, she turned some grass away, seeing a male body, one almost as beat up as her own.

"W-Who....are you?" she squeaked out to the mostly unconscious man.
1552322222222111111.title: Mikasa

15523222222221111111.content:
Laurence had no idea how much time had passed when he came to. He felt numb and weak, unable to move or work as he looked about and saw himself in a dense forest. He had a gash in his forehead wish put a sheen of blood down his face, drying a bit as one of his eyes closed shut from it.

He couldn't move and looked to see a dead cavalier's horse pinning him down. He coughed up blood, as it drooled from his mouth a bit. He faded in and out of consciousness until he heard the noise of someone approaching. Looking, he saw a girl in Hoshidan garb standing there. "W-Who....are you?" she said.

He looked back, still fading in and out of consciousness. A Nohr Noble at the hands of a Hoshidan...no way out of this. "I.......I'm....Laurence...of Nohr......s-so go on....do it." He coughed, gripping the ground with his hands.
15523222222221111111.title: A Chance Meeting

155232222222211111112.content:
Laurence....of Nohr?

There had been rumors of a sheltered Nohrian prince who hadn't seen much of the world at all. It was a mystery that many people had wondered about over the years. Guess there had to be some kind of truth to the rumors if this man was the one she had heard of. If it was true though, it was kind of funny for the unknown Nohrian prince to look not much older than her.

Her eyes widened just a bit and she gripped her katana a bit harder as the gears in her head worked. One way or another, the guy was clearly Nohrian, the kind of person she had been sent out to kill on the battlefield in the first place. She had already done it a few times earlier. Why...should this be any different?

"If...t-that's the...case..." She struggled to say, barely lifting her blade. "I...should...."

Even as she saw the boy closing his eyes, as it awaiting judgment, she could barely get enough strength to lift it up, her legs buckling under her as she fell back down to the ground, leaning against a nearby rock as her breath became more labored. She had an idea what was going on. She was in no better shape than he was. They were both too bloodied and beaten to make any significant move.

"I...can't do...it..." She said, staring at the boy as much as she could. What more was there to say? The two just laid in their spots, neither able to do much to the other. Laurence couldn't seem to believe it himself.

"Then...why are...you here?" he asked her, lifting his head up a bit.

"Same....as you....I...suppose..." She said softly as she leaned her head back against the rock, not in the mood to say more. She could only hope that the boy didn't get the strength to kill her...or get reinforcements. The very idea of that struck a bit of fear in her. She didn't want to die here, not in the field all alone....

"MIKASA!" Her eyes snapped open at the sudden sounds, turning her head slightly. It was a brigade of Hoshidan soldiers, one of them her friend, Iayasu.

"Oh....good..." She sighed a bit before closing her eyes again.

Both she and the prince had just about passed out once the brigade arrived.
155232222222211111112.title: Choosing

1552322222222111111121.content:
When Mikasa awoke, she laid on a bedding on the floor of a tent, which she saw the ceiling of the moment she woke up. Sitting up, she grabbed her side, feeling a quick jolt of pain as she heard a voice. "Don't move too much, you're still healing up."

Turning, she saw Iayasu standing at the entryway to the tent. "Iayasu! Thank goodness...where are we?" Mikasa asked looking up at her friend.

"This a forward camp we had set up to do some reconnaissance from. Helped us learn a bit about Nohr's movements from the last battle." Iayasu said. "You're lucky we found you when we did."

As she said that, Mikasa remembered something. "There was a boy there too...what happened to him?"

Iayasu smiled. "Another lucky break. That was one of Nohr's hidden nobles and the one responsible for the Dragon Vein that injured you. We got him bound in a holding cell for interrogations." She said. "Once you start feeling better, you can get back to your duties." She said.

And that's how it went for a bit, Mikasa simply wandered the camp to help with small jobs, however she noticed something. Some more foot traffic coming in and out of the prison, including some groups of soldiers. She kept inspecting and noticed some with bruised knuckles and bloody stains. She had an idea of what was happening. She assumed they were acting of their own accord and not under orders. Mikasa couldn't help but feel sorry for the boy, so she decided to help.

One day she put together a small bag full of some food. She had no idea what Nohrians usually ate and hoped that he might enjoy some more diverse foods. She also had a small bit of bandages just in case he needed those. She waited for the guard to go on break before sneaking in. Inside, she managed to get into his cell. He legs were bound by metal cuffs and chains at the ankles. His hands were done the same, cuffed at the wrist. He had both fresh and dried blood on him, a black eye and swollen lip, and looked emaciated, food deprived.

Laurence did not react at first until she finally spoke. "H-Hello?" And soon he raised his head up to look at her, as they met for the second time.
1552322222222111111121.title: Heading back

choices: Waking up in a strange world
15523222222221111111211.content:
This was Mikasa's first real look at the man, given how her last meeting with him was when she was half-delirious from her injuries. Looking at him now, she had to admit that he had a striking look to him, even behind all the injuries he had. Guess this was what Nohrians looked like. This was her first real encounter with one after all. After a second though, she shook her head. There were more important things to be thinking about.

"Hello..." she said softly, trying not to stutter or anything. "I've brought some food and bandages. I'll see what I can do."

"R-Really?....." Laurence choked out, feeling a bit hard to talk. He hadn't said much since being brought here, as evidenced by the slight voice crack that Mikasa noticed.

"Don't talk." she said, walking closer to him and sitting down in front of him, placing her small bag of food in the front of him while she had the bandages and other medical things. "You can use your hands still right? There's food in there."

Mikasa left it at that while she began tending to his injuries. She was no medic, but patching up small things like this was something she was good with. Laurence didn't say much, probably still shocked that someone was actually tending to him in this situation, just when he thought that everyone wanted a piece of him. Well, the girl seemed to be harmless (at first glance) so he didn't protest, using his hands to reach in, grabbing one of a few rice balls inside. He had never seen such a thing before, smelling it tentatively before taking a small bite. The taste....didn't impress..

"Ugh...it's plain..." he groaned.

"Shut up," Mikasa said curtly, squeezing one of the bandages a bit tighter to make a point, getting a yelp from him. "I don't know what Nohrians eat, but it's the best a camp like this has, so suck it up or starve."

Laurence seemed to be quiet after that, though grumbling a bit. Mikasa surprised herself at how forceful she was being with this stranger. Guess it was because he somehow gave her a vibe similar to some of her more picky friends. Well, at least it helped somewhat with the awkward vibe of the tent right now. The only noises were Laurence's small eaiting and the sound of her bandages doing their job.

"So..." Mikasa said after finishing some patching on his head. "You're Prince Laurence of Nohr I hear?"

Having finished what he could, Laurence looked up. "Yes, that's right, though not many treat me that way. I've been sheltered away most of my life. I don't think my existence is even common knowledge yet."

That sounded so strange to Mikasa. A prince whose existence was kept secret? Why would they do such a thing? That didn't sound like something her country would do from her knowledge. All the same though, she nodded at him.

"I see," she said before continuing. "I'm Mikasa by the way. Pleasure."

She actually did mean that, not wanting to be disrespectful even to a prisoner. The atmosphere around them seemed to be tolerable at least, with neither finding the other unbearable to be around. However, Mikasa knew that she shouldn't stick around long, lest others get the wrong idea.

"I'll try to say something to keep the others from harming you. There's something not right about improper treatment like this."

"You have my thanks." Laurence gave a small smile beneath his bandages. Honestly, Mikasa couldn't help but smile back just a bit. Kind of made her wonder why he was their enemy in the first place..but she guessed it wasn't up to her to decide that.

However, before she could begin to make a move out, the ground started shaking, causing her to fall to the ground again. Winds were starting to gust around, and she could hear the cries of others outside the tent.

"Oh no, another Dragon's Vein!" Laurence cried out, trying to stand, but unable to thanks to the shackles. "D-Damn it!" He couldn't even use a Dragon's Vein himself with how he was chained up. Just hearing the words horrified Mikasa, given her last experience.

"AHHHHH!" she screamed as everything just came falling down around them in a rush of magical energy.

Before either of them knew it, their world had gone black around them. Though...Mikasa couldn't help but notice a tiny speck of light before her vision went out completely....
15523222222221111111211.title: Proper Introductions

155232222222211111112111.content:
Laurence groaned as he slowly opened his eyes, light flooding his vision. He felt the breeze across his body as he sat up, some moderate pain in his side as he looked around. He saw the girl who was tending to him laying beside him. He nudged her awake as he looked around. The area surrounding them was lush green fields, with them on a stone-paved path.

Mikasa soon began to wake up and sat up. "Hey, are you okay?" Laurence asked as Mikasa rubbed her head.

"Ugh, my head...." she groaned before looking around too. "Huh? What is this place?"

"Oh dear, I didn't expect you two so early." A voice said. Laurence and Mikasa turned to see a girl, floating in midair in black robes with a lantern at her side as she smile, long auburn hair behind her. "I know she said that you two would be coming, I didn't think this soon though." She smiled.

"What? Who are you? What is this place?" Mikasa asks as the woman smiles.

"Sorry, I would tell you, but I need to get this place in ship-shape. Then I can explain. I already healed you two so for now I'm gonna send you two back, but not without some quick alterations for right now...and my name's Katya." The Witch winked. She was holding one of their bags and put some potions inside it before tossing one at and using it on Laurence who let out a yelp as mist surrounded the two. "I'll see you two later!" She said before lights enveloped them again. When the lights died down, they were....
155232222222211111112111.title: Waking up in a strange world

1552322222222111111121111.content:
As if this whirlwind of events couldn't get any more strange. Mikasa felt like it hadn't even been a minute since she woke up and suddenly she was knocked out again. What was up with her constantly getting knocked out today? Hardly ideal for a Samurai. Certainly didn't help that that girl's mouth ran a mile a minute and she barely even had a chance to digest her words before being knocked out.

Though, even as Mikasa's eyes opened again, she did remember her throwing something at them, especially at...Laurence!

"Prince Laurence!" she cried out as she got to her knees, looking all around for the Nohrian royal.

However, she saw no body next to her. She got up to her feet, still a bit woozy from the trip, wondering if he got up. Still, she saw no one, and there was no way he could get far with his injuries. Sighing, Mikasa put her hands on her hips, wondering where he was. Suddenly though, her foot brushed against something. Looking down, she saw what looked like something a female Samurai like herself would wear, though a but more pristine. It actually had a nice darker color mixed with some white, making an interesting contrast.

"Keep your friend with you," Mikasa suddenly heard a voice, earily similar to that girl from earlier. "Keep him safe until he's healed."

"What?!" Mikasa cried out, ending up picking up the pristine cloth. "You mean.....?"

Okay so....that wasn't just a dream? And whatever that girl threw at them turning Laurence into this? It was actually a bit surprising she didn't change her as well. Mikasa knew magic could be strange, but this was ridiculous. Well, in any case, she was at a crossroads of what to do. Just carry him like this? Well, actually, upon looking at herself, Mikasa could see that her standard uniform was really beat up from the Dragon Vein that hit her, all ripped up in places. No way could she present herself to her commander like this.

....Which then gave her the thought...oh boy...

"Can't believe I'm doing this," Mikasa said as she took her chest armor off, ready to swap clothes. "He better not be conscious enough to feel me up,"

Hiding her embarrassment, she put her new Samurai top on, putting her armor back on and placing her torn-up one in her bag, which still had potions in it. She could only wonder what those were about, but that was for another time. Making sure her katana was still equipped, she observed her surroundings. She seemed to be not too far from the Plains of Hoshido where the battle was. Camp shouldn't be too far.

"Oh no...I hope they haven't left!" Mikasa cried out, beginning to run.

Thankfully, she knew the way back to camp, which was smaller as it seemed like the army was heading back to Hoshido's capital. Right as Mikasa approached, nearly out of breath, who but Iayasu would see her.

"Oh Mikasa!" she cried out, grabbing her hand. "I'm glad to see you safe. We couldn't find you when that Dragon Vein was used."

"I'm...sorry," Mikasa said, bowing a bit to her friend. "I wasn't sure what happened, but I woke up near the plains just a while ago."

"Well...that's good to hear," Iayasu smiled, before looking at Mikasa's garb. "Um, where did you get that?"

"Oh this?" Mikasa motioned to her top. "Um...I was near a village and...they were thankful to be spared from the fighting...and gave me a new top for my torn-up one."

Mikasa could only hope that lie would actually pass, and it seemed to work as Iayasu nodded.

"Well, fair enough." she said. "In any case, let's go. It's time to head back to the capital."

"Right!" Mikasa said, her mind still full of confusion as to everything that happened, especially regarding the person now hiding as her own clothes.
1552322222222111111121111.title: Outside of Hoshido

15523222222221111111211111.content:
Wha....What's happening? Why can't I move or...? Mikasa? Where are you? What's going on?

Laurence thought all of these things to himself as he laid in grass trying to move and stuck staring up into the sky. He felt so weird after what had just happened. He had done studies on beings like the one they just saw but meeting one was new to him.

As he laid there he soon heard someone call out for him. Mikasa. He tried to reply back but no words came out. Soon he saw her and thought, 'Why does she look so big and is looking at me like that?'

Soon enough he was picked up by her as she held him up and seemed to be blushing now. As Laurence went to question it, a voice interrupted him. "You should rest you know," a similar voice like the one from before stated as Laurence felt odd. He felt as though he was losing himself in his new form, Mikasa's new garb.

"B-But....she can't wear me...right?" I ask the voice as I feel my consciousness fading. "Oh she will," the voice replied, "but we can't have you feeling her up or anything, so in this case...."

She didn't even finish and let Laurence fade and become the outfit in mind for now in order to rest and "relax", as she would call it. Mikasa soon donned him and met back up with her friend as they arrived back in Hoshido's Capitol. "What happens now Iayasu?" Mikasa asked as they entered the town.

"Right now you need to recuperate and rest. After that it might be best to report back to your group and see what they have assigned for you." Iayasu replied, Mikasa not going to argue as she did feel tired. The two would soon part ways as Mikasa walked and entered her own room in a nearby barrack.
15523222222221111111211111.title: Hoshido's Capital

155232222222211111112111111.content:
A couple days passed....

Mikasa was using the time to get rested up after the many events that just took place. Meeting the Nohrian prince, going into some other world...still felt surreal, yet the occasional voice in her head made sure she never thought it was a dream. In any case, the army was on standby for now, with the violence having calmed down since the battle on the plains. Mikasa hadn't talked much with her friends, mostly keeping to herself over the days. Until....

"Okay...I think he's ready to come back," Mikasa heard the girl from before.

"Now?" Mikasa asked.

"Yes, he's rested enough. Use the small red bottle I put in your bag. That'll change him back, though he'll look different since he'll have to blend in a bit," she said.

"If you say so..." Mikasa sighed.

With that, she laid out the robe Laurence had become. Looking into her bag, she found the little bottle the girl had been referring to. Not really sure what to expect, Mikasa poured the contents on to the robe, it immediately sizzling to life as it covered the robe in light, immediately transforming into a new and humanoid shape. However, Mikasa noticed that the forming figure looked distinctly....feminine.

Once the light was fading though, Mikasa gasped. In front of her was a girl, donned in the typical red and white clothes of a Shrine Maiden. She had long black hair that had a Hoshidan flower in it, though no other noteworthy features. Mikasa could only guess this was what the girl meant when she said Laurence would look different to blend it. Right as she thought this, Laurence's eyes began to flutter open.

"Am....I...awake..? How many....?" She was about to ask before realizing how she looked. Right as she looked like she would scream, Mikasa clamped her mouth.

"Don't scream. You'll just grab attention," Mikasa warned before putting her hand down. "You've been out for a couple days or so. The girl told me to bring you back just now. Guess she figured...you'd blend in more like this...."

"Oh.....I see..." Laurence sighed, taking in her appearance. "I wish it wasn't....a girl though..."

"Well, Shrine Maiden's are pretty low-profile. It's probably the best way for you to not be suspicious." Mikasa said, getting to her feet while helping her up. "Well...I can't keep you in here all the time. If this is how you're going to be while you're here, it's probably best that I show you around. The more you don't know, the more suspicious you'll be."

"I can understand that," Laurence wobbled on her feet a bit. "But how can I do it like this?"

"Relax....we'll get through it... somehow..." Mikasa sighed again. Great, now she was stuck playing babysitter. Just how she wanted to spend her day. "Well...let's go. We both need to get out and you've got a tough lesson coming."
155232222222211111112111111.title: Dealing with Laurence

choices: Mikasa heads up to the palace
They return to rest in the barracks for now.
1552322222222111111121111111.content:
Laurence groaned as he walked along behind Mikasa, trying to get used to his new body. Things felt off. Different. Weird. Walking around behind her they head outside as he looks around.

The buildings look odd, built out of different materials than places in Nohr, built from bricks mostly. They seemed to have some odd materials in this land to build with. As he walked he soon caught eye of a large statue in the city center made from white stone of a dragon. He tugs on Mikasa's sleeve for her attention. "What is that?" He asks pointing to it.

Mikasa turned and looked. "That's a statue of the Dawn Dragon, that brings light to Hoshido. You better learn as much as possible on it if you wanna pass as a shrine maiden."

He sighed as he followed along. Mikasa had stopped by somewhere as Laurence waited and looked around as Mikasa returned with some odd dish. "What is this?" He asked taking the odd vegetable dish.

"Fried daikon with rice. Don't worry, it will have more taste than the stuff I gave you last time." She said.

He remains a bit cautious and starts eating, and soon finds himself eating away at the vegetables, never having eaten a vegetable like this. "This is r-really good..." he said.

Mikasa couldn't help but smile just a little as soon someone passed in front of them and Mikasa stood a bit straighter. "Meiko, your majesty!" She said bowing, as Laurence caught off guard a bit just bowed with her.

Meiko wore a yellow and white archer garb, her hair a sleek black color and in a ponytail. And on her back was the Fujin Yumi. Glasses adorned her soft face as she smiled back. "Oh, Mikasa. No need to be so cordial here. I'm glad you're alright, after what happened it's a miracle." She smiled and soon saw Laurence. "Is she a friend of yours?"

Mikasa spoke up before Laurence could say anything. "She is. This is Lily, she's from a shrine a bit out of the way and out from the Capitol. Lily, this is Meiko, one of Hoshido's princesses."

He blushed and bowed more. "Ah! Y-Your Majesty!" He spoke as Meiko just chuckled a bit.

"Oh dear. Mikasa, do you mind coming by the palace at some time? I want to talk to you about an assignment." She said before waving a goodbye and heading off.

Mikasa and Lily continued the tour for a bit before stopping back by the barracks. "Thanks for showing me around Mikasa." He smiled.
1552322222222111111121111111.title: Learning about Hoshido

choices: Lily spends time with the shrine maidens
15523222222221111111211111111.content:
"It's no problem," Mikasa smiled.

She was honestly surprised that she seemed to be rather casual around Lili now, despite the whole "prince of the enemy" thing. Then again, he seemed to be a pretty nice person as a whole, which kind of made her wonder just what was behind this war to begin with. She never asked that question to her superiors. Perhaps it was a good time to ask that.

Lily looked at Mikasa after that.

"So...that was one of Hoshido's royals?" he asked.

"Yeah, that was Meiko, Hoshido's oldest princess and 2nd oldest of the royal siblings. She's a little bit older than me, but I've actually known her since childhood," Mikasa smiled. "I'm not overly acquainted with the others though. I've seen High Prince Nobunaga at times, but not often. I've barely even laid eyes on their younger siblings. Supposedly their younger brother is kind of a shut-in, and their youngest sibling is a girl trying to become a Sky Knight from what I hear."

"Wow...." Lily said. "I haven't heard much about Hoshido's royals before now."

"Well, perhaps you can return it by telling me a thing or two about Nohr's later," Mikasa smirked before turning to leave. "In any case, I should not keep Meiko waiting. Feel free to explore a bit if you want, or just stay here. I don't mind either way, as long as you feel you can learn your way around."

With that, she gave Lily a small good bye as she left her room. Lily wasn't too sure what to do in all honesty. He didn't really want to wait around. Mikasa's little tour had made him curious to learn more about the place. She did give him permission after all. With that said, he left the barracks room as well, though Mikasa was long out of sight. Well, he was undettered, making his way out of the barracks from there. He wasn't too sure how to act when others came by, so he just bowed a bit at times, getting some chuckles from others though.

"Ugh....I really need to learn how to act around people," he sighed. He was sheltered back home as well, so learning how to act around people was even more troubling taking into account his new gender.

In any case though, he felt like he knew where the barracks were now, and Mikasa had already told others that "Lily" was a guest that was allowed to her room anytime. That helped as he left, heading back into town again. Right as he did though, he immediately found himself stumbling to the ground, landing on his butt with a dull thud. Lily groaned at the discomfort, ready to say something to whoever ran into him. His frustration waned though when he saw that it was a young girl, probably no more than 13 or 14 years old at most. She wore the shrine maiden's garb as well, and had a headdress on.

"Oh I'm so sorry!" she cried out in apology, bowing low from her seated position. "I was in a rush and I wasn't looking!"

"I-It's okay," Lily recomposed himself and smiled at the girl. "It was just an accident."

"Oh thank you!" the girl smiled as she looked up, showing her brown eyes. "Hmm...I haven't seen you around before. Are you new to the shrine?"

"Um....." Oh boy, someone was probably going to say that eventually. "I..I came from out of town. I haven't...been to a shrine here before. Sorry."

The girl just smiled, shaking her head a bit. "No, that's no problem at all. If you'd like, would you like to join us for a session? That's where I was going before I tripped."

"Oh...well....." It was a chance to see some more of Hoshido's culture though, and the girl seemed like she wanted to apologize for earlier. "...Okay, I'd be happy to join you."

"Yay!" she cried before she got up, a bit more giddy now before she composed herself. "Oh, I'm sorry. I never introduced myself. I'm Himi. What's your name?"

"It's....Lily," Lily said, having to remember that name.

Upon hearing it, Himi grabbed Lily's hand, beginning to pull her along a new pathway through some buildings. Guess Lily would learn more once they got there.

****Meanwhile*****

At that moment, Mikasa had arrived at Castle Shirasagi.

"Princess Meiko wanted to speak with me," she said respectfully.

"Right, she said as much," the guard nodded before letting her through.

Mikasa let herself in, seeing the Castle for just the second time in her lifetime. It always felt so surreal compared to the rest of Hoshido, being in the home of the royals. Luckily, she at least knew the way to where Meiko would want her to come. As she did though, she happened to pass by an older man, probably 20 or so years old. He had somewhat messy short black hair, with some green-themed swordmaster armor. The sight of the divine Raijinto blade made it clear who it was. High Prince Nobunaga. Mikasa bowed as he passed, him nodding a bit in her direction. Nobunaga was known to be pretty kind, a starring example of a prince, though he likely had many things on his mind to talk with her. Putting that behind her, she found Meiko in her quarters.

"Oh, you came," Meiko smiled. "I'm glad you came quickly."

"It's no problem," Mikasa smiled. "So, what is it you need?"

"It's....a hard thing to say," Meiko sighed. "There are concerns about when Nohr might try to invade again. A lot of people are scared. So, a decision has been made to send some military on a secret mission to spy for Hoshido."

"Why tell me though?" Mikasa asked. "Don't you gave plenty of Ninjas for that?"

"Yes...but they want someone who can interact more with the residents," Meiko said. "Not to mention even sending Ninjas is risky. One was nearly captured some time ago. But that's enough of that. I'll cut to the chase....They want you to be a spy."

"WHAT?!" Mikasa cried out, barely caring about yelling in a royal's presence. "Why me?! I'm just a new recruit!"

"I don't like it either," Meiko sighed. "But...I can't go against what the others have decided. If anything, they actually think highly of you with your performance in the plains a few days ago."

Mikasa groaned as she thought about it.
15523222222221111111211111111.title: Mikasa heads up to the palace

155232222222211111112111111111.content:
Lily gets tugged as she continues to follow the girl, her arm being tugged as she is led along. Lily had no idea though how this would work. She had no prior shrine experience like a Hoshidan. "S-Sorry for me asking, but can you let me know how this works? Just since it could be a little different from what I had to do at my shrine." Lily asked.

Himi smiled back, "Sure, I'll let you know when we're there. We're really close!" A few more steps and they had arrived at a large ornate shrine building, which Lily marvelled at a bit.

As they entered there were some other maidens about along with some diviners and a monk. "Himi!" A diviner spoke as she apporached. "We were worried you were going to be late. What happened?" She asked.

"I-I'm sorry! I bumped into this girl here. She has a shrine outside of the city, a small one it sounds like too. Her name's Lily. Lily, this is Rakyo." Himi said.

Lily bowed her head as she greeted Rakyo. "Th-thank you for having me!"

Rakyo smiled and bowed back, "Of course, we welcome it. Now come along, we're about to begin." She said as they all entered the large room in the center of the shrine.

Lily looked around before asking Himi how it worked here. "We pray to the 4 beings of Hoshido. The dragon, the tortoise, the bird, and the tiger. We meditate first and open up to them and pray for good fortunes for Hoshido."

Lily nodded. "Uhm...okay, I'll try." She copued Himi's form and movement in everyway as she knelt down and closed her eyes. She took a deep breath before calming herself and after a few moments, she felt herself open up. She was experiencing something new, the sound of water flowing, of wind blowing, of leaves rustling and grass waving. She felt an indescribable feeling wash over her as the meditation ended. She opened her eyes with a smile and turned to Himi, "Please, can you teach me more Himi?" She asked.

Himi smiled and nodded as the session would continue.

----------

Mikasa sighed as she soon spoke. "I'll do it."

Meiko nodded, "Very good. The assignment can start tomorrow. Due to the mission though, we can only provide you with funds for food and taking you to Nohr. We can't risk being too involved at the moment." She smiled at Meiko. "I'm sure you'll do fine."

Mikasa bowed. "Thank you, I promise to try my best." She spoke as she soon was dismissed and left. As soon as she was out of the castle, she sighed. Great. A high-stakes mission immediately. Not what she wanted to hear. Perhaps it would be a bit easier with Laurence though since he is from Nohr. Perhaps he could be helpful.

Mikasa returned to the barracks and realized Lily wasn't there. "Lily? Where did she go?" She sighed.
155232222222211111112111111111.title: Lily spends time with the shrine maidens

1552322222222111111121111111111.content:
Lily's experience with the shrine maidens was turning out to be very productive. In addition to the Dawn Dragon and the 4 beats as he initially learned about, there were many other minor spirits the Hoshidans honored. It was quite enlightening with the complete contrast to Nohr. Nohr didn't have a concentrated religious effort like this. Sure, there was the Dust Dragon, but hardly a concentrated group like the shrine maidens.

"Wow....neat," Lily smiled. "Sorry that it seems like I'm unaware of most of this. I'm...actually relatively new to my shrine so....I'm still picking up on things."

"No problem," Himi smiled widely. "I was like that when I first started, and that was only a year ago. It always feels really peaceful though, like you and nature are one and the same. It helps to clear the mind."

It certainly did. Lily actually allowed himself to briefly put aside his worry over the attempts on his life from earlier. It was nice to finally clear his head and get some things in order. Though, he did feel like he was lying big time to Himi though. She was a really sweet girl...and he wasn't even supposed to be a girl right now. Basically everything he said was a lie, and that didn't make him feel good, especially with his eventual return to Nohr coming some time.

Well, in any case, the ending the session did come.

"Well Himi, it's been great...but I think I need to return back to where I'm staying," Lily said.

"Okay, thank you for the great time!" Himi smiled widely. "Would you come again sometime? We can be best friends!"

Ugh, she really knew how to lay it on. What was he to say to that? Still, he tried to smile, agreeing with her that they could be friends. She cheered a bit, leaving Lily both happy and conflicted. Life kind of sucked sometimes.

-------------------------------------------------------

Eventually, Lily finally made her way back to the barracks. Mikasa was still there, sitting on her bed.

"Well, hello," Mikasa said with a raised eyebrow.

"Hey, you said I could look around if I wanted," Lily said. "And I didn't get lost if that's what you're thinking. I actually had a good time."

So Lily described his time with the shrine maidens, intriguing Mikasa greatly. She actually smiled at him getting a friend, though she also understood the burden of the fact that Himi had no idea that he was really a guy. Boy, that felt rough. Well, after Lily shared his story, Mikasa shared her own, which immediately surprised Lily. She told him about her new job to be a spy, which saddened Lily. Mikasa apologized for having to spy on his home, but Lily shook her head. There was something going on in Nohr. Perhaps this was necessary.

"I start tomorrow. I'm guessing you'll be coming along." Mikasa said. "Meiko already knows you at least, so she'll probably be okay with it."

"I understand," Lily sighed, but he understood. He did need to get back to Nohr eventually. "Well, guess there's no point in debating further on it."

Mikasa nodded in agreement. All they could do now was prepare.

-------------------------------------------

"You sure about this?" Meiko asked.

"Yes, Lily is fine with it," Mikasa said. "And...I could use the support honestly. We'll both be careful. Promise."

Both Mikasa and Lily were in more plain clothes now, next to some horses. They had a bag with a few things, but mostly just money. They were pretty much near the border now.

"Well, I hope so. Take care of yourself," Meiko said with a brief hug. "I really don't want to send you of all people though. I'm sorry."

"Hey, even you can't control everything," Mikasa smiled a bit.

With that, Mikasa and Lily got on the horses, beginning to make their way into Nohr. This was it. Mikasa's first time in Nohr. One could only wonder what would happen now.
1552322222222111111121111111111.title: Lily's Experience/Mikasa

info.brief_description: Send your tactician into the world of Fire Emblem!
info.description:
Add a story of your tactician and them possibly meeting other tacticians along the way. You can have any background with your tactician, but keep it in the Fire Emblem: Awakening set.

Rules:
1. Don't be controlling.
2. Encourage others and don't be shy to add your own.
3. Have fun!
